Review_Text: We spent a very happy week in this lovely hotel. Despite the fact that it is located in the heart of the city it is a haven of peace built around a beautiful garden filled with birdsong. The staff are very professional kind and welcoming. We were offered refreshing mint tea and biscuits on arrival. Our room was comfortable with a very good bed large bathroom sofa good television minibar fresh fruit and cakes daily replenished mineral water table and desk air conditioning and adjustable lighting. We could see the Koutoubia and the garden from our window. We chose to dine in the Moroccan restaurant with traditional music and dance and at the Imlil beside one of the pools. We also availed of room service. All the meals were delicious. Next time we will try the Indian and French restaurants and the rooftop pool and bar. There are comfortable loungers beside the pool and many peaceful shaded alcoves on the terraces. There is also a piano bar beside the cool and calm lobby. There is a brand-new Museum of Intangible Heritage in the former bank building on the Jemaa El Fna a short stroll away. The souks and many other interesting sights such as the Secret Garden and Dar el Bacha are also walkable and there are taxis a few metres from the hotel entrance for Majorelle or Guéliz. Return transport for the airport was arranged for us door-to-door. Check-in and check-out were fast and efficient. Thank you to all. Ramadan Mubarak.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jatinder S wrote a review Mar 10
Review_Text: The staff were very friendly and helpful. We were looked after by Yousef Hind and Moisin amongst others and everyone was very welcoming. The Riad is beautiful and traditional right in the Medina. It is hard to find down a long narrow alley one the only difficulty we had was that we had to walk some distance to get to where the taxis could come. This caused some difficulty for my wife in heels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I made a mistake with booking this hotel on Booking.com and LoveHolidays.com. This resulted in my husband being charged when he arrived despite my already having paid with the other company. This was pointed out very early in our stay and could easily have been remedied by a decent manager.    When this supposedly high end hotel was informed they had taken two amounts from us for the same stay and asked to help they gave us assurances they would resolve this over the 2 nights we had with them. And then when we returned to the UK have fobbed us off saying we need to contact the agent.    Whilst the mistake was mine I deeply resent the bare faced dishonesty and grasping attitude that means that the staff smile in our face messing you around for weeks with nonsense emails all the while knowing full well they are in effect stealing from you. Despite whatever rubbish they have told me my husband and I can see two separate payments on our bank statements.    So for anyone considering staying here it looks beautiful and enjoys good reviews but beware all the while it employs some perfidious and rapacious staff who are content to say one thing whilst doing quite another to take your money there is a risk that you will experience the same underhanded practise.    If you like straight forward and honest dealings you won’t find it here.  This has tainted the entire experience of this French owned hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A great 3 to 4 star hotel if that’s what you are after. As a 5 star it falls short. Mini suite was spacious but nothing wow . Corridors dark. The pool area x2 were lovely. Based on the breakfast we chose not to eat at the restaurants.Boiled cauliflower  plain pasta is not my idea of yum for breakfast but each to their own.The housekeeping staff are so welcoming and friendly . The best . Location is good for the square. Could be great but needs some attention to be a true 5 star.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paulyne B wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: It s like we live in the castle ! Wow ! The qualité and the service incredible. The suite was clean and the staff very professionnel.  It was the 3 times and we are réady to go Back the next summer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michelle C wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Right in the middle of the action.
Review_Text: Gorgeous hotel in the middle of the action in Marrakesh. We had a beautiful garden room with its own little seating area.  The rooftop pool was a lovely place to while away the afternoon after a busy morning exploring the medina. Staff were friendly and helpful.  It is expensive for food & drinks onsite considering there are cute local places just outside the hotel doors.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My daughter and I have just returned from another hugely appreciated stay at this wonderful hotel. It is perfectly placed to safely wander and dip in and out of the city sights whilst being a calm sanctuary to return to.  We love both pools but particularly appreciated the heated rooftop pool in winter and enjoyed our afternoons up there with stunning views of the Koutoubia mosque attentive poolside drinks service and delicious lunches at the truly excellent restaurant.  I would thoroughly recommend a mini suite with terrace or junior suite as we’ve had before. Both are spacious excellently appointed with stylish terraces overlooking the peaceful gardens and housekeeping is exceptional throughout the hotel.  The staff are the most consistently genuine friendly and helpful that I have come across. This was only our second visit but we were warmly greeted like old friends and felt genuinely cared for in a city which whilst exciting can be overwhelming.  We particularly appreciated the help of the head concierge Mr Abbsedeq absolutely nothing was too much trouble both before and during our stay. He has a complete  Can do attitude and tireless desire to get it right.  There is a charming slightly faded glamour about this hotel which coupled with the genuine warmth of the staff makes for an extremely relaxing stay for which we are truly grateful. We feel refreshed and revived for 2023 and will look forward to returning…
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Robert H wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Having just returned from a five night stay I’m pleased to say this hotel was everything we hoped for. A place of calm away from the hubbub of the Medina the hotel is perfectly placed to explore Marrakech.  From its beautifully appointed rooms through to its amenities it really catered to our needs.  Special mention has to go to the staff and management though who made the difference. From the warmth of welcome and their interactions with the kids through to the surprise cake for my wife’s birthday we felt looked after every step of the way. Thanks very much and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Noor A wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary recently for 3 nights (mid December). The hotel is so fabulous. We were welcomed with mint tea and Moroccan cookies at the lobby.    Thanks for upgrading our room much appreciated since it was our wedding anniversary. They did not know about it so I guess we were lucky. We were shown around our room by a staff we didn’t like it how he was expecting a tip once he was done showing us the room. You could just know that he was expecting for a tip.    Another guy came upstairs and deliver our suitcases. He didn’t even expect a tip and just go once done.    The room is excellent we had the swimming pool as the view. The housekeeping came everyday and put petals on the bed for the first 2 nights. What a nice gesture.    Breakfast was just excellent! Really enjoyed it! Thanks for making our breakfast superb with the crepes eggs station fresh fruit juices selection of Moroccan pastries etc.    This hotel is situated in Jemma el Fnna it’s very quiet inside. But once you go out it’s a circus and completely different.    Went for a facial at their spa. Again excellent experience. But I didn’t like it how the lady waited for me to put on my clothes once done in the same room. She should have given me the privacy to put my clothes on after the facial. Herbal tea was provided after the treatment at the reception.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent two nights in this fabulous hotel early December. We were upgraded upon check-in from a standard double room to a mini suite which was beautiful (view on the Medina though was not very picturesque so we kept the curtains shut)....the room was very comfortable and spacious  with a separate living-room area and extremely well equipped bathroom. Much care was taken in decorating the entire suite with rose petals and towel art on the bed. The room was extremely well cleaned. We dined twice in the hotel (once in the Moroccan where the food was quite good and the ambiance and entertainment was very nice....once in the Indian where the food was good too)...the breakfast was excellent with a very nice choice of delicious and fresh food (excellent fresh fruit juice eggs cooked to your liking great choice of breakfast pastries etc.). We both had a massage and Hammam....the massage were somewhat disappointing though but the spa area is lovely. I highly recommend the hairdressing services (very reasonably priced and great service). The hotel is incredibly well located just a few minutes' walk from the Jema El Efna square...really in the heart of the Medina. The ride is about 20 minutes from the airport and cars can access directly the front entrance of the hotel if there are not too many policemen checking (otherwise you can get dropped off 30 metres off). Overall we really enjoyed our stay and found the staff delightfully friendly and cheerful. We booked through Agoda and got a very good deal. We are already planning to return with our four children in the near future!

Review_Date: Muhammad S wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: For the amount the hotel charges you definitely do not get the value for your dollar (or euro). Our room was blowing hot air since we arrived and we were told the first night that there was a glitch in the system and the AC would work again. It did not work. We were then told that the hotel controls the temp in the rooms which was a complexly 180 from what we were told the night before. There are much better hotels with the same cost as this one and would recommend those instead
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Omg this hotel was amazing! 30 minutes from the airport and located walking distance to the market. Upon arrival we were greeted with a nice hot tea and then showed up to our room. Rooms were gorgeous and had a pretty view of the interior pool area. Free large bottle water and fruit for you too.    Hair dryer  mini fridge there. No iron. Bed was comfortable.    The Indian restaurant on site was delicious as well as the Moroccan one.    Wish we stayed longer so we could have really enjoyed the hotel more  and maybe in warmer weather.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Perfect place to explore the old town
Review_Text: This hotel is an oasis in the middle of the medina. We stayed here for 4 nights. The staff is courteous and very welcoming from front desk to restaurants and housekeepers.  Their Moroccon restaurant has delicious food. Located in the middle of the medina its perfect to explore the old town and just 15 mins to the new town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in a perfect location right off the Medina
Review_Text: Really cannot fault this hotel. Rooms were beautiful and spacious the overall decor of the hotel was stunningly opulent and the service was consistently excellent. Also a plus in Marrakech was the rooftop pool so you could get the sun all day ( the main pool downstairs was quite shaded which is common with the typical style of buildings in Marrakech). Breakfast buffet was also fantastic with plenty of choice. The location is ideal as whist you are in the Medina vehicles are able to drive right to the door so no lugging luggage around the main square! Would not consider staying anywhere else next time am in Marrakech.

Review_Title: very good 5 stards hotel close to jemaa el fna
Review_Text: Very good hotel located in a small street  2 minutes walking from Koutoubia tower and another 2 minutes walking from Jemaa El Fna.    Despite the street was always busy the interior was very quiet.    Pleasant lobby. Nice classical architecture. The central area is a large courtyard with a large swimming pool snack bar a billiard room a small business room and other rooms to read rest or talk. The moroccan restaurant and the piano bar also overlook this courtyard.    There was another very plesant swimming pool with snack bar at the rooftop. There is an indian restaurant located also at the rooftop and an european restaurant at the low floor.    The staff was gentle  polite and efficient.    My junior suite had good size. A well equipped bathroom (missing hooks for towels and a towl for the bidet however). Bathrobes and twels had good quality. The bed was King size and very comfortable. Minbar was ok. There was a Nespresso coffee maker and a safety box addequate for tables. On arrival there was a large fruit basket. The living oom had tow sofás and a table and the balcony(only partial view of the Koutoubia althugh it as advertized as “with Koutoubia view” ) was very pleasant and had two chair and a table. Lightning was good. Soundproofing was aceptable except at a certain moment of the moment when the guest at the upper floor arrived and every step from the upper floor was heard. Wardrobes had sufficient space but there was not a single cupboard in the room.    He TVs at the bedroom and living room were large but the channel selection was poor.    The wifi was poor very slow.    Breakfast was very good with moroccan and western choices (including bacon and ham unusual in muslim countries). The lady at the eggs cooking station was good and fast.    My experience at the spa was good with the massage but very poor with the hamman.    Summarizing a very good hotel with high standards at an excellent location (probably the best hotel very closet o Jemaa el Fna).    Value for Money was average (i paid around 550 euros for the junior suite for two with breakfast) however i would recommend this hotel due to its location and its high level.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel in their Medina double room which comes with a sofa area and a balcony overlooking the blue courtyard pool. Tastefully decorated in North African style and colours. A great bathroom with separate shower bath and toilet. Loved the breakfast which included made to order omelette and crepe sections and French influenced bread rolls and pastries. The hotel is in the heart of Marrakesh literally a few minutes from the hustle and bustle of the Medina and the tranquility of the Koutoubia Mosque. Mid November was ideal time to visit as the temperature during the day was a very comfortable 22-27C.

Review_Date: James M wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Go out of your way to visit this stunning hotel.
Review_Text: This is in the top 5 hotels I have had the pleasure of visiting.    From the moment you step inside the beauty is unreal.    The amount just to see inside is unreal.    If you really want a treat go upstairs to the rooftop bar. What a view and drinks are amazing.    This hotel is not overpriced and just great service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel for one week. We went for a relaxing time after three years at home due to covid. The location is perfect being only a few minutes walk to the main square which is worth visiting especially at night. All the staff are very helpful if you need anything. It is a lovely hotel and I would come back again.

Review_Date: Radha W. wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Good experience at Jardins de la Koutoubia!
Review_Text: Jardins de la Koutoubia is a nice hotel!  The pool is very big and nice.  The rooms are also very nice but the first room I was given the AC was smelling a lot and the room was stinky but the second room they gave me was big and also had a nice sitout like a little balcony.  The breackfast was horrible sorry to say some things in the breackfast were okay like the omelette pancakes and croissants.  The orange juice was great!  The breackfast staff was kind especially Aziza she was very kind and helpful.  good hotel nice experience just bad breackfast.

Review_Date: Juliet D wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Lovely hotel close to the main square
Review_Text: Lovely hotel within a few minutes walk of the Médina but away from the hustle and bustle. The hotel has a kind of faded old world feel to it - it’s full of Moroccan decorations rugs and paintings which give it an authentic charming feel. We were welcomed with sweet tea on arrival and quickly checked in. We stayed in a Mini Suite which had a double bed and 2 singles a large bathroom and wardrobe area and a big terrace overlooking the gardens below. The staff were all very helpful and polite though we had a couple of instances within the restaurant where we struggled to be understood. We were on a B&B basis so ate breakfast every morning- it was good buffet style breakfast and the kids found enough to eat. We also ate once on the rooftop at the Indian which was really nice. The hotel has 2 pools - the main one in the central courtyard was a little cool but there’s another heated pool on the rooftop. I tried the spa and had an amazing massage (for much cheaper than I’d get at home). It’s a lovely hotel with kind staff lots of beautiful gardens and close to the centre of town. If it feels a little tired around the edges and less glitzy than a normal western 5 star I think this just adds to its charm.

Review_Title: Beautiful Spacious Mini Suite Close to Medina Square and Mosque
Review_Text: The hotel is perfectly located a 5 minutes walk to the Medina square. Our Mini Suite was beautiful very spacious with 2 bathrooms comfortable bed. Service was very caring and warm Breakfast was excellent eggs made by order nice variety buffet awesome cappuccino.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Louise c wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: This is the best hotel/riad in Marrakech. It’s location is perfect being just off the main square making everything very accessible. As you walk through the doors its palatial grandeur is breathtaking. The staff are courteous very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. The quality of the spacious rooms is excellent and they are exceptionally clean. There is an extensive choice of foods for Breakfast and we feasted like king's during our stay. This is a beautiful and wonderful place to stay and I would never go anywhere else in Marrakech. I will be going back very soon

Centrally located - beautiful hotel with a central courtyard that included a pool. There is another more private roof top pool. The street is blocked from cars normally so the luggage is carted in by the porters. The rooms are well sized. Good WiFi and TV. Fully air conditioned. The location is excellent - you can walk to the Medina and can explore other sites also.  Service is excellent and we would like to thank Abdelkarim who served breakfast and dinner at the French Restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah R wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: From start to finish this wonderful hotel did not fail to impress. Fantastic concierge service excellent housekeeping wonderful waiters amazing masseurs. Well worth spending the money to stay in luxury when visiting the bustling Marrakech. Our room was a junior suite and this was ample in size. Brilliant location very easy to get around to all the sights and plenty of help and guidance along the way. We will most definitely be back.

Review_Title: Take a good look at your credit card receipt.
Review_Text: Rooftop Indian restaurant credit card fail. Had two terrific dinners at the Indian restaurant. At the second dinner the server made an error and charged us $530 for a $53 dinner. No manager on staff to correct and after 1/2 an hour of trying a “Director” on the phone said we would be reimbursed the next day. Never did. Working with credit card company now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jen G wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: My husband and I together with two children (23 and 13) recently stayed at this beautiful hotel for 10 days. It was our first time to Marrakech and I was slightly unsure how I would feel especially as the hotel is in the middle of such a busy area. However we all loved the craziness of Djemma el Fna and to be able to walk to into this stunning place as an escape was amazing. The staff were brilliant food and drink great. Thank you Abde in the Skybar for looking after us so well each night til late and playing us some great tunes and Norman and Faicel in the Piano Bar. Norman’s knowledge of Marrakech and cocktails kept us entertained. Thank you all for helping make our holiday great. We will be back - Lee Jen Jack and Will

Review_Date: jacob oz wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We have the great honor to tell you guys about our great staying in the hotel Les jardein de la Koutoubia:  It was perfect in any aspect the rooms the staff the location the food the pool and actualy everything was perfect. I'd like to emphasize Mr Khanjari Abdessadeq  Head concierge service  Mr Abdessadeq is an angel. every question has been answered in a very kind way. we realy got from Mr Abdessadeq a vey professional and wolcome service .  we are very sure that thanks to him we'll recommand about the hotel.    Sincerly yours  Jacob Oz
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed for a week in the mini suite which I can not highly recommend. The room (2nd floor room 254) is stunning with a good size lounge area and balcony (double day bed) looking out towards the lush garden. The hotel boasts 3 swimming pools: rooftop ground level and one with the spa- underground). Pool areas are quiet and peaceful- a real sanctuary.  House keeping is twice a day. They left fresh roses on the bed and the bathroom everyday. The hotel has an Indian restaurant on the roof top and serves delicious cuisine. Throughout my weeks stay I didn’t eat anywhere else but here. The hotel also has other restaurants and snack bars. Staff ensure hygiene and cleanliness to paramount and this can be seen in and around the hotel grounds which are spotless. I need to give a special mention to the Head Concierge Mr Abdi/Abdul (sorry don’t know his full name) for all his help and guidance during my weeks stay. He arranged for tours suitable for me and my mum (aged 78) who has limited mobility and an English speaking tour guide. Our stay was perfect made by the helpful cheery staff at breakfast and the front door as well as the cleaners in and around the communal toilet. So pleased I choose this hotel for my stay. Jem Fanaa square is 3 minutes walk round the corner. Small touches made a big difference like the daily fresh fruit skewers delivered to all those around the pool at 4pm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Arrived late into the madness of Marrakech and were dropped on Rue Koutabia approx 200 yards from hotel  Feared the worst tbh !!!  Found hotel without issue and wow…  An oasis is the middle of the madness  Patio room magnificent  We were bed and breakfast and both did not disappoint  Breakfast was buffet style with a varied choice inc freshly cooked omelettes/crepes etc  Orange juice and fresh coffee delivered to your table by staff  The hotel itself is chic and stylish  Pool area immaculate where bar food/drinks were available by waiter service  Receptionists and concierge very helpful particularly with prices of taxis etc and with general advice  Please be aware that as soon as you exit the hotel you are fair game for the locals  I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return  Great situation for exploring the city  Thank you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel right in the Medina. Don’t misjudge by the front entrance….you go through the front door and you are in an oasis. The pool is wonderful and the rooms are large well decorated and extremely clean. The breakfast was excellent and the people who work there are fabulous. They are so helpful and try to accommodate you in every way. Highly recommended….you won’t be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jayne H wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Perfect serenity right in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights and wish we had had longer. It was absolutely beautiful and like something out of a movie. The reception guys were friendly and helpful and we were given a stunning room. We had opted for one of the cheaper rooms overlooking the medina and so glad we did. The street views were fascinating and always something happening. Breakfast was plentiful and sat in lovely surroundings. The pool area was well kept and clean and virtually silent ( the whole hotel is very well sound proofed). We ate in the pool bar area a few times and yes it was tourist prices but easy in the baking sun. In the evening all we had to do was step outside  walk a few metres and we had a huge choice of restuarants on the square. For being in the thick of the wonderful colourful hustle and bustle and being a few steps from taxis and shops you couldnt beat it. Then you walked into the hotel lobby and the calmness was amazing.  Great bedding beds toilettries and free water. Would definetly reccomend.

Review_Title: Beautiful backdrop for a lovely dinner.
Review_Text: Lovely ambiance. Went there before sunset. Restaurant and staff were helpful. The food was amazing. We are mainly vegetarian and love spicy food. Hanan provided amazing service. Chicken Tikka Masala was also good. There was also a dancing show at 8
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Beautiful setting decor style and great if you want to be at the medina. Lovely staff but see below food fairly food great room bathroom clean and comfortable on all levels.    However if you stay in a pool room which has a lovely outlook you will probably not get any sleep!  There is no soundproofing whatsoever we had a group who stayed up laughing playing pool with crashing balls chatting drinking until 4 am  therefore all guests in bedrooms around the pool area has no sleep over these nights. The night porter was too weak to ask them to move or go to bed even after many many guests complained. Not a peaceful place to stay at all.  When the breakfast service starts or anyone goes for a swim again you’re up!    Noisy traditional music starts at 6pm which we enjoyed to begin with but gets repetitive and annoying when it’s every night and continues until 10.30 pm again very loud in the room with the balcony doors closed.    So beautiful hotel and Duty Manager Adul was helpful listening to our complaint we were compensated slightly but if you value your sleep don’t get a pool room medina side may be worse ask for quiet!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen S wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Way Past its Sell By Date
Review_Text: In my 300+ reviews I have written only two negative reviews prior to this one. Here goes: All this property has going for it is location....period. The room was dirty. We showed the head of housekeeping a ledge in the bathroom and she said it was coloured marble....then we put a wet wash cloth on it and the 'marble' went away.  The Thai food on the roof restaurant was inedible (I am being polite after many visits to Bangkok) The dinner at the ground floor restaurant was Moroccan but bland and chewy. Not like Al Fassia and more expensive.  The GM was no where to be seen and when you asked to speak to him was was always 1) in a meeting or 2) Off site The person in charge was the head of public Relations....need I say more?

The room we booked was lovely and comfortable then they upgraded us to a suite - oo la la! Super location. An easy walk to the medina and never any problem catching transportation within the city. Main pool and roof top pool both great. Also a pool inside where the spa is; my wife and I had superlative massages. Staff and service impeccable. In particular Bouiski the head of reception was accessible knowledgeable fluent in half dozen languages and guided us through the various adventures we sought. We found the hotel via Trip Advisor and glad we did.

Review_Date: Rohit Bihani wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Best location, connected to Jemaa El Fna Medina
Review_Text: This is a traditional hotel with a fantastic location! On one side is Jemaa El Fna Medina and on the other is the Koutoubia Mosque. The hotel itself is in a peaceful alley which is the best part.  Rooms are large and very comfortable with spacious toilets and good amenities. there are 3 swimming pools plenty of dining options open terrace and indoor bar area and live entertainment in the evenings.  Its a true feel of Marrakech and Morocco!!

Review_Date: Oghale P wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: My stay in Hotel les Jardins de la Koutoubia was simply enjoyable: excellent location and facilities nice restaurants good customer service and friendly services. Special thanks to Khanjari the head concierge for his personal warmth and good recommendations. He made our stay memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beware of your money in this hotel
Review_Text: The holiday was booked through loveholidays. First mistake . The transfer system is really terrible even though we had upgraded to private transfers took the rep an hour to sort our transport. Hotel was all good happy smiles laughter . We were booked in 4 nights 9th may my birthday. A surprise trip from my children. Monday to Wednesday went okay . We were half board. Breakfast was okay  nothing really special. As we are British pakistani origin the food in all 3 restaurant s was awful the Indian restaurant food was full of salt and spices that were overpowering we never went back . The local cafes in the square were much more cheaper and better food . After 5 pm they hold a food market which we never knew existed until our 3rd night there. It was on this evening the 11th that my husband was still hungry due to not liking the food in hotel restaurant. Around 10pm we took a walk to see what we could eat in the square. It was the first time my husband decided to leave his money bag under our pillow in room  with British pounds in there we had morroccon money on us that we needed. Next day we realised when we were to exchange money that £120 had been taken  panicking the extra money that was in safe had also been taken £320 that’s when the staff manager and everyone changed. We were accused of wanting to claim travel insurance when we didn’t even have any . We were treated like petty accusers . My husband went to the police station to report the incident. There was only 1 English speaking officer which made it impossible to communicate with them . They took our number and email address but have heard nothing since. This was a nightmare holiday ruined my birthday and was £500 down . Was so disappointed in the hotel managers there was no compassion whatsoever of our situation. Would never go back there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: PJ M wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Rare posture of the staff regarding what they wrongly understood as a different couple when we were 2 male friends in hollydays. As they thought it was a gay couple waiters at breakfast were rude. At the pool bar the fact of not being French was also a minus at the moment of getting food or drinks. A level of discrimination and even racism not admissible in an international 5 star hotel. Definitely a place not to go if you are gay or not French. If we were not gay but we were 2 male friends and were lousy treated I imagine what would suffer obvious gay guys.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautifully relaxing, chic and tranquil Hotel with wonderful staff
Review_Text: We've just returned from a fabulously relaxing 4 night break at this hotel - this couldn't have been a better spot for us. As others have said don't be put off by the busy street on arrival at the front of the hotel it's just a 15 minute taxi transfer from the airport and you are in the heart of the action just a few minutes walk from the main square and the souks and yet as soon as you step into reception you enter a different world...a beautiful cool calm oasis with extremely friendly and helpful staff who seem to work tirelessly to keep their guests happy. We felt we were in safe hands from the outset and could immediately relax and enjoy ourselves.  We had booked a mini suite with separate sitting room but were upgraded to a Junior suite which was smart spacious and well equipped and had a beautiful large quiet balcony with a view of the Koutoubia mosque.  We wanted to be able to dip in and out of the local attractions and restaurants but also to have some relaxing pool time in the sun. This worked perfectly. There is a large pool set in beautiful gardens in the main courtyard and a smaller heated pool up on the roof with stunning views of the mosque both were lovely to swim in and relax around. There were good restaurants by each pool and we enjoyed breakfast each morning in the peaceful poolside gardens.  We've been to Marrakech before and love the city but the hustle and bustle can get a bit much this hotel provided the best of all worlds for us we can't recommend it enough and will definitely return.

Review_Date: Bob C wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: We were going to stay at a very famous hotel when I came across Le Jardins de la Koutoubia on google. The reviews I read were all good and so was the location so I decided to book a Junior Suite for my family and I. We arrived quite early in the morning so we weren't expecting to check in till later. I was greeted by Abdellatif at the front desk. He advised that the room will be ready shortly and we were welcome to have some refreshments . We had barely finished out tea when Abdel advised our room was ready and we could check in. Very seamless and easy check-in process and the best part was the room we were given was huge  separate bedroom  lounge  2 bathrooms and an open verandah. WOW isn't close enough to describe how nice the hotel is and how amazing the room we were given. The hotel is Amazing  the location is Amazing and the Staff are Amazing. As you can tell we had a fantastic 5 days and Abdul was instrumental in making our stay a memorable one. 5 Stars to Abdul and the front of house team. Our first trip to Marrakech would not have been the same without his advice and recommendations. THANK YOU Les Jardin de la Koutoubia and Big shout out to Abdellatif. See you soon Marrakech.

Review_Title: We will come back - could not fault the place nor the staff
Review_Text: Absolutely fantastic  Wonderful building  Great location  An oasis of tranquility in a busy medina    Great food lovely bar beautiful room  And lots of tortoises!    We stayed during Ramadan but we’re still allowed to have a drink in the bar which we appreciated    Our bedroom suite was absolutely stunning    There were two pools three restaurants and a snug bar.    The gardens are also stunning    There is also a pool table and table tennis to entertain the children
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kenneth F wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Spacious tranquil lots of facilities very welcoming staff good food - three different restaurants. Several snack bars scattered around. It was cold windy and rainy for about half our stay and having a great place to stay was very welcome. No downside at all.

Review_Date: Sue H wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: A great place for a meal in a tranquil setting
Review_Text: After several hours experiencing the Janaa El-Fnaa and the Medina we really wanted some peace and quiet. By accident we came across this hotel and after speaking to the doorman we entered through a very unassuming door. Wow what a surprise. A genuine oasis of calm in the chaos on the edge of the Janaa El-Fanaa. The tables were situated around one side of the hotel’s swimming pool shaded amongst beautiful gardens. We had a lovely light meal with wine and coffee. The staff were lovely with nothing too much trouble. What a find.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First visit to Marrakesh & we are so pleased we picked this hotel . Real oasis away from all the craziness of souks etc  Staff very friendly  great location lovely piano bar & great courtyard pool ! Highly recommend staying here .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel was in super location close to the Medina with some beautiful architecture however they let themselves down a little by not keeping up wit the maintenance especially the electrical fittings.    Staff at breakfast/room service / cleaners were superb but the reception staff appeared a little abrupt not very helpful.    I would class this as probably a 4 star the hotel also caters much more towards French clientele. Could not provide adapter as they do not hold any also no tea/coffee making facilities in room.    The shower riser was only waist high so could not have a proper shower without having to hand hold the shower head    We paid approx £200 per night for a twin room and were surprised to learn that this did not include access to the in door heated swimming pool & they wanted an extra 20 Euros per person per use to use the pool    The service at the Indian restaurant on the top floor was poor & very rushed they tried clearing the table whilst we were still eating & then issued the bill one the bill was paid they started turning the lights off if you want a nice relaxed meal this in not the place food was mediocre for the price many more restaurants in Marrakesh which provide super food and service for a similar price.    Overall disappointed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Erik P wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: Situated in the medina close to the Jemaa-Al-Fna this hotel is your must-visit in Marrakech!  Fantastic pool (unheated) area on the ground floor.  Great (heated) pool on the roof.  3 fantastic restaurants a wonderful bar… and above all: great staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elona B wrote a review Sep 2021
Review_Text: We stayed at les jardins for 3 nights family of five. The hotel is located in the best area possible in the Medina but not deep inside the hustle and bustle of the old Town  The hotel has a beautiful pool local features gorgeous gardening and is spotless clean  The staff is more than helpful nice polite always smiling and wanting to help. I want to personally thank Mr Khanjari Abdessadeq at the front desk for the wonderful tips and help with reservations  Breakfast was perfect for us fruits pastries veggies eggs and chocolate creps for my 10 year old son  We will definitely come back here on our next trip to Marrakesh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Excellent service from very friendly staff. The hotel was so close to the souk hustle and bustle of the old city and lots of nice restaurants but once you were inside it was like you were in a tranquil oasis! Would highly recommend this for value for money as well as the position. Very easy to walk to places / get a taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have loved this hotel for many years the beautiful architecture pools restaurants and quiet pool areas truly are an oasis.    We were so looking forward to visiting again.    I wanted to write this review because whilst here the Corona virus is having a devestating affect across the world and impacted Morocco also.    The Manager and staff of this hotel have continued to provide the most amazing service in such difficult times and dealing with stressed tourists trying get home cant be easy.    All too often we forget the human side of this and the Moroccans themselves must be very fearful and yet they continue in their daily duties.    When the last guests leave in a couple of days this magical majestic hotel will no doubt close its doors for some time.    My sincere thanks to you all for trying to keep things as 'normal as possible' in such difficult times.    I hope one day to return again to your majestic country and my favourite hotel ever!    Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Perfect location next to the famous square Djernaa El Fna. We had a fantastic suite nicely decorated Marokkaan style. Hotelroom was very quiet and we were even on the street side. Cleanliness friendliness and food services were great. Fresh flowers in your room in the lobby and outside in the garden (surround the swimming pool) were lovely. Together with nice temperature (27 Degree Celsius) outside our stay was to short.

First impressions are often right but not here. Arriving down a dusty street I thought we were in the wrong place but once through the door you are transported to another world! The reception area is beautiful - dark sultry and very Moroccan. We had arrived an hour early (despite French air traffic controls best attempts to route us the long way around) but our mini-suite was ready and oh what a fabulous room! Large luxurious well equipped and with rose petals everywhere! Lovely bathroom lounge area and a private outdoor terrace  Hotel itself is rambling but lovely. Very quiet despite being right in the centre of Marrakech. Two lovely pools including one on the roof that has the benefit of a gentle breeze. Comfortable sun loungers make it a pleasant place to relax either in the shade or the sun.  Restaurants very good serving a range of different foods. Also discovered vin gris which is rather good (apologies to any sommeliers for my appalling grasp of wines).  Gorgeous spa area underground. Gym small warm but perfectly adequate...let's face it you are unlikely to be spending much time in it!  Helpful staff on reception organised a private tour of the Medina and attractions which was was well worth it.  Overall a fabulous hotel in a.lively and interesting city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard H wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: This was our first time in Morocco so we decided to look for somewhere nice with good reviews. We didn’t want a Western style chain Hotel and this place did not disappoint.    The immediate impression as you walk in is the coolness from the heat and the sudden transformation from organized chaos on the street outside to almost stunning tranquility. A lovely welcome drink of mint tea was served as we checked in and bags were taken to the room. The staff took time to show us around the grounds on the way to our room which was really nice. It was an older style room in décor but it gave it an authentic feel and my good lady got very excited when she realized we had separate loos and bathrooms. I was not allowed to trespass in her domain!    The bed and lounge chairs were really comfy and the room temperature was easily controlled day and night. Every day the ladies who cleaned our room provided us with a new style of towel folding and petal arranging. Not something we usually expect but a nice touch to underline the superb cleanliness of the hotel.    There is loads of space to relax outside in the large courtyard a haven for shade if you need some and there is a roof top pool and loungers with café if you want to soak up the sun.    We took breakfast each morning and it was lovely. Plenty of choice for all tastes with the usual continental style of cheeses meats pastries breads and orange juice constantly being freshly squeezed. We varied between al Fresco and inside seating during our stay.    The hotel guest relations manager (Sorry I forgot her name) was superb. She arranged a couple of tours by private car one local and one to the mountains. Do expect to be taken to the Tanneries and spice shops and do expect to be hassled for sales but if you have a strong character you can overcome this. We failed miserably. The tour into the Atlas Mountains was well worth it and we persuaded our driver that we had no desire to stop off at any markets Souks Shops or camels! He got a free lunch for obliging!    This type of holiday was very different to what we normally do and the Hotel made it a really good change to make.

My husband booked this hotel for my birthday - it was situated in the old part of Marrakech close to the grand mosque and the medina was around a 5 minute walk.  The hotel was very tranquil and beautiful and on arrival the staff were welcoming and we were given tea. Our room was very spacious and overlooked the pool.  Breakfast was included. The service was very good and good choice of hot and cold breakfast with delicious fresh orange.  We had lunch at the hotel which was great and also the Moroccan restaurant which we would recommend.  The reception manager was very helpful during our stay and arranged a private guide for a morning called Abdul well worth the cost we visited the palace museum and souks and was very informative about the area all on foot.  The hotel has lovely spa facilities we had a relaxing massage each which was a nice treat followed by the spa pool.  If we come back to Marrakech again we would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane R wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Fabulous oasis in the midst of all the buzz
Review_Text: We had an amazing time and loved this Hotel!! Kind of an oversized Riad with three really nice restaurants..... the French was our favourite - my partner had steak tartare which was apparently really good and testament to not having to over worry about the food!Moroccan and Indian were good too and breakfast a great choice to cater for everyone. I had a kidney transplant last year so was pleasantly surprised by how fabulously well I ate!! Staff were attentive and friendly. We typically had a drink or cocktail in one of their bars before dinner the Piano bar was great when a bit chilly out but Sky Bar lovely for views!! We also made good use of their pools downstairs wasn’t heated although we preferred that the roof top was and had sun for longer! I was loved the way there was a new decoration of roses and petals on our bed each day! Would definitely recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Most riad hotels in Marrakesh are small and intimate which is great if that’s your thing but if you want spacious rooms 2 pools great breakfast and enough space for a family this hotel is for you. Staff is courteous concierge is knowledgeable and the location impeccable next to the big square with easy access to the Médina and it’s amazing shopping restaurants and night life. The SPA is a great deal for one or more days of treatments and the beds and showers amongst the beat we’ve experienced in our travels. All at a reasonable price. The only downside if you had to pick one? Having to pick rose petals off the bed everyday before going to sleep!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We enjoyed our last three nights in Marrakech at Les Jardins de La Koutoubia. The hotels location is unique being that it is right next to the grand Mosque and the central market square. It is truly an oasis in the middle of the chaos that is old Marrakech with beautiful views and all the amenities expected from a hotel of this caliber. There are plenty of luxuries available and the restaurants in the hotel were fabulous. We wound down every night at the piano bar to have some drinks and listen to the piano player before dinner. Breakfast was very good with just about anything you could need including made to order omelets or pancakes. The entire staff was friendly courteous and professional. We really felt welcome and special the entire time at the hotel. The room was wonderful. We got a basic room with a courtyard view that was surprisingly large. Everything was very clean and the bed was perfectly comfortable. Truly a five star experience at a good price! We would absolutely stay again at the Hotel and will recommend it to friends. Thank you to the entire staff at Les Jardins de La Koutoubia for making our stay so memorable.

Second visit to this fab hotel! Another great stay! Food delicious and all staff kind and welcoming! Enchanting and vibrant city! Right in the heart of the Medina yet an oasis of calm inside! The spa is fab; the piano bar and the resident pianist fab!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Luxurious and comfortable room. Amazing food. Wonderful staff. Great location. It's everything you want and more. I would love to come back soon. It's not the cheapest hotel But you definitely get what you pay for.

Review_Title: A peaceful oasis in the heart of the old city
Review_Text: This is a fabulous 5 star hotel in a central location just off the hustle & bustle of Djema Al Finaa square & Koutobia mosque yet once you are inside it is a haven of peace & tranquility.    The hotel is set out like a large traditional riad yet has an elegant & old world charm with the most stunning mosaics & decor throughout including 3 pools & restaurants.  The views of the sunset from the rooftop were stunning with the Koutoubia Minaret providing the perfect backdrop    We stayed in a spacious & beautifully decorated suite Shona with a fantastic view of the Koutoubia minaret from the garden terrace balcony.  Breakfast was simple and plentiful and the staff were always friendly polite & helpful.  Highly recommended & would love to return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I've been to morroco 8 times and this hotel was the best hotel so far the location is brilliant and the interior design is beautiful very royals and grand. Loved the fresh flowers in the room everyday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is ideally placed for access to the Medina (ca. 200 mtrs walk) and it is an oasis of calm compared to what's going on outside. It is in the style of a riad with two sections joined by a lane which has security staff monitoring it. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. There is a spa with a delightful indoor swimming pool (pay to use) along with two outdoor pools one on the rooftop the other at ground level in the courtyard. There are three restaurants (Indian - rooftop Moroccan - ground floor Le Relais de Paris which is in the second section). There is also an indoor bar which does snacks from 5pm and a snack bar at lunchtime and a rooftop sky bar. The rooms are spacious and housekeeping was superb. We booked through BA along with a private transfer (also via BA). Don't bother with the private transfer as it was chaos and we waited 40 minutes for our ride - we would have been better off using a taxi as they were plentiful.

Review_Title: One of the best hotels ever
Review_Text: I have searched for a nice hotel inside the Medina but I was a little afraid of reaching them walking at night. So I decided to stay in a hotel not far from the main roads that could be reached even by taxi. So I found Le Jardin that suprised me in different aspects: the inside patio is wonderful the room was cozy the breakfast was fantastic and the gastronomy options inside the hotel was amazing. There is only one complain about the indian restaurant: the first night there was a mistake in our bill that was prompetly solved by the manager (they charged two desserts that we hasn't ordered). On another night I invited my Family to have dinner with me (a total of 8 people) and I ordered 4 rice pots as side dishes. The waiter brought 3 and I reminded him about the missing one. He replied that he thought 3 would be fine. Everyone on the table was awared of the happening because I asked everybody if it would be ok. When the bill came there was 4 rice pots charged on it. Ok it could be a mistake - another one but ok. Then I called the marrocan hostess and said there was a mistake. She called the waiter and he told her that he had brought 4 pots instead of 3. She seemed to agree with him even my whole family witnessed the fact. At the end she decided to charge Just 3. The problem was not the mistake. The problem was to face 8 people against one. In a bill that costed us almost 2000 Dirham it would be not 40 Dirham the main problem. We decided for other restaurants during our stay. Even so the hotel was a great option and I Will recomend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Although I did not stay here I came across this hotel and it was the perfect spot for a little pit stop for lunch an oasis amongst the busy square and souk.  Very well placed near the Jemaa El-fna square. The staff were extremely friendly showing suggestions of places to eat within the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Bernd C wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Nice venue, Top hotel in the city center @ the Medina of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Nice hotel in the style of a riad. With a rooftop bar three good restaurants and three pools (rooftop yard and indoor). Service is very friendly and the house provides big rooms.  We were with a business group and had all a good time. It was a good experience.

Review_Date: neha j wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Memorable New Year dinner with friends!!
Review_Text: We were a party of 12( 6 adults and 6 kids) celebrating New Years In Marrakech. It was such a memorable experience with delicious Indian food and warm ambience. The hospitality of the server is something we will always remember. Wonderful dinner to celebrate the end of an awesome decade and to welcome the new decade!! Highly recommend this restaurant!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Yes! What a find real authentic 5 Star hotel right next to Médina. Just heaven. 2 pools one rooftop sky bar and spa. Amazing food and service. Great value compared to other less authentic 5 star offerings. Will definitely be back for longer. Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Leonardo C wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Most impressive is the positive attitude of the staff that immediately shower the guests with little attentions and careful service. Never overbearingyet highly polished in a friendly non mechanical manner. Incredible location 30 minutes by feet to the main attractions while being at the crossroads with the modern chic neighborhoods of gueliz and hivernage. We forgot a package in the lobby while going to the airport and the reception swiftly organized for a cab driver to bring it to us in 20 minutes. Highly highly adviced!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We have visted as a 10 persons group the Morroccon restaurant in the Hotel Les jardins de la Koutoubia . The dishes were ok  wine reasonable prices reasonable.  The awaited belly dancing lasted maybe max 10 minutes  what has been definitely too short. The gardenreception swiiming pool around the restaurant create a nice atomsphere.The Hotel is very well situated  everwhere colse on foot.    So on all in all pretty good but without "fireworks"

We stayed here with a 9 year old and had a great time. Its a 4 min walk to the Jemma El Fna square (main medina) and right across from the Koutoubia. The outside appearance is not flattering but once you're inside you forget the chaos outside and embrace the tranquil inside.  We ate at the restaurants and also used the Spa. Highly recommend for great location and friendly staff!

This is just on the edge of the Medina so you can get dropped by taxi at the door to the hotel and walk into the souk straight away! Rooms are fantastic it is worth upgrading to a mini suite with a fab view of the Koutobia Mosque. There are three great restaurants a Moroccan the best India west of Chennai and a great French Restaurant perfect for steaks. There are two pools with a heated pool on the rooftop. Staff are great service excellent. Prices are good. Alcohol is expensive in Morocco but this hotel does not rip you off. Highly recommended.

Review_Date: Khaoula M wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: I went there for a 45 min massage It was a gift card. I was treated with a lot of attention. The personnel are very professional and the details are really taken care of. I keep a very nice memory of that retreat.

Review_Date: Neil C wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Top Rated hotel perfectly located in a side road off the main drag and close to all major attractions and right next door to the main square Jemma ElFnr however far enough away to be very quiet.Great staff very friendly and always willing to help.They were even prepared to walk to the end of the road to hail a Taxi for us and at night the ever present security staff even called up a taxi for us on his personal mobile phone. Beautiful rooms kept meticulously clean. Lovely dining room for breakfast which becomes the Morrocan Restaurant in the evening. Lovely pool on the roof with food and drink available at all times. Highly recommended.

Came here for a week (still here actually and sadly our last day tomorrow) and have to say this is just the most fabulous hotel. When you pull up in your taxi outside it doesn’t look like much at all but once you walk through the doors - wow!!    Our suite is wonderful- spacious and beautifully decorated. The staff are attentive friendly and efficient through the hotel. The hotel has great facilities (including 3 pools one indoor one in the centre of the hotel and one on a sun trap’ roof) and location is perfect right in the centre of the old town just a few steps from the main square.    Would definitely definitely recommend a stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Martin D wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: On checking in shown a very substandard room and only on request of our travel agent was able to change. However next room had a noisy extractor fan in bathroom that wouldn’t turn off and despite asking staff to rectify several times they didn’t so we checked out after 2 nights having not being able to sleep properly. Taxis don’t stop outside the hotel so you have to wheel your suitcases 200 yards trying to avoid motorcycle traffic. They could do so much better the staff were very inattentive and it doesn’t deserve to be 5star rated. As we were moving hotel the staff made us carry our luggage out ourselves to taxis .. avoid

Review_Title: Fantastic hotel - an oasis close to the Medina
Review_Text: This is our second stay here and we truly love the hotel bars restaurants and accommodations here. The staff is superb professional and informative. The restaurants are wonderful including the main one off the lobby the restaurant towards the back of the pool and the Indian restaurant on the roof. The rooftop bar is excellent and has a great view. I recommend a room facing the garden or the pool since the street can be noisy. Tonight we’ll try the piano bar!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Long weekend in Marrakech and treated ourselves to a mini suite here. This hotel is fabulous - right on the edge of the Médina in a mostly traditional style with 3 lovely pools including one on the roof. The staff can’t do enough for you and special thanks to AbelAziz in the breakfast room and Moroccan restaurant and Mohammed in the sky bar who both provided exceptional service. Great pancakes for breakfast! We ate in the Moroccan and Indian restaurants and loved them both - expensive by Moroccan standards but not by Irish. Very high quality food.  Loved our mini suite so much - beautiful decorated 2 massive TVs and great bathroom with separate toilet as well as a garden terrace. Spotlessly clean and spacious we could not fault it. Would definitely go back. Great value- there are some seriously posh hotels in Marrakech like La Mamounia but much preferred this. Our only small thing was trying to arrange a late checkout which we got eventually until 2pm for free.  Great location for the Soukh etc and easy to walk to new town. Just across from Koutoubia Mosque. Beware taxis are just determined to rip you off - always agree price first before you get in! Hotel arranged pick up from airport which was overpriced but a nice thing to have on arrival.  Can’t wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil S wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Oasis if calm in the middle of chaos
Review_Text: Arrived at Les Jardins and checked in quickly and efficiently. Shown to a nice spacious room. Large double bed sofa patio and a large bathroom with bath and a separate walk in shower. Fluffy towels and bathrobes were excellent.    Breakfast included in the rate was excellent for both choice and quality. The Moroccan and Indian restaurants were also excellent.    Hotel has two pools one on the rooftop. Both very nice and quiet.    The staff at Les Jardins are absolutely excellent. Friendly efficient and welcoming.    We would stay again.

Review_Title: Beautiful but cigars in the bar - really?
Review_Text: Staying here now in huge and wonderful old room covered in rise petals to welcome us.    Unfortunately smelling of cigarette smoke from the piano bar last night. Smoking is permitted everywhere even though there are 2 distinct sections of the bar. The staff were not concerned about how unpleasant we found this. "People like to smoke" we were told! I wouldn't come here till they sort this. Terrible by European standards.    Looking at the 2 other nice hotels nearby to see about moving for the rest of the week.    Small issues - only one option of a red or white wine by the glass couldn't provide snacks in the bar limited help as luggage hasn't arrived yet.    I would take your business elsewhere.    Such a shame as such a beautiful hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Reinhold S wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Dear La Koutoubia Team.  Thank you so much for your great Service from reception employees to the Sky bar keeper.  A special thank you for the cake which our daughter received to her birthday.  We enjoyed a nice and relaxing stay again.  Best regards to all employees.  RS
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Claire B wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: From beginning to end our stay was marvellous. The hotel is a wonderful oasis of calm in the midst of the medina so close to Jemaa el-Fnaa square and the stunning Koutoubia mosque. Nothing was too much trouble the staff were always polite helpful and friendly. Our room (junior suite) was spotlessly clean and well appointed we spent a lot of time just chilling on the terrace. The restaurants were all lovely the food delicious and the only problem with the atmospheric piano bar was trying to find a seat some evenings! The whole place exudes elegance and was a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of the incredible city.

Review_Date: Sabrina S wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: NO BRAINER! YOU MUST STAY HERE!
Review_Text: This hotel is perfect in every way. It is right beside Jema el Fina KFC and an ABM. It is pretty close to the train station as well. The buffet breakfast is delicious! the staff are so nice. I definitely recommend this place.

Review_Title: Oasis in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Perfect stay for two nights at this lovely hotel which is superbly situated just next to the Medina. Lovely pool restaurants and a great roof top terrace. Excellent management and concierge who planned everything for us including airport pick up local and excellent guide who helped us navigate the souks and hot air ballooning. They also booked our restaurants even one that was fully booked and they managed to get us squeezed in! Rooms very comfortable. This is of course larger than the riads in the medina but we were so pleased we chose it. Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful suite and excellent front desk service
Review_Text: Interior was luxurious and old world elegant.  Breakfast was lovely and served either on patio or in elegant dining room.  Front desk was very helpful arranging guides and drivers. Gardens were filled with flowers and our rooms adorned with roses. All staff we encountered were welcoming and polite.

Excellent service and very relaxing place to enjoy all that is good about Marrakesh.  Expensive but good value and accommodation was very comfortable. Some areas are needing TLC which would make it a very nice hotel raising the level.  The staff were wonderful and friendly and always smiling and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 days ....the room was nice and appeared newly decorated. The safe however did not work and we waited in for over half a hour to get it fixed...in the end we just went out. Waiting staff here provide a good solid service but not overall that amazing. On 8th I visited to spa to ask about the treatment I have booked ...the woman on reception started to shout at me..I was in total shock ...NEVER in my 35 years of travel have I been shouted at by a member of hotel staff. I took my complaint immediately to reception where the spa manager came to see me...she said the woman on the spa reception desk was not there to deal with clients ..I questioned why she was on the spa reception not only on the 8th but took my booking on the 7th...I didn't get a reply..then the spa manager said I had misunderstood to which I replied that there was no confusion ..someone either shouts at you or they do not shout at you and I was quite clearly shouted at .. even writing this review I still can not believe how I was spoken to.....the hotel is close to the medina and we both enjoy haggling in the souks and found all shop keepers polite and playful when bartering which was great as we were a little weary before travelling here ...you do get a little harassed by tour guides but a simple no thank stopped them from pestering you further. We would like to say that 2 members of staff in the hotel were outstanding they were the customer relations manager who was always available especially at breakfast ..and the lady who attended the toilets near the pool...both were friendly and helpful and went the extra mile it is a shame that other staffing in the hotel were not as courteous.....A week before we travelled to this hotel we sent two emails and neither of these were replied to. We found out from the TripAdvisor forum that others who had travelled here also never had there emails replied to...this is rude and bad business practice. Overall we would not recommend this hotels as despite the rooms and grounds being pleasant there were too many faults that need to be corrected to make this a good hotel. I would also suggest that staff who shout at holidaymakers should be dismissed ....

Review_Date: Celia S wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We had a lovely week at this hotel from 27th September to 4th October. We arrived late at night so missed the tour but no matter. Our room (257) overlooked the front of the hotel which we rather enjoyed as we could hear very little but could look out on the madness from our tranquil space which was huge with a fully furnished living area and generous bedroom space. The Wifi was generally ok. The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful at all times  we had two guides (about £35 for 3 hours well worth it to see the Médina and main square properly and also to visit the Marjorelle gardens and secret garden by taxi and avoid the ticket queue in the heat. We walked to El Badi palace ourselves and had an interesting couple of hours there. The Atlas Mountains were well worth a visit too. We bought a rug for our living room and have no idea whether it was a bargain but we love it. We found the food in the hotel ok breakfast was a generous assortment but a bit monotonous. We thought the tagines in the Moroccan restaurant were very average the Indian on the roof had lovely views and atmosphere and the food was good  but our favourite was the French Restaurant which was lovely. We also enjoyed the ambiance of the piano bar in the evening although the seating arrangements were not really conducive to mixing with other guests. It was very hot during our week and we never had a problem finding a shady sunbed spot by the main pool which was how we spent most afternoons. All in all a very beautiful special week away in a beautiful hotel amid the craziness. Also we were able to use a locker in the spa and facilities on our last day as we had a late flight home which made our last day very pleasant!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gema M wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: The hotels is just a outside the busy Jemaa El Fnaa Square but once you walk into the hotel it is as if you were in another part of town. The hotel has two swimming pools manicured landscaperestaurants spa a rooftop bar and an amazing staff that made our stay memorable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Steve T wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: A truly wonderful hotel. It is located in small side street with a very unpretentious entrance; however once you are through the doors it is like you have entered another world. The reception area is plush and the patio and pool are truly palatial. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was spacious with a large balcony. The whole vibe of the hotel is calm and peaceful and you have no idea that you are just a three or four minute walk from the bustling Jemaa el-Fnaa square and souks. Breakfast is excellent and can be taken either inside or on the patio either is good and the service like everywhere in the hotel is first class. The location cannot be beaten as most of the main sights (such as Palais El Badi and Palais de la Bahia) are within walking distance.  Do not miss the rooftop Skybar. Drinks are reasonably priced and the sunset views are spectacular.  We stayed for four nights and this was our first trip to Marrakech; we will definitely return.

Review_Title: A high level of service and very convenient location..
Review_Text: I’m just concluding a visit to Marrakech for the first time. I chose this hotel because I thought it would suit my tastes and needs. I was not disappointed! The lobby and common areas are in tasteful Moroccan style. Breakfast by the pool is a delight. There is also a rooftop pool with sunning area bar and lounge area as well as an Indian restaurant. All of which I enjoyed! The location of the hotel is perfect if you are interested in seeing the many sights in the Médina. My room and bathroom were very spacious and the hotel was quite quiet in the evening. The rain shower was the best I’ve ever experienced! I had a comfortable king size bed and a large flatscreen TV with a large variety of channels. WIFI worked perfectly in all areas of the hotel—inside or out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I also took advantage of the very reasonable airport transportation to and from (10 € each way) and the hotel arranged a very good private day tour of another part of the country. I highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Lovely hotel in the heart of Marrakekh
Review_Text: This hotel was a few minutes walk of the main square and just near the main mosque in the medina. We were greeted on arrival and staff were very welcoming and the room was lovely with comfortable beds and every day the maids decorated the beds with roses which was a lovely touch. The sky bar was nice and had lovely views over Marrakekh but drinks were hotel prices as one would expect in a 5 star hotel. The Indian restaurant was very nice and the breakfast was lovely with a good selection. Staff were really helpful and polite and this was a lovely hotel. I would reccomend the hotel and would return in the future - a good spot to stay in
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We chose this hotel based on location and we were not disappointed....very close to the vibrant square and souks.  Staff were amazing so helpful and really couldn’t do more.  The 2 pools were great and could always get a sunbed when we got back from a day of exploring.  Spent our evenings on the rooftop bar which was just lovely to watch the sun set look over into the Médina and listen to the hustle and bustle of the square.  Front desk arranged for a taxi when we asked with no problems.  The bedroom was huge we had an extra bed for the little one and 2 bathrooms!!  Would highly recommend this hotel and would absolutely come back again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Aaron S wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: On arrival we were dropped off at the end of the street as cars we not allowed. At first it could be quite intimidating but don’t be put if by the exterior. Once inside you are totally transformed into a state of luxury.  We are very well looked after on arrival and even upgraded our room.  The location is perfect to explore the Médina and souks but would definitely recommend a guide on your first day.  The staff were always friendly and helpful particularly on the rooftop terrace.  We had an amazing magical week here and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: SO MUCH POTENTIAL, SO MUCH FRUSTRATION ...
Review_Text: A central location the availability of two swimming pools and many glowing online reviews played a large part in our choosing this hotel for our week's stay in Marrakech.    On our previous visit to Marrakech in January 2015 we had stayed in an excellent hotel in the Palmeraie but had found this to be too far from the medina necessitating a taxi every time we wished to make an excursion into town. Les Jardins does indeed have an ideal location being halfway between the Koutoubia Mosque and the medina and not too far on foot from most sites such as the Bahia Palace the Kasbah etc. The hotel building is attractive (once you're off the street) with cool shady external corridors and nice planting of bougainvillea plumbago and Queen of Sheba vines.    We had booked a room with city views but were upgraded on arrival to a room overlooking the inner courtyard and its pool. The room was spacious with tiled floors a seating area a very comfortable bed (firm mattress which we like) and extremely generous wardrobe and shelving space with many hangers. The bathroom was large with much use of marble and mirrors. There was both a bath and a walk-in shower. Everything was kept immaculately clean by the housekeeping staff who also decorated the bed with rose petals both on our arrival and on every succeeding day. The air conditioning was relatively quiet and worked well.    We did have a problem with Wifi in the room - it rarely worked perhaps because we were at the other end from the hotel Reception. In Reception and at the rooftop swimming pool the Wifi worked well although it did sometimes lock us out meaning that we had to sign in again.    During our stay the weather was extremely hot - in the mid-thirties/nineties - and so we were very glad to have somewhere to swim each day rather than staying in a riad without a pool. Both pools have attractive settings. The large one in the ground floor courtyard is cool (in the sense of temperature) but pleasant and has a shallow end suitable for children. The one on the roof - from where there are good views of the Koutoubia and the Atlas Mountains - is smaller and very very cold in spite of the fact that the hotel describes it as a "heated" pool. We could never work out why the pool was so cold in spite of the air temperatures being so hot all of the day and most of the night ... Both pools could do with a little maintenance - the courtyard one has rough areas where the main pool meets the shallow pool; the roof pool has a line of mould about an inch deep under the decking and above the waterline. These faults are not visible from above but are very noticeable when swimming.    The pools are open from 8 a.m. but bizarrely they are still being cleaned later in the morning - at 8.30 9.00 and sometimes even later than that. Similarly towels are always not ready on the loungers. It seems to me that if you are running a business and you tell your customers that something is ready at a certain hour it should be ready then - not an hour or so later.    We had noticed that many online reviews praise the hotel food. Quite frankly we were disappointed by the food in both the Indian restaurant and the ground floor restaurant. (I have been travelling abroad for 62 years so it isn't the case that I only enjoy British food). It is certainly true that there is a wide choice at the breakfast buffet but on several mornings the bread rolls were so hard that we could hardly split them with either our hands or a knife. My husband had crepes one morning and they were stone cold. (This was because he took them from the "stack" - but the crepe maker did not offer to make him some fresh hot ones!) Some of the croissants were very dry as was some of the bread; attempts to toast the latter were useless as the toaster hardly works ... The citrus fruit is not cut in segments to remove the pith but is cut in circles so that the membrane and pith has to be eaten with the fruit itself. On a hygiene level I would suggest that food is cleared from the tables in the courtyard restaurant a little more quickly as I noticed a sparrow "on a roll" (literally!) on our first day.    Breakfast is supposed to start at 6.30 a.m. but if you want eggs or crepes at that hour you will be lucky as these are not available until quite a bit later when the staff responsible for making these items finally appear.    I think that our greatest disappointment was with the hotel staff. Here I must make a couple of exceptions and say that the pool staff on the roof work very hard and are most helpful in moving umbrellas as the sun changes position. Marie (who is the wife of the manager of the Indian restaurant I understand) circulates among the guests at the pool and is always ready to help with queries or problems. Otherwise we were not overly impressed. Some reviews mention that a "welcome drink" is served to guests on arrival; we certainly weren't offered one.
