We also had a problem one day with our room card when after breakfast we couldn't get into our room again because the card wouldn't work. My husband went to Reception and explained the problem. The receptionist took the card and put into a machine and handed it back without a word of apology. "So it will work now?" my husband said. Apparently it would - but it didn't as we found out when we went back to the room and tried it again. This time I went down to Reception and explained the problem again. A gentleman came back to the room and tried our card managed to open the door with his own card and told us that the problem was "les pilles!" (the batteries). Promising to call an electrician he left us. I'd agreed to take a friend out that morning so I left my husband to deal with the technician - and he waited and waited and waited .... and eventually had to go down to Reception for the third time to enlist a manager's help to see what was happening (leaving the room unlocked of course). Hardly satisfactory. As for providing a free transfer from the airport to the hotel and vice versa - forget it. We e-mailed the hotel on 13th July asking for a transfer and six days later on 19th July we had a response from Fatima asking for details of our booking. We replied the same day and waited for a reply - and waited and waited and waited ... and eventually had to book a transfer with a taxi company in Marrakesh as the hotel just couldn't be bothered to reply to us or to arrange a transfer. We run our own business and reply to all queries and business e-mails the same day even when on holiday! So many reviews say that "the staff couldn't do enough" - well for us that is certainly true - they couldn't even have the courtesy to reply to our e-mail or book our transfer!    For the reasons above I have given a score of 3/5 which I feel is on the generous side as I found some of the above so frustrating that there were days when I felt the hotel only deserved a score of 2/5.    If that.

Review_Date: Kumu F wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Great Location; very clean and roomy.
Review_Text: Really close to the great square and the souk. Riaad was very well maintained with hospitable staff and great food. Beds are very comfortable and with clean white sheets and pillows; walk to several areas. Many people smoke in Morocco but the open doors and fresh breezed help. The Orange juice is fresh squeezed and the breakfast is a generous spread. We had our own guide and driver. Iwould stay there again anytime.

Review_Date: Jess Littman wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Les Jardins is located very conveniently in the medina but just a block away from a main road and one block from Place Jemma al Fna which is an excellent landmark in case you get lost or need to direct a taxi. The hotel is luxurious with a huge pool in the courtyard and another pool on the roof. The roof pool deck has a view of the Koutoubia mosque and the bartender there makes a limited selection of excellent cocktails. The rooms are huge and very comfortable with beautiful tile floors. The decor is a little creepy (lots of close up photos of veiled women's eyes) but you won't want to spend much time in your room anyway with the lovely pools and bustling medina just outside. The spa is very lovely and offers a variety of treatments.    We only tried the Moroccan restaurant (the hotel also has Indian and Continental restaurants). The food was good but not the best that we had in Marrakech (for the best go to L'Ibzar). The breakfast was as good as a hotel buffet gets including excellent coffee and fresh orange juice.    While the Jardins is very nice it is a hotel not a Ryad. The smaller Ryads in the medina are former private homes now tiny boutique hotels. They are very charming and beautiful. The choice of a hotel vs a ryad is a matter of preference: the ryads are deeper in the medina and a bit harder to access; they may also lack some of the amenities of the hotels although I am not sure about this. On the other hand they may provide a more charming or "authentic" experience.    Note that while the street on which the Jardins is situated allows cars some taxis will refuse to drive into the medina at all. However you can see the hotel from the street corner with the main road so this isn't a big problem unless you have all your luggage - arrange airport transfers through the hotel to avoid dragging your suitcase up the street.    Also note that Moroccan hotels do not provide hair conditioner only shampoo.

The Photos of this hotel do not do it justice. I keep trying to capture ‘it’ but it’s impossible as a picture can not show the ambience serenity and absolute 5* feeling. The staff are excellent always. This Hotel has made our weekend and I would come back to Marrakesh just to visit this hotel! The roof top bar has the best sunset view so special. Loved both  pools staff at rooftop pool cannot do enough to help you. Every meal we had here was exceptional. Thank you for an unforgettable weekend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for a 4 day visit to Marrakesh. The hotel is perfectly placed in the Medina very close to the Souk and the Koutoubia Mosque. Rooms are very comfortable quiet clean and well equipped. Three restaurants roughly Moroccan International and Asian all very good. A very large and delightful central pool is most inviting and there is a rooftop pool and bar as well. The Spa is excellent reasonably priced and the treatment we had was first class. The staff are very friendly helpful and efficient. We would come again in a heartbeat. A perfect place to base your stay. Thank you.

The property was in an excellent location. Literally an oasis in a rather authentic working class neighborhood. It was about 300 yards from Jemma Fna and a 100 yards from the Katoubia mosque. Unfortunatelythe property has seen better days. The carpet decorations and paintings as well as the lighting and atmosphere really needs a major overhaul. I’m sure it was a grand hotel 30-40 years ago but now not so much. Also the food at the breakfast buffet was very ordinary and limited. The staff overall were very friendly and helpful. I just wished that the lady on the egg grill would at least smile a little. Overall a good stay and would recommend if you’re looking for an excellent location.

Located 5 minutes on foot from the Jemma-El Fna square this hotel is the perfect starting point to explore the old city of Marrakesh. You can park your car directly in front of the hotel.    The rooms are spacious and very comfortable; the breakfast buffet is amazing; service is always kind and very helpful; and the restaurants especially the one on the rooftop is wonderful. The pool on the main patio of the hotel is a refreshing way of ending your day.

Review_Title: Amazing oasis in the madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: Just returned from 3 night break to Marrakech. This hotel is amazing. Situated less than 5 minutes from the Souks. Had a room overlooking the pool. Rooms roomy and beautifully decorated. The spa is a must! We experienced the Hamann which was great would fully recommend. The staff were very attentive but not too much and the melon by the pool at 3.30 every day was gratefully received. The reception staff were very knowledgeable and helpful. Would highly recommend having a private tour guide. The hotel arranged ours and he took us out for 3 hours. Would definitely return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is our first time staying at the hotel previously we came here for lunch whilst staying at le mamounia. What a beautifully serene hotel it’s so beautiful inside cool and with a laid back vibe. The food here is absolutely amazing.    The service from all of the staff is faultless everyone is pleasant helpful and they bring an air of calm to a bustling and vibrant city.    The food in the rooftop Indian fusion restaurant is to die for! Like it’s gorgeous! Mouthwatering curries and tandoors fresh naans and rolled popadums! So good!    The breakfast here is varied well presented with a fresh egg and pancake bar too.    If you are not staying here do try the rooftop restaurant for lunch or dinner you will not be disappointed! In the evening the views of the city are beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom

Review_Date: Amina Shaath wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: An experience we will always treasure
Review_Text: The hotel is just in the heart of the Medina. The breakfast was fantastic with a large variety of options from made-to-order crepes to pastries eggs yogurt etc. The three restaurants were very good especially the Indian restaurant on the roof. All the staff with the exception of the woman on the reception desk were very friendly and helpful.

Review_Date: Ruben Campbell wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Look no further...this is the hotel you should book!
Review_Text: After 20 years I decided to go back to Morocco and of course Marrakech had to be one of the cities to visit...but chosing the right hotel to stay is really what makes the difference and Les Jardins de la Koutoubia is the best hotel we could have booked! Excellent location right by the famous square Jemaa El Fna where you should get lost inside the colorful souk and let it turn into an unforgettable experience. Back at the hotel you can treat yourself at their fabulous spa where the staff is not only very professional but also very nice! Then for dinner you have 3 restaurants to chose from but being in Morocco I went for the local food...it was delicious! ...For breakfast you have a fabulous buffet and you can sit around the pool listening to the birds! Everyone from the reception to anywhere in the property is extremely kind! Definitely the hotel we will go back to when in Marrakech!

We spent four days here and felt very spoilt. Despite the size of the hotel staff remembered details about us and others (number of persons waiting for a table room number). Very helpful and friendly staff. Adorable rooms with large balconies. Fresh roses in our room every day.    Perfect location for exploring the city. Wanna get spoilt in Marrakech? Come here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Having booked a double destination trip to Morocco and being somewhat disappointed with our first hotel in Agadir I was a little anxious about our hotel in Marrakech. What an absolute joy we landed in!! This hotel is exactly the moroccan experience we had hoped for.    Firstly on entering the hotel you get the feeling of absolute calm after the bustling movement and noise of the street (the hotel is literally at the entrance of the Medina). The reception staff quietly and quickly checked us in and at the very end of the process mentioned that our two rooms had been upgraded to mini suites.    The mini suites were anything but mini. From large bathroom kingsize bed three sofas to beautiful terrace furniture. A calm oasis within an oasis in wonderful colourful noisy Marrakech.    After our journey from Agadir we decided to rest at the rooftop swimming pool and bar (theres also a restaurant there). This was lovely but we later decided that the ground floor pool (outdoors) better suited usafter our trips to the Medina and souks. The pool area is just beautiful and the photos on this site do not do justice to it.    Breakfast was good but with less verity than other hotels but the setting was great. Also this hotel serves good coffee!! The hotel bar is actually a proper bar. Wonderful panio player and just perfect for a nightcap.    The spa is a must. I have been to many (generally book hotels with spas) this is probably the nicest I have been to next to "destination spas". Full marks. Even if a treatment is outside your budget just visit the pool and relaxation area.    The location of this hotel alone would merit booking but add that to the ambience discreet and most helpful staff and I personally feel you will not be sorry.

Review_Date: C M wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: BE CAREFUL: VERY DIRTY, BAD SERVICE, AND DEFINITELY NOT A 5* HOTEL. YOU ARE BETTER OFF SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!...
Review_Text: Dirty hotel with hygiene practically nonexistent  Shabby place and rooms looking onto decadent gardens.Caught them twice giving us used teaspoons at breakfast and used pool towels Full of stains.  Blurry water-no one to take your order  Business center:no telephone-not working computer keyboards-couldn’t check in.  Travel companion on heart medication caffeine strictly prohibited. Ordered decaf and brought regular coffee 3 times - the last one lying that it was decaf.  Also no chamomile tea  No coffee and tea making facilities no room complementary water all throughout stay.  Saw myself waiter wipe off used teaspoon and bring it as fresh.  Completely inefficient staff not speaking English at all definitely not earnest to help  Complained to duty manager did nothing  Complained to girl introduced as manager only to have her admit she wasn’t later on.  No general manager!  We had arranged airport pick-up through hotel and driver asked for money upfront. Told him it was through the hotel -we had no local currency and insisted because the hotel is outsourcing its rides with a taxi company (at 02:00 AM).  Breakfast: poor choice and iffy hygiene. Had to boil your own egg. Cheeses/hams were only half covered with insects treading all over.  Girl-manager tried bribing us (1 night free) to stop us from writing on TripAdvisor.  When I refused she said: “ It doesn’t matter your bad feedback will be lost in the bulk of the good so we don’t care that much”.

Review_Date: Lee and Steph D wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: When we arrived the hotel welcomed us with a drink while they took care of the paperwork. Our room was comfortable spacious and was kept very clean. The breakfast each morning was delicious! The location is perfect for walking to many of the sights we wanted to see and the front desk helped us with what a taxi should cost for the places we wanted to go. The pool was perfect for relaxing after a hot day of walking around the city. We went to the restaurant and bar on the roof which had beautiful views. We really loved our time here!

We pushed the boat out a bit when we decided to choose this hotel. After previously staying in a lovely riad a couple of years ago we knew that we would need a larger hotel for the pool but we did not want to sacrifice the proximity to the suqs. This hotel was perfect. The location was excellent close to the suqs and the many beautiful architectual wonders that Marrakech has to offer. On site there was a lovely pool to lounge around and we were even allowed to swim late night after a hot night out in the suqs enjoying a meal. OUr rooms were really lovely - clean and cool and with an adjoining patio balcony with our friends. Staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely book again.

Review_Title: if you complain you get an apple !
Review_Text: I do not normally write reviews but this hotel made me really angry! We complain about the bad service especially in the pool area the unsmile personnel and the lack of hygiene! My real problem was the absolute lack of real hygiene!  My travel buddy will soon write a detailed review but I write this right now because the manager has the nerve to told us that she didn’t really care about one bad review because there are hundrents excellent reviews! So my dear manager because of your arrogance you will get two reviews from two dissatisfied customers ! Of course we don’t take her last offer of don’t paying a nights fee! It’s a matter of hygiene if you want to call yourself five star !soon you will see my travels buddy full detailed review!

I really liked this hotel it has a location that cannot be beaten right by the main square. The two pools are lovely I preferred the rooftop pool with great views. There was also a sky bar which was nice and the food from the Indian restaurant was also good. The only slight negative for me was breakfast which was not as good as other hotels that I have stayed at in Marrakech but even so it was still good.    I would use this hotel again when returning to Marrakech.

Review_Date: Sara Santos wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Me and my sister stay in Les Jardins de la Koutoubia for 5 days. The reception was amazing and very helpful the indian restaurant at the terrace has a magnificent food and a lots of simpaty in the employers was one of the best restaurants that we visited in the city. However.. A few things were very disapointing..including the service at the breakfast every days less da last day we have to look for cofee and for juices have tables that nobody sees and for that noone was serving. And the sevice at the pool was terrible. Still today i'm wating for a water. There is one wateriss that was amazing and was the only one who do a good service at the pool and we saw that we was really upset when he sees the pool in bad state Mr. Mohamed that works in the shisha bar too. An extraordinary simpaty and dedication to the work.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Traveling as 2 couples we stayed here for 4 nights. The roof top pool and bar was great you have an excellent view of the city and the mosque and the staff and accommodations were excellent. There is a spa and salon as well as a few pools ground level and on the roof. Overall a great experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Feeling of a riad in a luxury hotel
Review_Text: We have travelled extensively all over Morocco and have been to Marrakech alone approximately 12 times and this is the first time we have found a hotel that we are committed to returning to. A gorgeous old style hotel with completely modern amenities this lovely destination has the charm of a riad but all the features (including three excellent restaurants and two pools) of a large hotel. I was utterly charmed by our room and the service was incredible. The location is also unbeatable - I was worried that by staying in the Medina itself it would be noisy but it was an oasis of peace and beauty. Cannot say enough about this hotel: it was a real find and will be our new “regular” when we return annually.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An Oasis of calm and comfort amidst the bustle of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Great Hotel. We had a garden room our children a standard...... on arrival both rooms were upgrade.....we had a spacious and comfortable suite. Hotel very peaceful : style o old world elegant......conveniently situated for the souls and the main square. Clean and well kept . Helpful staff. Nice swimming pools. good spa. Nice piano bar with friendly waiters. Lots of places to lose yourself for a quiet read in comfort. Breakfast very good and varied. Beat restaurant the Indian/ Asian on the roof.....good menu. Moroccan restaurant also good but limited menu........ the French restaurant is OK....not very impressed needs to re think its menu. Overall a great stay we would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Anne-marie S wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here for 5 days last week. On arrival were upgrade and amazed by the room. It was stunning. The whole road is beautiful. Outside it is noisy and chaotic as you would expect from Marrakesh but once inside the unassuming reception it is so peaceful. Loved loved loved the roof pool as we quite often had it to ourselves. Snacks up there were fab and the roof bar was just beautiful to see the sun go down. Staff at the bars were lovely and the security guards were very friendly as we strutted by. Definitely recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: What a fantastic hotel. Superbly located. Friendly and knowledgeable staff who remember your room number. Delicious breakfast to set you up for the day! We were upgraded to a great room with balcony overlooking ground floor pool. Room very clean with great air conditioning. Hotel WiFi free and best I have experienced in a hotel. Hotel just got better and better as we explored it. Has a great spa and a really chilled roof top pool and sky bar. Also has 3 very good restaurants our favourite was the Relais de Paris in a secret garden!! Highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katherine S wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. The location is superb - just minutes from the square but once inside the doors it is a haven of peace and tranquillity. The rooms are spacious - we had a mini suite overlooking the pool - with comfortable beds a lovely sitting area and a wonderful bathroom. The pool area is delightful with comfortable sunloungers and a lovely pool. The breakfasts are excellent and the staff are outstanding. I’m looking forward to my next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Very nice hotel with a great location. You can enjoy the buzzy Marrakech and relax in one of the swimming pools or enjoy the spa.  Breakfast is quite good and will give you the energy to enjoy and visit the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We went to great trouble to contact the hotel prior to confirm whether we could secure day passes for the use of the pool. We received email confirmation and the prices yesterday. We traveled to the hotel and were turned away. Waste of time. Poor service. When we return we will not stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Phil N wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Located on the edge of the Jemma el Fna this hotel was so peaceful after the noise and buzz of the square. We were upgraded on arrival to a mini suite which was located on the roof next to one of the pools. The service was excellent the facilties spotless staff responsive and the food we sampled was very good. Not one of the cheapest hotels available but definitley worth the extra we paid. I would definitley go back to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fiona B wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: The location of this hotel was one of the reasons we chose it but found it delightful. We had excellent service from everyone we encountered. We had two different stays as we went to Imlil to go trekking in the middle of our time in Marrakech and on our return they had upgraded us to a junior suite which was lovely. Our first room was beautiful spacious and well appointed. It was a joy to return to the peace of the hotel just a few steps away from the noise and chaos of the big square. There is a very nice big pool though the sunbeds are a bit squashed together.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Thoroughly enjoyed our week here. Hit a heatwave in May - 42 deg C so visits and walking were constrained but it was idyllic come back to their excellent pool. They actually have three. Service all round was good and we were most pleased with the cleaning of our room. Staff were very obliging and friendly. This was upmarket for us though not I recognise ultimate luxury. But the convenience of being a hundred yards from the main square and from the Koutoubia Gardens made for a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Right in the Heart of the Medina
Review_Text: Two minutes to the main square. Five minutes to the souks.    Great pool. Good inexpensive food options at all hours. Dine inside or outside.    Rooms clean. Call for prayer can be loud in the rooms. Strong service. Very good breakfast. Great lobby.    A very pleasant stay in a great location.    If this review is helpful then please indicate so below.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Unassumingly Moroccan. Amidst the chaotic Jemaa Al Fena a short walk abt 5 minutes later and into a rather unassuming hotel entrance voila. The Piano Bar was superb to end every night on a high. The cocktails and what not are prepared to perfection. Yes a bit pricey but it was all worth it. We had the chance to even get our hands on the piano with their permission and it was a night to remember. When the piano’s not playing jazz music fills the air. Or you May also sit outside and enjoy the serenity. Best place to chill and reminisce.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel, but lacks 5 star service
Review_Text: I really loved this hotel from the moment I walked in it was literally like a slice of paradise. Incredible decor very Moroccan - stunning ambience with a calm and tranquility that surrounds you as soon as you leave the Medina behind. The lounge/reception is beautifully decorated and through the huge doors facing you - you get an immediate glimpse of the gorgeous pool surrounded by lush greenery. Everywhere is quiet and peaceful.  The room was great - a nice size with LOADS of cupboard space and a larger than normal bathroom with double rainshower and large sunken bath. Everywhere was spotless and the huge king size bed comfortable and smelling of fresh linen.  Our view of the amazing pool never got boring. I really did love the scene outside my window.    Three very good restaurants - all part of the half board deal - so long as we didn't go over 300 Dirhams each.  This was possible with 2 out of 3 courses and no alcohol.    The Moroccan was very nice - tasty and hot traditional local food somewhat ruined by the continuous live musical accompaniment. It ended up sadly just sounding like a noise and one that wasn't entirely pleasant.    The French was divine - lush gardens lamp-lit private and very romantic. The food was good but not great.    The Indian on the rooftop was also nice with a fantastic view of the Koutoubia but not amazing food as I'd hoped. Rather average.    So now for the bits we didn't like:    Bad service around the pool. Waiters would bring a drink over to a customer on their sun lounger and then wouldn't ask anyone else around the pool if they wanted a drink. I found this behaviour rather odd. Surely at a 5-star hotel the waiter service is part of the experience? Especially in the baking heat. This meant we were forced to yell across to them hoping for a response or get up and go to the bar to place an order.    We complained about this several times but we noticed no difference whatsoever. Not good at all and this really let the hotel down. It didn't feel like luxury.    The food at the snack bar by the pool had so much potential. Nice menu good food choices but everything tasted of nothing. The salad was tasteless the pasta was flavourless the club sandwich was awful. And we were paying for it too.    The beautiful spa with the amazing pool and comfortable sun loungers was not part of the deal for hotel residents as they were charging 200 dirham each just to swim in it. I've travelled all over the world and have never been asked to pay just to swim in a spa pool. The hotel claim this is so it doesn't get too busy down there. Instead - because of their lack of judgement it is permanently empty instead. What a waste.    These little touches would have really helped to make the hotel top points for me.    Great choice of breakfast beautiful decor a haven away from the crowds and madness of the Medina (which is 2 mins walk) but just a few things they need to improve on.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Les Jardins de la Koutoubia for 4 days in April. Here's the positive info: the room was huge the view from the room was fantastic all the staff was helpful friendly super nice especially Khanjari Abdessadeq. The bad info: We stayed in room 251. The room felt shabby. There was plaster falling from the ceiling onto the furniture the toilet was constantly running until we asked for it to be repaired. The rugs were worn. There was no bottled water available except for the 1st day. There was always roses on the bed but no one to clean it up. We had dinner in the restaurant on our first night and it was awful. The breakfast was okay. The pancakes were pre-made and cold. There was a poor selection of breads. It was not a 5 star hotel experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful experience here. It's a beautiful hotel with a lovely courtyard and pool. The food is good and we really enjoyed the breakfast buffet. But best of all it's located so close to everything--near the mosque the souks and the wonderful artisan center. I hope to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent! Perfect location, good rooms, lovely service
Review_Text: The location: Simply perfect! Right where you want to be but still rather quiet. It is 2mins walking to the Djemaa El Fna (the big square) and to the 'entrace' of the all the big souks. So you are right in the medina and can go everywhere by foot - but on the other hand the hotel is still super quiet and you don't hear much of the noisy medina.  The rooms: Spacious quiet with a very comfy bed large shower amdn much space to store things.  Service: Excellent! The maid service was really good she puts some roses on the bed (romance!) and everything is very clean perfect. Same is true for the service during breakfast (very attentive) and at the front desk (very helpful organizing Taxis etc).  Food: Breakfast is good lots of choices (freshly made eggs pancakes fruits etc.)  Other: The hotel has 2 pools:one big at the courtyard and another small one at the rooftop (!) where they also have a restaurant a bar/lounge and all of that with an excellent view on the Koutoubia & the media.  Good rooms are high floor (2) w/ a view on the pool/courtyard.  Will return for sure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sharon P wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Great location so close to the Square with oodles of shopping. Our room was lovely with rose petals throughout our room and lots of fresh flowers in the lobby (if you have an allergy perhaps another location would suit you better). Our room was spacious and had the best shower ever -- supersized and super strong with lots of coverage. Everything we ordered in the restaurant was absolutely delicious with generous portions and the warm olive rolls were decadently delicious. Lots of seating around the pool and in the shade where you can enjoy a cooling beverage. Very satisfied with our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Absolutely loved this place. From check in to our late check out service was amazing. Our suite was just perfect. The location just outside the medina so everything was just a walk away. But again would say service superb
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rana A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We booked the hotel through booking unfortunately recommended by friend with non refundable charge.  We were shocked when we see how old non maintained the hotel is. The furniture is extremely old.  The flowers decorating the place is so non artistic  Breakfast choices are so limited.  When we checked into the room the carpet color was washed out the paint color is uneven multiple wall cracks and glue marks on walls seen. The handle of the shower was broken. The sink was not draining efficiently. The toilet seat is seated in a separate room with no sink near by available for after use wash while the cleaning chair is situated in another room!  Many other failures noted.  This is added to a difficult access entrance if you are renting a car.  We complained to the reception and asked to check out but the hotel refused to refund our money and offered us an upgraded to junior suite.  No much difference in space however a broken fountain was added in the terrace. When we went to sleep one of the bed lights wouldn't turn off again broken.  While asleep we kept hearing this unexplained noise that turned to be caused by the fountain pump because it lacked water.  For the first time in my life I sleep on such a hard mattress in a hotel.    However the staff in general is friendly and helpful  But hotel is not a 5 star standard in my opinion
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a beautiful tranquil hotel at the edge of the Medina with lovely gardens. Great food good views from the rooftop bar over the city. Very comfortable bed and room. Friendly and helpful staff. An ideal location for the souks. Bustling outside but very peaceful within!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The hotel is so peaceful everything we need to relax is here with the Medina a stones throw away. Breakfast is fantastic affair with a great selection. Les jardins de Bala is marvellous and we ate here many times.  Abdel and Norman who work tirelessly in the bar are wonderful and really looked after us.  Thank you for making our trip a delight - we will return. The Sellins family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We arrived at the Indian restaurant at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia and were ushered inside by a very enthusiastic doorman and brought up in the lift to the restaurant on the third floor terrace. We were sat at a table that was chosen for us but we immediately moved to another that wasn’t in direct sunlight. We placed our order and while we felt were were being rushed through our meal the food was very good. We asked for the bill and on closer inspection we discovered that the entire itemized bill had been duplicated and we were being overcharged by about 80%. When we brought it to the attention of the head waitress she wasn’t particularly bothered or even apologetic from this moment on ... not as much as a smile or any apology was to be had from her whatsoever. Then the manageress came to our table and again offered no apology and it was as if we were being an annoyance to them. The bil was then amended and was handed to us by the head waitress again...still without any apology or even a smile. She then walked away...we got up and left with a very sour taste in our mouths. Double check your bill before leaving this ripoff joint. We of course did NOT leave ANY tip although we DID leave a tip for the young friendly waiter and told him that it was for him alone and NOT for the management.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel! The grounds are beautiful the rooms are amazing and clean! Best location! Great service breakfast comes with the room and you can get Moroccan pancakes the buffet or they have an omelet station. Two pools. And the location can’t be beat. You are basically right next to the maze of the Medina but you can still take a car right to the hotel door.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: After staying in a shocking "hotel" we transferred to this magnificent institution for the last 4 days of our holiday in Marrakech.  From the moment we stepped inside its perfect foyer with sumptuous red velvet chairs and magnificent floral displays we felt secure and cared for.  We were upgraded to a fabulous suite and our minor problem with the hot air conditioning was comprehensively resolved.  Everything we asked of them they delivered on quietly and efficiently and with good humour.  We ate in all the restaurants in the hotel and while service was variable the food was excellent  Breakfast was breathtaking and all encompassing with fruits meats fresh crepes fresh omelettes sweet cakes as many courses from the buffet as you could ever need  Good coffee and freshly brought to our al fresco repast  I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough from its setting in the medina the helpful staff the guides for the souk the availability of proper high quality information  We had a late flight home and were given a 2 pm check out and we were happy to take lunch in the beautiful courtyard by the pool and while the afternoon away  A joy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just had the most fantastic 2 night stay at this fabulous hotel.    We arrived hot and tired after 2 days trekking in the Atlas Mountains and were warmly welcomed.    The room was amazing and the staff all lovely and kind.    From the reception desk porters bar staff and waiters. The service was exemplary. So thank you.    The location is a 3 minute stroll from the heart of the souk and a real oasis from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Equally it’s a good location for exploring the rest of Marrakesh.    We ate in the roof top Indian restaurant which was delicious but also heard that the other restaurants were just as good. The roof top bar and piano bar are lovely. But our favourite spot was sitting by the open fire enjoying a bottle of wine.    Having been to Marrakesh a number of times this was by far the best place I’ve stayed. Would wholeheartedly recommend it and will definitely be going back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A truly exceptional property located just two blocks from the central square with exceptional service this hotel is highly recommended. Each morning our room received fresh roses. The wood ceilings are gorgeous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a wonderfully atmospheric hotel with a great location convenient for the main square and the souks. The mosque was a great landmark for finding our way too.  The hotel’s facilities and staff were amazing and the breakfast delicious! We at a meal in the Moroccan restaurant which was lovely with music and belly-dancing too!  Lovely pools public areas and our suite was fantastic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I'm writing this review from the bar at the hotel.    We passed it walking back to our riad from the souks. I'd fancied a beer but alcohol is not widely available in the Medina.    I asked if non-hotel guests were allowed to have a drink at the bar and we were welcomed in.    There are nice velvet sofas indoor but better still plenty of outdoor seats adjacent to a palm tree surrounded pool.    Drinks are not cheap - 90 dirhams for a cocktail and 60 for a beer but when your choices are limited it doesn't matter! Spirits are more expensive.    I would definitely recommend it if you're after a drink in the old town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Location, Beautiful Pool, Average Service and Poor Spa Service
Review_Text: I've stayed at this hotel 5 times. I've gone back multiple times because the location is fantastic for easily accessing the tourist shopping areas of the Medina but yet it is removed enough that when you are inside the hotel it feels peaceful. It has two fantastic pools and the rooms are always clean and some of them are very spacious and luxurious (suites). The past two stays were somewhat disappointing and I'm not sure I'll return. During my most recent visit the hotel rooms were very hot and the hotel had not yet turned on the air conditioning for the season. I was staying at the room with another friend two female solo travelers and we couldn't sleep at all the first night. I contacted the front desk the following morning and was instructed to 'open our patio door' at night. I explained that we would like to move to a higher floor (we were on the ground floor) because we weren't comfortable opening our door on a ground floor at night. I was told the hotel would review the available suites and let me know shortly. When I returned that afternoon the front desk was completely unaware of the request I had made by phone in the morning and advised that all of the available rooms on a higher floor were checked into by newly arriving guests. They offered to turn on the AC for us which we gladly accepted. They failed to tell us that it would take 24 hours to actually 'turn on' and we spent another night unable to sleep due to the temp. We paid over 375 euro per night for our suite to me this is unacceptable at this price point and for this type of property. The following morning I complained again and they brought a standup fan into our room.    We also experienced disappointment at the spa during this trip. The visits all felt rushed and unlike during previous experiences we weren't offered tea or water after our services just taken to the changing room to leave. There is a lovely pool area in the spa that in the past was always nice to relax by after a treatment but the spa employees never offered it this time. On our 3rd day we called the spa to ask if they had any last minute massages available. They advised that the could accommodate us in 12 minutes if we could come now. We went down to the spa and when we arrived they explained that they only had 45 minute massages available. They said they mentioned this on the phone but it is possible I missed it as it was in French and I am not a native speaker. I was fine with a 45 min massage but my friend preferred to reschedule for another day when she could have a longer massage. When she mentioned this the staff became visibly annoyed and scolded her in front of other customers for taking up their time and canceling an appointment at the time it was meant to start. She explained that we had just made the appointments 12 minutes before and apologized. She felt very uncomfortable and declined all other treatments at the spa after that incident. We instead went to the spa at La Maison Arabe and the friendliness of the staff and calmness of the facility were a significant contrast.    The location and pool of this hotel truly make the property. The breakfast is also lovely if you arrive early - towards the end it gets messy and a bit chaotic. After we paid so much money and didn't sleep for 3 nights and then had such an awkward encounter at the spa I realized that it is sadly time to find a new go-to hotel in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A lovely place to stay our last 2 nights in Morocco.
Review_Text: We chose a beautiful Hotel in the Medina at the end of our Moroccan vacation. our room was spacious overlooking one of 2 pools. The pool on the third floor was heated but both were well used. We ate dinner in the Moroccan restaurant and it was delicious. The staff were friendly and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is wonderful with a beautiful entrance and courtyard two or three pools three restaurants and lots of green spaces. We had the minisuite and it was very comfortable (we did need to turn on the A/c as the room was hot even though the temperature outside was mild). Service is excellent and always friendly. The location allows to you go almost everywhere on foot. The only possible criticism is that it was rather expensive...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The closest 5* hotel to all sights - Amazing!
Review_Text: I recently travelled to Marrakech with my Mum and wanted a great hotel with a great location we got it!    This hotel was so welcoming traditional full of culture and SO close to the Medina Square.    We had a room at the front of the hotel with twin beds. It was so beautifully decorated with rose petals on the bed welcoming music and crisp white sheets.    I would strongly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Most friendly hotel; lovely family atmosphere
Review_Text: Gives you the feeling of being in an old morroccan palace. We felt immediately 'at home' particularly our grandchild (aged 9). Lovely pool in a subtropical garden + the typical morroccan amenities (incl. belly dance) . .. . . . . just relax!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My family and I spent four days in this magnificent hotel in Marrakech. When we arrived the employees took immediately care of us taking our baggages and leading us to our suites. We booked two junior suites(composed by a large bathroom with toiletwide shower and a bathtub a bedroom with a big and comfortable bed and a tv and a living room) and when we got into the rooms we remained completely stunned: the whole room was full of scented rose petals and in the living room we found some delicious sweets accompanied with a lot of fruits.  The breakfast is located in a typical Moroccan place and it is just fantastic: you can find everything you’d like to eat from the salty to the sweet as crêpes with Nutella or tasty omelettes.  But the best is yet to come: in the hotel there are three swimming pools the patio one the spa one and the roof top one.We fell in love with the patio one surrounded by palms and every type of green. Opposite the swimming pool there was a lounge furnished by amazing Moroccan furnitures and a beautiful and detailed fire place a perfect place to take the sun or just chill out. The roof top was characterized by an amazing swimming a pool and an astonishing a view of the Koutoubia tower. Going around the hotel my family and I completely felt the Moroccan vibes in fact the hotel could be perfectly described as a typical Moroccan riad. The hotel executive a gentle and cuddling woman helped us to find the best places to visit in Marrakech and the best restaurants to eat Moroccan specialties as tajines or cous cous.  This holiday has been one of our best ones thanks to this amazing hotel. We recommend it to everyone because it’s 2 minutes on foot far from the great Jemaa El-Fna square and even because without it we couldn’t feel the Moroccan culture and style!  Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Robin J wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Lovely oasis in the middle of the medina
Review_Text: Great place to stay out cone for a meal. Average European prices and a great escape from the hectic Marrakech life...    The hotel and swimming pool are pure class... and a lovely gem in the heart of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Only ate at the restaurant but well worth the visit! Chinese ,Indian and thai
Review_Text: Looking for somewhere to eat Chinese or Indian food and both available here. Delicious stir fries for 3 of us and a curry for the 4th. Friendly service beautiful rooftop location. Very helpful staff. Lift available.  Great night!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: LOUISE E wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Marrakesh is like no where else we have ever been! Incredible! This hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect for everything you would want to do. Just a few mins walk and you are in the middle of the action! We would agree with other reviews that the majority of staff are lovely polite and attentive. The seemingly more senior staff on reception were not as friendly but we efficient all the same! We stayed in room 260 and would request this room again it was perfect.  Cocktails in the bar were some of tbe best we've had and staff there were lovely.  Would highly recommend this hotel. We saw many others on our travel but this hotel wins hands down on its location!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Keith P wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Best hotel to visit the Medina area.
Review_Text: Don't let the access road to the hotel put you off the chaos outside is all part of the Marrakech experience. Once inside all is peace and quiet and the only outside noises are the calls to prayer.  we were lucky and had an upgrade from a pool view room to a suite which was very large with a great outside area.  Nothing to complain about at all in this hotel food was breakfast was good and plentiful and everything was spotless.  All the staff with the exception of the men on the reception desk were very friendly and helpful. reception staff did their job and that was it no hello or attempt at conversation maybe it was a culture thing!  Step out of the door turn left and that's the start of the Medina where all the action takes place. It is all a mixture of noise people and mopeds but just join in and enjoy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John H wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Stayed last week for 2 nights. Great location just minutes from the famous square. We were ugraded th a suite which was fabulous. Great breakfast with lots of choice. Would highly recommend staying here.

The moment you walk through the doors you enter an oasis of calm away from the craziness happening outside. It is less than a 5 min walk to the square. The hotel is beautifully decorated and kept spotlessly clean. We stayed in a junior suit number 175 which was lovely very spacious and peaceful. All the staff are very helpful and always have a smile for you. The outside pools are both heated. Breakfast is good with a great selection of fruits breads cakes and cereals there is also a hot selection and you can order omelettes and crepes.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to book here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Last minute booking and so pleased we went to Marrakech. Was a little nervous after reading some reviews of the city but not once did we feel unsafe or harassed- a polite non merci and a smile was all it took to be left alone!  The hotel was fabulous excellent location - don't be put off by the scruffy outside trees! This is a very well run hotel where all staff were friendly and polite. We changed our money at the hotel they booked a horse and carriage ride for us (£15 for an hour) . The hotel is very close to Jemaa el-Fnaa and all the action lovely to hear the call to prayer from Koutoubia Mosque which we could see from our hotel room. We had a fabulous room looking into the courtyard/pool loved listening to the birds! Everywhere was clean room was spotless - bedding and towels changed daily (despite leaving towels hanging up to reuse they were still changed everyday). Excellent breakfast choice- only busy morning we had was the Saturday with the hotel being full. We were on a bed and breakfast basis and ate out most of the time but when in need of wine with our meal ( most of the restaurants we went to did not serve any alcohol) we ate at the Relais de Paris Imlil and Les Jardins de Bala restaurants always finished our evening in the piano bar for a night cap ( excellent staff  remembering my drink without having to be told!). Be aware smoking is allowed in most bars/restaurants in Marrakech- not a problem if seated outside!  We booked 3 treatments in the Spa and sadly have to report it wasn't the best we've experienced- it was ok. It felt like the staff were just going through the motion of giving a massage or the Hammam and in no way connected with us. The spa itself is lovely and you can use the pool in there when booking a treatment. Maybe the staff we met were just having a bad day!  We preferred this hotel to the smaller Riads  lovely areas to sit and relax excellent roof top pool and seating areas great views from the roof terrace. It is not an old hotel it just has the feel of somewhere old and relaxed -shabby chic  - it was great to be able to sit in the bar kick off your shoes and put your feet up to listen to the guy playing the piano.  Be aware it is cold in January and you need coats for early morning and evening but when the sun came out which it did everyday the temperature was perfect even for sunbathing and swimming in outdoor pool ( we had blue skies and no clouds for 7 days) .  We will certainly return here  perfect for a weekend break from the UK.

Review_Date: Mohammed S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: 5 star Oasis - Excellent location -Wonderfully indulgent in Moroccan Magic
Review_Text: 1 Week stay - absolutely fabulous and chic    Free upgrade to a pool view room ..    In morocco all the Riads and traditional buildings do not look much on the outside. So dont be fooled    There is usually a small arched door which you bend down to go through Just like Alice in wonderland its the other side that blows you away .    Well planned layout and decorblend the traditional look with all the modern and contemporary touches.    3 heated pools and top notch spa It felt like you did not have to leave the hotel     but it was very close to all the hustle and bustle of Jemal Fnaa square and main attractions were all easily accessible.    Breakfast - good selection and quality sourced produce  freshly squeezed orange juice  fresh made to order omelettes crepes etc    staff are very attentive and room service and maid were brilliant especially the roses and petal designs on the bed  every day was a new surprise and we felt we were on our second honey moon after being married for 19 years ...lol    Live traditional music around the log fire in the evening .. too much to mention I could go on and on but you get the picture ..    definitely would go back again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is very well located about 3 min walking distance from Jemaa el-Fnaa. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is delicious served in a cosy and beautiful room. The Spa the outside heated pool everything was great and done beautifully.  We were three friends and stayed in a triple room on the second floor. The room was very spacious and lovely decorated in Moroccan style. We had private varanda to the patio with “pool beds” to enjoy the sun.  Absolutely nothing to criticize. 5 stars. Would love to go back.

Review_Date: Stephen M wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Do not be put off by the first view of the hotel location as once through the main door all changes to an excellentwell run hotel !  The hotel is down a narrow street which has small local shops etc on both sides of the street. The hotel has three floors which are all accessed by modern lifts or alternatively by stairs. There are three swimming pools one in the central courtyard one on the roof terrace which is heated and one in the spa (which we never used). Plenty of sun beds around both outdoor pools and towels were supplied at each. There was also waiter service for food and drinks at each pool.  We had a room upgrade to overlook the central pool and it appeared that our room had been recently refurbished. Bedroom had adequate wardrobe space large double bed (probably larger than king size) settee and coffee table facing wall mounted flat screen TV. Electric kettle and cups were supplied on request by reception.  Bathroom was good with walk in shower with rainfall shower and hand held shower head plus there was always hot water available.  We did not try any of the three hotel restaurants as we stayed on B & B so we could eat out locally. The breakfast menu was a mixture of continental Moroccan and western (ie bacon and eggs) with fresh orange juice tea and coffee.  Local "restaurants" are good and not expensive but sometimes the Moroccan translation of food was not quite what we expected but it was always good!  The restaurants or food stalls in the main square can be a little fraught and noisy but that is a matter of choice.  The main square and market are a 5 min stroll from the hotel.  If never been to Marrakech before it can be a bit of a culture shock at first but it is safe and you quickly get used to it!  We will be going back to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From check in to checking out our stay was exemplary.  The staff were first class extremely welcoming and attentive to our every need.  There was a lovely welcome when checking in starting with a room upgrade too a suite!  The manager explained all the local amenities and places of interest on a map.  The hotel decor is very traditional and impressive. A good choice of restaurants and bars.  Our room was spacious and extremely comfortable.  At breakfast on our first morning the PR lady checked we were happy and whether we required anything.  I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Marrakech it is fabulous value for money and is in the heart of all the action!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is truly a five-star hotel. Excellent spa and the service is beyond reproach. It is centrally located near almost any destination. Our room had an ample balcony overlooking one of several pools. Staff was friendly and accommodated any request we had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nelly E wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: The best location in Marrakech Just near the place Jemaa El Fna.  Very spacious room and the Koutoubia suite is soooo beautifull and just near the pool.  At breakfast ..you have it all and all prepared in front of you ...eggs and crepes.  2 pools and the one on the roof is heated and has sun the entire day  The restaurant Paris preparesyour Steak Tartare at the table and the pool restaurant is the place to have your salades supervised by Marie .thank youMarie for your kindness and all the information you gived us  It was our 3rd stay atLes Jardins de la Koutoubia but not thelast one  As itwas my husbands birthday the sympatic public relation offered him a homemade cake
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dre V wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: charming oasis in the centre of the Medina
Review_Text: Besides unique location Les Jardins de la Koutoubia offers everything a traveller can dream : spacious luxury rooms quietness (heated) swimming pools excellent wellness facilities marvelous restaurants (the Moroccan restaurant is absolutely top reservation recommended) very helpful and friendly staff super service.. Price/Quality on top in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Katie C wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Great location and close to the main square. Staff were very helpful and friendly. I was upgraded to a suite which was very large with two living room areas and a massive bathroom. A very comfortable bed! The breakfast was delicious with continental cooked and freshly made pancakes and omelettes. A boutique hotel with plenty of character so if you do not want to stay in a standard soulless hotel then this is perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: I have stayed at this hotel at least 20 times over the last few years among 4-5 other hotels in Marrakech. Les Jardins de la Koutoubia is by far my favorite property in Marrakech. The location is unbeatable - literally steps away from Jemaa al-Fnaa. Not only does the hotel have beautiful guest rooms but the pool lounge and spa are also top-notch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Denis B wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Amazing location for this small luxury hotel
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Location is amazing (and extremely quiet) next to the crowded Jama el Fana square (center of Marrakesh). The staff was very nice and helpful. This is the perfect oasis in the center of Marrakech. We liked the traditional architecture of the best riads.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely traditional hotel although you wouldn’t have thought so from the outside. It’s really on a bumpy scruffy road my heart sank when I first set eyes on the hotel until I went in. It was magical and very welcoming. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was very nice & clean. The breakfast was really nice too. Loved the swimming pool just what you need after walking around the souk. All in all a good experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The hotel is an oasis of calm amongst the chaos of Marrakech. The beautiful lounges restaurants and bedrooms are all topped off by the most gracious service from everyone you meet. The beds are comfortable the breakfast is excellent and the restaurants are a nice alternative if you don’t want to head out. It really is a beautiful hotel. It’s hard to find one thing to complain about! Maybe add a full length mirror to the bedroom so ladies can view their outfit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Lovely hotel in a great location very nice swimming pools breakfast was very good I booked a suite room 251 overlooking the Mosqueand we were impressed.All the staff at the hotel were very nice people.Also i was surprised how quiet it was at night time for sleeping.  will stay at this hotel again when i visit Marrakesh.Thank YOU.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane R wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We had a junior suite with a gorgeous terrace and if we stood up could see the incredible Koutoubia and defintely hear it which is a haunting incredible sound - you step in from a pretty scruffy street just off the Souks into a very traditional hotel - lots of red velvet marble local furnishings and met by hugely courteous helpful smiley staff - our room was super comfortable housekeeping excellent and room service very efficient - overall I feel the property is slightly in need of refurbishment but still easy and comfortable to be in - the best part of the stay was the amazing outdoor pool like a warm bath form early morning to noon comfy sunbeds and great pool bar and snack service with an outdoor restaurant beautifully laid - so welcome after a day in the Souk. A roaring fire in a traditionally beautifully decorated open lounge a lovely place to relax and drink cocktails - magical at night when the grounds are lit. Breakfast could not be faulted incredible choice and freshly made omelettes crepes just delicious. We didn't try the hotel restaurants as there are so many choices close by - but they looked good. A lovely relaxed stay - not for those wanting a contemporary hotel - this is a lovely traditional easy and relaxed stay for any age

Review_Date: Nickie W wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: A pocket of peace in central Marrakesh
Review_Text: Stunning hotel with an amazing spa. The bedrooms are beautiful and the service first class. We didn’t eat in the restaurants for dinner but breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of delicious food.  I was here for a 3 day conference and can really recommend the hotel for the purpose.  Perfect location to explore Marrakesh or just completely relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Eirini- Giorgos wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Great location very beautiful insideit makes you feel like a prince in a palace. The best way to relax afrer a busy day.  Great restaurants and breakfast.  Polite and efficient staff. We needed to modify our reservation and they were happy to help us.  We will return!  Highly recommended  EiriniGeorge November 2018
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eirini- Giorgos wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Great location very beautiful insideit makes you feel like a prince in a palace. The best way to relax afrer a busy day.  Great restaurants and breakfast.  Polite and efficient staff. We needed to modify our reservation and they were happy to help us.  We will return!  Highly recommended  EiriniGeorge November 2018
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An excellent hotel in the perfect location
Review_Text: What a lovely hotel. Situated in exactly the right place for visiting all the fascinating souks around the medina. The rooms were clean spacious and well appointed. The breakfast was far better than anticipated as we were just expecting a continental breakfast. There was a wonderful choice of cereals fruit pastries and with pancakes eggs/ omelettes cooked to order. We ate in two of the hotel restaurants which were superb and with great service. The staff at the reception desk were wonderful. Extremely helpful in ordering transport changing money and giving advice. The beautiful young lady in reception had a great sense of humour and made it a fun holiday. We will certainly return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: You don’t go to Marrakech to chill-out its a bustling mad city that makes its own adrenalin filled with promise but always ready to trip you up! This hotel addresses all that......  Just on the door step of the busiest tourist attracted square and set in a former palace this real Hotel delivers all you would expect with beautiful surroundings rooms amenities restaurants and staff and gives real value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hocine N wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is very nice and the location is perfect if you want to waldk in the old city of Marrakech.  The rooms were really nice and the service as well.  What could be improved was the restaurant I tried (there are 3 in total in the hotel) : French restaurant is soulless. The reception is not always perfectly organised. But people are nice and really trying to help when you ask.    I am not giving maximum rating because this is a 5 stars and food available is really important to me. but the rest was really great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A perfect situated hotel near Place el Fna.
Review_Text: This is a very beautiful hotel. The suites on floor 3 are very beautiful and comfortable. The staff is service minded and very helpful and nice. The two pools one on the ground floor one on top floor are very nice. I can strongly recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Suzanne Vidal wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is a great choice as it had all of the amenities for a vacation style stay (pools restaurants and entertainment). It’s in the Médina but in the outer side so it’s easy to get to a just a step outside of the craziness of the Médina. The rooms are very big and comfortable. I will definitely stay here again. Top quality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent accomodation in the heart of the action close to the Medina central to the souks. Also a great hotel for peace and quiet to relax at the roof top pool. Food excellent and the staff friendly. We Loved our few days in Marakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Stedman E wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: A shabby-chic old world hotel next to the square and medina
Review_Text: While a little tired around the edges was a spacious calm and luxurious Moroccan style retreat which was appreciated after the hustle bustle and hassle which is found when exploring the medina and markets. The pool area is very good and the underground heated pool next to the spa and gym was pretty spectacular. The buffet breakfast was good and we enjoyed meals at both restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Gaurav Agarwal wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Visit to Marrakesh stay in Les Jardins De La Koutoubia
Review_Text: Good hotel. Located right next to the Jemaa el - Fna square and the Medina. The rooms are good and have local Moroccan touch in them. The main sight seeing points are all close by and within a walking distance of the hotel. The breakfast of the hotel is good and the staff is extremely helpful. Marrakesh is a beautiful place to visit and I look forward to visiting the city again very soon !!!!1
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Luxury in the heart of old town Marrakech
Review_Text: 2 couples in 2 neighbouring rooms: stayed for 5 nights in this hotel and were delighted at the luxury and attentive service we experienced here from the taxi transfers to room cleaning to poolside and restaurant service. Couldn't fault it.  On arrival you are greeted with refreshing scented flannels and mint tea flamboyantly poured by one of the waiters whilst the reception staff process your documents. We were give advice about booking a registered guide when first visiting the locality because of unscrupulous practice and they arranged one for us. We also booked through Fazir the owner of the hotel's taxi transfers for a day's taxi and guide to travel outside the city which was the best thing we did. He was punctual and reliable to the second with every journey.  Our rooms were upgraded from exterior street facing to interior pool facing and I would recommend this for the views and ability to put wet clothes on windowsill to dry. (Although there is laundry service at a reasonable price but we didn't use it.)  It is on the edge of the old town down a little road opposite the main Koutoubia mosque of Marrakech: and only round the corner from the start of the souks and medina (large market square with market stallsperformers cafes and restaurants taxis horse and carriages tuk-tuks etc).  All of the old town is full of character and chaos and a must see but is also labyrinthine a bit intimidating and rather squalid in places so the hotel is literally an oasis. Taxis can't bring you to the door because the road is cordoned off but it's only a couple of minutes walk away from where they can drop you off.  The first time you enter your room be prepared to be delighted at the creative rose petal patterns on the bed and around the bathroom features. These were changed and rooms cleaned twice daily! Lovely touch.  The rooms are large air conditioned with huge comfy beds and a large shower bath and sink in the ensuite bathrooms with all the towels slippers bathrobes and toiletries you'll need for your stay: replenished generously daily. Hairdryer and digital safe were great too. Plenty of drawer and hanging space. No kettle or complimentary drinks but there is a mini bar and room service. I rang down for an iron and had an iron and board delivered within half hour which I kept in our room for the duration of our stay.  We chose bed and breakfast rates and loved the choice available: fresh crepes and  omelettes made to order with the usual cooked breakfast items on a buffet. Also with a nod to the overt French influence: a range of pastries croissants jams and cereals with a colourful array of delicious fresh fruit. Orange juice and hot drink orders were taken at the table.  We also ate lunch at the poolside bar a few times and tried the Moroccan and International restaurants there due to visiting on an annual Islamic festival that literally closed Marrakesh for a few days around our visit. Perfectly pleasant but expensive for what it was rather limited in choices and underwhelming food. We ate far better value and quality food in the new town (Guillez).  Helpfully the exchange rate you get at the hotel is very good compared to some other places we initially used. And the reception was always manned  so we only exchanged stirling as we needed which was very convenient.  Some of us visited the spa for a traditional Hamman massage: the girls couldn't have been nicer and more professional taking us on a tour of their facilities. To use the spa pool you have to pay £20 extra: which we thought was expensive and it was cold and dark so we didn't use that again.  The main pool is lovely: plenty of beds seating areas and shades with towels replenished as people leave. It was very busy and there was a bit of bed reserving going on but we managed to find somewhere every day at some point.  The upper terrace pool was too hot for us( temperatures reaching 42 degrees!) but had a more intimate setting.  Great facilities service and experience all round.  Just one irritant: when settling our room bill we were charged around £6 a day per room for tourist tax which we hadn't realised was required.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Quiet, top class service, brilliant location
Review_Text: Spacious room with sitting area bath and shower; overlooking the charming green courtyard and pool. 3 restaurants and a 'snack bar' - all very good especially the Indian/Asian and the lunchtime poolside. Delightful staff. Close to the centre of the Medina so perfect for exploring Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect is all I can say
Review_Text: The stay in this hotel was included in a trip of 10 days in Morocco (5 nights in Marrakesh and 4 nights in Agadir).  And why did I labeled it Perfect? For several reasons:  - location: 2 mins walking distance of the heart of Marrakesh (Jemaa El Fna square)  - amenities/services: all you can ask from a 5 star hotel - 2 swimming pools beautifully located and maintained 3 restaurants (only tried 1 and was probable the weakest point) good bar.  - Rooms: large with all you could need and decorated with the harmony of Marrakesh and the entire hotel  - Staff: majority of them friendly and kind  I recommend it no doubts about it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Edvard B wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: This is probably one of the better hotels I´ve ever stayed at. Nearly everything was perfect. It was like travelling back in time. Pools are amazing staff is amazing the style is amazing and the breakfast is beyond amazing! I will stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I did spend 4 days in this hotel and it was fantastic.  Staff very friendly. Fantastic food with 3 restaurants.  The breakfast it was very nice with a plenty of choices.  They have a large swimming pool with a fantastic view.  Bedrooms very tidy and pleasant.  Fantastic.  I will came back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo-Ann E wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: We stayed in a junior suite for 5 nights which was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The hotel is exceptionally clean. Beds are comfortable too!  The hotel was magnificent all the way.  Service was good and housekeeping is exceptional. We felt very welcome here - The staff are very friendly.  Had a massage at the Carita spa - which was very relaxing.    I would give a little feedback... as there are two pools I would recommend the smaller rooftop be adults only where couples can enjoy a relaxing time 😉  The breakfast could be improved with more choice. Lacked ‘international’ type food in my opinion. I ate fruit (which was quite limited) and toast daily with only one choice of brown bread or white. For three days the only eggs available were boiled! Our final day however there was plain omelette available.  Despite feedback I would definitely come back here. The location is perfect. It’s relaxing and very authentic. And just a short stroll to jemaa el fna square that can be explored by day and night. Also close to other main attractions too.  A great stay in Marrakech 😁
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shaheeda S wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: When we arrived at the hotel my heart sank. The road in was not shall we say suitable but once inside it's like a secret garden where all other things don't matter. We were there for 7 nights and didn't want to leave. The hotel staff a very friendly and accommodating. The food is a bit pricey but we were 5 minutes away from the soukes. The rooms are amazing very spacious and always smelling of roses.  I would love to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A lovely five star hotel that is stylish and located in a central location in the medina. The service is excellent and the rooms beautiful. This truly is a five star hotel with style and service that would be excellent anywhere in the world.The variety and food in the restaurants was excellent and each had its own style and ambience.  Its greatest asset having been out and about was being able to return reasonably quickly (due to its central location) to the hotel to enjoy its ambience and superb facilities.

Naturally we were looking forward to our mini family escape. We had booked a 5 star hotel (as per the travel agents ratings (4.5 stars on trip advisor). Our flight was at 6.10 am and due to land in Marrakesh at 9 am with transfer to hotel.    When we arrived at our hotel that’s when we experienced our first issue. We were told to wait in the reception as our rooms were not ready. We thought okay we don’t mind waiting a bit though everyone was exhausted after having been up all night finishing packing ironing getting ready arriving at the airport for 4am and being on a 3 hour flight. But hey we are on holiday so what if we weren’t able to get access to our 5 star hotel room bed for a little while longer?.... but how long is acceptable?    We didn’t get our room till 4:30pm. We sat around on 2 seater sofas for almost six and a half hours! Ridiculous!!! And that didn’t end there. Our kids were supposed to have the adjoining room. We were told that room was still not ready as the previous occupants had not yet vacated. An hour later I went to reception to tell them that we still didn’t have the kids room and I wanted to make a complaint. As soon as I said this the receptionist said that the room was ready and that they had ‘forgotten’ to inform us. He handed me the key card for the room. Had I not come down to complain I’m sure we all be sharing that one room 😡.    Unfortunately it didn’t end there. I’d specifically phoned the hotel when I was in London to ensure my kids room had two single beds. Upon arrival I again reiterated the point and the reception had said that it was noted. Yeah. They had a single double bed. Down I go again to complain. The receptionist seems surprised and said it’s noted on our booking that it should be two single beds in the kids room. Add on another 45 mins before they adjust their room with the two single beds.    When we did get our room the floor was filthy. We had to ask the reception desk to remove the rug in our room. It really was that bad. By now we are shattered.    A few days after arriving I was unfortunately taken ill. I was in bed for two days both days I couldn’t get much sleep due to the building work on the third floor next to the Indian restaurant. Constant drilling and banging.    On checking out we were made to feel like criminals! Not only did they get our bill wrong saying we had ate at a restaurant that we didn’t even visit they didn’t even apologise for their error when they could find the receipts that they claim we had signed. They then also accused us of taking items from the mini bar which they also admitted was a mistake. No apology and no ‘thank you for choosing our hotel’    The overall stay was average but only two stars as this is a service industry and thus they are judged on their service. Poor.    Never going back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Diana G wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Amazing hotel!! Great location, high level of service + fantastic guide
Review_Text: We thank you for 7 wonderful days at your hotel. Everyone says "that the hotel has a perfect location" .... and it's not just a good but amazing location with direct access to the souk. You provided a high level of service when we had to change our booking and secured large rooms facing the beautiful garden and views of Koutoubia.
