But the very best was your recommendation of Hamid our private guide for 4 of the days - we explored the Southern and Northern part of the Medina took a day trip to the Atlas mountains and a day trip to Essauira. We love the adventurous atmosphere of Marrakech and will definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed in a Riad without a pool and fancied a day trip to lounge somewhere. This hotel promised to deliver just what we needed and we were not disappointed.    For a fee of 780 dirhams we were rewarded with a generous pool and loungers a two course lunch and an hour-long massage. The waiters were attentive and the setting is simply beautiful. It is within easy reach of the main square and we were able to walk it from our Riad easily. The day pass allows you access to the spa and pool and the facilities are simply stunning. The massage was lovely too very refreshing.    Lunch was two course included in the fee. Dessert was amazing. Drinks were at extra charge but at 180 dirhams for a bottle of wine they were reasonable prices for a hotel setting in Marrakech.    I would highly recommend this to anyone staying in the city it is the most amazing retreat from the hectic streets of the Medina. I’d go back in a flash.

Review_Date: frui vita wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Relaxing hotel - Exceptional in all aspects
Review_Text: Recently enjoyed a 4 day stay. Fantastic location within a 2 minute walk of the main square in the heart of the medina. Walking in from the bustle of the street the contrast is breathtaking. Grand period reception looking onto a glorious pool/garden area full of shrubs trees and flowers - a beautifully attended oasis surrounded by a striking period building. Further pool area on the roof with great views and atmosphere.  Rooms stylishly furnished and spotlessly clean - we stayed in a junior suite looking over the inner courtyard but rooms on the outer side overlooking street might be less appealing?  Stylish dining areas - particularly for breakfast around the inner courtyard. Good breakfast selection.  Super Indian restaurant at roof level.  Staff all friendly and efficient.  I really cannot fault this hotel and cannot wait to return. Thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We were recommended this hotel by a very seasoned traveler who goes abroad twice a month to different countries yet has stayed here 8 times because it was so good and has recommend it to friends and family. I can safely say it was the best recommendation we have ever received and we are so glad we came here. It is AMAZING. Pure bliss and exactly what we needed. The staff; from reception the pool staff restaurants bar cleaners house maids spa staff and room service are exceptional!! 5 Star and beyond! Always always greet you brilliant service very kind Moroccan hospitality and do the hotel proud! We are 3 days into our 6 day stay (room 370 totally recommend it. Roomy clean great private patio amazing shower big screen TV and the bed is sooo comfy!) yet are so shocked at some of the few negative comments here. We have found the best hotel in Marrakech and will be returning 100% here each year! The pool is to die for all restaurants serve gorgeous food and a welcome retreat from the heat the location is amazing and in the middle of everything you should want. The hotel is spectacular and facilities it offers but by far the most impressive is the amazing and lovely lovely staff!!!! They can’t do enough for you and are an absolute credit to the owners. BRILLIANT!! Thank you for an amazing unforgettable stay which isn’t over just yet. We will see you soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: HECTOR D wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Excellent service, rooms, location and food!
Review_Text: This was the second time in the Hotel and even better than the first one. Hotel have beter appearance and food is excellent. One of the best location close to all attractions walking distance. Rooms very spacious and clean. Restaurants a must!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Great location and venue for a great meal with good service. Away from the hustle of the city on the roof top of this five star hotel.    Very good food which in this city rated as excellent !!    Easy access but on the expensive side
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Cristiano Cabutti wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We spent a few days for a family reunion in Marrakech for a long weekend and this hotel was recommended by a friend of my parents that is coming here twice a year. This hotel is strategically located in Marrakech. The hotel features not only beautiful rooms in Morocco’s style but also two restaurants two swimming pools a beautiful Carita Spa. I had a great Morroco’s Hammam and my girlfriend had a stunning linfatic-dren treatment. The hotel is few meters away from the Médina the souk and the Place Jamaa el Fna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The hotel amenities were great especially the rooftop pool and courtyard toward the rear of the hotel. It’s only a 2/3 minute walk from the main square.    The restaurants were pretty good with much of the food being served buffet style. For a few meals breakfast notably it was quantity over quality however.    Also a very minor gripe but worth flagging for anyone staying here: I was charged for the bottled water in the minibar at the end of my stay despite being told otherwise by staff - at a 5* hotel in a country where tap water isn’t sanitary to drink you’d think this’d be free!    A staff member also tried to make me pay my tab for a second time as I was exiting the hotel after checking out. I had to find the colleague I dealt with earlier to persuade him otherwise! Not ideal when attempting to get on your airport transfer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Thanks for the room upgrade at the arrival!
Review_Text: Lovely big room very comfortable with large bathroom. Thank you for the room upgrade free of charge on the arrival - Very much appreciated! Only one complaint: the staff took a bit long to bring our suitcase up to our room therefore we were not able to change and put ourselves comfortable because our suitcase was still down at the reception. We had to call up to remind to bring the lagguage to our room. They could have been more prompt. Overall very good experience and hope to return next time to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claire W wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Can’t speak highly enough of this hotel and it’s staff. Stunning building and grounds comfortable and spacious rooms beautiful gardens and pool excellent service and fabulous location. Would definitely recommend a stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bobby G wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Got scammed by someone in the hotel
Review_Text: As we left the hotel one day someone Infront of us as we were walking turned around and asked us if we recognised him.    It was the hotel reception steward. His name was either Muhammed or Abdullah (can't remember now). Anyway he was wearing plain cloths and said he'd finished his shift and was on his way home.    He asked us where we were going and we said we were going to a thanery (leather factory).    We'd just got the directions and details from the front reception but this guy now told us that they'd made a mistake; the thanery closes at midday as the work is too laborious in the heat.    He insisted on showing us something else and walked us 10 minutes to somewhere where someone else had tried to scam us before.    People in this country can be very forceful and they take advantage of our polite and affable western demeanor.    As we had a chance of bumping into him again at the hotel we followed him so as not to appear rude.    When we got to where he wanted to take us it was just a shop selling the same rubbish at every other stool.    In fact several street people had already tried to take us to this shop already so it's abundantly clear that they get money for every person they bring there.    As he left us in the shop he shouted to the shop owner in Arabic that after his shop the shop owner should send us on to another shop just next door selling argan oils (why?)    We walked around the shop so as to be polite and when trying to leave the shop owner accosted us and tried to find out why we wanted nothing.    What a strange question. Why don't we want anything? - By this point I was getting quite fed up of these people's switch personalities from friendly to unfirendly as soon as they see that you're not likely to be a paying customer so I just asked him back why he thought we'd want any of this polished antique knives candle holders leather bean bags or tea sets.    He then tried to take us to the oil shop and when we told him we didn't want to go he asked where we wanted to go.    We said to the main square and he said there was nothing in the main square.    What nonsense. The main square is the main attraction!    By this time I was ready to punch the dude so I just said curtly that there was nothing in the Argan oil shop either and we left with a bitter taste in our mouth.    Anyway - after this we made our way to the thanery leather factory that the girl in reception had given us a map for.    Turns out this guy from our hotel lied to us. It didn't close early! It was open literally all day! The guy who 'accidentally' bumped into us in the street had just lied to us to get us to go to the shop he wanted to take us to which we didn't want to go to.    I'm really let down that our five star hotel would expose us to something like this.    I knew Marrakesh was dodgy and that's why I paid well over the odds to stay in a five star hotel.    I expected they'd be doing everything they could to protect us from these sort of stuff - but as you can see they didn't and actually if I can comment two things about the hotel;    They didn't give us any real induction when we arrived.    1.) No map of the area or of the hotel. I only found out when we left that there's a nice Indian restaurant on the roof as well as some beautiful gardens with a beautiful view over the city. Such a shame we never saw them!    2.) We didn't get any sort of induction or orientation about the city and there was no invitation really to come and ask either. Whenever we did ask we received not cold but not ever so warm responses and it was always very to the point. It was some way through the holiday that was asked about the thanery and then found that they had a map of the city.    Finally - if I'm going to give a full summary;    I saw a bird eating from the breakfast buffet and I shoo'ed it away but the staff saw it as well and they did nothing. They didn't change the food nor did they shoo away the bird.    I wonder how often that happens and how many five star paying customers are paying over the odds for food that the birds have already pecked at.    On the last day our waiter at the breakfast was so rude he couldn't bring himself to say anything to us other than to clarify what it was we wanted.    Our "thank yous" fell on death ears.    And finally; if you've got gluten intolerance and or diabeties (like me) then you will only be eating rice tomatoes and cucumbers for breakfast.    Everything else is very sweet fruit and bread.    So to conclude: the hotel is nice but the people running it are just the same as the people in the street. They're gutter folk.    BUT it's probably the same all over Marrakech so it's probably as good as anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Nigel B wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: The hotel was in a central location. We had a mini suite and it was worth the extra money. There are two pools and the service was great from the staff. A good tip to seeing Marrakesh is to have a guided tour. We arranged this through the hotel and it cost 300 dirhams. All of the tour guides must be registered and there are lots who are not. They have either a red or green badge.  The food in the hotel was good and the service pleasant. The hotel offers a transfer service and it was very good and cost 10 euros each way. You do not need to change any money prior to your trip as you can change your own currency in the hotel or in the local exchange kiosks. The exchange was the same everywhere.  Just remember to take a pen with you to complete your visa entry into Morocco at the airport. We enjoyed our trip and the people were all very friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Great Hotel. Service  food and location very good. Roof top pool was a nice surprise. All 3 restaurants offered good quality food and service . Picked this over a Riad as it had a spa restaurants and gym. Would go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved the hotel very comfortable and the staff were lovely and helpful. Terrific all around great bar spa and nice restaurant. Beautiful courtyard in the Moroccan tradition lovely to sit there at night. Perfect location near the souk and cabs out front.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: J Blair H wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Marrakech was the first Arab city I ever visited. All of my research told me to prepare for an assault on my senses. The hotel is in heart of all the sites and sounds of the old city; a short walk to the city center and the Medina. Upon my arrival I was greeted with a warm greeting and a offer of mint tea. I originally reserved a room facing the pool but was told I was being upgraded. My room was a large suit with two TV's a lounge area kingsize bed granite everywhere in the glass enclosed bath and very nice art works. it also had a very nice enclosed deck with glass doors opening to the garden. It was beautiful and quiet. For a first time visitor to Marrakech the environment can be beautifully frustrating and fascinating simultaneously. All the sounds smells throngs of people and continuous pressure to engage in trade can wear on you after a few days. But yes; this is why I came to Marrakech! After a long day of sightseeing and negotiating with merchants the hotel is a tranquil respite from the plus of the city. Excellent multiple dining options are from a French bistro to Moroccan fine dining. The desk staff is very professional and helpful and all the cleaning staff must have been sent to charm school. Highly recommended!

Hotel and location was absolutely fantastic.Great location and a great hotel.  Peace and tranquillity in the middle of hustle and bustle. Hotel staff very friendy as are the local's.  Great food and a fantasic room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tejas W wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: You get what you pay for...
Review_Text: Great location. Right next to the Medina. But once you enter the hotel it is an oasis of calm. Great pools. Food was excellent. Breakfast was very filling and the Moroccon restaurant was great. Much better than the touristy places in the medina. If you are willing to may a bit more you get your money's worth.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Karen N wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: It is a beautiful riad- great for couples - children are out of place  Pool food is simple and good  Breakfast is great  Could do with a bit of renovation in certain areas  Hamman / scrub fab  Great place for a long weekend  No longer  Rooms pretty noisy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is the fifth time we have stayed here and we love it we were upgraded to a suite on arrival which was amazing. Great decor surroundings service and fab location for the souk and main square. Many thanks
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This place is always good. We’ve been coming for a few years and the staff are always lovely and helpful. Definitely will be back. The pools are both great and the restaurants good. The breakfast is plentiful with a wide selection.

Very nice hotel in excellent location. Authentic Moroccan architecture with the mod cons. Good staff and food beautiful pools and gardens. Close to all the action but not noisy. Would definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Great hotel. Impressed with the bedrooms and bathrooms ...very spacious clean and stylish. Excellent location great pools great food in the hotel breakfast was brilliant and it was lovely for the supervisor to come over to introduce herself on the first morning  great service... really couldn’t find any faults with it so I would highly recommend. Taxi from airport is 100 DHS in the day 150 at night airport is a Ten minute taxi ride away.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is an oasis in Marrakech. Wonderful garden with pools and good restaurants. The rooms are very fresh and the breakfast fantastic. Very helpful and serviceminded staff. I would gladly recommend the hotel to everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We arrived late at night check in was smooth but nobody told us where anything was in the hotel would of been nice to be shown where the restaurants were and the spa pool etc. We found the room and it had been decorated nicely with roses and rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom. The bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom a good size. There is a mini fridge that did not get cold a flat screen tv with only one English news channel a safe in the wardrobe which worked well. In the bathroom there is complimentary bath products but no conditioner for the ladies and these were not replenished every day there is a hairdryer for the ladies to use. Unfortunately the drains gave off a nasty smell in the bathroom and the sink was not cleaned very well. Towels are changed daily as was the bedding slippers were provided and dressing gowns. I did feel that rather than dressing the room with roses and petals every day it would be better to just do this on the day of arrival and spend less money just providing guests with complimentary bottles of water. There is plenty of storage space for clothes and plenty of plug sockets for charging.....remember your round pin adapters!!  The WiFi only worked in our room if we sat in the toilet it did not work anywhere else in the room although it worked ok in the public areas of the hotel.  The breakfast was uninspiring and the service was poor the toasters are pitiful and you need to stand for at least 10 mins to toast your bread as orange juice was served by staff and not left out for you to help yourself this did not get filled up during breakfast and glasses were small. For a 5 star hotel the breakfast needs to be better and a bigger selection of food available.  The restaurants are expensive and not 5 star again service was slow and you did not feel comfortable. The food mediocre and needs to be improved.  The pool area is nice and tranquil however the pool service is dreadful and if you require food or a drink you have to go in search of staff they are slow and don’t bring the bill when you ask to pay. We got so fed up waiting for the bill one day that we ended up leaving and going back to our room the next day the waiter had the cheek to say we forgot to pay the day before even though they ask your room number when you order so they can bill it to you room anyway. The sun beds are comfortable but need a pillow we kept asking for a second towel to roll up and use for a pillow there are parasols to use also. The spa is very nice no complaints there.  We did ask the concierge to send someone to look at our air conditioning 4 times as it was not working but this did not get fixed so we gave up in the end and wedged the window open with a cushion every night. The lift is temperamental and although you press the button nothing happens and it does not arrive ok for us as we were only on the first floor but felt sorry for the people higher up we assume that the staff were using the lifts and overriding them. The toilets in the pool area are ok but you are given flannels by the attendant to dry your hands on and then we observed her drying them out in the sun to be reused.........I didn’t want to use these again so opted for my own tissues........not a five star thing to be doing!! We also left some money on the coffee table in the room and went out on our return this was gone it wasn’t a lot of money so we didn’t kick up a fuss but be mindful that all valuables should be put in the safe whilst you are out we assumed it was the maid and she might have been under the impression that it was a tip but in my mind the room staff are tipped on the day you leave the hotel.......hence we did not leave a tip on our last day. We only got a turndown service twice and had to ask at reception for more loo roll and clean towels. The hotel is in a good location if you want to be near the main square and markets just a 2 minute walk. We do feel that there are lots of improvements needed within the hotel.....  Some gentle music piped at the pool area  Improved WiFi in rooms  Improved cleanliness in rooms  Pillows for the sun beds  More English channels on the tv in rooms  An introduction to the hotel on check in  Better food options  A vast improvement in the attitude and speed of staff  Complimentary bottled water in the rooms  If the improvements were made then I would be happy to say it was 5 star......at the present time it is certainly not
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: cynthia n wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is gorgeous and filled with an old world elegance and charm that wraps around you from the moment you come through the door. The restaurants are quite good as well and there are lots of options - but don’t miss Relais de Paris!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Carla M wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: An exotic and luxurious hotel experience
Review_Text: The tour I was on stayed at beautiful hotels in four Moroccan cities but this was by far the best experience. The rooms were attractive and comfortable the patio was gorgeous and the roses lent an extra touch of luxury indoors to match the flamboyant bougainvillea outside. The pools were amazing. I appreciated the excellent service throughout.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Vikram L wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is a gem! It is so beautifully located and it's old style is pleasing to the senses. However there is something amiss. The staff seems unmotivated and that is the basic problem. There is little or no enthusiasm and hardly any will to please. Nevertheless the hotel is a nice place to stay but it could be much much better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The hotel is 5 star but has a matter of fact and worn out attitude.The Reception is slow in answering queries....it took 3 calls and a personal visit to reception to get any clarification on the A/C problem.The waitresses at the morning breakfast restaurant are more often than not chitchatting and preening themselves and make little effort to clear the table with used crockery while the customers breakfast.The Indian restaurant has mediocre food and inadequate and slow service.They bring 2 dining plates for 3 persons and then take hours to bring the third plate while the food gets cold.At check out the concierge is handling 3/4 guests at the same time leading to unnecessary confusion.I needed some minor repairs to my spectacles.....a minor issuebut was requested to pay 100 Dhirams in advance.I somehow gathered the impression that this was the tip in advance to the hotel boy!The hotel’s main advantage is that it is close to the Medina and has lovely gardens.But it certainly needs to improve its service to 5 star category.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Tranquil luxury in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel is lovely but with one glaring fault.    We stayed here for 8 days on our honeymoon and were given a room upgrade to a junior suite which was lovely. The hotel itself is beautiful tranquil well maintained and we loved the rooftop pool! It is however also situated not even a two minute walk from the Medina which is amazing. Our room was made up beautifully with rose petals every day as well which was a lovely touch.    We enjoyed the breakfasts - though if you want toast be prepared to stand by the toaster for 15 minutes (they are useless!) but fresh fruit pastries omelettes and crepes made for you are delicious.    The biggest let down at this hotel is the service sadly. In fact we were very often made to feel like we were a nuisance. I haven't ever stayed in a 5* or even a 4* like that. At breakfast we would probably have say 3 plates each for cereal fruit toast etc we would end up just piling everything in front of us because no one would take it away as it was used. Last morning we were in fairly early (7.30am) breakfast wasn't busy and we just got totally blanked by the staff. I had to go and find someone wait for them to stop talking to the other waiter and then ask if we could have some drinks. My tea came and was luke warm so requested another... all of these things were slammed down on the table in front of me without a word or smile. It's actually the younger members of staff who are more polite and once they came in they actually said good morning! We also had dinner in the Moroccan restaurant our last night again poor service not very friendly and we ended up spending really quite a lot of money on a pretty poor meal with poor service it was really disappointing.    Finally I would say watch your belongings... I put most things in the safe but left a pair of earrings out which consequently went missing. I never blame maids for anything I think it's unfair but my earrings were left in one place and were no where to be found. Luckily they weren't really expensive however they were one of my favorite pairs :-(    It was a real shame for the money we paid the service really was pretty poor. Inattentive sometimes(/often) unfriendly staff made a dent in what was otherwise a lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bunmi A wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Lovely hotel in a lovely location.    Near enough to the square about 2 mins away by foot.    Good breakfast good sized rooms. Lovely views from the roof top.    Nice restaurants.    Will visit again.    Stay away from the hustlers hanging around outside the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nathalie C wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Great hotel amazing staff! Near the Medina this hotel is quite amazing  . Lovely garden great pools on the top floor is heated but the main pool is cool and refreshing!  It is a super nice hotel with friendly staff.  We have enjoyed our stay very much! Would go back anytime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nelsa Abreu wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: DO NOT GO: Atrocious attitude from the hotel manager
Review_Text: We went into the hotel for a look around and saw they had an Indian restaurant where we decided to eat. There were a lot of problems with the food served completely cold and taking too long to come back to the table. We tried complaining to staff in the restaurant but were told the manager was in France there was nobody to complain to and that we should just be happy with our food.    Getting nowhere with the restaurant staff we asked to speak to the manager of the hotel. We went with one of the waiters to reception where a few minutes later a tall guy in a suit appeared who claimed to be the hotel manager. He was extremely rude from the first minute of seeing us saying that he didn't manage the restaurant the restaurant manager was in France and we needed to come back next week. I said I just wanted to explain what the problem was and he got right in my face and said "I don't care what your problem was it has nothing to do with me".    I asked for his name he refused to give it to me because he said it had nothing to do with him. He started shouting (seriously) and being very aggressive. The waiter from the restaurant was equally shouting and aggressive by this point and we got a phone out to video them as I have honestly never in my life seen service like this particularly in a hotel which claims to be a 4/5 star. The manager then tried to grab the phone from us he said "This is Morocco you are now going to see how nasty things can be in Morocco". He wanted us to hand over the phone saying it was illegal to video anyone in Morocco.    It was honestly like a scene from a comedy film this guy had clearly had zero training in how to talk to customers. We never once refused to pay we just wanted someone to hear our complaint.    There are so many lovely Moroccan staff working in hotels throughout the country it is a shame that Jardins de la Koutoubia employ someone who is so completely terrible at his job. It suggests to me that the probably pay very little manage their staff very badly and that this guy is probably the only one they can get. I can't see any other explanation for why any hotel would employ a manager as useless as this.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Paulien F wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: It was a very nice hotel. Very clean and the staff was also friendly and helpfull. But the breakfast wasn’t that good at all. The most anoying thing about our stay is the fact that one of the staff members behind the reception desk told the taxi driver in Arabic that he could ask 300 dirham to bring us to the AirPort (normal price is 100 dirham). He was shocked that my boyfriend could understand him (because my boyfriend speaks very well arabic) and my boyfriend attent him what to what he said that wasn’t correct at all and that he was fooling us... so also in the hotel you have to be aware of the fact that you can also get tricked in money related issues.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Our stay at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia made our Moroccan holiday complete
Review_Text: We have traveled extensively and this hotel has to be one of the best we have stayed in.  The room was very spacious and rose petals sprinkled around the bed and bathroom was a really nice touch. The service in the bars and restaurants was first class. Being next to the souk the hotel is ideally situated. We plan to visit Marrakesh again and without doubt will stay at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia. Thank you fir a wonderful stay.  Nick & Janet Gray Durban S. Africa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ritz S wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: We have been to this hotel 2 years ago and this was just the best hotel we ever stayed in (and we have been all over the world!) the costumer service is excellent all the little details about it is just unbelievable. Incredibly clean the swimming pool spotless and with amazing views. The fragrance of the room is something i did not forget form 2 years ago its just fantastic. The detail of the fresh rose petals everyday really makes you feel special. Also from 2 years ago I was just thinking about having the mouth watering pancakes again at breakfast! Breakfast is very complete with a lot of to choose from. Thank you so much for another amazing experience I’ll always recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you so much to all the staff! Keep on doing the great work!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm and perfection
Review_Text: Our second visit to this hotel adjacent to the Jeema el Fna and the souks. It is an expression of perfection from the service to the rooms and public spaces. The restaurants serve delicious food comparably priced with restaurants on the adjacent streets and the breakfast is divine. Will definitely return for another escape from life’s stresses.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautifully decorated hotel. The staff was outstanding and the room was beyond expectation cosy and clean with private veranda. The breakfast buffet was divine and The Morrocean and Indian restaurants at the hotel where absolutely fantastic.Will definetly stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Manuel R wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is located at the best-best-best place to live Marrakech Médina live.    Outstanding hotel services and quality. Swimming pool with warm water in the 3rd floor is more than convenient for relax time after long hours visiting ball amazing zouks and places inside Marrakech old city.    Best of the best friendly crew. Local guides being coordinated by front desk manager is a must.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Location location location. Not only that. The staff is very friendly and they smile a lot. The hotel is one step from the busy market yet you will find it quit an calm. A real retreat from the erratic streetlife outside. The room was spacious and clean and well cared for.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Honestly this was our least favorite of five stays in Morocco. We wished we were in a small ryad instead.  This hotel is quite large very impersonal and nothing much to write home about.  Our room was a generous size included a small living room. There were very few places to plug in phones/computers and we had to crawl around on the floor and unplug floor lamps (that is something that is surprising in a hotel that is trying to be 'detail oriented'.)  There was absolutely nowhere to put toiletries except balanced on the bathtub edge (that is a personal pet peeve).  The view was of a pool with people lying out; the ryads we stayed in all had lovely views of towns or courtyards.  The location was fine. It is walking distance to the main square but we were told by our guide not to walk there alone at night. The street it is on is filled with garish loud shops.  If you are getting dropped off or picked up by car it is extremely difficult for cars/vans to get into the deadend street and out again. One night it took us 15 minutes to drive the short distance out due to delivery trucks parking and blocking the whole street.    *(Just as an aside if you are choosing places to stay in Morocco--skip Marrakesh. It is the only place that had lines to get into gardens and monuments and the medina was filled with Chinese-made cheap products half the authentic products and producers are gone. In addition the rude snake "charmers" and henna ladies will grab you and make you pay for photos. We couldn't wait to leave this city.)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The exotic destination of Marrakech hides one of the best hotels I have stayed in during the past 30 years! As you walk into this hotel each turn reveals something magical. The decor the food the pool the spa & gym and the great location are only exceeded by the exquisite rooms and service. Fresh rose petals in the room every day? Thought I was dreaming!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Outstanding accommodation and service. The included breakfasts were superb. Room facilities were excellent. Location is very good with easy access to the medina and all other transport facilities. we enjoyed our stay very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew M wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: This is a fantastic hotel with a typical unassuming front door from the bustling street side. Once inside the hotel is tranquil and feels a million miles away from all the sensory attacks you encounter in the busy streets of Marrakech.    All rooms either face out or into the courtyard where the pool is. Ask for a room facing in as they are much quieter. Several restaurants to choose from an excellent breakfast and a great piano bar with a wide selection of local and imported wines and spirits.    We had a suite which was effectively two rooms they had knocked out the wall and connected. We had a bathroom each one with a shower and one with a bath. Well appointed rustic feel to the rooms and warm and welcoming staff.    Location is excellent as you can literally walk outside and turn left or right and you're very quickly into the main square with snake charmers and food stalls and shopping in the massive souks of Marrakech. Take a guide these souks are a maze and easy to get lost. Also watch out (particularly ladies) when you're in crowds watching the performances in the square pickpockets and overly friendly local men!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Myra M wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I have traveled to over 30 countries and love staying in fabulous hotels. This hotel ranks high on my list of best hotels from its excellent location grandiose room size friendly staff and beautiful property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jason C wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is worthy of its five stars ⭐️ . It has the best location being a matter of yards away from the main square however inside it is an oasis of calm and opulence.  The decor is amazing and the staff are extremely welcoming and kind. The breakfasts are a great feast and set you up for a day of sight seeing.  The roof top terrace and pool offer splendid views of the medina and Koutoubia mosque and should you tire of this pool there are another two pools to consider at the hotel.  Food at the restaurants are of excellent quality and have varied menus catering for all tastes.  We had a room overlooking one of the pools which was light bright spacious and spotlessly clean.  I have been to this hotel now some 4 times and will be back again next year such is it’s allure.

We were upgraded! Our room/suite was a marvel we loved it. Hotel very accommodating when we asked them to schedule small trips outside Marrakech at the last minute. The tour guides they chose for us were excellent. The hotel's restaurants were pretty good and we ate at them most of the time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: lovely roomslovely cocktail bar with pianist;also cigars on sale which was unusual in maraakech.the swimming pools were good;especially the one on top deck.  nice breakfast but rather slow and far too much of a buffetbeing repetitive.in allgreat will return again!!

Review_Date: Mandy F wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Good hotel in an excellent location
Review_Text: Comfortable  clean  well equipped and peaceful rooms ; has good facilities with gym  two pools and a choice of three restaurants ; good selection at breakfast . Great location close to all the main tourist sights
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Six nights. Two kids 11 / 10 and two adults. Shared mini suite overlooking pool. Breakfast great. Rooftop pool has sun all day. An oasis away from the noise of Médina. Call to prayer and tweeting birds will wake you at 0530 and 0630 respectively but no issue. Great service - we had mint tea brought to the room each night. Use gym - one running machine is good - all the rest of the kit is ropey! Spa and hairdresser used - good value. Cocktails with pianist each night - kids felt grown up. All this inc supper one night in the Bala curry house and lunch a few times and the extras bill was £400. Great value I think. Two gripes; check out was PAINFUL. Not prepared didn’t know the facts and a little incompetent. And we booked an 0730 cab for the airport and it didn’t show up; had they booked it? On the whole a 10/10. Great hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful. A traditional Moroccan gem and peaceful oasis, 3 mins from the mad main square
Review_Text: We returned to Les Jardins for the 8th time recently. We travel a lot and the reason why we return to this hotel again and again is that we receive fantastic service from all staff (from the manager to the pool staff) the location is perfect the hotel feels authentic not a sterile chain and the food is fantastic. The breakfasts are glorious and the rooftop restaurant Les Jardins de Bala serves wonderful food throughout the day and night. Relaxing by the rooftop heated pool looking out onto the Koutoubia mosque listening to the call to prayer is an experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A comfortable and tranquil hotel conveniently situated within 5 minute walk of the main square and surrounding Souks therefore when we had had enough of the bustle of the Souks we could quickly recover in the tranquillity of the hotel. Only downside was there was no AC in the hotel gym which made it very difficult to use even in February when temp only 20 degrees.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just on the outside of the Médina is this gem of a hotel. Once you enter you enter a haven of peace quiet beautifully decorated it is the place to be. In the basement of the hotel is the Karita spa which just adds to your tranquility. Rooms are a little outdated but still very nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia for a week in February. The hotel is comfortably furnished and decorated in traditional Moroccan style but it has all the facilities which one expects from a modern hotel e.g. free WiFi throughout. The location is very convenient with all the attractions of central Marrakech within walking distance. The hotel encloses a large sheltered courtyard containing the main comfortably heated swimming pool. The pool is clean and pleasant with plenty of sunbeds. There is another pool on the roof terrace and a third in the SPA. Rooms either face the courtyard or as our did the street. However the street is quiet at night. We were upgraded to a mini-suite which had excellent facilities with both shower and bath. It was warm comfortable and very clean. We needed to use the heating as the weather was cold. The hotel has three restaurants and we ate in them all. The main Moroccan restaurant serves breakfast and dinner. The breakfast buffet has plenty of fresh and dried fruits cereals and delicious breads and pastries. Egg dishes are cooked to order and are good. Dinner is mainly tagines and kebabs. It's not always clear whether your tagine will contain vegetables couscous or just the meat - so ask before you order. The French restaurant Relais de Paris has has an excellent menu and delicious food and is very well run. Absolutely the best value for money. There is also an Indian restaurant on the roof terrace; its menu and the food are fairly standard. The bar is pleasant and serves alcohol (not always available in Morocco). The hotel staff are efficient and friendly and take a genuine interest in their guests. We had an enjoyable stay and I have no hesitation in recommending Les Jardins de la Koutoubia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Khadija Alhayki wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Situated in the heart of the old Medina Les Jardins de la Koutoubia is an enchanted lovely hotel. We were warmly received with green tea and deserts. My room was overlooking the pool and was nicely decorated with petals of roses. It was very nice very clean and comfortable. It had a hair dryer an iron  slippers nice toiletries and free wifi. The hotel has a spa that you need to book in advance. Breakfast has a good selection of options and the “regheefa” and he “crep” were freshly baked upon request and tasted like heaven. I would like thank SadeSituated in the heart of the old Medina Les Jardins de la Koutoubia is an enchanted lovely hotel. We were warmly received with green tea and deserts. My room was overlooking the pool and was nicely decorated with petals of roses. It was very nice very clean and comfortable. It had a hair dryer an iron  slippers nice toiletries and free wifi. The hotel has a spa that you need to book in advance. Breakfast has a good selection of options and the “regheefa” and he “crep” were freshly baked upon request and tasted like heaven. I would like thank Sadeq in the reception Hanan from the breakfast team As well as Jameela and Khadija from the house keeping team who went out of their way to make sure our stay was as comfortable as it could be. I would definitely go back. from the house keeping team who went out of their way to make sure our stay was as comfortable as it could be. I would definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Miguel M wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is very good well centered and beautiful. Has three restaurants (Indian international and Moroccan). The Moroccan restaurant has almost no vegetarian food (that is why the 4 points review)    For family or love this place is worth every penny.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: michael w wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: A good rest on the way to and from El Fna
Review_Text: If you are on your way to or from El Fna and you are nearby the hotel Les Jardins de La Koutoubia don't miss to visit their famous piano bar. To sit down there having a drink and listening to the piano player/singer brings you back to old times when people like Orson Wells and the like frequented Marrakech. All you are waiting for is Hercule Poirot coming in to take his afternoon tea or night drink...  Service is very nice as well as the whole atmosphere of relaxing on the search of the lost time.  This place is good for loading up for the drums of El Fna and it is as good for relaxing after an exhausting evening in the medina of Marrakesh.  Highly recommended. We will be there as often as we can when being in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent 6 nights at this hotel.  My overall impression: They can do better for a 5-star hotel.    Check-in: Fast served tea and snacks. Upgraded to a mini suit (thank you!).    Room: Moroccan themed which was wonderful. However it seemed old and not very clean. For example the shower bidet was spotted and not very clean. The bathtub had an old dried spot. The rokm didn't have this overall "clean and hygienic" impression that normal 5-star hotels had when you first entered.  They had a huge closet towels bathrobes and other bathroom supplies were avilable.  - No tea/coffee corner. Water bottles not supplied.  - Fruits upon arrival in room.  - No iron in room    Laundry: Fast (given at night and received in morning). Clean and smelled good.    Spa: Good experience clean. I had a whole body massage. My only bad experience is that the masseuse didn't smell nice especially when massaging my head and face. Not too expensive either around 600 MAD.    Breakfast: Awful. Limited options for a five star hotel! Same dishes every single day. A small table for cheese products and meat a table for cereals veggies and yogurt break and croissants and eggs/bacon/steamed veggies/sausages/meat. And a lady who does omelette. It's a very tiny section.    Pool area: Heated pool but we didn't go for a swim. There's an area with a fireplace next to the pool that was cozy and great for chilling. There was also a closed room with a pool table and tv.    Other comments:  - Reception area was nice to be honest. It had a Moroccan theme.  - Check out: We waited for a while until someone came to get our bags. They did provide us with a taxi.  - Proximity to other areas: It was next to the old souk and Djama'a Al Fena. More modern shops were 30 minutes walking distance. We did not use a taxi a lot we walked all the time.    N.B In the photo of the bed kindly note that it was made for the purpose of taking a photo not by an actual staff member. They would usually make it nicer :p
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful riat very well located just next to the big souk. 3 wonderful swimming pools (one indoor/spa - however for this you have to pay extra which is a bit strange - it rained a few days and we wanted to relax at the pool without taking a treatment every time (with treatment you get free access to the pool) but the cost for lying there are a flat fee of $20...). Staff is friendly they even arranged a birthday cake for us so we were able to surprise our birthday family member! Breakfast is great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I just say first impressions I was delighted when I stepped in. Bright velvety red sofas nice decorations at the lobby and the reception staff was very polite.  I was given a mint tea and a fresh towel but it is not hot here so I did not see the use of it.  I stayed in a room overlooking the pool and with the sound of the local birds.. delightful.  Nicely kept. The room is nice plenty of space unfortunately as I checked my bed there was hair all over the linen. The cleanliness of the bedroom was also an issue that when I pointed out it was rectified.  The staff here is lovely. The room needs some updating. Clear wear and tear is very visible.  There are 2 pools one is heated and sun-loungers everywhere lots of choices. The garden is fantastic and peaceful. I had lunch at the restaurant and it was very nice and good  Price. I don’t agree it is a 5 star hotel. there is no complimentary water or coffee in the room. Very different from another hotel I stayed. On my last visit. Breakfast was good but nothing exceptional. Wi-fi works well.  I recommend it in low season ... it must be extremely busy in the summer .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Miryam S wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Beso place mear Jemma el Fna
Review_Text: Great hotel friendly service perfect situation. Gardens are beautiful and rooms spacious and clean. If you want to stay close to the souks and enjoy continental luxury without paying a fortune this is the hotel. If I ever travel to Marrakech again I'll go back to thai hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Abi O wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We were pleasantly surprised to find out that the hotel was in the heart of the Medina. A beautiful hotel with wonderful views of the Medina. The staff were friendly which made our stay all the better. We needed tour guides to take us around the Medina and the Atlas Mountains. The chief concierge Abdessadeq Khanjari made sure we got the best tour guides and we got the real Marrakesh experience.  Definitely going back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Be Careful If You Are Considering This Hotel!
Review_Text: Unfortunately the staff at this hotel ruined what was otherwise a fabulous holiday. On checking out they presented me with a additional bill for breakfast for my children which we had paid for in the package (proof given) and has been confirmed by my travel agent. After a heated discussion I had no option but to pay as I was running late to catch my flight home. I have chased this up with the hotel after and despite Mr Abdellatif Bouiski from the hotel promising a refund I still have not received any payment. I have wasted time chasing this payment and really wish I booked a different hotel where they are not trying to cheat you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: In my view this is the best place in Marrakesh  A old fashion Riad in the very hearth of the city close to the main square  Rooms are spacious and clean  Breakfast is delicious  The service is of a real five star which is not common in Morocco (especially if compared with other hotels which are even more expensive). Staff is highly professional and friendly  Rates are convenient again compared to other solutions  I would not consider anything different in planning a trip to Marrakesh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We have stayed in this hotel many times and it remains our favourite
Review_Text: Not only el a beautiful place the personnel is friendly and efficient. The rooms are lovely. The restaurants Marocain and Jardin de Bala (Indian) serve delicious food and are also good for vegetarians.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Emma M wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Great hotel, very close to the Medina
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Koutoubia is a lovely hotel a calm in the hustle and bustle of the Medina and nearby square. In the courtyard is a lovely garden surrounding a swimming pool and at the far end there is a huge fireplace with comfy chairs that catch the sun in the morning where people bask in the sunshine post breakfast. Breakfast was good with lots of fruit bread and juices plus a fresh omelette cooked to order. Ask for a room overlooking the swimming pool! The front of house staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel organised a tour guide to investigate the Medina which was well worth doing (less hassle) and we visited some very interesting nooks and crannies that as tourists on our own we may have missed (town bakery lotion and potion shop with argan oil and so on). The spa/hamam in the hotel is perfect for a hard day as a tourist! There is a two day treatment that my friend and I enjoyed hugely (having the dead skin removed by a good rub down by a loofah on a marble slab and sloshed with warm water! Our rooms were lovely beautifully decorated and on arrival your bed has rose petals laid out in a lovely design with a delicious plate of fruit available. Very much recommend this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Manuel QP wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: The Hotel is very well located. The Lobby and restaurantes need a renovation. Rugs carpets and sofás are very old. The rooms have been renovated a couple of years ago and are confortable.. People are very nice but service is not like a European 5 Star Hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alan b wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I would recommend this hotel for its friendliness and high standards of service. Both the French and Moroccan restaurants were excellent however the Indian restaurant on the roof was very disappointing the food served was terrible extremely bland and basic. The waiting staff were friendly enough but it definitely requires a new chef! All in all I would recommend this hotel with the exception of the Indian restaurant
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Justin T wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: best hotel i have ever stayed at
Review_Text: honestly don't know how to put it into other words Authentic Perfect positioning in proximity to the markets but also the club strip is only a taxi ride away Staff are great. Log fires are amazing which the staff will set on request. Hearing the call to prayer everyday gives you the real experience of being in Marrakech and i honestly do not think we could have chosen a better place to stay. You don't have to worry about having cash all the time or card because you can eat and drink at any of the restaurants on the complex and provide your door number as to which you can pay after your stay. loved it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Pam S wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Amazing apartment which was beautifully presented on arrival with rose petals arranged to enhance the first impression. We would have liked more free time there to enjoy the facilities which looked very appealing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I know this property quite well although I’ve never used it as a hotel. However I’ve visited it’s restaurants first the Indian in 2015 and more recently the Moroccan in November 2017. The food was good the quality of service as you’d expect of a five star hotel and the prices are more then adequate. I also enjoyed a pleasant drink in the hotels Piano Bar. On top of it all I must admit I just love the hotels decor - full of character post-colonial interiors of common areas are really charming. Les Jardins de La Koutoubia is one of Marrakech’s grand dames and probably one of the best addresses to stay in when visiting Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Having walked past this place several times decided to stop for lunch. Were not disappointed as restaurant situated around a beautiful pool in the centre of this lovely building. Had a lovely lunch with wine and good service. Spent a wonderful afternoon in their gorgeous spa enjoying some of their treatments. Would look at staying here next time as such a lovely place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis close to the Medina but near the main roads
Review_Text: We found the location to be perfect for our first expedition to this intriguing and exotic city. It is not as secluded inside the Medina thus we were able to park our rental car nearby and unload bags without navigating hidden alleys and uneven surfaces expected of the ancient Median setting.    The breakfast was great with all westerns and Middle eastern expected treats. There is an incredible roof bar and a pool that overlooks the Plaza and main Mosque at the Medina making this roof /pool/bar perfect sunrise -hanging out after a walking shopping marathon in the souks. The hotels also has    While the property decor is not as modern as the new five stars hotels in town the rooms and beds were comfortable and fresh. The setting offers total quietness amidst the buzzing trading vibe going outside in Marrakesh.    The menu at the restaurant for dinner could improve a bit we decided to venture out and taste other places and enjoy a more ample diverse dinner menu.    For the proximity to the main roads getting in and out the Medina was not a headache  which worked well for - first time visitors - like us  we recommend this place for first time visitors. We may venture to more secluded places on our next visits I heard that getting lost and discovering architectural hidden gems and extravagant riads is part of the adventure when traveling to this enigmatic city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Barry F wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: First trip to the Hotel and glad I read about the drive up to the arrival area which does not create the best impression. That said on entering the hotel you suddenly realise the quality of the reception area and the hotel itself.    The staff at check in were very courteous and helpful and ensured my room which was a Junior suite was ready even though it was only mid morning. Also on departure I was able to keep my room till 2.30pm without any cost.    The buffet breakfast was excellent and was available in the downstairs restaurant or on the patio terrace. Once again staff service was very efficient and the range of hot and cold foods was vast with plenty of different drinks to choose from. Also breakfast was available till 10.30am so no need to worry about early starts.    We also eat in the hotel Indian restaurant which is situated on the roof of the hotel. Once again first class staff service with food to match and great views.    Other facilities we used was the hotel spar which had a wide range of treatments at sensible prices along with the patio bar on an evening. The bar has a great feel to it with both background music and live entertainment on the weekend. The bar shuts at midnight but on the Saturday evening we found the waiters happy to serve drinks well past this time    The location of the hotel is ideal for everything in the centre of Marrakech with the advantages of being able to get to other places in the city very easy    I would have no problem in recommending the hotel for a business trip or a holiday getaway. I hope to get back to Marrakech very soon and this hotel will be my one and only choice when booking my trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: This hotel is situated very close to Djemaa el Fina yet not at all noisy. As soon as you step into the building you enter the different world. It is very relaxing and almost all staff are polite and friendly. There are so many public spaces where you can relax and food  here are very nice and beautifully presented. It is not cheap place but if you would like to feel nice Moroccan hospitality you can feel it here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I popped in to the bar at Les Jardin de la Koutoubia. There is a great relaxed atmosphere with efficient staff. The seating includes a colonial-style bar and further seating around the pool and beautifully lit  garden area. The margarita cocktail was fabulous! It’s a welcome break from the frenzy of the souks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amanda M wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia. It was our first trip to Marrakech and the hotel location could not have been any better. Located just a short walk from Jemmaa el Fina (the main square) it was ideal for our needs during stay. The room was spacious and very clean. The hotel also offers 2 pools- one in the courtyard on the ground floor and one on the rooftop which is heated. Interesting layout in terms of the WC not being in the main part of the bathroom. Hands down this hotel delivered in terms of location price and service versus the riad we booked for the end of our stay. Would highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A big hotel with a very interesting interior. Stayed in one of its suites the room was very big with a separate living room. a big painting hanging on the wall. The service was excellent. Foods were amazing. Very close to the famous traditional night market Jemmaa el Fina. From my room I could hear the noises from the market. One drawback is that the hotel way is very narrow and it is surrounded by small vendors and shops. Another concern is safety due very large crowds around the hotel particularly at night. Overall experience is fine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: we stayed as a family of four (2 adult children) in 2 rooms interconnected by a balcony overlooking the pool & courtyard (which was nice). a very well featured hotel in the old moroccan style. three restaurants including the one of the roof - an excellent indian/ thai cuisine. the tagine restaurant was less appetising but good traditional food. the garden restaurant menu could do with an update. but had a nice ambience. the spa was very good with good therapists. my son even tried the hairdresser (rated OK). would recommend. nice cocktail bar with excellent staff

Well not much to add to my previous reviews of this hotel. The staff are excellent and very helpful. The hotel suffered a fire on the top terrace which has resulted in the Indian restaurant to be relocated on to the terrace which has the roof top pool. Beds are in short supply and space is abit tight. This only a temporary situation has work was nearly finished on the new restaurant. Special praise for Marie who runs the Indian restaurant the food and service was first class. We look forward to seeing the new restaurant when completed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Hotel is absolutely beautiful on entrance everything is magical specially if this is your first arrival in Morocco The Breakfast is really big there is plenty to choose from. We visited this hotel twice during our stay in Morocco I have to say during the second visit they were not as attentive to us as like in the first one. They forgot to bring us our luggage until we reminded them a couple hours later. Still I really recommend this hotel above any other in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Excellent place to stay while visiting Marrakech. Perfectly situated just outside the souk and very close to the big square. Excellent service and very nice rooms and restaurants. Very nice pool area and a lovely roof top also with pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had booked a taxis from airport via hotel for 200 Dirham – met just outside terminal – easy journey until entering the medina when traffic congestion hit home – arrived down a narrow street to find unassuming entrance to hotel    Once through the doors the experience began – check-in formalities included form filling mint tea a sweet cake and back to the desk – some whispering followed and then it was announced that we had been upgraded from booked our mini suite to a junior one – then followed a trek from the old hotel through what appears to be a narrow street to the more modern extension to the room overlooking La Palais de Paris restaurant – thank you    We stayed in room 77 – otherwise known as Les Palmiers - first floor junior suite - for 5 nights from 11 October 2017 – set in its own block with a room below – as a result it was generally quiet    Being a junior suite it was spacious with a separate sitting area with flatscreen TV and what looked like a working fireplace – separated by a curtain is the spacious bedroom with very large firm but comfy bed opposite hanging and storage space with another flatscreen TV – separate toilet – very large bathroom with walk-in shower – good flow generally well controlled with decent toiletries and large soft towels – outside there is a terrace with deck chairs an awning and curtains for privacy    The air conditioning worked well and could supplemented by a ceiling fan - the passworded wi-fi did the biz and passed the newspaper download test – there is a decent size fridge and an Nespresso coffee machine offering expresso sized portions – there was a turn down service on 3 of our 5 night stay which was appreciated    Breakfast is served on the ground floor next to the pool – egg and pancake stations plus extensive hot and cold buffet – good coffee and juice served to the table – however during our stay service levels dipped and became erratic – fewer items were replenished – coffee arrived cold more than once    There is a bar and alcohol is served throughout the building which is not the case in many places elsewhere – whilst it is reasonably well priced it can’t beat supermarket prices – there is a Carrefour within a 15 minute walk away just past the Cyber Park – the alcohol section is extensive and is on the lower floor – well worth the walk    We had a guide arranged by the hotel – 300 dirham for about 2 hours’ worth of guiding and chat including stops at perfumery and carpet shop – good introduction to the Souks and the history of Marrakech and Morocco and its relationship to the wider political world and Islam – for first timers like us we got a very good introduction and enabled us to better understand the guide book    Where we ate more often than not in the hotel – best food was provided by the lunches – good choices and tasty – dinner less so especially in Les Jardins de Bala – we did eat dinner outside the hotel – Kit Kif – did not disappoint with great views across to the Mosque – Portofino – safe European option – and the Red House which was a good experience    The hotel is in a very central location within the Medina and within easy walking distance of Place Jemaa El Fna and the Souks but still directly accessible by car which many of the Riads are not    Drivers in Marrakesh appear to follow a Highway Code that defies understanding and especially in the Souks you have to watch out for motorbikes and cyclists who are threading their way through the crowds at speed    In the main the hotel was a good choice for what we wanted - the room was well appointed quiet and comfortable – the restaurants offered choice – service was generally ok if a little patchy at times – the prices for food and drink reflected the hotel status and local customs – it was very popular particularly with the French – thank you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maria C wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Fabulous hotel right by the square...an oasis of calm and relaxation.  We stayed in a standard room overlooking the central pool...all mod cons...all it conditioning and a ceiling fan. Toiletries provided along with robes and a proper hairdryer. Safe provided in the room free of charge. The room was perfect..comfy bed and beautiful linen. Sofa in the room and a tv...not that we used it!  The rooftop pool is cool and great for a relaxing afternoon after exploring the city  Breakfast was good and you could even get bacon..not something I've ever had in a Muslim country. Fresh juice and fresh coffee/tea served to your table  The staff were courteous and friendly...sometimes a little slow service wise...but you're in Morocco - just chill and enjoy !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard L wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: I can't give this hotel 5 stars even though it designates itself five. A very solid 4 1/2 though. It is situated on the edge of the very noisy crowded and frenetic souks. As one walks back into the hotel the pool and gardens of this Riad are immediately in view and are most welcome.    The front desk staff were very helpful with all we asked (booking restaurants arranging tours and giving advice about prices and tipping). I'd advise availing yourself of such help since costs are remarkably fluid in Marrakech. Contrary to what I read on other reviews everyone on the desk and the restaurant manager spoke very passable English. Not as prevalent with secondary staff. A little French will take you far.    Pool was clean and refreshing with ample shady spots on the main level with a second lovely albeit less shaded rooftop pool.    Nice breakfast on the patio by the pool. We had dinner there one night and as good as most of the restaurants we tried in the Medina without the craziness of traversing the busy evening souks (or more imposing empty souk when side alley shops are shuttered. Main thoroughfare only was open and populated when we passed through post-dinner at 11:00).    Losses points on slightly tired finishings limited rooms with balconies no peephole in the door (helpful when "someone is knocking on your door at 4:00am - "Sorry. Wrong room") no coffee in room and non-obsessive poolside service.    All in all recommended for location pool/garden and comfort at a reasonable cost.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jan M wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Good choice for a weekend getaway
Review_Text: The hotel is located centrally close to Djemaa el Fna which is a great plus. Given its central location we were able to get to all the main attractions within walking distance during our stay in Marrakesh.    However the location itself was not the only plus. Friendly staff nice and spatious rooms and the pool area as well as the inside garden did make our stay in Marrakesh an enjoyable memory. I would definitely recommend the hotel especially if you do not want to spend all the money on a riad - we paid approximately $ 250 for our room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: James B wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: The hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of the Media - a 15 min taxi from the airport. Try to pay 140 dr for a taxi....they will push for 200+.    If you don't speak French or Arabic - you will really struggle as the staff speak basically no English. If i didn't speak French we would have had a very tiresome week of Falty Towers explanations. They need to address this urgently to justify 5* hotel rating.    Pools:  It has two good pools - they do get busy if the hotel is full. And the downstairs pool is only 30% sun at any time as in a courtyard. The roof pool was better in our opinion - more breeze and lots of sun.    PLEASE BUY A COUPLE MORE CDs - the music is on repeat all week!!    The lady who looked after the bar at the top pool was really lovely - but mostly they rest all hid in the bar rather than keeping an eye on the guests.    It would be good if the team helped with parasols proactively- you have to hunt them down and ask for help.    Food and Drink  The snack menu is fine but limited and a bit basic - sensibly priced.  The Relais is ok - not bad but not great and a bit soulless.  Breakfast is a simple normal hotel continental with fresh pancakes and omelettes - with the usual. Service is a little inattentive or chaotic - never once was a clean table ready for us to sit on. That said when you get to talk to someone they are all friendly and helpful.    Rooms  We had a mini suite with a little terrace. It was lovely. Best bathroom for a hotel in last couple of years with great shower.    AC was sadly a real let down - not cold enough and we raised it the management but nothing could be done to improve it - they did offer a new room but with a couple of nights to go it was more hassle than it was worth - our laziness!    There is free wifi but had hotel had huge problems with it this week and it didn't really reach our room. Gave us a 4G router which was perfect after we asked.    In summary - a great option due to location and pools. Better service (and language skills) AC and more variety on breakfast and menus would get it to 5*.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I visited the hotel with my wife and our baby. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating to all our demands throughout our 5 day stay. The room was large clean and comfortable - included a good size patio. Wifi was great in most parts of the hotel. There are are several very decent restaurants and bars in the hotel including snack and breakfast bar. The hotel's location could not be more central 2 minutes walk from Jemaa el-Fnaa. This is a fantastic hotel for those wanting to stay in a luxury place in the heart of Marrakech!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lisa B-K wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: An oasis with high service levels and a fantastic rooftop restaurant..
Review_Text: Stayed here for seven nights and would like to particularly mention the warm welcome on arrival the much appreciated upgrade to a mini suite with garden views the excellent roof top Indian/Asian restaurant and the perfect pool. Everyone smiles here and appreciate it if you try to speak a little French. Would like to particularly mention the lady who serves poolside drinks - very gracious and attentive.    It's location is excellent and close to the main square and Koutoubia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Granted we stayed there in the off season but the rooms are fab the pool is magical and you cannot beat the location. The rooms were being redone and are likely finished and the room rates were incredible as it was July. We headed out early - rested in the heat - and shopped all evening and until midnight. The spa was .. interesting but is independently owned. The roof top pool was always quiet and the views are amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Amazing hotel in the middle of it all!
Review_Text: If you want an oasis in the middle of the Messina this is the perfect hotel. Great rooms. Very Moroccan. Amazing pools. Delicious food. It is VERY central. You step outside and within 2 minutes you're in the main square. Customer service is perfection here. They even upgraded our room upon arrival. Wifi is good enough (no where in Medina guarantees wifi but theirs is pretty close) to check emails and social media. Will for sure come back here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel there was nice and clean. Only thing put off was that the tour guides bug you once you step a foot outside and tell you not explore the suks on your own. Don't listen or pay them. Everyone was friendly there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel had amazing pools and a beautiful garden - and that was a pleasure. Unfortunately too many of the sun beds were broken and it was not always possible to get towels.  We were disappointed by the service and with the cleaning - most of the floor staff were disengaged in their work. Some not giving the guests attention. Others watching loud YouTube videos. The quality of food in the Indian restaurant were ok but the salat in the French were terrible - it was old and brown and should have been trashed and the chicken was red. Altogether Le Jardins de La Koutobia is a bit worn out. You don't get value for money.

Review_Date: Luis M wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: A good location does not give the 5 stars
Review_Text: I believe it was a very nice 5 star hotel in the past but not anymore. The location is great but service is not outstanding at all (they do only what is supposed to be done). The breakfast is really poor: the same everyday (old) plastic covers is something which does nlt correspond to a 5 star hotel.  The hotel really needs a renovation. Carpets are old and dirty .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Lots of great things about this hotel- lovely pool to relax in amazing location crepe and egg chefs for breakfast as well as a large selection of other things to eat large bedrooms and nice bar area and live music in the evening.  Staff could have been friendlier and more welcoming but in general very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil C wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Family day visit to us pool. Excellent. Well worth it
Review_Text: Spent a special day here to escape hot and busy Marrakech for a day.    Cost for 3 of us was 600 MAD for a day pass to the pool but well worth it. Call ahead before going since they will only have day visitors if they are not totoally full in order to keep pools at optimum for their hotel guests.    We had a misunderstanding when we arrived and paid. We were led past the pool in centre courtyard of hotel and inside. We thought we were being taken to the indoor spa pool.    We went back to reception and were able to get it all sorted..... they could not let us use court yard pool but were giving us access to roof top outdoor pool. Hotel treated us to mint tea after this misunderstanding cleared up.    This turned out to be better. Smaller pool but more private and some nice shade and good views of city.    We had lunch by the poolside which was excellent.    While day set us back 1000 MAD but pool and excellent lunch was really worth it. A totally relaxed day at poolside on a day of 45 Celsius in Marrakech

After a long transatlantic fight I was happy that I arranged for the hotel to have someone pick us up. The hotel is a short 15 minute drive from the airport which I greatly appreciated. I can’t lie when we initially pulled up to the hotel I was not impressed at all.
