The hotel is nestled in the middle of a city block that is lined with various shabby looking shops that are located right in the heart of Marrakesh right next to the Medina and the mosque which is a plus. I will admit that I was getting ready to be disappointed that is until you walk into the hotel lobby which I can sum up in one word BEAUTIFUL. The hotel was done up in lots of reds and very elegant. We were offered the traditional mint tea with tiny pastries as we waited to get checked in. Another nice touch was the cold scented hand towels that were given to wipe the heat and travel off NICE!!. After a wait of about 15 mins I was called to the front desk and surprised with a room upgrade HALLEJUAH!!!. We were taken up to our room which was spacious and had two twin beds with a living area that looked over the swimming pool. From our room we were able to get a panoramic view of the whole hotel and the mosque. The bathroom was beautiful and had a tub and shower separately the only problem was that our rainforest shower head didn’t work at all. Rather than complain we just used the detachable shower head    As English speakers it didn’t bother me that the staff assumed that we spoke French. We were able to communicate with them pretty easily using the little French I knew and the English that they knew so it was fine. The staff was very nice and accommodating and helped us get cabs when we needed to go somewhere. The hotel staff also helped with making sure that cab drivers didn’t take advantage of us by telling us how much the cab fare was to different places.    Food    The hotel offered buffet breakfast which offered your standard breakfast fare. It was decent    Amenities    The pool was very nice and clean and a good way to get away from the heat. Just remember to get there early every sun bed was always occupied as the saying goes “the early bird gets the worm” There is also poolside service for food and drinks which you could charge to the room.    The hotel had lots of rooms and areas in which to relax. There was a pool room computer room and various other rooms scattered throughout the property surrounding the pool area. There was also beautiful pictures of natives displayed in various times throughout the hotel which were beautiful.    Overall I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely come back as long as I have the same room (lol).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: All the personnel is very kind the hotel is extremely well located and it rewards you with it's wonderfull gardens and swimming pools (yes poolS) - when the 46degrees comes you can just hide under water.  The breakfast is kind of tricky when you are more than 2 because there are no available tables. The hotel rules allow one single person to take a table for 6 and some do it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Lovely classy place just by the medina
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel just by the Medina. Serene environment with a feel of old world class about it. The Piano bar and area around the pool is really lovely. Great drinks and staff are very attentive and fast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed with 4 kids we had a great time starting at reception with Mr. abbdellatif who was very professional nice and gave us good tips and good feeling  The rooms are very comfortable and big  The location of the hotel is perfect  We had a great time and already plan to return soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The highlight hotel of our vacation!
Review_Text: My friend and I spent 4 perfect days at this lovely hotel. We lived it up in our suite with our private outside patio. The decor was pleasant and we loved the plush bathrobes and rose touches. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. The location within the old city is perfect. Literally steps outside of the medina and souks though very quiet. The breakfast was good though after a few days with the exact same choices we got a bit bored with the food. Spent a few afternoons lounging by the pool taking a break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Well worth the cost.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This hotel is amazing can't fault in any way and that's why I keep going back to it. This was my 4th visit to this hotel as it's so good all the staff there are fantastic can't do enough for you.  This hotel is a Gem and the location is great too a throw away from Jemma El Fnna and about 20 min walk from the new part of Marrakesh. I am looking to book my next holiday there already my son and me had such a great time staying at this hotel it was like being at home with all the benefits at staying at a hotel. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making our stay so wonderful. Miss Fatima & Mohamed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed here for 1 week at £89 p/p per room. There was 5 people in my group and we had breakfast included. Breakfast was served form 6.30am until 10.30am. The crepes were amazing. The hotel staff were also pleasant and we got upgraded to the largest hotel rooms on the premises. The hotel is a 5 minute walk away from the main square the hotel has 3 pools. 1 main pool 1 pool in the spa and a roof top pool over looking the hotel and the Koutoubia mosque. The hotel has an indian restaurant an italian restaurant and also several bars 1 of which is open until around 1am. The drinks are fairly pricey - £4.50 for a bottle of Corona £8-£9 for a glass of wine. The rooms are cleaned well and we couldnt fault anything in the hotel. Its very tranquil and hotel staff make your stay comfortable. Thanks to everyone there for making our stay welcome. :) The wifi is pretty decent too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Got a great deal for this hotel on Amoma. It really is 5 star. Wonderful service from the staff and was upgraded for free to a mini suite.    Our room was decorated with rose petals each day after cleaning.    The pool is really beautiful and you can continue to use it even after closing because the staff are very accommodating. We were even able to get wine served to us at the pool at 9 pm with complementary pastatios and olives for the equivalent of 10 pounds with a tip.    The location is also amazing. 3 minute wall to the main square and Souks and a 2 minute walk to the main road opposite the old mosque and where the airport bus drops and picks up from. 3 euro return for the bus.    The hotel itself is an old merchants massive Riad which has been redone into a hotel by a French owner.    We tried the French restaurant and it was very nice and relaxing. Had a propper large dinner with wine for about 90 pounds.    Would stay here again if we came back. Great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: a fantastic Oasis by the noisy jemaa el fnaa
Review_Text: this is a large hotel with several pools (ground floor and rooftop) with a great atmosphere of tranquillity and relax.  There is a french meat restaurant which is excellent with a very nice garden where you can have your meal.    also the bar has good cocktails.

Review_Date: Cristina Campelo wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: I was upgraded to a suite
Review_Text: I arrived and was served tea and biscuits. Someone from the reception came to tell me that I my room would be ready in 30 minutes and that I had been upgraded to a suite. Nice! The suite was spotless with rose petals on my bed and in the bathroom. The hotel has two swimming pools. The one on the roof in only a tank although nice because it has sun all through the day. The main one looses the sun from 5H:30 PM onwards. Breakfast is very good at the level of a 5 star. A minus to this hotel is not having the public spaces with air conditioned.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Badly needed haven very near the medina
Review_Text: Excellent suite. . Facing the street but that didn't mAtter at all. Lots of space . Room beautifully pr epared every day. Don't get a shock when you arrive...once you get inside its lovely. Good exchange rate at reception. Nice swim pools . . So relaxing. Food is fine . No kettles in rooms. .generally excellent service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The gardens surrounding the tall tower Koutobia are nice. Well laid out rows and trees plants shrubs. Has a lot of seats for people to just sit and relax especially in the evenings and night time. Since this is June it's very hot during the day and I had to rush through because of heat.. would love to come back during winter times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A real Riad inside the Medina outside the hotel it is crowded and when you arrive you as yourself if you have booked the right hotel. Entering the front door and paradise opens nice swimming pool palm trees sun beds awesome restaurant and nice food. Friendly staff in the reception and nice rooms with huge bathroom. The hotel is very central and 2 min from the Jamaa el Fna square with street food and entertainment.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Very pleasant stay in a lovely place
Review_Text: The location of this place is perfect to visit Marrakech and all the main monuments. The hotel is beautiful and the staff took great care of us. The breakfast is excellent and the local cuisine is great. The service was well trained and very kind. The rooms are beautiful with a nice traditional touch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Nice place for a hotel do close to the main square. Nice bar around the pool and excellent Indian restaurant on the roof top highly recommended. Could just refresh a bit the facade/ entrance especially on this very small /dirty street not in line with the standard of the hotel

Review_Date: Sarah B wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Staying in a Riad we fancied a relaxing day at a pool. I believe you can come for the day for 200 dirhams we did a day rate of 790 which was £63 each this included a two course lovely lunch and hour massage in the Spa which I think is great valve. The Spa area is beautiful with an underground pool too!  Lovely pool area such comfy sundbeds and nice pool on the roof too with views of the mosque. All areas are sort of a colonial feel and the hotel is not too big. The gold sinks in the bathrooms were looked after all day with fresh flowers and red rose petals in and around the sinks. The staff were very friendly and we had good service delivered to our beds and freshly cut fruit offered to all guests for free by the pool. Sometimes things are slower during Ramadan but we were not disappointed.    We did a trip to the Sofitel too but I preferred this hotel as far better service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: To take it upfront - we talk about a hotel decorated with 5-stars - the benchmark:    Checkin & Bar service were polite prompt and professional - Shukran!    To us THUS IS THE PLACE TO BE AT Marrakech:  Style of a Ryad but a bit larger.  Centrally located between Mosque Koutoubia and Place Jemaa-el-Fna - perfect.    Nicely decorated rooms - showerheads could be better taken care of as well as sinks stinked a bit even after flushing water.    Great pool (~20 m) at the patio with several sunbeds. Pool service for beverages and food? Failure - you have to search for them then they come with no motivation and no order within a week was delivered in full - always something missed.    Breakfast is served under the romantic arcades of the patio as well as inside. Offer is good as you may expect in a 5-star hotel.  Service - sorry which service? Asking 2 - 3 times to get all plates forks knifes and coffee on the table?  Chatting staff but tables are not cleaned... still chatting and we return from buffet with next plate - the old one's were still there - best we did was a stack of 4 plates. We didn't dare to complain as usually guest is kept responsible and we didn't want to hear "you should not have gone four time to buffet" or "re-use the 1st plate so it doesn't stack on table".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a super hotel we are 3mature ladies on our annual jaunt first time in Marrakech we arrive tired from the airport arrival not good ! Entered this oasis of peace and charm wonderful check in and very welcome mint tea .quickly shown to our two lovely mini suites 152 & 153 mini suites seem to be in pairs down a small flight of steps we were opposite the lift. Rooms so clean and well presented excellent bathrooms desperate wc and full of thoughtful touches rose petals and plenty of toiletries . Spacious terrace with full size lounges and two mini couches.  All the staff we encountered were so friendly helpful and professional. Excellent choice of food at breakfast especially the egg station overseen by a most charming lady .this hotel is very clean and pays attention to your every need  3fabulous pools my only concern was as having arthritis I needed my friends help in and out of the pools however they are planning to install much needed hand rails for better access.we spent many happy comfortable hours by the top pool well looked after by the excellent staff bringing cold drinks. We ate at the realism de Paris restaurant once the food was good although the service not quite as good as at other areas of the hotel.  To sum up this hotel has oriental charm great rooms super staff and feels so calm and serene after the bustle of Marrakech. I thoroughly recommend it to all ages especially women on their own we at all times felt safe and secure not that we had any problems in Marrakech whose people were friendly and welcoming.choose le jardins for a upmarket well run break in the sun thank you to all management and staff
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Best location if you wanna stay in the old city!
Review_Text: The location for this hotel was just perfect - just a minute's walk away from the markets and a very short walk from the mosque. Upon arrival we were given complimentary tea and sweet snacks which we found very welcoming. The hotel itself was lush from the rooms to the lobby to the outdoor pools. It was lovely to arrive in my room and find the bed and bathroom had been decorated with rose petals!!! What a lovely touch. The staff were also very hospitable and lovely. The Indian restaurant on the roof is definitely worth trying. Though breakfast choices were limited the fresh pancakes/crepes were gorgeous! Overall I would recommend this hotel to anybody :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Suraiya Z wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Our trip to Marrakech was made special by this hotel. Nothing was ever too much trouble for the staff who were polite and thoughtful. Everything was so beautiful. The decor wass tasteful and the heated pools were a bonus to use in the day time when the temperature would reach 23 degrees. Would definately come again. The spa facilties were good and reasonably priced. We travelled with our 3 year old and the staff were super friendly.  We walked everywhere and is close to the mosque and markets. Breakast was good with plenty of choice. We tried out the indian resturant - it was authentic and very tasty and reasonably priced.  We also tried out the tagine in Cafe KifKaf and it was lovely and is literally round the corner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Best part of this hotel is the location. A one minute walk to the square and medina. You are right in the heart of everything. Rooms are traditional and very nice. The breakfast is average. Roof top pool is one of the best in Marrakech.    The only frustrating thing is with the internet. You need to put in t he password every time when the ipd locks and returning to hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: pat c wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Luxury hotel in city centre if that's what you want
Review_Text: Great location superb setting and great staff. Indian restaurant on the roof terrace was excellent but in Marrakech. The place to be if you don't want be immersed in the local colour and noise. Could be anywhere in the world
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rog J wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Great atmosphere hotel and excellent Indian restaurant on the roof. Affords superb evening views of medina sunsets and the koutoubia. Serves Casablanca beer ..very nice. Staff helpful and speak English.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For my first visit in Marrakech I wanted to have a nice "riad style" hotel and after a friend's suggestion I spent a weekend in this hotel. The hotel is in a tiny little road very close to the Koutoubia (symbol of Marrakech) and it is very hidden just at the end of this typical noisy street. When you will find it ....just open the doors and then.......Magic!!!  You will find yourself in a peaceful and English-Moroccan-Indian style lobby full of charme welcomed by the personnel that will take care of you from now on. My room was on the inner side very calm and well prepared. Only problem for me is that the curtains are not dark enough and so I was waked up at 6h30 in the morning by the sun and singing birds...nice...but not if you are a sleepy bear like me...  The swimming pool on the roof is just fantastic flowers everywhere stunning view peace and sun !  Restaurant at the pool is nice but not with the same level of mistery and character of the rest of the hotel. Food is average to my taste I was expecting much better standards. Price for wines food and beverage very honest. Breakfast is room downstairs is just great food quality high you have to try the Moroccans crepes! (I had 5 of them...). The bar is also great the barman is very skilled nice mojito and again a lot of atmosphere you can play piano if you want! . In conclusion great hotel full of charme old and authentic with a real soul. I am a bit severe I hope it will be taken as a push to do better but I will give only 4 stars because of the food in the top restaurant and the curtains in the room not ok for a luxury hotel like this but I am sure I will come here again I have enjoyed every second of my weekend! Congratulations to you and your very kind and professional personnels
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Kind staff bedroom : beautiful and modern decoration lot of space and storage. Idem with bathroom.  overall decoration and impression is superb mix of Morocco way of life and european one.  Very nice restaurants and great breakfast buffet big swimming pool on the ground floor a 2nd swimming-pool with warm water on the roof top.  A garden surrounds the biggest swimming-poll provides really nice place to drink cocktails. And the SPA is amazing.  Two drawback : no internet connection during our stay (but it obliges us to rest and connect when we were in other place) and some very bad-mannered children who were screaming shouting around the pool (roof top one). And when I say that ... I am a mother I can understand how children can be exited by swimming-pool but here it was insupportable. But Hotel is not responsible parents are ...  So overall in this hotel you are leaving near paradise close to every thing of charming Marrakech: I highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane Y wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Friendly and Helpful team of staff
Review_Text: The reception staff are amazing and so helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. A special thank you to Abdul. The restaurants are all very good and again the waiters are so helpful. The gardens are pristine the pools so clean and the wardrobe space is enormous. Location is very central and easy to get around the Medina on foot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: layla a wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Liked the garden .the location .WiFi excellent  staff v. helpful.gave me an upgrade to a minisuite. Professional and friendly especially abdulatif at reception.  Breakfast good but can have more variety  Housekeeping need to pay attention to the no disturb sign .  Corridor carpet is old and smelly.needs cleaning and some air freshener in the hallways will be nice  Had wonderful time and beutiful memories
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Lovely immaculate hotel beautiful deco attention to detail is superb.    Very friendly and helpful staff.    This is what a proper 5* should be like.    The hotel bar situated at the next to the lobby also has a great selection of drinks and snacks and a great view of the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Annie P wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: What a lovely peaceful oasis in the bustle of Marrakech!  Really interesting to learn of the history and see the old photos. Well worth a visit to just take a bit of time out. We had a tour guide but very easy to do yourself: There is good information there.

Review_Date: Debra K wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Peaceful retreat in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: We stayed at the Koutoubia for 3 nights just prior to Easter and the hotel and staff were just delightful. As we pulled up to the entrance we were slightly concerned at the proximity to the busy streets which were noisy with traffic everywhere - the taxi driver could barely squeeze around to the entrance - however as soon as we stepped into the hotel all of the bustle from outside disappears and it is quiet and tranquil. We were checked in very quickly but our room was not available for another 30 minutes so we were shown to the terrace and served a lovely warm mint tea. When we went back to reception for our room allocation we were advised that our mini suite had been upgraded to a Junior and 'one of the best in the hotel' - nice! We were shown round to the room which was in a garden area of the hotel close to the patio area of the fish restaurant. The room was amazing it had an enormous bedroom and bed separate lounge area huge bathroom and a steam room and a small patio outside with table and chairs. The bed was scattered with rose leaves - and this continued on every night of our stay in various designs - such a nice touch! The room had a full size hairdryer toiletries a safe and mini bar - usual prices for drinks from there. The hotel areas are nicely looked after clean and very attractive with little nooks and rest areas everywhere. There are two pools one on the roof close to the Indian restaurant and one on the ground floor near to reception. There are a number of sunbeds in both areas with towels provided. We sampled all but one of the restaurants during our stay (we braved the fascinating chaos and atmosphere of the food stalls on our third night instead of the fish restaurant on site). The Moroccan Restaurant served traditional food such as tagines in both meat and fish versions which was great for my non meat eating husband. The snack bar for lunch time which had a variety of club sandwiches and salads available and the Indian Restaurant on another evening serving a variety of meat and fish dishes though we both enjoyed our meal here it was not overly remarkable. Service in all three locations was first class. We also had drinks one evening just outside the piano bar which had a mix of recorded music playing along with live piano sessions. Breakfast is served in the Moroccan restaurant each day until 1030 and there is plenty of choice for everyone. Hot selections fruit pastries and cakes as well as crepes and pancakes cooked freshly at a food station. The location of the hotel is great - a stones throw from the beautiful Koutoubia tower which serves as a useful compass reference point no matter where you are in the medina! You are also very close to the main square literally 5 or 6 minutes walk away and therefore all of the souks. We walked to lots of the city's museums landmarks and gardens from the hotel including the Saadian Tombs Marrakech Musuem Bahia Palace and Majorelle Gardens. There are lots of taxis around and horse drawn carriages if you choose not to keep your steps up! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for a stay in Marrakech. The staff here are so polite and go out of their way to help and offer great service everyone from people tending the gardens to the staff at the reception and entrance greet you with 'bonjour'/'bon soir' and it really creates a great welcoming feel.

Review_Title: The Perfect Place to Stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed here with my husband for four days after a kiteborading trip to Dakhla. Koutoubia was so perfect we didn't leave the ground for 36 hours. The room was lovely the bed comfortable and the patio in our room magical. We loved the heated rooftop pool + deck and the Indian restaurant that served up there was delicious. We also loved all the perfect nooks and crannies to relax work and be transported back to a simpler time. Also the breakfast buffet was the best I've ever had (normally I avoid buffets at all costs and I still dream about this one a week later).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roar Maagaard wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: A very good and central choice in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed for five days in this very nice hotel. It has the absolute perfect location in Marrakech and beforehand we were afraid of potential noice from the street and from the big mosque. We had one of the cheaper rooms facing the exterior - but there were no noise from the street at all - very calm stay! Rooms are spacious 2 toilets good bathroom with both shower and tub. Beds were large - but here is the first point for possible improvement: beds are too hard - so put a 8 cm soft top mattress on top of it and the bed would be perfect. The second point is: start moving towards a smoke free hotel by making th big majority og rooms for non-smokers. This is how things will move - so start doing it now.  The two pool areas in the garden and on the roof are both perfect.  Buffet breakfast could not be better.  This is a 5 star hotel - and it would get 5 stars from me too if they worked on my 2 points.  We would recommend this place to our best friends - and come again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Am here with my husband for a week break and it is just perfect - we love this hotel and will definitely be returning. Charming staff wonderful rooms stunning pool area all in all a ten out of ten X
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a Riad in the true sense of the word: a dwelling around a courtyard that you cannot see from the street so as not to show the wealth of the inhabitants.    When we arrived in our taxi from the airport I thought: "is that all- for that price?"...    But that was the last time I EVER entertained that notion- for I saw the inside...    The hotel has three pools (one inside the Hammam) three restaurants (Moroccan Indian and French/European a snackbar a piano bar a hamman/beauty salon views from the top floor free WiFi roomservice and on & on...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is probably one of the best hotels I have been to. GORGEOUS rooms very spacey modern refined impeccable service (and that's difficult to say when you are with a 1 year old baby). The premises were out of a fairy tale great breakfast with a lot of choice by the beautiful pool... It's just fabulous!!!  Only mayhem was finding the small street leading to the hotel - right by Jamaa El Fna - all while driving in chaotic traffic (it's right by the pedestrian street with horse carriages/Koutchi parking). Once you have found it the 1st time it's easy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tracy K wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We went as a group of friend for lunch here prior to going through the souks as it is close by. It was a stunning spot and the food and service was top notch.  Would definitely go back again. Looks like a beautiful place to stay as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Elin R wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: We bought a day pass to enjoy the hot day by the pool. The day pass was 200 dirham per person which didn't include any drinks or food. The pool area was nice and the offered towels for us. We had a lunch in the Indian restaurant where the service was slow and poor. The location was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very well located really near of the amazing sigh points in Marrakesh.  Very good services great food and apartment. Really stylish hotel. It's a must in this city. I enjoyed there for tree days and fall in love !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: The hotel as many previous reviewers have said is a surprise package. First impressions are of a busy street of cars hand carts motor cycles and people but when you step through the hotel entrance you are greeted by calm and tranquillity and very welcoming staff. To think 4 hours ago you have left the midlands of England and have arrived in such a fascinating place - so different yet so welcoming.    The rooms are spacious overlooking the central pool area. Although only a few metres from a noisy busy road on the roof of the hotel by the smaller pool you can hear no street noise only the calls from the mosques for the faithful
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Another visit to this magical hotel and will return
Review_Text: After a wonderful night in a yurt at the foot of Atlas we returned to this hotel for 4 nights.  This is the 6th time we've stayed at this hotel (the only hotel we repeat visit) we were not disappointed. The location just outside the mad square with the Koutoubia mosque in view from the rootop pool and the magical call to prayer makes this hotel special. Brilliant service from all staff fantastic breakfast and Indian restaurant super (shame it the rooftop restaurant had recently burnt down - it was still running though am sure it will be rebuilt quickly) Personal thanks for great service to Abdessadeq Khanjari Head of Reception and Abdel Bari Bar Manager. We'll be back! From the Sellins Family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Beautifully designed hotel with wonderful rooms and pool. We stayed two nights and were kept awake both nights until after midnight with the music and singer in the piano bar. To management please either close the door to the piano bar or play music a bit quieter after 11.00pm. The prayers from the mosques in ther middle of the night also kept us awake but as this is a muslim country that is to be expected. Breakfast ( especially the olive bread) was delicious. I agree with other reviewers that the lady making the crepes in the breakfast room does look extremely unhappy but she is friendly enough when you order a crepe from her. Would highly recommend the food in the Indian restaurant Les Jardins de Bala. The food and service in the restaurant Relais de Paris was terrible. The fish we received was uncooked and had to be returned twice and the waitresses were more interested at checking their makeup in the mirrors than attending to guests. The bill then took nearly half an hour to appear due to "technical problems" Reception staff were friendly and efficient. Be careful of the men standing directly in front of the hotel who tell you that they work at the hotel have some free time and can show you around Marrakech. They are just after your money. Taxi to and from the airport should not cost more than 10 euros. All in all I would recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 days over the Marathon weekend. This boutique hotel is perfectly positioned just around the corner from the main square. It lacks the polish of a 5 star European hotel but this is more than compensated by the Moroccan experience. Recommend the rooms overlooking the pool as larger than the standard rooms. Liked the opportunity to use two pools - the view of the snow covered Atlas Mountains from the top pool was lovely. Had great massage and Hamman. Sabah on reception was charming and very helpful. Only downside the wine in the bar was expensive and not very chilled. Nice nibbles though!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great location, great service, wonderful perfume!
Review_Text: Very good location so close to the main square but peaceful and easy to find just looked for the landmark tower and could get home no matter how lost I though I was. Room was upgraded and was lovely well decorated (super old black and white photo art) huge balcony large comfortable sofa fridge fresh fruit daily new rose petals on the bed and robes and slippers with both a large shower and a bathtub. Almost my favourite feature was the scent used throughout the hotel in the elevators and restrooms it was addictive. The rooftop Indian restaurant is excellent lunchtime grilled food there delicious the main bar is cosy and friendly and is perfect spot to end the night. The local rose wine served there (with pistachio nuts and olives) and on the rooftop poolside is refreshing and delicious and affordable. For a fancier night out also enjoyed the French restaurant. I loved the breakfast would agree with some others that the lady making the omelettes most days was a little grumpy but they were yummy as was the large selection of hot and cold meats fruits and cheese and the most delicious yoghurt I've ever tasted and I really really don't like yoghurt normally! Overall I found Marrakech delightful safe friendly. I only felt slightly out of place once in the main square late at night when it was a distinctly all male atmosphere but rest of the time was relaxing particularly enjoyed Sunday evening which seemed to be many local families out for a walk and dinner like the passeggiata. I had two great day trips to the Ouzoud waterfalls and will never forget crossing the Atlas Mountains just stunning. Helps to know French as seems to be default language.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lena L wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: Perfect for a weekend in Marrakech. Right outside the medina and the big square this is the most amazing quiet oasis to relax and enjoy the vacation. Rooms are truly beautiful (I wish I could buy the furniture) and you definitely feel like you are in a fairytale. Amazing stay! Highly recommended! Rooftop pool is the best kept secret!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had never been before and would go back. Staff are amazing so happy and helpful. Hotel is great. Fantastic location for getting everywhere and easy to find! You will know what I mean if you have been to Marra before!!!!! Indian restaurant in hotel definitely worth a visit. I can honestly say the best I have tasted. Hotel bar is friendly and the staff know what you want after first night and bring your drinks over. Nothing is too much trouble for anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis close to the hustle and bustle of the Medina, Jamaa el Fna Square, Koutoubia Gardens and Mosque.
Review_Text: The suites are located in a peaceful setting a few minutes walk away from the main hotel. Our 'Mini-Suite' overlooked a verdant courtyard garden with views from our private balcony terrace towards the Koutoubia Mosque. This became a sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle dust and heat of the Medina and Kasbah. The buffet breakfast was varied had a broad selection of European and Moroccan dishes and set us up for each day ahead. When we walked around the hotel we felt we were living in a different time and cocktails in the Piano Bar were a splendid way to end a busy but satisfying day. For two days we hired a private guide via the hotel reception. Each day we planned what we wanted to see and were not disappointed at the additional sites we were taken to. Dinner at the hotel's Moroccan restaurant was good (700MAD for 2 peoples - drinks. starter and main course) though dinner at the Indian restaurant was a disappointment - dishes lacked taste were served luke warm and were almost inedible (650MAD) . The only irritation to flag to other guests of La Koutoubia are the cost of taxi's. As with other international cities the taxi's are abundant in Marrakesh licenced metred and easy to hail However should you ask for a taxi via a hotel porter / doorman then you will find the taxi is either for private hire or the metre is switched off at which point the fare rockets from 20-40 MADs to 200 MADS. Just a minor irritation but something to be aware of. Would we return? Difficult to say as there are some splendid luxury Hotels and Riad's to try another time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best hotel ever and forever
Review_Text: Love the hotel the staff and the roons with patio view is my Second time here and I will be stay again insshala  the manager MRs Roukaya is the best Oh my god love all The spa is wonderful And the Hamman is the best
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful location, beautiful hotel, a few inconsistencies
Review_Text: Hotel is fantastically centrally located with great views including the Koutoubia Mosque. Room was traditional if not a bit dated and overlooked the road outside which was noisy on occasions but benefitted from a small outside terrace. The main pool was excellent and we very much enjoyed relaxing with a beer overlooking the pool courtyard of an evening. The upstairs pool was delightfully quiet but too many chemicals in the water. The spa was also excellent. There was too much inconsistency between service / quality between different parts of the hotel. We thought the bar / indian restaurant service and food was great. Breakfast was poor the food itself was fine but tables were often left uncleared and on a number of occasions there were several tables available when we arrived but none cleared and gaining the attention of staff difficult. The concierge was really helpful with dinner reservations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Situated next to the frantic heart of the city and an ideal base for visitors.  Naturally its an old building but the facilities are more than adequate and include 3 swimming pools. One pool is roof top so one minute you can be lost in the souks and five minutes later relaxing next to the roof top pool viewing the Atlas mountains and being plied with refreshments.  Rooms are large and modernised breakfast is plentiful and there is a choice of restaurants in the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Wonderful hotel in Marrakesh center nice place to relax and enjoy good food and music. Close to the market and other central sites. Perfect place to relax and enjoy typical food from the region. A real 5 star hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Alina K wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Stayed at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia for five nights.    We had a nice but not really warm welcome. I would have expected more information about the hotel its three restaurants the SPA and also some tourist-relevant information.  Anyway we got an upgrade and thus view to the court yard / pool.  Room is really nice clean and covers every need one might have. On top its really calm which we highly appreciated after having spent time in the bustling souks during the day.    The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to stay very close to the medina and its also just next to the famous mosque la Koutoubia.    Unfortunately we did not have a five star experience at Jardins de la Koutoubia. The common rooms and also some of the restaurants were very cold during our stay. I admit we were there during winter time but especially common rooms should be heated.    Breakfast was very disappointing. Every day the same boiled eggs white bread sweets small selection of fruits and unhappy faces from the staff. One would think that the staff would wish a good morning when entering the breakfast room - but no - thats not gonna happen. Omelettes and Crepes are freshly prepared but also at those stations staff is really unfriendly almost rude. On the food markets in Marrakesh you can find all sorts of fruits avocados etc but unfortunately they don't make their way to the breakfast at Jardins de la Koutoubia.    There is several cats living at the hotel. Even though I like cats I don't necessarily need them lying! on the chairs / sofas where I am having my breakfast. I found that really unhygienic and don't really know how guests with allergies cope with the cats in the hotel.    Due to the poor breakfast and mostly unfriendly staff I would have given the hotel 4 stars but unfortunately we had quite a bad experience during our stay. On our second last night some guests above our room played extremely loud music at 1am. After 30 minutes we called the reception. Only 1 hour later staff managed to make those guests turn off the extremely loud arabic hip hop kind of music - first they didn't want to believe us that the music came from within the hotel. The guests in the room above us turned off the music but didn't stop screaming and shouting and jumping. Then at around 6am again - loud music etc. After all we had a sleepless night and complained at the reception about that. The only answer we got was: "Some guests are not well educated. We cannot do more than ask them to be silent". Well to be honest - yes a hotel can never know what their guests will be doing but can make up for such a night towards other guests. No matter if a voucher for the SPA a massage or pastries - in such a case it would be the hotel's duty to make guests happy again - but no one cared about our sleepless night during our vacation.    So imagine you are allergic to cats or something unexpected happens - don't expect this hotel to take care of you or your needs.    For the ones coming for business or also the social media addicts - internet connection is quite poor and only at night you can have a proper connection.    It's a real pity that guests are not treated as such as the hotel and amenities itself are very very nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tyra R wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: This hotel was a hidden beauty! At first when we pulled up outside the hustle and bustle area right near the Jamaa Al Fanaa we were a bit concerned but once we entered the hotel we were awed. The service straightaway was lovely they even had the hotel manager walk us around the hotel for a tour whilst they got our room ready. The decor is fabulous and it's very well maintained. Rooms are plush and extremely comfortable balcony was huge for even our standard room! Staff were over attentive even if you were walking by they would smile and greet you room service were always on point with our orders. We had lovely evening at the bar with customers singing with the gentleman playing piano. Great atmosphere the staff are an asset to this hotel. Only bad thing was the Indian restaurant at the hotel we looked forward to didn't taste very Indian at all! But that's expected considering the staff were Moroccan! It was apparently the only Indian restaurant in the area so disappointing for those of us who can't get any spicy food elsewhere! However that is a minor detail as they did other cuisines that were delicious and their buffet breakfast was very tasty. I would most definitely stay here again. Quite romantic setting so next time will go with my husband!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Excellent location with impeccable service. Would definitely stay here again. We were upgraded to a suite which was very nice. They reception was also quite helpful in making dinner reservations for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The room was huge with a terrace lots of place to store stuff great shower good breakfast. Rooms prepared a little "over" with rose petals all over but we felt welcome. Just behind the mosque we could here it in the morning wich was a plus.  very close to the soukh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We have stayed at this hotel several times we just spent a week there over New-Year. The hotel was as usual marvelous the organisation for the new-year eve party was amazing. All and I mean all the personnel are friendly and extremely efficient. Thank you for the lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Leo C wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: My friends and I came in and we're allowed straight in we felt very under dressed as it was quite fancy! But we were sat down straight away and brought a list of amazing cocktails! We had lots of reasonably priced drinks and even got to sit next to the pool! I'd go back if I'm ever in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Rooftop terrace is a great place for a refreshing drink or light lunch after a visit to the Khoutubia mosque
Review_Text: A little tricky to find this place but it is worth seeking out. Haven of peace on top of the hotel. Small pool if you want to chill out. Alcoholic drinks. Local and international menu. Shade or full sun. A nice place to while away a few hours in the heat or shade.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a find. The Location could. Or be better. Two minutes walk from the main square and three minutes from the main souk entrances.    Great staff. Very very good rooms. What makes it even better are two fantastic surprises. Firstly the roof top pool and bar. Simply unique and sensational. Secondly the cheeky fun and very unexpected Indian restaurant. Amazing.    Elsewhere the bars are great the music bit too much and very welcoming the staff perfect and the food excellent.    I rarely give 5 stars - but in this case very well earned and deserved. A great hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely serene place in the middle of the medina
Review_Text: For the first time being in Marrekech the city can be quit overwhelming. Luckily we've chosen to stay in Les Jardins De La Koutoubia. When you step out of the hotel you'll get to experience a crowded colourfull impressive city. This is enjoyable when a hotel in the middle of the medina enables you to have a quit place as well. We were booked on to a garden suite(situated on one of the hotels patio-gardens) which was spacious and had its own covered garden. Even though you're just a couple of minuts away from the Koutoubia mosque the hotel with its serveral patio's is very serene. The rooms are build and decorated in Marrocan style.  If you'd like to visit Marrakech make sure you're a good negociator. In contrast to the Western part of Europe where we're from it's very common to negociate about amost everyting in Marroco.  Recommendations: take a trip to the Atlas mountains make sure you'll speak some French.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: .....away from the madness in the Medina!  Marrakech is an eye opener and definitely a very different travel experience than I've experienced before.  This hotel is serene peaceful and has a very laid back feel to it. Our suite was very spacious and very well presented with a balcony overlooking the pool. The bathroom is huge and the shower is massive! We had a very comfortable stay.  The buffet breakfast is good but selection is very limited and nothing in comparison to the food spread offered in most western and Asian hotels but it is good nevertheless especially the crepes and pancakes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spotted this hotel 4years ago while staying at The Nourra Barriere which is just outside The Medina. This is a beautiful old hotel with so much character. All the staff are so nice and nothing is too much trouble. The roof-top hotel is a peaceful oasis with stunning views over to La Koutoubia Mosque. The food is first class and the husband and wife team who run the Indian Restaurant are to be congratulated on the standard of the food and the ambiance they provide. The French Restaurant is also of a very high standard. Breakfasts were excellent. Rooms are lovely and the standard of cleaning is very good. A beautiful oasis on the edge of one of the most fascinating squares in the world
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for a couple of days in January. Weather was slightly chilly during the evenings but the hotel provided a fire outside which me and my husband would sit round. The hotel had a nice pool heated pool at the top which we used. Also has a nice Indian restaurant on the roof top terrace and I would recommend a visit to this also. Even if your not staying at the hotel. All in all a lovely stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Louise B wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Private elegant hotel in the middle of everything
Review_Text: Having never been to Marrakesh before let alone stayed right in the centre of things I read many reviews of this hotel and wondered how it would provide such an oasis of calm but we arrived and found it did! The staff were very helpful in arranging transfers for us from the airport and we were welcomed with mint tea and pastries as soon as we arrived. The patio rooms look out over the central quad which has a beautiful pool and lush vegetation. The hotel is wonderfully decorated lots of Moorish detail there are roses and rose petals everywhere! We felt so enclosed there in the best way; when we wanted to head out the hotel staff were very helpful and when we wanted to stay put there were lots of areas to sit. The rooftop pool was a real treat very private easy to come and go plenty of space. The hotel has many places to stop and enjoy the view every corner has been thought-though. The restaurants were a high standard gracious service the Indian the best. In parts the decor could do with updating but honestly this does not detract from the feel of the place. We will certainly return a complete success.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anthony C wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Smashing hotel right by the Medina. All staff very friendly and helpful. Food in the restaurants was lovely. Large room with sofa and comfortable bed. Only downside was free wifi which was not great but we were on holiday so not a drama

Review_Title: Wonderful hotel in the hubbub of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel is an absolute oasis in the center of Marrakesh. We have visited it before and were keen to return. We had dinner in the Moroccan restaurant accompanied by two drum players and singers and then a short burst from a belly dancer. Apparently there is a wonderful Indian restaurant on the roof which we didn't know until our last evening! We also ate at the restaurant at the side of the pool more than a snack bar wonderful salad here. The staff are wonderfully attentive and I would be happy to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: JULIAN M wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: It's is beyond me why people om TA can find fault with this wonderful hotel. Rooms are spacious and spotless and staff are polite and efficient. The public areas are calm and peaceful and the pool areas clean tidy and not overcrowded. Location... What more can you say 100yds from.the madness if the medina which yiu leave the moment you walk through the front door. Hotel restraunts are first class. Indian as good as any in the world French restraunt is lovely in a fabulous settington with well cooked dishes. Morrocan resytaunt all I can say is go hungry and enjoy the tagine. The beef is soo tender. 4th vist in and just booked for next year. Well you can't improve on perfection so why look
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Aine P wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Stayed here from a recommendation from a family member and was so glad we did.  We were only staying in Marrakech for 3 days so it was brilliant for coming and going. It's not much from the outside as you suddenly come across it on a very very busy street....but once you step inside its like a complete transformation.  So tranquil and very pleasant. Beautiful room...we had a suite which was worth getting . There was good choice of food if you wanted to eat in hotel and breakfast had a good variety also.  Very very close to main squareJemaa-el-Fnaa....so brilliant to go to and fro.  We asked reception to organise a guide for us which I would totally recommend. He took us on a walking tour to get us our bearings. It's a little daunting walking around as its so manic etc...so it was great to not have to worry as our guide basically looked after us. He was very handy if wanted to buy anything as a lot of people would get ripped off by sellers if you didn't haggle proper so he was great for advice on price etc.He saved us on spending €20 on a short taxi ride and got it for us for €4 instead!  He wasn't intrusive or anything and you didn't have to make conversation...he would just walk ahead of you and take you where u wanted. Well worth it and the guides are very reasonable.  The hotel also has a beautiful big pool but gets cool as sun goes off it...otherwise they have a smaller one on rooftop which gets the sun all day. Gets a bit crowded but it's lovely with view of the mosque.  All in all...I would definitely recommend staying here....clean stylish central nice food. Very pleasant stay...👍
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sara F wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We actually stayed elsewhere but we really fancied a spa day and lunch. The hotel is no doubt utterly beautiful on the surface and I would expect a lot from the reviews I have read. We paid to use the hammam and pool which turned out not to include the outside pool which we were very disappointed with. The shower in the spa was broken and the plastic flip flops we had to wear made all the floors exceedingly slippery both my husband and I nearly fell on multiple occasions!! Once we found out our €40 didn't include both pools we decided to venture above ground and see what we could get for lunch and maybe how much we had to pay to use the outside pool. Unfortunately when we looked in the pool it was filthy with floating "bits" and the floor of the pool was grubby. Suffice to say we went for lunch elsewhere and were very underwhelmed with the whole experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Grand, modern hotel within walking distance of medina sights
Review_Text: This hotel with its lovely courtyard and elegantly furnished rooms is a great place to stay in Marrakech. Expensive but worth it. We enjoyed breakfast on the ground floor where some ate outside in the garden. We also had dinner at the international restaurant in the garden. The staff were very helpful especially given how large the hotel is and how many people were staying there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Laila G wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: A beautiful hotel. Excellent service the breakfast was amazing and the service was so good. Just so peaceful even though it's in the medina. The rooftop pool was so nice. Very close to everything😊 The staff is always willing to help you with whatever you need.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Andrew M wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel for 6 nights.    Firstly this is an excellent hotel in terms of location and amenities. I have travelled to marrakech a few times and i was surprised at how this hotel was so close to the medina and yet once inside the hotel it felt like you were in peace and tranquility. Whilst I know there are better hotels in Marrakech in terms of value for money location amenities and quality of service this is a winner.    We stayed in a city facing suite which was impressive and yet slightly dated although this is extremely common in marrakech. Veiw was not that nice however that fault is due to Marrakech as a whole rather than the hotel. Bedding was clean and rooms were ample in size. I really loved the large marble bathroom with a rainfall shower. Rooms were clean and bedding very comfortable.    Food wise breakfast is good though self sevice buffet. Large selection of fruit nuts etc and the usual omelette bar. The hotels restaurant's are good although we did not try the moroccan one as I knew quite a few other places in marrakech. We ended up eating twice at the indian/thai restaurant and once at the french. All in all food is good quality and filling however the only dish i was not inpressed with was a the chicken satay but thats was purely due to what i was used to and not the quality. Staff were very accomodating and freindly. Both restaurants are quite romantic.    The hotel has two outdoor pools and one indoor pool in the spa area. I was quite impressed with the size of the pools especially with the central location of the hotel. We spent most of out time by the terrace pool which had food and drink service (I would reccomend their club sanwich very tasty and filling) the indoor pool is in the spa area and heated. I cannot say how amazing it looks.    The fitness area is large however very few machines other than cardio. Would be better off swimming in the pool. But thats the story for nearly every hotel.    Overall staff were very friendly and accomodating. They were always there to help and never asked for tips. The hotel whilst stightly old fashioned has a great location and feel to it. I would definitely reccoment this hotel and would stay here again. I have given it four as a realistic rating as if you were to spend 3 or 4 times more you could stay in a better hotel. However that would not be sensible for most.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a fantastic hotel. Located in the old town of Marrakech 3 minutes walk from the main square. First impressions are how grand it is and it doesn't disappoint. Greeted with tea (traditionally very sweet) and room upgrade. The suit was lovely and spacious with rose petals on the bed every day. Staff will help you however they can (not all speak english). Lovely pools bar & restaurants. Can also treat yourself to a lovely day in the spa (costs extra but reasonable). Mainly adults there but i feel children would be welcome. An oasus of calm in a manic colourful part of the city
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As a budget traveller it is well outwith my pocket to stay here. However it is well within my pocket to eat here. Excellent Indian restaurant on roof terrace. Mains 100dh. Good food. Many side dishes Wine for 200dh. Attentive staff. Beautiful location.  If you come for lunch you can use the pool all afternoon.  Don't be put off by the grand interior. Ask to have a look around. You won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: One hundred and one night kind of hotel 💕
Review_Text: Stayed there for 4 nights got the "koutoubia" suite.  Clean hotel very good staff and so friendly there's 3 pools I tried theme all and it was great.  The breakfast is sooo god and original a mix of orientale and occidental buffet (must tray the fresh bagrir crêpe mesaman and eggs)  Can't even describe the spa the staff are so compétents and not expensive I've done the 45 hamam+ 1h massage of hot oil for a 100€  The suit was to clean and well organized cost 130/night  Maybe a little bit expensive but it's absolutely worth it cause we had our own terrasse that leads directly to one of the pools it's aTow steps of alfena and old city of Marrakech.  The deco of the hotel Makes you imagine the hundred and one night .  Defiantly going back to this great hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location, nice property, but bad wifi
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here three nights. The hotel probably has the best location in all of Marrakech with a great view of Koutoubia Mosque and a very short walk to the main square. The rooms and two pool areas are vey nice. The Indian restaurant is excellent while the Italian one is ok but had a great dessert. My wife enjoyed the spa.    We were promptly upgraded upon arriving but for our first first room the AC wasn't working. However they did move us fairly quickly.    The first two days the wifi didn't work in our room (only in the common areas) while the last day it did work. Overall the wifi was a bit slow. The only other con was that you can't take a very long shower or it will start to flood the bathroom.    Overall a very good hotel that needs a few fixes to be absolutely great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect location, lovely views from roof top pool
Review_Text: We visited a few hotels in Marrakech. Les Jardins de La Koutoubia is in our estimation the best choice.  The staff are very professional kind hardworking and offer service with attention to detail  The roof top pool offers beautiful sunset views of city minaret and High Atlas Mountains  The hotel interior design is gorgeous in authentic plaster wood and mosaic tile. We just couldn't get enough of all the beauty walking the hotels grounds  Our room and bathroom were renovated recently do were contemporary but with no loss of a Moroccan design  The location couldn't be better  So easy to walk within a few minutes to square gardens medina  Really I can't say enough. This hotel is heaven
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Went for a drink after dinner at the piano bar area where local musicians were playing songs from the desert near the pool. Magic. No strong lights very nice decoration plants everywhere and the most important silence enough to enjoy the music...Unforgettable...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: this was the second time we stayed here. Last time roughly 7 years ago and we still love it. The difference to back then was that we treated ourselves to a "junior suite".  What stands out is the roof top pool and especially the fantastic location. Just around the corner from the main square and you can basically pop in and out of the souks. It's a real little heaven when you enter the hotel from the bustling and lively streets outside. Having said that the room windows are so well isolated that you won't hear any of the noise from inside your room.  The Maroccan restaurant is good and the breakfast buffet great.  We stayed here for two nights before we left for the Atlas mountains and the dunes. On the way back to Marrakech to catch the flight home we stayed one night at the Sofitel. Not comparable we so much more like Les Jardins de La Koutoubia we regretted having stayed at the Sofitel.  We will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Superb stay at this lovely hotel
Review_Text: We stayed in late September 2016. We are a family with two children (8 and 10) and also travelled with our parents and other family members. Despite an earlier post the hotel is superbly well located a mere two minutes from Jama al Fna square and the souks at one end of the street with the beautiful Koutoubuia mosque at the other end. The staff were friendly and attentive bith to us and to our children. We loved the enormous mini suite as we had our double bed on the raised part of the room with steps down to the seating area which was tow very large and long sofas that became beds for the children (without cluttering up the room). The parents have a degree of privacy whilst knowing the children are snug in their beds a few steps away. The bathrooms were enormous - separate rooms for shower sinks/bath and WC all in beautiful stone. The children loved the enormous pool and we spent most of the hot afternoons around it (or the roof top pool). The Indian restaurant for lunch was delicious and the couple who run it delightful. We had an Indian banquet two days running which was a lovely way to spend a couple of hours on the roof top. Breakfast is at tables in the shaded areas around the pool with the tables interlaced between the palms/plants which was very nice. The buffet breakfast was extensive and again all members of the family found whatever they wanted. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Two members of our family and their 8 month old baby had driven from Switzerland and the hotel staff walked out to the Koutoubia mosque with us to try and find them as they had got a little lost. The baby attracted lots of warm and gentle attention and there was a high chair for mealtimes. The Caritas spa is another treat beautiful Hamman rooms enjoyed by me and my son in one and my wife and daughter in another. My wife had been to the La Mamounia Hamman the day before and whilst the decor at La Mamounia is unrivalled she preferred the Jardins Hamman as she felt the little Hamman rooms have a more authentic feel. Plus there is another enormous spa pool underground with loungers for relaxation (no kids allowed around the SPA pool which is fine as the children wanted to be in the large garden pool anyway). The hotel is clean and well looked after. It doesn't look much from the street (none of the Riads do) but it is wonderful to return to its gardens after a walk around the Souks. All in all a great stay loved by all the family and we would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We visited this hotel on a recommendation for drinks. It's in a great location 5 minutes from the square. The staff are attentive and friendly. We decided to buy pool passes which were pretty reasonable at £15 for the day. We ended up visiting the hotel for a few days and always had a great experience. We also tried the good too which was tasty and well presented. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech.

This hotel and staff just get better with every visit. This is our third year in Marrakech and it is starting to feel like home from home. Even the simple things  such as recognition from certain members of staff a note welcoming us back from the management team and a tray of traditional cakes in our room.. Morocco is struggling at the moment due to the incidents in Tunisia France and Belgium but I as a well seasoned traveller wandered down side streets without any apprehension. Yes you will get the odd aggressive trader but the majority of people are welcoming and very happy to help. So give it a try and experience a fabulous holiday destination.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charley W wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: My girlfriend & I have stayed at the hotel twice now (July 2016 & Aug / Sept 2016) for in total 18 days. The hotel is spot on staff are so incredibly friendly & helpful location couldn't be better for the medina and if you are looking for a true oasis toget away from the hustle & bustle of Marrakech while easily stepping back into it then this is your place for sure. We loved it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amma B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: I was a bit nervous about a solo trip even though it would be my second time in Marrakech. The staff at Les Jardins De La Koutoubia made me feel at home totally comfortable and safe. I was given lots of advice on places to visit and a tour guide for hire to accompany me. My room was comfortable and clean on a daily basis with fresh flowers and petals on my bed. Breakfast lunch and dinner were always great. Most most special about my visit again were the staff and how welcome and warm they were towards me. If you are looking for a place in the heart of Marrakech this is also a perfect location. My entire stay for a week was great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Had a lovely long weekend at this charming hotel. Location is perfect within walking distance to the Souks and Jemaa el fna. Food is great and prices are fair. Beautiful courtyard with pool. We were upgraded to a nice large room with our own private terrace. Really enjoyable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely food cooked to perfection. We ordered Rice with some curry dishes with some fresh juices.    Service is good and they looked very well after us. We haven't stayed in the hotel so can only review the food.

Review_Title: Great property in the heart of old Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights in end-August and thoroughly enjoyed our time. The hotel is a 5 min walk from Jemaa el Fnaa yet provides a quiet private haven away from the bustle. The property is well maintained and the architecture harks back to Moorish times.    The great bits:  1. Rooms - We were in a Junior Suite (Room 172); it came with a living room and a bedroom... both were aesthetically pleasing (I especially liked all the prints and paintings depicting Moroccan life spread across the property). While we spent little time sitting around the living area does have a Nespresso machine which is handy.The bedroom was quite large(especially if you are used to travelling in mainland Europe) with a comfortable king size bed. The bathroom has both a bath and a rain shower cubicle and expected amenities like toiletries robes slippers et al.  2. Lovely pools (rooftop and main) - you would want to keep some time to just laze around!  3. The spa - we treated ourselves to massages/facials on 2 days. Rates are comparable to UK. The spa also has its own little pool which is great to wade around in. Note that the use of the hamman has a separate charge of MAD200. Drinks(smoothies and alcoholic beverages) can be ordered in the spa. The slight challenge we faced was with language. Most of the staff are conversant in French with very limited English.  4. Breakfast - Great spread by the poolside. Fresh juice and fruits were my highlights.  5. Service - the hotel staff were great. Always ready to help with a smile on their faces.    Could be better  1. Connectivity - wi-fi in the rooms is slow. Don't count on it for Skype or WhatsApp.  2.Piano Bar - We had a few mojitos at the Piano Bar and they need to do significantly better. (We also noticed that the choice of whisky is rather limited across restaurants in Morocco. Given the number of British tourists visiting Marrakech was a bot of surprise). 3. Les Jardins de Bala - We had starters and drinks at the rooftop Asian restaurant. While service was very courteous the food is rather sub-par. It lacked flavour and texture.  4. A few niggles in the bathroom which need fixing. Nothing significant.    To/from airport - We used the hotel pick up/drop off service for a charge of MAD200. Hassle free. Is a 15min ride to the property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael P wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: The hotel is in the perfect place for the main streets 2 mins walk to end of the road but your far enough away that you dont hear any traffic noises and close enough to the medinas and souks etc 5 mins walk opposite direction of the main street. Staff very good friendly and polite reception staff very helpful we did the taxi tour with guide so we could go to the places we wanted into the mountains and along the rivers and villages great fun and loads of photo opportunities. all in all no complaints whatsoever.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Absar A wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: The atmosphere was lovely I remember the belly dancers and the sound of the drums and the ring of the strings the food was decent in the hotel pricey but is was the atmosphere you were paying for so it was well worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: MR MOHAMED J wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: We had a great family indian meal including young one who was 2 years old.    We had chicken tikka masala and chicken jalfarezi and rice.    Manage onion bhajis and french fries.    Even had a non alcoholic lemon mojitos.    Highly recommended but relatively expensive.    Nice quality food.    It is close to Jemdefa Faana Square.    It is our second visit at thus restaurant within 8 months.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sherene B wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week. And we loved every minute. Staff are very friendly and helpfull. There are 3 restaurants you can chose from: Indian French and Moroccan. We loved both Moroccan and French the Indian not so much.    There are 2 outside pools. One on the main floor where mostly children play around and one on the roof where adults can find some peace and quiet during their holiday. You can also order some food and drinks at the poolside. Leaving the hotel is not even necessary as you have everything you need inside. During the day time it's way too hot to walk around anyway.    During our stay we had half pension so that meant each person can use up to 30 euro every night and chose whatever he or she would like to eat in all 3 restaurants. And believe me at the price of 30 euro you can have a starter main and dessert as the prices are very reasonable!    Rooms are clean and spacious room service is great and cheap compared to other hotels i've stayed at! Overall great experience would come back for sure!!    Tip: Before checking out ask for a copy of your bill and dubbel check is everything is correct as we were billed for things we didn't take out of the mini bar. And billed for drinks at a restaurant we had not eatin at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in here at the beginning of July - The hotel was excellent value - excellent room ( we were upgraded to an amazing Hugh suite - excellent location 5 mins from the main square and 25 min walk to the new town of Gueliz- all in all an impeccable hotel only slightly let down by some of the staff who are quite surly and miserable. Would recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: great location 5 minute walk to the main plaza. Really nice employees. great seating area in the reception and excellent bars. the pool is great to enjoy in the afternoon the only downside of the hote is the long time they take serving you in the bars restaurant and with room service. Breakfast is great specially by the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is the best among the hotels I stayed in Morocco. It is a 5☆ hotel ~150 meter walking to Jmaa .. Square and can be reach by car!!! All staff can speak English the room and beds are bigger than what you saw in the web espeacially the bathroom having both shower and bath. Breakfast near swimming pool with variety of items including bacon a cook at breakfast grill knew how to made fried eggs over easy and we heard the bird singing sound during breakfast.  I strongly recommend this hotel to my friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Danka V wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: An amazing hotel! One of my favourite. So beautiful so clean roses everywhere a nice perfume is always there. A welcome with mint tea. We received a tour from a nice asy. We had a great big room with view on the pool. The rooftop is so beautiful!!! A big roofpool with a great service. The food is awesome! Breakfast was the best! For me 6stars. I have eaten like a queen. The streets around are so busy but inside the hotel its so relax and quiet. I cant wait to go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ruth Y wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: Charming hotel but not a 5 star
Review_Text: We had a lovely welcome from reception with Moroccan tea and cakes. We stayed in a mini suit which was beautiful and immaculately clean. I couldn't fault the room which was decorated to a high standard and was very spacious. The rest of the hotel is not consistent in standard. Some areas are well maintained and inviting whilst other areas are shabby and over looked. There is free wifi although it is very temperamental. We were half board which included a free breakfast and either lunch or an evening meal in one of the hotels 3 restaurants. The international restaurant was sadly always empty. The food looked inviting but the quality was poor and the menu lacked edible choice for us E.g Cockerel goat and raw fish. We did not try the Moroccan restaurant so I am unable to comment on this. The Indian restaurant was very popular and was full every night. The food was delicious and the service impeccable. The menu was varied and accommodating to all pallets. The breakfast was a limited choice buffet of a low budget and quality. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. The pools were lovely and immaculately clean. The only complaint was that there was no waiter around the pool side to take your drinks order which meant that you had to leave the pool side and get changed in order to go inside and order drinks - this took away some of the comfort from the experience. Our room key cards failed most days which meant we had to go to reception to get them revalidated (according to reception they can not be in a pocket near metal or near a mobile phone device -practically near impossible at times). The hotel is in a very desirable location with the souks and market shops just a 5 min walk away from the hotel. The mosque is directly opposite the hotel and the hotel is generally quiet and peaceful. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels all around the world but would not rate this hotel a 5 star standard by any comparable standard. Whilst the hotel is very charming it could be improved greatly as it a 3 star standard at the very most.

Review_Date: Jan v wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: very good location and good service
Review_Text: Les jardins de la Koutoubia is located next to the famous Jemaa El Fna square.  The hotel looks traditional but is quite well organized and has 3 good restaurants.  The Spa is of a very good standard.  We had a nice junior suite but had to ask several times to activate the wifi which was each time done quite soon.  In general : when you open yourself to the staff and waiters your always treated very well !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thank you for a lovely visit the rooms are clean and spacious the pool is lovely with lots of chairs and the location is great (close to the night market). Also try the Indian restaurant on the top floor its delish!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter C wrote a review Jul 2016
