Review_Text: Popped in to look at the hotel as not overly impressed with hotel I booked rooms were light and modern  pool area on roof and ground floor looked very inviting service for drinks excellent and so reasonable compared to where I am staying will defiantly book here for 2017 vacation.

Beautiful calm idyllic surroundings but very poor service in the bar and at the poolside. Have waited 30 mins on a drink at times. Food good when it arrives but more often than not the appetite has gone by the time it's served. However definitely a welcome rest place amidst the chaos outside
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Les Jardins de la Koutoubia (06-14/07/2016), an excellent choice at 2 min. from Jema el Fna
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Koutoubia is a traditional and old style 5 stars hotel at 2 min. from the square and the souks. Charming very quit with nice green square swimming pool spa 3 excellent restaurants mid size a bit old fashioned needs some light refurbishing. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious (we had a mini suite) well equiped clean and everything is working! Honest exchange rates for € and $. What a pleasant experience compared to all these modern "clubs" and palaces at a driving distance of 30 minutes and more from the city center.  Prices are more than acceptable in the bar (13€ for a gin tonic and a Martini olives nuts etc. included) and in the restaurants (e.g. 25€ for a very nice bottle of red wine).  Interesting half board formula where you can have diner à la carte in one of the 3 restaurants and get a credit of 15€pp to spend on food not drinks. This allows you to have a starter and a main course at your choice. Free Illy coffee in the rooms. Pleasant breakfast buffet in the morning is included complete offer but not extended.  Some minor typical misunderstandings as "forgotten to fill up the minibar or the coffee stock". 1 call to the reception desk an 5 min. later everything is ok.  Will book this hotel again without any doubt if we go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is the ideal base for exploring Marakkesh. The rooms are very quiet and comfortable (also quite cool) the bathrooms are luxurious the spa is fantastic the pool is clean the restaurants are delicious. AND the hotel is less than five minutes walk from the main square of Marakkesh restaurants shopping etc. You can sightsee and when you are tired you return to the hotel and relax by the pool. Would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Georgia L wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: I have stayed at this hotel about 4 or 5 times as it is an oasis of calm in the middle of Marrakech. It has always had beautifully decorated and clean rooms the pools are lovely and staff charming. There is just one small area which I feel could be worked on it's the reception staff who are just a little off hand and not terribly helpful. We forgot our toothbrushes and we also wanted to borrow a hat for the day as it was so hot round the pool. They just shrugged and said they didn't have anything. I do feel they could have helped us a little more and not been so disinterested. But all in all a lovely place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Amy B wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: My group was brought here by a guy who knows Marrakech and Morocco very well as a nice place to have a drink. And it was just that. The setting is lovely overlooking the pool and I have to say that the cocktails were absolutely delicious! However I have to say I preferred our more humble lovely little Riad to this bigger hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Faisil S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Oasis of calm inside the hustle and bustle of the medina
Review_Text: Never judge a book by it's cover is what springs to mind when reviewing this hotel.    I came across Les Jardins de La Koutoubia by chance as i'd been messed around by Novotel Suites (see my other review). When the taxi pulled up outside I was less than impressed the exterior looked a bit tired and dated but as soon as I walked through the doors I was pleasantly surprised.    The hotel has a classic look and feel about it the gentle smell of Jasmine runs throughout. The staff were friendly and very helpful our rooms were clean comfortable and a good size.    There are two outdoor pools one on the ground floor and one on the roof top. I thought that the pool on the ground floor was the nicer of the two but found certain areas would become heavily shaded. The roof top pool looked a bit dated but the bonus was sunlight from all directions.    Location was great literally around the corner from Jemaa el Fna and a 5 minute taxi ride to the Guliez. Even with it's close proximity to the centre I found it amazing how quiet it was inside the hotel.    Breakfast was'nt great and the rooms didnt have complimentary water. These were the only two negative points I had but over all was a great stay. I would recommend this hotel if you want to stay in the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Hotel with character and brilliant location
Review_Text: This hotel is right in the middle of everything and you can walk to the souks or square so handy no taxis needed.    The hotel is perhaps not a 5 star as a bit tired and dated but it has so much character that you forget about the little things. All the staff were helpful and friendly especially the ones on the roof top swimming pool area.    Rooms were all very clean with beautiful bathrooms. Plenty of space in all rooms.    Stay here if you want to walk to everything.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: have used more than 10 times, still AMAZING! Really special place.
Review_Text: I have done more than 10 trips to this hotel so I feel  Positives: clean LARGE rooms MANY toiletries great service loaded breakfast. Right next to Jamaa el Fnaa  Negative: extremely hard to find parking. Not a problem if you are an out-of-town.    Great smell comfort warmth and a great deal for those on travel to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Second stay was not quite as good as last time.
Review_Text: We were returning customers and had a lovely mini suite overlooking the pool.  Really enjoyed our 1st stay here 2 years ago so we returned.    This time wasn't quite as good for 2 reasons. Firstly some works were going on in the rooms. Sitting round the pool during the day or outside the bar in the evening listening to someone banging with a hammer isn't as relaxing as it should be!!    Secondly and more importantly were other peoples kids. We went to relax and having kids shouting about is really annoying. One of the 2 outdoor pools should be adults only. A number of people were getting upset and we saw 2 couples complain. For the record it's not a great hotel for kids.    Breakfast and general service by the staff was pretty good.    Would I return? Not sure now. We love the location near the square but so peaceful when you get back inside the hotel (until the kids turn up). Hotel needs to decide who they are appealing to as you cannot please everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Samantha P wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: After just returning from spending our honeymoon here last week i am eager to book my next stay here. It is located literally around the corner(2 min) from the old medina. The hotel entrance is somewhat underwhelming but as soon as you enter reception you are transferred to a lovely tranquil almost Riyadh style hotel. Staff are great hotel is very clean and spa is wonderful and good value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kirsty A wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: This is NOT a 5 star hotel. It's a 4 star at best. The staff at reception are unfriendly unhelpful. The rooms are shabby and in need of updating; pillows lumpy things missing from the room peeling paint in bathroom French Windows that do not lock properly. There was a tour guide "linked" to the hotel who lingered outside and try and rip you off. The worst thing about the hotel is the food greasy and inedible. The wifi is also very poor. The best thing is the pool but then you'd expect a swimming pool from a 5* hotel. DO not come here when there are better 5* hotels in Marrakech. It's worth paying more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Stayed a few days Marrakech this hotel was excellent for the location and it's facilities. We had a mini suite which was very nice with plenty of everything.    The breakfast was okay but not always enough food and the same every day!!    However they did make a very good G&T in the bar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joe F wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Looking to stay in the Medina by the marketplace and souks? This is the place!
Review_Text: From the outside the hotel is nothing to speak of. Enter and you will be reminded of the expression - never judge a book by its cover. For us it was the beautiful grounds the very nice rooms with a Moroccan flair the roses everywhere the very good service (though the service is more "casual" than one might expect at these prices but we were fine with it). And the location is in the heart of the Medina less than 5 minutes walking distance to the marketplace and souks. Would definitely go back! Only complaint - wifi though free was pretty spotty.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Loved this hotel upgraded our whole party to suite rooms !! Cake and tea on arrival - helpful staff will help with anything - everything here is perfect - so relaxing - would recommend  I stayed with family friends and our children we were all made to feel very welcome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I would never book this hotel again. Have stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels and all have delivered five star service. The breakfast was the same everyday we stayed 4 nights and got fed up with the same food everyday. The pool was supposed to be heated but it was freezing cold. Even the spa pool was cold. There was no tea facility in the room to use the spa facilities you had to pay 200mad. The spa had no ambience it smelled like damp the treatment was basic no tea was offered after treatment. Never again so I would say avoid staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights and we enjoyed it very much it is a real 5* hotel that is perfect in every way. The food here is great and the pool on roof top is amazing. During our stay we walked for hours and hours in the medina souks and Fna Square. The staff are helpful with all our questions they were nice to make phone calls to our guides who did not show for pick up. We highly recommended this hotel a long stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Such a cool bar around the pool - to either sit outside and have a few drinks while the sun goes down or inside in a dark corner lapping up the music.    Around the edge of the swimming pool is quite possibly the coolest pool table room looking out over the swimming pool.    Staff are friendly helpful and very accommodating. Beer and wine is good value and it's a quiet luxurious setting off the main busy streets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A friendly calm oasis in central Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins de La Koutoubia for our first trip to Marrakech on the recommendation of a friend. I'm glad we listened it was perfect for us - a great central location between the old town of souks and the market and the new town of shops and boutiques. Also the mosque at Koutoubia is a great landmark if you're as easily lost as I am! The staff were welcoming and friendly and we were always greeted with rose petals on our bed. We had a suite with a lovely outside seating area as well as a large room and comfy (firm!) mattress.  The real highlight for us was breakfast at the pool side with wonderful fresh fruit and nothing but the sounds of chirping birds.

Review_Title: Always Marrakech, always Le Jardin de la Koutobia
Review_Text: It was my third time in Marrakech. I lo e te city and I always book in Le jardín. The place is really nice te food and beverages are really good people is very kind and it's 5 minutes from te souk.  I recomend it 100%!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Only stayed for a weekend and would have liked to stay for weeks. The staff are absolutely brilliant the food superb and the rooms are sumptuous.The inner pool is nice and cold the upstairs pool exquisite. Loved the bar snacks...not too sure about the Indian restaurant (no chapatis??). Must say the in-house pianist was worth every minute. I've not heard anyone play piano with a backing track and adding his own style in many years. Laughed uncontrollably. The in-house spa is worth a visit with its underground heated pool excellent barber and easing massages. Outside a stones throw from the main square with all its hubble and bubble - the food is OK but there is much better to be found on the streets in the many café bars. If I go to the area again this is the hotel I will stay at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel on our tour through Classic Journeys. It was close to the mosque so we heard the lovely call to prayer in the morning and it was close to the main square in Marrakech with all the fascinating people watching (snake charmers men dancing henna artists local foods etc).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A little piece of tranquility amongst the Marrakesh mayhem
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel very tranquil the staff are friendly and helpful restaurants and bar very atmospheric and delicious food too! A real escape from the mayhem of Marrakesh a place to recharge your batteries ready for the next assault on the senses as you step outside the haven of the hotel's walls!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wandering back from the Medina we spotted this restaurant / hotel as much as we love morroccan food we fancied an indian curry it looked good we weren't disappointed: we recieved a very warm welcome attentive staff service was excellent food was delicious maybe a bit expensive against previous meals in Marrakech but what you'd expect to pay in the UK if you fancy a curry this is the place to go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of calm amongst the mayhem
Review_Text: We loved this place! In the middle of the medina stones throw from the wonderful mayhem of Marrakech. An oasis of tranquility and style. Maybe a little past its best but lovely staff nice rooms and great breakfasts. Piano bar to be avoided if piano player is there however. Try the Thai restaurant attached to the hotel if you get bored of tagines.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alan W wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: A great beginning - we were upgraded to a mini suite! The hotel is well appointed lovely rooms two good swimming pools (the one of the roof is heated) good Indian Restaurant and the pool side bar has a decent menu.Staff are charming. The really fabulous thing is the location - within a short distance of the La Koutoubia Mosque (visible clearly from our room) and the Jemma El Fna square (just ask for 'the Square' and everyone understands!! Great for wandering around in the evening or going to the top rated Maison MK Restaurant or Tonsil both within a short walk from the hotel. Rose petals scattered on the bed once made of a morning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent Service, Location and Amazing Staff and Crew of the Hotel
Review_Text: This was our second time to stay at Les Jardins dela Koutoubia and we love the hotel for its excellent service location and the hotel's very polite and helpful staff and crew. Another plus that I would like to mention is the hotel's outstanding heated pool. Our 2nd trip to Marrakech was end of March so it was quite chilly and the heated pool of the hotel made our stay very relaxing. I would also like to mention the wonderful restaurant on the top of the hotel which serves amazing indian/morrocan food! We were also traveling with our toddler and an infant and the hotel staff made our stay very comfortable by providing us with a super big cot. I would also like to mention a wonderful and amazing breakfast selection of the hotel. =)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Nicoleta J wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: The hotel and the service is good (it is 5* so it should not be any other way). The location is the best. The breakfast is not good quality we do not recommend it at all. Anyway the hotel is very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in a very central location
Review_Text: Most beautiful hotel very luxurious oasis in the middle of the medina. Staff could not help enough. On arrival we were met with Moroccan tea and beautiful pastries. The room had a beautiful balcony where you could sit and take in the beautiful scenery of the gardens. I used the rooftop pool which was lovely. Breakfast was nice and service excellent. We ate in 2 of the restaurants the Moroccan and the steak restaurant both were lovely. We travelled as a family group of girls but this would make a lovely romantic getaway for a couple.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel at a very convenient location. 2 minutes walking distance from main square La Koutoubia has 3 restuarants. We tried the Indian restuarant which was very good. Breakfast is included and was great with omelet and crepes stations. Fresh Orange juice a lot of different kinds of pasteries and cold cuts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Roger D wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Slightly flawed grand hotel in an unbeatable location / Grand hôtel luxueux
Review_Text: Grand hotel in a prime location about 100m from Djemaa el Fnaa. Excellent copious and varied buffet breakfast (brunch really). It didn't quite run like the unobtrusive well-oiled machine one expects at this level (as a trivial example the minute hands on the clocks displaying the "Time in Paris New York London" etc clocks in reception all pointed to very different minutes). Service in the Relais de Paris was fussy rather than discreet. The final bill for one night including two courses each in the Relais was way too much at around 400€.    Grand hôtel luxueux très agréable et spacieux ! Les salles de bains sont superbement grandes et fort bien équipée ! Le cadre est magnifique les salles à manger ou salons sont confortables et harmonieux le petit déjeuner est délectable. Très bon souvenir de cet hôtel !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jo B wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Had a fabulous lunch there - food and wine good. Service attentive. Gardens around the pool are pretty and great to sit in the sun sipping a cocktail. Wouk recommend if you want somewhere near the medina - prices not bad either.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I took the responsibility of booking a hotel for the four of us; so when we arrived at 4am to a tattyish alley to find the entrance of the hotel I was so scared of what might be awaiting us. It turned out to be a lovely hotel with rooms surrounding the pool.  I read some reviews about the mosque azan being disturbing but I did not find it so. What was disturbing though was a singer that the hotel has by the pool early every evening and this was really annoying as you could not rest in peace after all the walking you have done during the day. His singing is loud and monotonous derwiche way. He got on our nerves.  Otherwise the rooms and bathrooms are spacious and clean. They bed is decorated with flower petals daily. The breakfast is decent but not OTT. The service is good.  The hotel is just at the edge of the big FNA square and walking distance to the maze of souks. I would return to the hotel for sure especially if they stop the singer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kirsty MH wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: So disappointing - on the food front anyway
Review_Text: I must start by saying when we started planning our trip to Marrakech we did initially hope to stay at this hotel. Eventually we decided to have a bit more of an authentic experience in a Riad buried in the souks which was so interesting but we still wanted to visit this hotel as it looked beautiful and it was just as beautiful in person. The grounds rooms bars etc all look beautiful. Front desk staff very helpful.    We decided to have a meal in their restaurant. By Marrakech standards certainly not cheap so we were expecting some amazing food. Unfortunately I can not even slightly recommend the restaurant of this hotel. All bar one waiter were just plain rude. Food arrived cold or inedible (my lamb tagine had so little meat on it I left the restaurant hungry!) it was mainly grizzle and fat while my partners food was cold and quite tasteless - quite surprising from our other experience in Moroccan food. When we mentioned it no apologies or offers to heat his meal etc. Just practically ignored.    This rating is only a two for the look of the hotel - I could not recommend this hotel less for a "treat yourself" meal there are plenty of other lovely locations at a fraction of the price that won't leave you with such a bad taste in your mouth - literally!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Louise c wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This is without doubt the best hotel in Marrakech. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The décor is uber lux. The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. The breakfasts are delicious and there is an amazing selection of foods to choose from. The 2 pools are lovely especially the roof top pool with views of koutoubia mosque. I have been here twice and will be returning next year. Try the cocktail bar too and ask for a koutoubia cocktail - fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel O wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel so atmospheric. As soon as you arrive you are seated and offered a refreshing mint tea and pastries whilst the staff take care of checking you in. We were upgraded and had a huge room that overlooked the pool. The room was spotless and adorned with rose petals and roses each day. The attention to detail was wonderful. We ate at two of the hotel's restaurants the Indian and the main restaurant serving Moroccan cuisine - in both the food and service was very good. Breakfast each day was plentiful with a wide choice of foods available. We would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have enjoyed that lovely place only for a drink after dinner. Our target was to chill in a quiet place after having spend the day in the souk.  It was a huge success. Service is perfect lot of choice in the menu and you will feel alone even if the place is almost fully booked. Amazing.  I recommend that place for people who need to find peace on earth (Marrakech).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location close to the Dmaa El Fna
Review_Text: I was in Marrakech for 7 nights and spent the first three in a traditional 5 bed Riad in the middle of the Medina (Riad Bleu De Sud reviewed separately). During my holiday I also wanted the option of staying in a more conventional hotel with a swimming pool but which was also located in the Medina and had character and charm so I booked 4 nights here. This proved to be a good decision and I really enjoyed my stay. It is located within a 2 minute walk to the main square but is very peaceful and tranquil. There are three swimming pools 1 in the courtyard in the centre of the hotel 1 on the rooftop (my favourite and a real suntrap) and a 3rd one located in the spa. The room was spacious with a separate sitting room and 2 lavatories. When I arrived in my room there were rose petals scattered in the bedroom and bathroom which I found charming. The walls are decorated with old photographs of people and places of Marrakech and were very interesting. Breakfast was served until 10.30am and was ok. There was an egg station and a pancake station with items cooked to order which were pretty good but other than that breakfast was just average. The cakes and pastries available were a little dry. Service was friendly and pleasant but nothing particularly special and I have no complaints. The exception to this was the lady working in the rooftop swimming pool restaurant. She was excellent very efficient warm and friendly. She provided the best service I received during my stay. I had a hammam scrub treatment with massage in the spa and really enjoyed this. The one issue I had following this wonderful experience was that they did not offer me a fresh dry bathrobe afterwards and I had to put on the one that was wet following the hammam scrub. I asked for a fresh dry robe which they happily provided when asked but it would be so much nicer if this was automatically provided. In my opinion this is a 4 star hotel rather than a 5 star but with a little work it could easily gain a genuine 5 star rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We felt so welcomed on arrival here. I had been here for a drink a few years back and promised myself I would come and stay here on a next visit. The lady and gentlemen at the reception desk were so helpful during our entire stay (thank you) the rooms were good size and the grounds of the hotel are lovely. One can spend the entire weekend inside or step straight out into the bustle of the Medina. My only feedback would be that the staff at the rooftop could be a little more engaged and mindful but I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a long weekend break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Lush Oasis In the Heart of Marrakech Mayhem
Review_Text: A stunning hotel with beautiful decor and a lush green courtyard. Highly recommend this hotel. Upon arriving from the airport and taking in the first views of Marrakech city life the hustle and bustle and traffic I was found slightly daunting the prospect of a hotel located centrally and a stone's throw away Jema El Fna but as soon as you step into the hotel lobby your are in pure tranquillity and are greeted by friendly staff pouring you Moroccan mint tea and offering you sweet pastry on trays. You are lead to the courtyard pool side to complete paperwork in the sun. You are thoroughly eased into your vacation.  The hotel has 3 wonderful restaurants all serving fantastic food of different cuisines. Breakfast spread is equally impressive with a fresh omelette AND fresh crepe stand. The Spa facilites with heated jacuzzi pool is fabulous and the rooftop pool area is just as great with stunning direct views of the very nearby Koutoubia Mosque.  The ensuite rooms had a deep bath as well as a shower room within. The only small little criticism would be the fact that there is a window into the main room with a curtain and also the doors for the bathroom and separate toilet are not your normal type but more like a grated/grilled design.  This is such a minor issue relative to the broader brilliant experience I had staying here. For the evenings there is a lounge area a gorgeous large fire place and a pool table room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for long weekend. Hotel lovely. Nice touches with the rose petals on the bed. Weather great. Piano bar great atmosphere. Lovely sitting by the fire in the lounge near the pool. Had the greatest massage at the beautiful spa. Food great. Great service. The souks are very colourful and an eyeopener.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel just a short walk to the square and markets.  Rooms were fantastic and the food and leisure facilities were great with a really good breakfast.  Would highly recommend and will definitely go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The place is just stunning very central and ever so close to the airport. My tip is to ask the hotel to arrange arrange a taxi pick up from the airport as it is much cheaper (we paid 200 dirhams on our way in and only 100 when the hotel arranged the taxi!). We were ever so lucky as we got an upgrade to a suite with garden view. The breakfast is amazing and the stuff just helpful! I would happily stay here again on my next visit.  If you are thinking to explore the Atlas I suggest you to use the numerous agency dotted around the town. They will pick you up from the hotel in the morning. Make sure you get a deal (huggle if you have to) as prices will change greatly from place to place.  Marrakesh is a treasure to discover and this hotel is the right place to rest your tired feet while there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ben W wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: We are about to enjoy our last evening here and if I wasn't eager to get home to our dogs I would wish I was staying!! The rooms service food pool and staff are all excellent - very attentive service whilst non intrusive. Our journey from the airport was hectic to say the least but walking through the doors into the large lobby area is like entering an oasis!!! It's the calm in the middle of the storm as you're a minutes walk from the hustle and bustle of the market. I will certainly be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Ricarda B wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Great calm hotel in the middle of the busy life of Marrakech
Review_Text: Very nice hotel with a calm pool area and a roof top pool with a gorgeous view. Rooms are nice and clean. It is a special pleasure to find the room being decorated with roses each day.  The Indian restaurant at the top of the roof is very good as well.    Great stay: we'll come again!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Who on earth is running this place?!
Review_Text: This was our second time in Morocco and we have always experienced beautiful service at the Riads we have stayed in in Marrakech and Essaouira. My fiance decided to book something 'extra special' for our last night of the week we were in Morocco. He alas chose El Koutabia.    a) this is not 5 star more like faulty towers in a beautiful building!    b) they argued with us at the beginning about how much we needed to pay by miscalculating the city tax by £50 then not apologising when we proved them wrong.    c) They upgraded us to a suite (something they threw back in our face when we complained at the end. Of course you're going to upgrade people when your massive hotel is practically empty).    d) black coarse hairs all over the room looking a bit like a weave. They did send someone to clean up after I called reception.    e) hotel restaurant is hugely over priced and not the best curry at all however sweet staff in the Indian restaurant.    f) many tired fixtures and lifts not working.    g) breakfast from 6.30am I don't think so. Expensive buffet breakfast which took them nearly an hour to set up and a lot of gossiping and paying no attention to the customers (just two of us!). After asking g for an omelette and them saying they don't do that until 7 we still didn't get it at 7.20!    We had had enough so I calmly went to reception and spoke to the only political and understanding young man who was on night duty. I explained what shame it was thatsuch a beautiful hotel felt like a hotel that was closing down and that no one cared anymore. And that all our experiences of Morrocans in tourism were one of the best. He advised me to put in writing my experience so I took the details.    The woman (I can't call her a lady) who came back on reception found it very very hard to take the complaint and proceeded in being very defensive. I thought at first it might be a lost in translation thing but her facial expressions reminded me of my middle eastern female family members when they are very angry! I knew from then that a letter to the manager would be absolutely useless as I would rather not slag off a place without speaking to management. However I am compiling a letter as I write this.    So in a nutshell do not go here as it will bitter your experience of Morocco and believe me it is no reflection of the Moroccans or the experience you can have. Save your money and stay double the time in a properly run clean and friendly Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Living the fantasy which is Marrakech
Review_Text: As is custom in Morocco you cannot judge this place by its facade. This is a great hotel with loads of atmosphere (outside fire places) good facilities (beautiful spa and hammam + heated roof top pool) and a perfect location (a couple of minutes walk from the big square and the souks). Of the hotel's restaurants the Indian one (Jardin de Bala) is the tastiest. Not everything works perfectly though and something should be done about the extreme heat in the rooms.    If you don't mind waking up before dawn with the call to prayer from the Koutoubia (when the whole city comes alive with 'song') this is a perfect place to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I would give it more stars!
Review_Text: This hotel is so beautiful no review is enough you have to go there! There is a roof top pool that many are not aware and two streets from the souks. Service is amazing and they gave us a free upgrade where the room had a private outdoor lounge. I cannot wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah A wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: A Sanctuary in the midst of mayhem
Review_Text: We stayed here for our honeymoon for one full week. It was my second time in Morroco but first at this hotel. After the stress of the wedding we wanted some peace and quiet and we certainly found it here. We stayed in a suite which was truly bliss. This hotel is crazy about putting rose petals on your bed everyday. Nice touch. The hotel is huge with an oriental feel to it. It's not corporate or bland you get a lot of character and friendly faces greeting you. The hotel reception is huge and comfortable to wait around in. We took day trips out and retired the hotel bar at night. The beer a Casablanca will set you back €6 and be warned the piano player is not blessed with the best voice.  Our room was really too hot at night which is the only thing that bothered me. They have some centralised heating system that comes on in every room and cannot be turned off. I opened our balcony door to find the noise of the water features kept me awake. Also birds can fly into your room if you leave the door open. I did not sleep the first few nights. The hotel manager was very accommodating and tried to assist as best as possible. I eventually adjusted and risked leaving the doors open at night. Morroco temperatures seriously drop at night. The three swimming pools particularly the heated pool on the third floor on the roof top made our stay. Oh the hotels jardins de Bala restaurant is awful Indian food. Very overpriced full of cream and soggy vegetables.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury near the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: I am going to this hotel for the fifth time in February 2016 so anyone reading this will rightly assume I must like it a lot. It's about 5 minutes from the main square leading to the souks. It has all the amenities you could wish for. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. It has 3 restaurants and a cafe by the ground floor swimming pool and another by the rooftop swimming pool. The restaurants are French Indian and Moroccan (the latter complete with belly dancer). In addition there is a very pleasant bar with piano music in the evenings. I think there are fitness facilities available but I don't know exactly what because at 77 I don't go into that stuff much. Finally there is a nice garden in the first courtyard (with the swimming pool) and also in the second courtyard where the French restaurant is situated. Rooms on one side of the second courtyard have fine views from their balconies of the Koutoubia mosque.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We have travelled here 3 times in the last year and a half the most recent visit was for our honeymoon. I would recommend this hotel and its restaurants on any occasion. Always inviting desk staff that are super helpful that speak fluent english french and darija (I'm sure there's other languages spoken here but these are the 3 I'm familiar with). Atay and Moroccan sweets at the desk any time of day or night. Room attendants more than friendly and genuinely attentive and caring. Hotel rooms well appointed super comfortable beds quiet rooms on the inside (cost a little more but well worth it to have the balcony overlooking pool or garden areas) bathrooms very large and roomy and always clean. Roof top restaurant (Les Jardins de Bala) by far the best restaurant I've ever eaten at. Breakfast buffet always a treat great variety of food and waiters/waitresses over the top helpful. Now to the spa....my favourite place of all. So beautiful you feel like you've been taken to another realm. Hammam experience absolutely out of this world (you have to learn to not be shy and get naked for the experience). Spa pool is quiet and inviting. Spa attendant staff especially Mina and Roquaya deserve recognition for their above par service. I will return again Inshallah and will dream of this place until then.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a great hotel within a 2 minute walk of the Jeme El Fena square. We drove here and parking though limited was not a problem and watchful security guards made sure the vehicle stayed safe.    The hotel is a lovely well maintained Merchants house with a choice of swimming pools and places to eat including a rooftop Indian restaurant with views of the Koutouba minaret.    We were upgraded to a suite which was massive with seperate seating areas two bathrooms and toilets and lots of touches that made a stay so enjoyable.    The bar was reasonable. Would go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Abhishek S wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Take bus number 19 from the Airport bus stop is on the right exactly in front of airport. The driver or a helper asks each passenger about their hotel and suggest directions and which stop to get off.    We bought a return ticket of 50 dirham each valid for 20 days or so.    Get off at first stop walk towards left and into the first street on right. The hotel is only 5 min walk away no need for any taxi just ask driver for directions if required.    There is a fountain exactly in front of the hotel entrance.    You get a warm welcome as you enter the hotel and are greeted with a hot cup of mint tea with morrocon sweets.    The hotel's interior architecture resembles moorish palaces like Alcazar in seville.    Rooms are comfortable and the only noise you would hear would be the constant twittering of the birds . Our room was facing the pool and i would recommend everyone to opt for the same if possible.    There are plenty of roses and other flowers all around the hotel and it smells amazing one deep breath would rejuvenate your senses.    There are two swimming pools smaller one being in the terrace giving brilliant views of the koutoubia minaret.    We went to the Indian restaurant in the hotel. It is reasonably priced and has good quality but it failed to tickle our tastebuds. we only tried vegetarian dishes.    Staff was very polite and helpful.  Breakfast has a good continental selection. The hotel offers free wifi which has good signal even in the rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: lovely hotel, great service and location
Review_Text: spent christmas 201 week there ..and loved hotel. Great room overlooking pool .. spacious clean comfortable great bathroom ... only downside was wifi was very poor and daily had to call reception for them to reboot on their server ... the spa was wonderful had 2 great massages and fantastic facial there. Roof top pool area was lovely. Indian restaurant was just average and moroccan also average for dinner at night. Breakfast could have been better with more choice of breads fruit and more healthier options. Location was superb .. so quiet but so central for all. Staff were truly amazing in all departments ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Very nice and elegant place beautiful interior design comfort bar drinks luxurious surroundings nice location in medina nearby the Square and markets. The place to stay or either have a drink or eat. Swimming pools spa. Good investment for a good experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The welcome was wonderful the hotel accommodation was comfortable and clean.  The garden area and pools are beautiful The rooms are spacious with plenty of wardrobe space with a lovely bath which was decorated with rose petals everyday. Modern moroccan interior flows really nicely throughout the building and rooms. All in all a lovely hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: MR MOHAMED J wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Great Indian food at the hotel
Review_Text: We had a great family Indian meal and we enjoyed it.  Great atmosphere and it was on the 3rd floor of the hotel near the Jemda fana Square.  Would recommend anybody who enjoys Indian food has full range includes Onions bhaji chicken curry meat dishes    Thanks to staff and management for providing top Indian food
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sandra M wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: I did not stay at the hotel but had a nice lunch by the pool. Couscous and chicken. Well worth the money. Calm and soothing atmosphere. You can pay to use the pool as wellsomething I did not do. But it looked inviting.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A beautiful oasis for the weary!
Review_Text: My wife organised this trip as a surprise. Well what a lovely surprise when we arrived. It was all she imagined and more than I could have hoped for. Not perfect but not far off. Just outside the entrance lobby you will find the busy buzzy noisy splendidly colourful and aromatic streets and squares of Marrakech but take a few steps into the hotel and you are transported into an oasis of calm and tranquility (except for the call to prayer at far too early o'clock!).    The hotel wasnt that busy as we understand that November is low season. Most visitors we spoke to seem to have been upgraded. We were rather unlucky in this respect as we had already upgraded our room at reservation stage. However the room was lovely and we had a beautiful pool view suite (after we had been given a garden view suite not what was ordered and they moved us the following morning). We couldn't really fault the room at all.    Breakfast was uninspiring but there was plenty of choice. The bacon was mostly like leather and far too overcooked (maybe this was for the American market - and we met no Americans at all!). Otherwise it was fine.    You should know that people seem to eat very late in Morrocco. We booked a table at the Indian restaurant one night for 7.00 pm and we were the only ones there for the whole meal. The food was fine but not overly authentic. I think you might be best to stick with the Morrocan restaurants off site and leave the Indian food for when you visit India London or Bradford! My wife ordered a Thai green curry and apart from the chicken in it and some small flakes of aubergine it was nothing like a green curry and should really not have been advertised as such. I strongly suggest that the chef looks at any Thai cookbook to see what a THAI green curry contains (clue: it isnt just green chilli guys!!).    There is an awesome looking spa in the basement but it is to be paid for if you want to use it not just for facials or massage but if you want just to have a steam bath or a relaxing swim. I thought that this was a bit much to expect of someone who has paid handsomely to stay in the hotel so we decided to give it a miss.    Go to this hotel and enjoy the calming nature and lovely people there. It is a joy but perhaps try out the local restaurants for truly authentic meals. If you get a chance to meet Marie co-owner of the hotel spend some time chatting to her. She is charming and loves to be of help.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely stay in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Great ambiance in the lobby when you arrive all fresh roses everywhere. The swimming pool on the roof is heated and you have a splendid view over the mosque and the Atlas mountains at the horizon. The rooms are spacious and clean roses everywhere very nice. Big bathroom.    The spa is overpriced but luxury too.    Good breakfast friendly and helpful staff.    Will be staying here again next time I'm in Marrakech.    Gay friendly!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ronald f wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: An oasis of tranquility in the centre of the Medina
Review_Text: This is the second time i have stayed here and will not be the last. Beautiful suite on the third floor a balcony surrounded by birdsong and the faint drumming from the El Fna square in the background only interrupted by the mesmerizing call to prayer from the Koutoubia mosque.  i would not call this a typical package holiday guest/family hotel and thank goodness for that. Its guests are an eclectic mix of characters who appreciate quality and quiet and the peace to do their own thing without the involvement of othersno need for holiday reps shows here.  The food in all three restaurants is very good with the rooftop Indian excellent.  Breakfasts are very good and at all times the staff are efficient polite and helpful.  I good write for pages on this hotel and not have to introduce any criticism i love it.  I do hope like the souks the El Fna square this hotel never changes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joris Boot wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: An oasis of calmness just next to Jemaa El Fna
Review_Text: Location and getting about  The hotel is located in a small street that leads from the De la Koutoubia mosque to the Jemaa El Fna square; last bit is pedestrians only. The square is just a one minute walk away from the doorstep. Ideal if you want to have your dinner on the square at one of the small stands (a must do in our opinion; see our review about Jemaa El Fna). The hotel itself is an oasis of quietness with a pool and garden in the courtyard where you can choose to have your breakfast and hear the birds twitter.    The hotel  The hotel is shaped like a square (Riad) with rooms at both side of the hallway that leads through it. In the middle is a quite large garden with pool. There's a corridor surrounding it and leading you to the spa centre "secret" exit of the hotel nice seating areas and a pool room.  On the roof you'll find another (slightly heated) pool with a beautiful view on the mosque. Though there are plenty sometimes all the sunbeds were taken. On the other side of the roof is one of the three (I believe) restaurants of the hotel.  There's (password protected) wifi throughout the whole hotel but it is sloohoow and unstable.  We found the staff very friendly and helpful. We went to the reception a several times for inquiries and they gave us every bit of information we hoped to get. They speak both English and French.    The room  From the rooms on the inner side of the hotel you have a lovely view of the pool and garden. A truly wonderful sight every morning when you open the (double darkening very well) curtains. The rooms are very large; any other hotel would call them suites. There are a lot of cupboards a desk a "living room" part with a large seat a couch and a low table. Of course a safe a minibar and a tv are in the room as well.  The bathroom is very spacious too. It has a seperate bath and shower and yet a lot of room to move around. The shower itself measures about a metre by 15 I would say and has a rain head. The water temperature of the shower could vary a bit which was a little bit annoying. Naturally they provide you with enough towels and all kinds of toiletries.    Bars and restaurants  Breakfast starts at 7.30h (or was it 6.30h?) and is served untill 10.30h. Choice from the buffets is large. We liked to have our breakfast outside but there are more than enough seats inside.  The bar directly behind the reception has a very nice interior mixing grandeur with Moroccan influences. Later in the evening a man plays relaxing tunes on the piano. Prices of drinks are high. I believe 50 MAD for a beer and 60 for a glass of wine.  We did not have dinner in the hotel but the restaurants looked fine to us as did the menu and the prices.    Sight seeing  As said the square is very close by. Venture into it and the surrounding souk by yourself. No guide needed; we used Google maps after having viewed the street map using the hotels wifi. This gives you to do the square souk palace mosque and Dar Si Said museum which are all within walking distance at your own pace.  Outside the medina we did not found anything really worthwhile even the highly recommended Marjorele gardens (see our seperate review). You might want to book a tour of any kind. We did a very nice cooking class with Urban Adventures.    Weather  During our stay which was inthe middle of November we only had clear skies and day temperatures of about 25 degrees Celsius. In the evening it cools off quickly to about 15 degrees. Within the city we did not notice any winds what so ever. And obviously we had no rain what so ever.    Overall / In conclusion  In our opinion this is the place to "come home to" and escape from all the hustling and bustling of Marrakech. Enjoy the subtle luxury in every aspect. And when you have come at rest walk back into the city again. There is so much to experience. We stayed three nights (two and a half days) which still left us with the feeling we have to come back here again and do all the things we missed. For sure we will book our next stay in Les Jardins de la Koutoubia again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alicia R wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: No doubt it is the best located 5 star hotel in Marrakech and also one of the most beautiful Riads. The heated rooftop swimming pool is to die for and the bar around the patio is the most elegant one in the Medina. The only problem was the hamam which was really poor and not well looked after not worth it for the Spa or the food but for the location and the garden patio.

An oasis of calm in the bustle of the Medina throughout the week we were there the effect of coming into the hotel with its calm spaces pool and extensive flowers did not diminish. we we lucky to be upgraded to a suite which constituted excellent value for what we had paid but as we were given free of charge the grade of rom we had booked to cover the period after checkout but before we had to leave for the airport we know that the booked room too would have been fine if not quite the treat we enjoyed.    There haas been some negative comment in these reviews about the attitude of the staff; we found them unfailingly helpful and friendly. From the one of two things that needed taking up we learnt that the issue seems to be that most of the staff have apparently good English which can lull you into thinking you are being fully understood most of the time you are but when it is about something unusual e.g. trying to explain about the low electrical hum in the room the day to day hotel English breaks down. In retrospect i wished I had used French more and as i had resolved to do. Small issue but i think it might go some way to explaining why some people found staff unhelpful; they were not  in our experience.  The biggest negative about the hotel for us was the Indian/Asian restaurant. Why should it work in Morocco? In our view it did not. The food was uninspiring the atmosphere dull and buy local standards it was not cheap. Altogether better was the Moroccan restaurant which ddi all the local staples to a good standard but we could have done without the belly dancer.  The hotel is ideally situated just of the main square only minutes from the souks and within easy walking distance of everything else in the Medina with the bonus that as it is so near to the minaret of the mosque which dominate the medina you can always locate where your hotel is.  we look forward to returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pedro S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Wonderful hotel a few steps away from Plaza Jemaa el-Fnaa
Review_Text: It’s amazing that only a few feet away from the noise and activities from the Jemaa el-Fnaa in Marrakech once we got inside the hotel we could enjoy peace and relaxation in a great atmosphere and a well maintained garden.  The breakfast was not bad but considering the category of the hotel they could have more varieties and better service. Somebody seating near us called the waitresses three times and finally got their attention. If they can correct this I think that people will feel more welcomed and will enjoy better.  The room was spacious very clean and comfortable decorated with arranged rose petals. The sleep quality was great.  I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

I stay at this hotel for 6 days.I had a junior suites with nice view.The price is not very good but its ok.  The hotel that gives 5 stars service need to read this carefully.  Stuff very good but 40% dont speak english  Internet connection is not good in the room only in the reception  From 9 in the morning until 10 at night the rooms are very noisyyou listen the door of the nearest room or the dialogue in the room abovealso the steps!  Pool in the roof is heated but not enough  Channels in the tv are 90% French.  The bathrobes are very small  Aircondition unit in the room is very very noisy also in low speed fun.  The bathroom smells food in the morning because is the kitchen below( this is not very bad)  Anyway i reccomented for the position and i wish next time not have the same problems
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Having stayed here 8 years ago I was eager to stay here again when travelling recently with 7 girlfriends to Marrakech.    This hotel was even more amazing than my first visit from arrival with the extremely helpful Abdel helping all of us with our forms and wifi access whilst we relaxed in the warm and friendly bar. To our sad departure with the lovely porter waiting by the busy road with our luggage.    We spent our first day enjoying the rooftop pool and then using the wonderful Hotel Spa for a Hammam & hot oil massage (highly recommend).    The rooms are extremely comfortable with a beautiful aroma. Fresh rose petals adorned the bed and bathroom daily.    The food from the rooftop Indian/Asian Cuisine restaurant was delicious. The breakfast offered a great selection of fresh food with eggs to order however you like them done.    EVERY member staff couldn't have been more helpful and extremely friendly and polite always a lovely warm greeting no matter what time of day.    I could bore everyone for days on all the wonderful elements of this hotel but instead I urge you to go and discover for yourselves. Did I mention it is also only a very short distance to the Souk!    We can't wait to return and will be back next year...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Visit the Medina and Souk and then go here for a relax and wind down. It's pure luxury and at a very reasonable cost. I'd recommend the Squid on the lunch menu or the omelettes. Eat and chill out in the cool and civilised surroundings. Just be careful that when you take your life in your hands crossing the road (the zebra crossings mean nothing in this town) or you will miss out on a true pleasure of a hotel and restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris M wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: This is a quiet elegant hotel located on a dead end street but just a 3 minute walk to the complete madness of Place Jemma el Fina the immense square teeming with people snake charmers fire eaters etc. The hotel has a gorgeous outdoor pool served by two bars many sofas and nooks a perfect place to have a drink before dinner. But what gets this hotel 5 stars is Room 24 the Koutoubia Suite. Do whatever you have to do to land it. I stayed at the hotel as part of a small tour. I asked for an upgrade of our room in advance. What I got was my own Riad on the roof a small house. It had a 600 square foot patio with a sofa chairs 2 chaise lounges and a large working fireplace. Out one door was the heated roof top swimming pool and bar that was hardly used and felt like our own private pool. Inside the room was probably 1000 square feet with a bathroom suite including a tub you could float a small yacht in. This all overlooked the minaret of the Koutoubia Mosque which is dramatically lit at night with the moon rising behind it. After taking stock with my wife we rated it one of the top 3 hotel rooms we have ever had. In case you are curious the other 2 were a suite at the Four Seasons in NYC with a 500 square foot terrace and a room at the Post Ranch in the Big Sur with a free form rock hot tub perched over a 3000 foot drop into the ocean. In short this was something very special. Now for the best part. The upgrade to this from a standard room with a tour discount cost us only $148 extra per night. In Manhattan this room would be the equivalent of a $3 million dollar apartment. I think the regular rate was around $1000 a night but if you are with any sort of tour carpe diem ask for the room and go for the upgrade.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Simo I wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We had 2 nights at suite room i liked the view and beautiful bed with a good decoration of patals on it but sadly the breakfast was not bad and not fresh i got my stomach hurt from the omellette they made for me next time if i had chance to visit it i wont try their food anymore i will just try food out since the hotel has a good area near to jamaa fna and other coffee or restaurant
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Beautiful Hotel we travelled with Kuoni and met by Issam a very nice knowledgeable man not too pushy but got us the tour and guided tours we wanted with really excellent guides. Our suite was upgraded on arrival and Issam bought my husband a fantastic bunch of roses on learning it was his birthday. The hotel is a lovely oasis with 3 good restaurants it was fantastic located right next to the Koutoubia Mosque inside the city walls 2 minutes walk from the huge square and the Souks. This was amazingly busy especially in the evenings at weekends people come from far and wide to the city. I felt a little uncomfortable as there were motorbikes and hand pulled carts everywhere some motor bikes had whole families on Mum Dad and two kids - no helmets except Dad! Crossing a road felt like taking your life in your hands! I knew it would be different but didn't quite expect medieval different. Up in the Atlas mountains still ploughing with 2 donkeys and a wooden plough. All in all a fantastic city break with amazing 30 degree heat in November but be prepared for culture shock as European is isnt ! But that is what travel is for. The tourist industry has taken a hit here too in recent years but well worth the trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Perfection from start to finish. We were seated in the foyer and served with complimentary mint tea and petits fours while the reception staff booked us in. I thought I'd seen everything but WOW when we were shown into our room. Fresh fruit and roses were everywhere. The room was serviced twice a day.  It was only a 2 minute walk to Place Jemaa El Fina the large open square from which all the Souks ran off. Beware the guides!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As we were driven through the streets of the walled city of Medina our hearts sank. The taxi had to avoid all sorts of traffic-vehicles animals and people but we were overjoyed to be greeted in such a friendly manner on entering this wonderful hotel. It was a true oasis of calm. Of the three restaurants we loved the traditional Moroccan one with its bright red decor and wooden ceilings (plus the entertainment). Needless to say the food was plentiful and delicious at all times. All the staff were helpful and the two swimming pools were just built for inducing relaxation.Our patio room was spacious. FAB-U-LOUS!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Morris Family wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel - great facilities and service and probably the best location in Marrakech - 30 metres from the main square but once behind the front entrance a quiet oasis! Spa was very good (especially the Royal Moroccan Haman scrub and massage). Also the best Mojito in Marrakech in the sumptuous red piano bar. Views from the roof pool terrace to die for!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Pabna B wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Best indian food in marrakech. Very 5 star rated and excellent hospitality and services. Only downside stray cats nearby. Maharaja style and class. Wonderful staff. Would definitely visit again. A little expensive but did not matter as we were craving badly for an indian.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We just returned today from this amazing oasis. First thing I wanted to do was express how much we fell in love with this place.  When we first arrived (early in the morning 9:30) our room was understandably not ready yet. They kindly invited us to breakfast. An amazing full buffet breakfast by the pool. Much appreciated as we had woken up at 4 am to take our flight.  Shortly after just before 10:30 our room was ready. We were given an up grade to one of the most beautiful rooms in the hotel. This trip I must add was a special treat for my birthday. The staff went to all extremes to make it perfect! I was pampered beyond expectation and I would like to thank everybody at les jardins de la koutoubia for the AMAZING stay!! I hope to be back one day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Meena B wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: My first visit to Marrakech Morrocco and I loved it!! Staying at this hotel definitely contributed to my amazing experience without a doubt. What a beautiful hotel in the perfect location for me and my friend as we wanted to be close to the Big Square. This hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from there and also very close to the clubs and top restaurants in New Town. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel as it was pure LUXURY. Beautiful spacious room with a very luxurious bathroom two toilets living room area AC quiet peaceful ambience and top room service. I cannot fault this hotel in any way. There were two pools three different restaurants (Indian was exquisite and a must try!) bar spa and snooker lounge. The Wi-Fi signal was very good. The food at the hotel was also very nice choice of Moroccan and Lebanese style. We did not experience any issues staying here staff were very friendly helpful and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again and also recommend to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sharon L wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: 5 Star Hotel a short walk from the Square
Review_Text: We could not believe this hotel. Our room had a separate sitting are and two full bathrooms one with a soaking tub. This was a very relaxing place to stay with great amenities. Two swimming pools a day spa and three restaurants. We are an older couple but there were lots of families with babies in strollers and youngsters.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David A wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Great room, great service, great location
Review_Text: The journey from Marrakesh airport was a bit of a culture shock but arriving at the hotel an oasis of calm amidst the chaos of Marrakesh was a pleasure. The location couldn't be more central - right next to the Medina and opposite the Koutoubia mosque. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was huge and plush and we found all of the staff friendly helpful and courteous. The hotel's PR Manager (sorry I didn't get her name) took a personal interest in ensuring that our stay was a good one and Hameed the tour guide gave us some fantastic insights into the culture and history of Marrakesh. The rooftop pool was a delight as were the spa and the Indian restaurant. We will return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Disappointing given the fantastic location and the building itself.
Review_Text: Staying here for the second time this year and it is a lovely hotel in some ways. The location and the general ambience are indeed of a very high standard. However on this particular trip we are regretting not trying one of the other excellent hotels in Marrakech.    Be warned that the main swimming pool is not heated which means it has been pretty much empty every day. This is a real shame because around this pool is by far the nicest place to spend your time. The service around the pool is also less than attentive.    The much smaller pool on the roof is heated but has been full of children and it is not nearly such a nice space to hang out.    We have been particularly disappointed to discover that hotel guests can't use the indoor pool and spa area without paying 200 dirams per person (approx £15 per person). We were told we could spend the day for tha price but we only wanted to spend 30 minutes or so having a swim given the freezing pool upstairs. It seems a particularly ridiculous policy given that the indoor pool has been empty and it is currently raining outside!!    The hotel is quite dead in the evenings. I think this is because the main restaurant downstairs which serves Moroccan food isn't very popular. And the restaurant on the roof isn't that great either.    I am wondering if this hotel is resting on its laurels somewhat as it has had very good reviews in recent years. I am hoping that the hotel might raise its game because it has so much potential and some of the staff are very friendly and helpful.    I am yet to be convinced that I will be staying here for a third time…...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Fabulous hotel in a great location
Review_Text: I have just returned from a first time visit to Marrakesh with my daughter and we both loved this hotel. It is in an excellent position in the Medina just by the busy square and yet within it is an oasis of calm and luxury. We were greeted with mint tea and pastries and upgraded to a 2nd floor room overlooking the palm-fringed pool on the patio and with a view onto the famous Koutoubia Mosque. A nice touch was that the bed was freshly adorned each day with fresh rose petals. The bathroom was large with an excellent shower and we liked the separate toilet. Early evenings we enjoyed hearing the Moroccan musician play on the patio. The rooftop pool area was spacious and the food at the Asian restaurant on the same floor was superb. Friendly helpful service throughout the hotel and very good spa facilities. The only one small niggle was poor Wi-Fi but otherwise you would be hard pushed to fault anything about this hotel. We would definitely stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fabulous hotel, but some of the staff let it down
Review_Text: The hotel is in an excellent location with lovely rooms and facilities but some of the staff are less than helpful. On arrival we were upgraded to a suite and check in was efficient with really helpful people showing us to our room and explaining how everything worked. The room was very spacious with a large balcony and spotlessly clean. Room service later that evening was also very good. However the staff at breakfast were grumpy as were reception when we had a number of queries. The spa facilities are excellent as were the treatments that I had but again some of the staff weren't attentive and I was left to find my own way around. Service for food and drinks around the pool was slow and unfriendly but the girls cleaning the rooms were the very opposite nothing was too much trouble for them. On check out we asked for a taxi to the airport early the following morning but it didn't arrive and there was no apology. All in all a very mixed level of service but a very nice place to stay.

Review_Date: Sylviane W wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Conveniently located at entrance to Medina
Review_Text: Great location at the busy entrance to the Medina and near the Koutoubia mosque and gardens but once inside a haven of peace around the large swimming pool bordered on one side by tall palms. Very good service. Liked our very comfortable large room with a very well appointed large bathroom w/window w/tub and separate shower and a separate toilet on the second floor overlooking the pool. The buffet breakfast was very good and plentiful with a couple of stations for hot plates. The hotel has a major spa. The hairdresser the manicure and pedicure were excellent.  The only negative are the corridors which need new carpeting and one of the elevators was out of order for some time. And the wifi connection at the hotel's 2 pc's is not very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: great spot...dont be alarmed when you first arrive!!
Review_Text: Right next to the souk in the medina. Party of 16 with 8 rooms between us...I think the rooms got mixed up on arrival at reception? I booked a suite and although the room was lovely it wasn't a suite. My friend booked standard and got a suite. I asked at reception and they were very happy to move me but for a short trip I didn't want to repack/unpack again. The pool areas are lovely as are the eating areas. Nice time had by all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Third time and will be back.
Review_Text: As you can tell I really like this Hotel. Firstly it must be pointed out that this hotel is not 5 star possible 4 star at the best and possibly a excellent 3 star. The hotel is situated about a five minute walk to the Medina and Souk but as soon as you walk through the doors its like a sound barrier has come down it's so peaceful. Was upgraded on arrival so that was nice and although the hotel was full it didn't seem busy. A big must is to eat at the Indian and also the French the food is simply amazing. The staff are always friendly and helpful. Really cannot fault this hotel and we will be going back in a year or two.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Calm in the Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: The gardens around the Koutoubia mosque and minaret is a green oasis within the Medina quarter of Marrakech which is noted for its crowded Jemma-el-Fna plaza and the Souks market. The gardens are notable for its orange and palm trees. Since the mosque is 1000 years old the gardens offer a calm shaded walk in the midst of ancient history.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Long weekend break with friends first time in Marrakech this hotel was fabulous. Staff were welcoming approachable nothing was too much . Rooms were clean with air con. Spa facilities was of a high standard and just what we needed after a day at the waterfalls.  Being in the heart of the medina you could not hear the hustle and bustle of the outside.  The only downfall was the fact the toilet ( in the bedrooms ) was separate to the bathroom and had no sink so you had to go to the bathroom to wash hands and for us Muslims do isthinja not ideal !  All three pools were clean plenty of robes and towels.  Would defiantly recommend .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Loved our visit to Marrakesh but this hotel made it. Stunning colonial style hotel with huge rooms and bathrooms and in walking distance (minutes) from main square and souk. Our junior suite was splendid.  Would highly recommend Indian restaurant on rooftop.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James L wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Great hotel for first night in Marrakech!
Review_Text: We chose this hotel because the location style and reputation suggested it was a good place to spend the first night and adjust to the frantic pace of Marrakech. This worked well for us and we enjoyed one night here before moving on. We chose a garden view room - looking inward over the enclosed garden and pool - recommend this for peace and quiet. Room was veru good size although a bit old fashioned. Hotel staff were OK but not particularly service friendly. Breakfast as expected - we had a lunch there on arrival with some guests - a huge tagine average/good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect location for the main square. Short transfer from the airport. Lovely friendly hotel with good restaurants.
Review_Text: Great room although we didn't have a balcony but could open the french windows. We were upgraded to a small suite which was very spacious and clean. Two outdoor pools one on the roof with a pool bar/restaurant. In the evening this was an Asian restaurant which was superb we ate there 3 times. International restaurant had a good menu. Moroccan restaurant was good with belly dancing and music in the evening. We had lunch most days at the downstairs pool which we thoroughly enjoyed. All the staff are so helpful and friendly. It's a couple of minutes walk to the square and souks which seems to be buzzing all day and night. We went on the Marrakesh Discovery trip which was really good to get a feel for the city although was a bit long this took in lunch at a Moroccan restaurant which was good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Daniella S wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: This is a fabulous hotel and spa a 5 minute walk to the main square in medina. Hotel staff and concierge can't do enough for you to make your trip special. We ate at the hotels indian and French restaurants and both were very good and reasonably priced. The hotel is a fabulous locations to chill out just steps from the madness of the souks. I'll be back for sure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Have just returned from 5 nights at this stunning hotel. We arrived relatively late evening and were dubious as we were driven through the dusty motorbike ridden mayhem of Marrakech. After being dropped outside the hotel we were met by the doorman who took our bags we sat down in the grand reception area and was served mint tea and pastries. Check in was smooth with staff friendly and polite we were upgraded to a suite much to our delight and was amazed at the decor both inside and around the hotel.  To say this hotel is a haven of tranquility is an understatement as soon as you enter the lobby area the hustle and bustle of the streets outside are immediately left behind. At times it was difficult to imagine that we were in the centre of the medina as there was little if any noise from the outside.  The hotel has two pools one on the roof top terrace and the other in the courtyard of the hotel both have sufficient sun loungers with nice towels provided by the hotel.  Housekeeping was of a high standard with our bathroom towels being changed twice daily.  We ate at the Indian restaurant on the roof terrace and the Moroccan restaurant by the pool both were reasonably priced and the food was good.  Service around the pool was efficient with drinks being delivered to the sun loungers with olives and snacks.  We would definitely return to this hotel but was. It that keen on Marrakech itself
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lauren M wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Such a beautiful hotel .. Agreed with all other reviews.. Such an amazing clean and quite hotel compared to the hustle outside.    Staff all polite and friendly.    Ate In the indian twice once okay and second not so okay but each to their own.    I loved the hotel but didn't personally like marrakech.    All in all great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sebastian H wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Stopped in here for a few drinks before heading out for food. This place is high end set in lovely gardens with a beautiful pool. Was very envious that we didn't stay here. Will definitely come back and stay.

Review_Title: Great potential but didn't quite deliver...
Review_Text: Our Riad didn't have a pool so on the owners recommendation we visited this hotel.    The price was reasonable for a day by the pool (200 dirhams / £12.50) however the service was pretty poor. There's a lot of staff but they didn't seem to serve anyone!    The pool itself is a great space located just off the main square and very tranquil (be warned the water is pretty cold).    We ate lunch by the pool which was fine drinks during the day (alcoholic and soft) plus lunch for the day for 2 people came to about £45 in total.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is in a fabulous location just off the Place Jemaa el Fna (the main square in the old city and a stones throw from the Koutoubia Mosque . So outside is the usual Moroccan hussle and bustle and inside it's tranquil. The hotel is built around a large courtyard with a central pool (which we didn't try as it was December !). The rooms were spacious suites and overlooked the central or a side courtyard. The breakfast was wonderful in the restaurant. We had one evening meal and while tasty it was quiet. I can only assume the guests were eating out (and there's lots of local restaurants to chose from!).  There's a spa underground which my wife says was very good.
