There's also a pool in what feels like catacombs - great fun. There's also an Indian restaurant on the top floor which affords great views over the city.  A good place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing hotel for couples and families
Review_Text: From the outside all you really see of this hotel is the door and a red carpet. It looks very unassuming however this is a gem in Marrakesh. Its situated just a minute or two walk from the busy market and bus stops however once you walk inside you can't hear a thing from the outside. Its just pure calm and serenity once you step through the doors. We were very luck as we got upgraded to a suite on arrival and I must say it was glorious. Overlooking the pool and patio area with generous space inside.    The location of the hotel is perfect. You're close enough to the market for it to be easily accessible however far enough away to not deal with the crowds.    All the staff were very friendly and happy to assist in any way they could. You would be wise to come here with some basic French or Arabic although some of the staff did understand enough English to get by.    Breakfast was lovely if a bit same-y after 7 days. I would like to see more of a variety of Moroccan breakfast items rather than just usual cakes and fruits.    We arranged a couple of tours with the front desk which was handled efficiently and we had a great time on them so they have good contacts in this regard.    My biggest grip albeit something not everyone will care about is the gym. It was very basic with 2 treadmills a cross trainer a cycle and a multi purpose machine. A decent selection of dumbbells would have been lovely.    Otherwise I don't have much else to say it was overall a great place to stay and one we will be returning to for sure in the near future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: stephen m wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: This is a really nice hotel in brilliant location. It is really central but is really calm and quite inside.    The swimming pool and spa were great and the food excellent. We had a huge room and the bathroom was fabulous. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: David G wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: For a 5 star hotel it has a lot to improve.
Review_Text: Starting with language spoken. They assume you speak french or spanish! You approach staff in english and either they don't understand or reply in french or spanish! With us at check-in we hand our passports to fill info and the lady wrote on the form we were from Spain even with a completely different passport!  Room: room facing patio with very very bad soundproof with all doors and windows closed. You can listen clearly to a conversation at the pool cellphones ringing water splashing....everything! Impossible to take a nap and at dinner time you can listen cutlery glasses dishes chatting...  Food: for a 5 star hotel breakfast is poor. Moroccan restaurant and pool bar with NO or only 1 vegetarian option (pool bar vegetarian option only on fridays!). From 5pm to 7.30pm you can only eat if you call room service! They stop serving food by the pool at 5pm...unacceptable if you arrive by that time for a swim and can't order a drink or snack...  For more than 3 times we had the 'Do not disturb' sign outside and they entered our room.  Very very very slow internet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here in August 2015 for 4 nights before travelling to the Sofitel  This hotel in next to the main square in Marrakesh. Inside its a tranquil haven and you would not realise how close you are to the bustling souks and main square!  The staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly the rooms clean and spacious  We loved the rose petals on the bed and in the bathrooms!  My daughters room which joined ours via a balcony was also a lovely room and each day the maids left a rose for each of them and arranged my younger daughters soft toys!  The restaurants were also of an excellent standard we especially liked the Indian restaurant on the roof ( there is also another pool on the roof) the main pool is on the ground floor.  We weren't sure when booking if this hotel would be family friendly but it certainly was providing very nice chicken goujons for our little fussy eater! There were other family's staying with babies toobut it would still be a lovely romantic retreat for a couple.  We will definitely be back one day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This hotel is literally 1 minute walking distance from the popular and very noisy Djemaa el Fna but once you step inside the hotel all the noise disappears and you find yourself in the middle of quiteness and serenity. It has a beautifull pool in the garden and a pool at the rooftop where you have a lovely view of the Koutoubia Mosque. Really loved this hotel.    Only issue is that the staff doesn't understand English that well they really need to work on that. Especially the restaurant staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel was originally the largest riad in Marrakech and now is a luxury hotel so is perfect for anyone wanting to have the hotel luxury with authentic surroundings. The pools were brilliant courtyard for swimming roof terrace for sun bathing. Wouldn't bother with the restaurants as the food doesn't come up to the high stands of other restaurants in the area. You are a stroll away from the souks and yet you can't hear any commotion from inside the hotel! We were upgraded to a suite on arrival (off-peak season) and the room was gorgeous. Would recommend highly!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just arrived back from 5 nights here and it certainly is a calm away from the city! Literally as soon as you step through the door all the noise goes away. Staff are friendly and accommodating with the exception of having to ask three times for an extra pillow but a small issue.  Spa staff could have been friendlier and slightly more accommodating as they seemed very rigid in being exact.  Prices not cheap for food and drink but it is a hotel and many shops close by sell water and snacks.  Wifi rubbish in the rooms but ok by the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This hotel is spectacular there is absolutely nothing I can fault. The location is perfect to visit the medina which is what attracted me to book this hotel and I wasn't disappointed. It is an oasis amongst the chaos of the city. We booked a medina view and we're upgraded to a pool view. The room has fantastic facilities a bath with a view a shower room mini bar and the bonus of a hairdryer. Food and drink is value for money and the service is always served with a smile. Both pools have attractive surroundings one of the gardens the other a roof top towels are provided around the pool so no need to bring one. If you stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed I highly recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The Hotel was in the Medina and was a heaven.  All was a totally luxury hotel.  We loved the restaurant the rooms the service the pool the spa etc.....  It was a total heaven in the middle of the medina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Love this hotel. We just got back early our today and are already thinking of booking again. Our rooms were upgraded and they even arranged late check out which was great as I was travelling with my son.  This was our 2nd time at the hotelvery friendly staff can't do enough for you and have always got a smile for you.  It is in a perfect location to explore the Medina or the town centrea stone through away from main square.  i can't fault the hotel in any way it's a little gem in the madness of the hustle and bustle. It's a family friendly hotel and perfect from couples too.  Please ignore any bad reviews that are wrote about the hotel yes it probably needs to be updated in some areas of the hotel but over all it's lovely and the rooms can't be faulted.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: On arrival we were given a room upgrade to a suite. This wasn't a room it was an apartment with panoramic views over central Marrakech. The standard of decorsize and general ambience was first class. I've stayed in 5 star hotels in the UK and this suite beats them all with ease. We even had our own patio complete with sun loungers couches and an electronic sun canopy.  In general the layout and amenities in the hotel more than merit it's 5 star rating. To be honest you need to experience it to get the full picture. Most of the photos understate the beauty of this property. For example the pool on the roof is much bigger than we anticipated and that's a general theme throughout. The pool in the central courtyard is stunning and surrounded by lots of lovely trees and little hide away's.  The hotel location couldn't be better so be sure to get out there and meet some of the local people. We've travelled fairly extensively and can honestly say the people of Morrocco are the most articulate humerous and genuinely warm people we've come across. At his point special mention needs to be made of the hotel staff. The manageress was highly visible and regularly checked that guests were happy with their experience the lady that prepared the pancakes had a beautiful smile and made my daughter Erin feel very special the waiting staff were attentive the grounds staff we polite the lady on reception had a lovely manner and the cleaning staff were a delight. It is people that can often make an experience good or bad and this hotel will stay in my memory for years to come for all the right reasons.  The food was excellent with choices to suit most tastes. The restaurants are very reasonably priced for a hotel of this stature. We have also stayed in Le Jardin de la Medina and this one edges it on a number of fronts.  I'll finish by saying I honestly can't find anything negative to say and we would like to thank all the staff for giving my family a stay to remember. Get to Marrakech and stay at this hotel - a must do!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Nikit P wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Went on a 5 day holiday last week and stayed here was in shock at the way the hotel's architecture. As soon as we entered we were met with Moroccan herbal tea and pastries. After sitting near the pool waiting for the rooms to be made but once the rooms were ready we went up and the hotel management went the extra length and decorated my sister's room with balloons and a poster on her door saying happy 18th birthday    The hotel has 3 restaurants all situated in different parts of the hotel the Indian cuisine is on the rooftop Moroccan is on the groundfloor next to the pool and french is in the second garden and pool. The indian restuarant has a wide range of items it is perfect for vegetarians. Unfortunately the Moroccan and french restaurants do not have vegetarian options apart from one or two dishes.    The food tastes great especially with the option of ordering whatever style of indian curry you like (e.g. Madras Tikka etc).    The hotel has 2 pools one on the rooftop next to the indian restuarant and one on the ground floor in the centre of the hotel. The hotel is in the a square shape with the middle being hollow.    Overall throughout my stay the hotel staff were always smiling and willing to help they even offered to get a henna lady in from the market to apply henna on my sister's hands as we were too tired to go find one in the market. The room service was good and they were ready to give you anything you wanted.    On our last day we took advantage of a 30% off massage voucher which we could use in their massage centre in the basement of the hotel. They had over 500 massages available for male and females with the added availability to give you a massage that may have not been on the menu.    The breakfast was amazing with over 20 selections of muffins croissants and cakes. Fresh pancake station that made pancakes to order egg station that made fresh omelettes fried eggs and scrabbled eggs with chillis cheese and other items you wished for.    Overall during the whole stay the management treated us well and were there whenever we needed them be it from calling a taxi to getting us something that was not available in the hotel i.e. balloons we wanted balloons and they went and got it for us. They even told us want sort of taxi fairs to expect so that we don't get ripped off.    We spent around £3000 including 2 night dinners 4 day breakfasts massages poolside drinks etc. thats £3000 between 4 of us which was quite reasonable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Great hotel  lovely surroundings  2 pools  plenty sun loungers  helpful staff and lots of options at breakfast. You can have a snack by the pools or sit in one of the restaurants for lunch Great location too  just a few minutes walk from the main square and the start of the sooks and it really is an oasis of calm when you come back in from the noise and bustle of the streets and the square
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This was our second visit to Marrakech. Previously we had stayed in one of the many Riads. We found Les Jardins de la Koutoubia to be an oasis in amongst the hustle and bustle of downtown Marrakech. Room was large and clean and full of character. we had a small patio which looked out over the garden. Breakfast was excellent with wide choice of hot and cold food. Great to eat out looking out over the pool and greenery. Very peaceful. Would return here with no problem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: There are many many reviews confirming what a little jewel this is but I wanted to share this with you  when we arrived at the Hotel from the Airport I asked the receptionist if their was a fixed taxi fare and he confirmed there was at 100 Dirham when I told him we were charged 250 without our asking he went and checked the hotel cctv got the number of the taxi driver and insisted he came back and return 150 to us before he returned the receptionist took 150 out if his till and gave it to us. We will definitely be going back there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ali C wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: What a fantastic find. The welcome on our arrival was wonderful the hotel accommodation was comfortable and clean. (they gave us a complimentary upgrade because we were on our honeymoon). The options for dinner outstanding.    All the staff were friendly.    The central pool was clean and quiet.    In the evenings there was a short set of traditional Morrocan entertainment...which added to the ambience.    The position of the hotel is outstanding...literally within moments you are in the central hustle and bustle...yet when you are the hotel you feel like you are in the middle of no where. Perfect location to explore and relax.    We are excited to return some time to see more on Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is the best location. Very comfortable and clean. Very good breakfast. Marrakech itself was not my cup of tea but did not regret hotel choice. I found the staff pleasant and helpful. They even gave me a room on the last day as we had a late departing flight without extra charge. The food in the Indian restaurant was good not great. The rooftop pool lovely and warm plenty of sun beds and umbrellas. Walking distance to sights and restaurants. I did a lot of hotel searching before booking this hotel and I would go there again ( if it moved somewhere less uncomfortable once you step outside)!Enjoy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Unexpected amongst the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: I have a great love of Morooco stayed in apartments and hotels in Marrakech tthis is the best the food is to die for the staff very friendly.    The location is the best ever because 2 mins from main square were there is much to do in the evening but so tranquil inside rose petals everywhere arabic style very beautiful and very romantic I have stayed here a few times other places dont come close to the standards here
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Renato Gama wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: I have stayed there with my sister and wife in two rooms. Amazing hotel impeccable service and a pool that can't be better. Very well located near the Koutobia square. The hotel offered services to help you with the shops in the souq which by the way was not even a block from the hotel. Can't complain about nothing. I do recommend

Review_Date: Julie S wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: Great hotel around the corner from the square and market. The hotel is an oasis in the city the rooms are large spacious and soothing. Roses strewn on the bed and bathroom fragrant and a beautiful balcony overlooking the pool. Easily a 5 star in the U.S.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This hotel is an oasis - so close to the hustle and bustle of the square (2 min walk) and yet you walk through the door and its so tranquil. The hotel benefits from two fabulous pools (the largest one in the main couirtyard and a smaller one on the roof) and this is the reason I chose this hotel over a riad.    We were there a week and required the option of being able to cool off from the Marrakech heat so for this the hotel was ideal.    As we were staying a week we were also upgraded to a courtyard room.    Breakfast is great - fresh danish pastries (still warm from baking) and fresh fruit salad allow you to fill up and potentially not require lunch.    Tried the Indian restaurant - excellent but not particularly spicy.    Would throughly recommend Marrakech and this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I just spent 3 nights in this beautiful hotel in Marrakesh and i can't wait to go back!  As i've been to Marrakesh before and although the Riad i stayed in was very nice the location wasn't very satisfying so i was expecting that sort of thing…a beautiful place but in the middle of the caotic maze of the Medina so me and my friend were very positivly surprised when we saw that we were just few steps away from the main square (Jeema Al Fna).  The hotel decor is opulent but not exessive with the most beautiful garden and a very relaxing swimming pool.  We really enjoyed the roof top area with the smaller swimming pool and the fantastic view of the Mosque.  We were upgraded to a bigger room very spaciousclean and with a beautiful view.  The staff has been very helpful and accommodating with special thanks to Simo the (taxi driver) that has been taken care of us.  Breakfast was served in the garden and it has been very enjoyble everithing was fresh and very tasty from the orange juice to the pastry and the delicious jams.  We alsohad lunch and nice fresh smoothies by the pool.  I truly reccomend this hotel…and can't wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful spot for a drink but poor service
Review_Text: Poolside sunbathing area is a great spot to escape from the chaos of Marrakech. It is very tranquil and beautiful. But... service leaves a lot to be desired and it misses the Moroccan charm of the riads.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful oasis, set right in the centre
Review_Text: We have just returned from a weekend break. We stayed here last July but this time returned with some friends. We stayed in rooms 229 & 234 which are connected via a terrace. This was wonderful as each couple had there own privacy but the adjoining terrace offered a great place to all relax & catch up.  The rooms were spacious clean & comfortable. The hotel staff were all lovely & helpful except for Omlette lady who was good at cracking eggs but not a smile at breakfast!  Pool area is good. We only ate around the pool & in the Asian restaurant which were fine. The PR lady was once again very lovely & helpful.  We had treatments in the spa which were well worth it.  We hope to go back again in the autumn.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marie G wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: This was our second visit to this hotel . It's in a busy but safe street just a one minute walk from the main square. The garden area and pools are beautiful but apart from the waiter by the roof terrace pool and the wonderful piano bar waiter downstairs the rest of the staff need to learn how to smile.  The breakfast is good but I wish the pancake lady wouldn't serve pancakes with her bare hands.  Riads are normally a place of calm and quiet to allow you to chill after the madness of the Marrakech streets and this was indeed the case on our previous visit but unfortunately on this occasion there was a group of middle aged English guests that played loud music and acted as if they were partying in Ibiza both by the pool and through the nights in their room. We did complain one night as we had to get up early in the morning but it didn't help. The hotel should have dealt with them properly and they didn't instead we spent half our nights awake getting more and more annoyed.  It was just an unfortunate thing normally it's a lovely and serene place that I whole heartedly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This hotel is a true gem.... An oasis of calm conveniently located in the Medina close to The Souk and all attractions ..  Don't expect polished 5* deluxe... It's not .. But then neither is the price ....  But if you can forgive the odd broken tile you get Boho Chic for outstanding value ... The hotel is a Grand Old Dame that ouzes style charm and character ...  Some of the staff can have a French sternness sometimes but are genuinely hospitable and it runs well.. The rooms are very spacious and if you smile on check in you may even be updated to a junior suite ...  Thank you Houssein at the deck pool ... You are profoundly professional and have looked after myself and Lady Jo very well ...  If you fancy a night out dancing try Bo-sin or La Comptor ...  Give it a try .. It's a gem .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I have recently returned from a short trip with my mother and stayed for a few nights in Les Jardins de La Koutoubia.  The hotel was really beautiful and the setting very tranquil and peaceful.  Our room was fabulous and very well maintained and cleaned. The staff in the hotel were all outstanding and nothing was too much trouble. Whilst it is a luxury hotel it is very relaxing and calm without having an uncomfortable feeling like some other luxury hotels.  We ate in all of the restaurants and the food was excellent I can also highly recommend the cocktails.  Thank you so much for such a lovely stay and I would definitely return to this hotel.

Review_Title: Great for a roof top cocktail or swim
Review_Text: Great views of the Koutoubia Mosque. Great little roof terrace for drinks and snacks. Take a towel and have a dip in the roof pool overlooking the mosque A stone's throw from the central square too. Ground level pool environment also lovely
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nick V wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Nice hotel with good facilities decent rooms and a good central Medina location but sadly let down on checking out by inept and surly reception staff. I will return to Marrakech as it's a great place to visit but not to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It is not the best hotel ever but... Seen the location the staff and the restaurants... It is my preferred hotel in Marocco.  If you want ta visit Marrakech and enjoy it on full go there to restore your energies after a full flesh of excursions and excitement. You will fell blessed  Nice pools (top floor and ground floor) 4 different style restaurants and great staff make the J. My choice forever.  Price is also good (avoiding the high season) so... What else?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Excellent location for this lovely hotel hidden away from the chaotic streets of Marrakech. I would definitely stay here again - staff were all polite and helpful and the pool areas were great for chilling out after a busy day sightseeing. Also provide a great selection at the breakfast buffet!

Review_Title: Tranquility in the heart of Medina
Review_Text: Truly lovely hotel for a short stay.  Being situated in the madness of medina you would never expect to find such peace inside. The hotel is probably the largest one in the medina and certainly has the right standard to it.  To rooms are spacious with plenty of wardrobe space with a lovely bath which was decorated with rose petals everyday. Modern moroccan interior flows really nicely throughout the building and rooms. It has 3 swimming pools - the main garden one (get your beds reserved early) the roof one - perfect for all day sunbathing and one more next to International restaurant (not sure if you can sunbathe there).  The Spa. Really nice - treatments were great. I've tried 1 hour facial which made my skin feel soft and hydrated the massage my partner had was great as well. Very strangely you have to pay to use the Spa (pool and steam room) but it's complimentary if you buy a treatment.  Talking food - 3 restaurants with great setting. The international one - without a doubt my favourite. Very romantic and chilled outdoors setting food was simply great and perfect for modern european taste. Sadly cannot say the same about the asian and Moroccan restaurants even though the atmosphere was nice the food was rather disappointing.  All in all a lovely hotel that I would recommend to friends yet certain things were a let down - the air-con wasn't powerful enough for 42C!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diane M wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: So peaceful inside the doors of the hotel compared to the manic conditions outside. Traffic chaotic but taxi driver negotiated safely. Hotel make you feel welcome and do everything to make your stay enjoyable. Breakfast excellent and lunch/diner from the rooftop Asian restaurant are excellent. Pools and sunbeds super. WiFi throughout the hotel was spot on despite some reviews stating the contrary. Rooms spacious and the roses/petals each day add a little extra.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anja O wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Fantastic location- 2 minutes from the main square and souks. Lovely roof top pool rooms are small but extremely nice and tastefully decorated- loved it!    The only downside is that check in at 2pm is not reliable. I showed up at 2.20pm and had to hang around for a further 30minutes before my room was ready.  There is also no complimentary water in the rooms which for a 5* hotel like this would have been nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Patricia R wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Just checking out from this hotel I have to say this place is gorgeous. The rooms are huge and beautifully decorated the bed is very confy but the pool does it all. We could not have picked a better place to get away from the chaos of the city. As soon as you walk in you feel you have reached paradise. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Last Night of Luxury in Marrakech
Review_Text: Having stayed at a Riad for most of our stay in Marrakech we decided to get a well rounded experience by spending the last 24 hours in this luxury hotel.    We had no regrets as upon arrival we were immediately offered mint tea (obviously) and upgraded to a mini suite. I'd be intrigued to know what the regular suites look like because the room we were given was spacious and luxurious.    It was a shame we still had so much to see in town because you could book a trip to this hotel not step out a ingle day and still have a great time. There are multiple dining areas three different restaurants at least two pools and various sunbathing locations with great views of the Koutoubia minaret. It felt exotic and classy - highly recommended.    There's also the added bonus that you are right in the centre of the city! I don't think we could've been closer to the centre.    Amazing! Just amazing!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Danny E wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Great stay helpful and friendly staff. The separate children's pool is a real plus.  The souks are just around the corner. Inside the hotel premises you still forget the buzz of the city with its wonderful gardens beautifully lit at nighttime

Review_Title: Calm and Tranquil In the Medina
Review_Text: My husband and I spent a week at this lovely gem in the middle of the Medina of Marrakesh. The hotel gave us a calm and tranquil hideaway right in the Medina. The room was spacious and overlooked the pool. Rose petals scattered on our bed and around the bathroom. Breakfast was a great affair with a huge selection of choice. The bar was lovely with a seating area outside beside the pool. The service at the pool great with a lovely selection of snacks and drinks. Staff were all very helpful and I highly recommend this hotel. They were so helpful and gave us a late check out as our flight was in the evening. Full marks all around!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We only had drinks in this restaurant. The setting is absolutely beautiful staff very friendly. Food looked good although we only enjoyed their terrace for a few drinks. For us was the perfect place to enjoy a warm Marrakeah evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely hotel in a great location
Review_Text: We stayed here for 6 nights we chose this hotel because of the location and good reviews. We ordered a car to pick us up the airport it was very expensive at 300 dirhams can only assume it was the hour. We landed at 1240am but other than the price it was a good hassle free pick up.    We booked a medina room and were upgraded to a lovely mini suite on the second floor which we were very grateful for. Massive room with a lounge area and balcony. I did specifically ask for a room away from the elavators having read reviews saying that they are quite noisy and they said that was fine so was abit bemused to find our room was next to one! but luckily not one that was used a lot so wasn't an issue. It was authentically decorated with big pictures a large tv that had some English movies channels. Fruit was replenished nice big shower with strong pressure just to note that the privacy of the shower area was only protected by a see through curtain so if you are staying with friends you might need to work out a rota!.    Two pools as has been mentioned the ground floor one doesn't really seem to be serviced in terms of fresh towels or people serving drinks. The rooftop one however the staff were far more attentive and the view is amazing. You have the usual problem of selfish people saving their sun beds with towels for hours before they plan to use them and spoiling it for others. The staff really should do more about this they have got some pool rules that prohibit this practice so they should enforce it as there aren't enough sun beds for guests. There is a restaurant by the pool that serves drinks and lovely food.    Breakfast was included I do love hotel breakfasts and there was a nice mix of everything. Lots of fresh fruit Lovely pancakes my favourite! ..The bread was very very dry so would avoid that. There was someone cooking eggs on a hot plate to order. Something I found strange was that they cooked plain omelettes on the same hot plate as ham ones Being a Muslim country there is expectation that you would haven't to worry about these sort of things but given my experiences I would just be careful what you eat if you have specific dietary requirements.    Other things I found generally the staff were friendly and attentive the location is great right in the middle of everything so there is no pressure to haggle with taxi drivers to take you anywhere unless you want to go further afield. I used the spa a couple of times and would definitely recommend a visit. Easy uncomplicated holiday in a beautiful hotel giving it 4 because it is 5 star hotel with 5 star prices so the expectations are higher!.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fiona L wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We have just had a week here . If you want a glossy new 5 star hotel this is not for you . It's gorgeously traditional with luxury Marrakech style . Rooms are cool and elegant  the pools clean and calm  service is perfect . If you step out you are on the midst of the hustle of the souks and within easy walking distance of great restaurants  but you could quite happily stay and enjoy the charm of the hotel

Review_Title: Beautiful calming hideaway in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Five of us in all my husband parents and 12 year old daughter had no idea what to expect after a lot of travelling and only checking in about 930 pm on Saturday night. In the heart of the medina the craziness of the short transfer from the airport and then the unobtrusive hotel entrance we wondered about our choices! However stepping inside the hotel and into reception we could have been stepping back in time. Heritage and history of ancient Marrakech with subtle luxury was the feeling as we checked in. A porter in traditional dress gave us some sweet tea and then then receptionist urged us to go into one of the restaurants as it was late and she would check us in and have our bags sent straight to our rooms.  We dined in the Moroccan restaurant on the first night and with traditional live music in the background whilst enjoying excellent local cuisine we knew we had made the right choice with this fabulous hotel. There are three restaurants at the hotel and we ate in all of them with the Indian and french restaurants all so very enjoyable. Probably the best half board deal we have ever had not your usual boring repetitive buffet but with 300 dirhams credit per person we struggled even with 3 coursers to spend the money!    This hotel is authentic and a real oasis of calm and literally about a four minute walk away from the main square " Jemaa el fna " which is just too mad an experience to b able to accurately describe here... From souks where you you can great bargains for leather goods to 5 year olds selling biscuits snake charmers dancers musicians all with aromas of fresh cooking. A real assault on the senses This square has to be on your bucket List but is not for the faint hearted and you need to have your wits about you.    Location of this hotel is probably one of its best assets alongside its charmauthenticity quiet luxury and strange calm amidst the madness of the Medina. We would definitely recommend this hotel even to families our 12 year old daughter had 2 pools to choose from with a table tennis table and pool table to keep her entertained. The main ground floor pool is enveloped in a lovely garden giving us relax time inbetween adventures.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kevin L wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Within the madness that is the medina is the calm oasis of this hotel. It's like an old stately home with loads of character and charm. With it 3 restaurants main pool and rooftop pool plus spa you can't go wrong booking into this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Chris E wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Supreme Luxury in a wonderful setting, amongst the chaos of the Medina!
Review_Text: Superb hotel offering supreme luxury and tranquillity in the heart of Marrakech's medina. Stepping in from the heat of the city the grounds of this hotel are an oasis of peace and calmness. Fantastic room great pool. Didn't eat there but had a decent cocktail.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great respite from the busy street alongside.
Review_Text: Cool shaded areas and colourful plants. A nice place to stroll and maybe get a carriage ride at the one end of the gardens. Could do with renovating and using the fountain area but worth a visit all the same. X
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An oasis of calm in the midst of chaos
Review_Text: We only spent one night in this hotel after our flight was cancelled. It was quite expensive for Marrakesh over £225 for a night but well worth it - absolutely no quibbles. The staff were very accommodating the service outstanding and the rooms luxurious. What really sets this place apart is that it is right in the heart of the Medina very close to Jamaa Al Fana and the souks but the moment you step in to this place you are transformed from utter chaos one moment to a peaceful retreat. I absolutely loved the way the hotel is set out traditional and oozing style everywhere. The swimming pool in the midst of the courtyard is so magical. We wish we had more time to appreciate this property but had to sadly leave in the morning.This has simply got to be the best located hotel in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: What a lovely way to spend time in Marrakech. The hotel is welcoming annd generous.  Lovely piano bar and french restaurant. We enjoyed the daily rose petal patterns on our bed and how quick it was to get to the heart of the city
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amanda L wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Asian restaurant and piano bar worth a visit
Review_Text: We found the hotel on our first night tired hungry and thirsty. Had a drink in the piano bar first which was relaxing although cigarette smoke takes a bit of getting used to and the pianist "strangers in the night" etc is accompanied by some weird sort of sound system. Still a welcome respite from the hecticness outside especially as it was raining and cold. Then we managed to get a table in the hotel's Asian restaurant upstairs which was fully booked even though it was Monday night. Excellent lamb jalfrezi and chicken tandoori and a welcome fire.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What an unbelievably gorgeous place to stay. Luxurious with great service. Laid back with a sophisticated feel about it. Travelled with my daughter for a long weekend away to relax and sit in the sun. The hotel is exceptional. On arrival we were welcomed so charmingly by the front desk manager and his assistant who couldn't do enough for us throughout our trip. They upgraded us to a fabulous suite overlooking the main pool with birds singing outside our window. This is probably the best situated property in Marrakech being situated in the middle of the Medina with the fun of the hustle and bustle outside the door but a calm and sophisticated hotel. The hotel benefits from 3 restaurants - we ate at the Morrocan which was lovely but the Indian on the roof terrace adjacent to the second pool area was exceptional. If you want an unbelievable experience at a gorgeous hotel look no further. This is a wonderful place that is run like a Riad but with the advantages of a larger property. I'd definitely come back again as a destination hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Tranquility but yet, still in the heart of all the action!
Review_Text: We stayed here for a short break in February and found the whole experience wonderful.    The hotel is gorgeous characterful and has lots of areas around the grounds that you can 'retreat' to which are tucked away so you don't need to stay in your room. All the staff were wonderful spoke good english and were very helpful.    There is the pool in the main area of the hotel on the ground floor one on the roof (which we got to use even in February!) and another in the spa area (though I never saw this one).    Our room was large clean and well catered for (2 tv's(!) a mini bar & large patio) and overlooked a quiet area at the back of the hotel.    The location was wonderful. Just 10 minutes in a taxi from the airport and a short walk to the main square where the night market is and the maze of souks which is great when you have just had enough and want peace and quiet.    The breakfast is well catered for with cold and hot buffet and on hand cooks making fresh omelettes & pancakes (a real treat).    We are already planning our return trip next February!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: DavidBarbara B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Travelling with Classic Collection we were met at the airport and whisked to our hotel. It is in an ideal position. All the important sights of Marrakesh were within walking distance. Room was comfortable and clean - overlooking main swimming pool. Excellent breakfast choice. There are three restaurants and we ate in the Moroccan - good food and atmosphere - and La Plaisir which was very quiet and though the food was of a reasonable standard I ordered a sirloin steak which was in fact 6 thin slices of thin veal - very nice but not what I had ordered. We spent so0me time on the terrace by the pool there and noticed the Indian restaurant was very popular. All the staff spoke good English and were extremely helpful. Overall a very good base from which to explore the delights of this exotic destination
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sean C wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: First of all some parts of the hotel are not UK and Ireland 5 star standard such as the bedrooms which are 4 star (Try the Marker in Dublin if you want to see 5 star). But I didn't go expecting 5 star so was not disappointed. I loved everything about this hotel. The beautiful swimming pool areas in the hotel which you don't get in UK and Ireland 5 Star make up for it. Perfect position for exploring in a short time.The staff were brilliant polite and helpful (As everyone we met in Marrakech where) especially the barman in the Piano bar who could speak some Irish (amazing and funny). The food was excellent especially in the 3rd floor Indian restaurant. My wife and I went to the Hotel Spa for Hammam with black soap followed by massage. Have never done anything like this before but it was brilliant. The Spa was beautiful and very relaxing.  This is a fantastic hotel. Go and experience it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel was a last minute booking that we wished we had allowed more time at. Travelling with 3 adults we took advantage of all the hotel had to offer including lovely swimming pool outdoor poolside restaurant & modern rooms. Overall our stay was really positive with the only downsides we found were: the hotel restaurants were very expensive compared to restaurants elsewhere as a guest you are reliant on the hotel facilities as it is located well away from the city centre and other experiences. Staff were a bit rude although you don't have to spend time with the apart from checking in etc and that's a bonus! You will enjoy this hotel for its relaxing pool and nice rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Anna S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: One of the greatest hotels I've ever stayed
Review_Text: Room upgrade on arrival early check in late check out amazing and friendly staff great food at the international restaurant and snack bar by the main pool very good breakfast clean rooms luxurious....  Close to everything at the centre of Marrakech.  Great experience a bit pricey but totally value for money.  I recommend this hotel for anyone who would like to relax and have a great time at this beautiful hotel.  Only problem we had during the first 2 days of our stay was the Internet connection which was only at the lobby but they fixed it as soon as they could.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Louise c wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: This hotel is just lovely. We have been upgraded to a suite with the most wonderful views of koutoubia mosque from our private patio. The room is spacious and very clean. The staff are friendly and the roof top pool wow! I want to stay here forever.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this property having stayed before some years ago. However if you are offered a mini suite you will NOT be in the main hotel. Clearly what has happened here is the hotel has acquired another adjacent former hotel which is accessed by a narrow alley off the main pool courtyard. Yes you will have views of the mosque (and the back of some other retail properties) the courtyard here is not up to the same standard though the rooms are nice. You can be sure about this as the previous hotel sign is over the entrance. We were disappointed as we had actually booked a room over looking the centre pool. Too late did we realise our mistake as we had already unpacked and didn't fancy moving again. The international restaurant is also in this part which is good. Breakfast is excellent and so is the Indian restuarant with lovely views. The location of this property is superb two minutes from the square and medina. Just beware what room you are offered
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Les Jardins de la Koutoubia in the Medina is situated a mere 3 or 4 minutes walk from La Place and the souks - depending on how long and often you are slowed down by people wanting to sell their stuff or offer you a ride in the horse-drawn buggies. Relatively unimpressive front to the street the full charm of the hotel will begin to get you once you enter the lobby: elegantly styled it opens to one of the (three) pools ( one heated ). And all of a sudden you feel far away from the hassle of the streets.The room we were given was lavishly decorated overlooking the patio.  The service people are charming and very observant.  Of the three restaurants we visited only the Morrocan ( ok but nothing to shout about a little astounding the appearance of a belly dancer later in the evening ) and the outstanding Indian place on the 3. floor - excellent cuisine great local wines and the service a charming lot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Elisa N wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: I've been coming to this hotel for many years and it never disappoints. It is full of character and tranquility. Its location - literally less than a minute from Djeema El Fna - allows you to combine relaxing by the fabulous pools with shopping at the souk. The breakfast is absolutely outstanding and served in the perfect setting (you must see the photos) and for us it means no lunch as we always overindulge. The spa is our favourite anywhere that we have visited. We had a few issues with the room during our last stay in September and we couldn't have wished a better response from the staff. There are seven of us going back this Easter and we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. Absolute heaven.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is a real oasis in the main centre of Marrakech. You cannot imagine what it really is until you go there. We spent 4 days there and had a great time. The restaurant is also really good I highly recommend the steak tartar. The chef is very nice and also the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of calm in Marrakesh Medina
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend Feb 6th-9th 2015. The hotel is very conveniently situated near the Koutobia Mosque and right behind the main square of the Medina so you can pop out and walk to everything in the old quarter - we found it a perfect location.    The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very quiet on the first floor overlooking the courtyard and swimming pool with a small balcony. We slept like logs every night and only once did I hear the call to prayer at 6.00 am. The breakfast was very good. I had the lovely fresh prunes figs and apricots with their yoghurt every day as they were so fresh and delicious. We only discovered the lady who makes the pancakes and flat breads on our last morning which was a shame as we would have liked to have had those each day instead of the brown bread which was disappointing and dry. The rest of the food was very good.. We didn't eat in the restaurants at all apart from our buffet restaurant as we went out each night. The bar was nice with a pianist on some nights and piped music on others. The housekeeping was excellent especially the nice touches of rose petals on your bed slippers and fresh roses on your bath robes! I would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I visited this beautiful hotel in the heart of Marrakach which is literally a two minute walk to the main square. The entrance opens to a lovely reception area and has two swimming pools one on the ground floor and one on the roof top. The staff are 1st class and warm and welcoming. We (a group of 7 ladies celebrating a birthday) were upgraded to suites and they were just enchanting. Nothing is two much trouble and all with a smile. The receptionist the waiters the pool man and security were fantastic. They even made a beautiful cake for the birthday lady on the Saturday and we throughly enjoyed the belly dancing that evening and the lovely music from the two man band. The waiting staff and the band played/sang happy birthday in Arabic. I would highly recommend this hotel with lovely restaurants and the breakfast is just fantastic with mutiple food choices. I hope to go back very soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This hotel is a real oasis - luxury and opulent but next to the very heart of marrakech - we loved it !    We were upgraded to a mini suite and this spoiled us ! The staff are very very helpful - Breakfast was superb .    One of the major highlights of our stay in marrakech was our hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: R W wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We visited the Piano Bar here for a couple of glasses of wine. It's a fabulous place with a fabulous setting right on the edge of the main square. Wine is about 200Dh for a bottle (about £14 ) - much the local "going rate." There is live piano music and singing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent oasis right in the middle of the action
Review_Text: Ive read a bunch of the reviews here and they all have elements of truth.    This place is great but it is showing some wear. We were upgraded to a suite on arrival. It was huge with its own outdoor area by the heated pool. No complaints about the room or the grounds which were lovely.    The front desk staff I found to be quite helpful when asked. The elevators need to be replaced and yes the furniture needs to be spruced up but you are literally right in the main square and the medina a better location you will not find.    Breakfast was large; we ate at the international restaurant and the Indian restaurant. Being married to an Indian and knowing what good Indian food tastes like I'd say skip the Indian place but the international one was pretty good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma W wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Great location and walkable to most of the sites in Marrakech. Rooms are fairly simple clean and have all you need. Food was excellent in the Moroccan style restaurant and Indian we didn't eat in the French restaurants. Hamman amazing and great value for money. Staff were super friendly and attentive. Highly recommend you hire a guide from this hotel - we did it one day and were so impressed we hired him the following day - very cost effective and can tailor an outing to exactly what you want to see.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Lovely Hotel in a perfect location
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 7 day stay in this hotel which is in a perfect central location. We were warmly greeted at the reception and given mint tea and morrocan pastries whilst checking in.    The hotel is very clean and comfortable with lots of areas to sit in the shade or the sun. The decor is very traditional creating a wonderful authentic Morrocan atmosphere. Our room was lovely and spacious with a nice terrace facing the gardens and the Wifi worked really well. The roof terrace is fab with a heated outdoor pool the garden pool is also heated and great for a swim. The breakfast was plentiful and offers a good selection of hot & cold choices. All the staff in the hotel were very helpful and friendly. The bar is cosy and relaxing and serve lovely cocktails. The reception exchange sterling at a good rate and don't mind exchanging small amounts which is handy during the last days of your holiday.    We can highly recommend booking via the reception the hotel guide called Abdel Hamid Labyad. We booked 2 walking tours one for the south and the other for the north each tour was about 3 hours and cost 300 dirhams (this did not include entrance fees to palaces etc but they are only 10 dirhams each). Hamid was very friendly and knowledgeable and made each tour a very interesting experience. We went to several areas and saw many things that we would not of found on our own and having someone explain the meaning of it all made it so much more enjoyable and worthwhile.    For dining we enjoyed a lovely evening in the Dar Essalam restaurant which is situated in the souk about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The decor is amazing good food and there are musicians and belly dancers making a really fun evening. This restaurant is also famous for its connection with a Hitchcock film. We also dined in the International restaurant at La Maison Arabe again about 10 minutes walk from the hotel towards the Hivernage area. The International restaurant is by the pool in a beautiful setting and the menu offers International and Morrocan dishes they also have a Morrocan restaurant in another part of the Riad. We first had a drink in their Jazz bar then went for dinner which was an all round excellent fine dining experience. The hotel reception will book tables for restaurants and give you directions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: HECTOR D wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We love to be in this hotel! Perfect location walking distance to mayor attractions. The hotel is very comfortable and mystic. The pool area is very nice and needed after a day tour in the Medina and areas around. Remember Marrakech is an exotic destination so take your precautions. Visit the Medina first with a guide if you want to go deep there. Avoid uncrowded areas at night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Manuel A wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: In style in the heart of the city
Review_Text: From the outside one would not say this is a wow! hotel located right in the centre of the city. It has everything a tourist visiting Morocco wishes including the large swimming pool within the hotel walls. I was so impressed about the set-up and services that I asked the manager how comes the advertising is not to the level of the hotel itself. Ok there may be small inconveniences that one may encounter but the open-minded tourist should place the hotel within its environment and enjoy it fully.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard V wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Visit for lunch only - food was average/ pool area was lovely
Review_Text: We visited the hotel for lunch and the pool area is beautiful and peaceful especially considering how close it is to the main square. However the food (tagine) was average the portions were small and it was overpriced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: William W wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We went for dinner one evening in the Moroccan restaurant (Gastro MK at Maison MK was closed) and were very pleasantly surprised. Very quiet (it was mid-December) but the food was far better than standard tourist restaurant and hotel fare (such as Le Salama). Not a destination restaurant but overall service was excellent and well-priced (since when did a tagine become £15 to £20 in Marrakech?).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The misses for me are in the details and the front desk customer service here. I booked a mini suit with 2 beds as I was traveling with my dad. When we got into our room it was a romantic couples suite with rose petals everywhere and a large bed. I said we booked a suite with 2 beds and the guy told me to just pull the beds apart. This is certainly not was I expected for 300+ Euros a night. I shouldn't have to pull the romantic couple bed apart to accommodate myself into a suite I booked. The room was big though and nice but certainly not very clean. I had to wear the slippers around in the room as the floors were dirty. The bathrooms were a bit dirty and some of the toiletries had already been used as the one by the bath tub was half empty. The staff in the restaurants and at breakfast were very friendly and nice but front desk service was pretty awful. They weren't very friendly and were a bit curt when they spoke to you. I encountered 3 different people at the front desk from the time I checked in and checked out in the 2 days I stayed there and they were all rude. They will help you get stuffed booked or done but they just aren't very nice about it. I booked this place based on location and that in itself is great. This is my second time to Marrakech and if I head back I wouldn't stay here again. The price I paid and the customer service I got don't align for me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I was not a guest at the hotel but went here for the spa. I opted for the moroccan hammam followed by a toning massage. It was a very relaxing and peaceful experience and I enjoyed it very much. The lady at the reception was very helpful and accommodated me despite them being busy and me having no appointment. The best thing is you can use their pool facilities before or after any treatment and they even served delicious mint tea.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lene T wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: Nice hotel, but not a 5-star experience
Review_Text: Overall a beautiful hotel in a great location. We especially enjoyed relaxing on the daybeads by the pool area in the courtyard.    We stayed in a junior suite on the 3rd floor in the new wing. From our private terrace we had a perfect view of the Koutoubia Mosque. The room was clean but unfortunately the quality of the room was dissappointing. The fountain on the terrace didn't work sockets were falling apart etc.  This is not ok when you stay and pay for a suite in a 5 star hotel. We've stayed in riads in Marrakech for half the price and with a much better room standard.    The staff was helpful and friendly.    We recommend having dinner at the Indian restaturant (Le Jardin de Bala) on the roof terrace. The food is delicoius and the atmosphere is cosy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Allan S wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: An Oasis of calm in a town of madness
Review_Text: This is advertised as 5 star and it very nearly is. Good food served throughout and the service is excellent throughout the hotel but particulary good in the reception and bar area's. Most staff here appeared to be very happy all the time either that or they were mad but what ever it was they were very friendly couteous and very good at their job.    Outside this Oasis is another story. It is madness and everyone wants a piece of action or mainly your money. There is one guide named Abdul (who isn't named Abdul around here) who is very godd and takes his time showing you around the souks. He is right outside the hotel door every day. speaks perfect English and you'll recognise him by his 3 teeth!!! Seriously he's good. would I go back to Marakech? not in a million years. Enjoy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was not a guest in the hotel but came to eat in Restaurant Morocain with a friend. We sat in the room with live music and a belly dancer appeared for a very short while. The room is comfortable with red upholstery and white napery. We shared some local rose and the Moroccan salad then I ordered and greatly enjoyed the beef tagine with peas and artichokes. Service was good. Maybe it is a little overpriced but we had a nice evening. A cat did wander through the restaurant and that does not bother me at all but it may be an issue for others although maybe it was a one off.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Robert Grimm wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: This hotel is an amazing experience. Outside was the Moroccan life in its full glory people everywhere and life laughter and smiles. As soon as we stepped inside of the hotel all the street sounds were silent completely relaxing. Greeted by the friendly staff how helped us to the suite that we booked for a weeks stay.    The room the service and the food is out of this world by far the best one we stayed in. They offer multiple choices of restaurants in the hotel Indian and Moroccan are the best in house not to mention the breakfast.    Heated pool on the roof and a bigger pool on ground floor spa with a classic Moroccan hammam. This is a perfect getaway for everyone.    This is not exactly a kids type of hotel but my daughter was treated like a princess everywhere we went FYI.. she had the whole pool to her self all week :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great Location and a great hotel
Review_Text: Stay at this hotel. It has some issues but those are easily overcome by the friendliness of the staff the beautiful hotel layout and the location next to the Jmaa Fel Naa square. Our room was very clean the rain forest shower was very nice and the people were very friendly and ready to serve. They also spoke a variety of languages and my minimal French was not a problem. The breakfast layout was very substantial and they had something for everyone even halal and kosher meats. The coffee was to die for. At night they had entertainment both in the restaurant and in the open piazza next to the pool. We enjoyed the outside guy in particular -- he played a native stringed instrument and we liked his music so much we went out and bought CDs. He was very entertaining and interacted well with the small group by the fireplace. Despite these wonderful aspects the hotel has some drawbacks. The carpets are ratty and worn and the elevator door does not always open and shut properly. More important when we arrived at 10AM we had to wait almost two hours to get a room. This is OK because the lobby is nice and they provided tea (once) with cookies. But waiting that long when you have a reservation is not good. The hotel made up for it and gave our small group two adjoining rooms and a balcony that overlooked the courtyard. This made it very nice and we appreciated the hotel's effort. The only drawback to this very nice upgrade was the internet. I don't know if it was the room we were in or our technology but the internet was a constant problem throughout the trip. I am glad this was not a business trip and was very happy to be vacation. However if i remain true to my rankings with internet so important it will cost a circle if it does not work well. Something else that works agains the hotel is not having any coffee in the rooms. You have to go downstairs to get breakfast to get any coffee in the morning. For me this is a major inconvenience. You might also want to straighten out the indoor pool situation. The hotel advertises the pool but you have to pay to use it and then not for the week -- it is per visit. I thought this given the advertising was a bit misleading. Finally be careful when you leave the hotel. There are 'guides' and such that stand outside the door and will solicit you when you leave. Onc eyou get used to it it is OK but it is a little nervewracking walking out. Overall this hotel is an oasis of calm right near the chaotic environment of the main sqaure. Stay here and even with the small challenges you will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely hotel but careful about your room choice.
Review_Text: We arrived late in the evening very tired and were given a room on the second floor. Just wanting to sleep this proved to be impossible as there was a constant noise outside the room  initially we thought it was the lift however it turned out to be a dumb waiter taking food to the top floor restaurant . We complain and were told they would oil the pulley. By now it was rather late and only on our persistence did we eventually get moved . The second room was an improvement . However I believe that the rooms parallel to the dumb waiter I think it was 219 should not be used as it is impossible to sleep!!!! Nevertheless the hotel is charming clean and we enjoyed our stay once we were settled .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Relaxing escape from the real world.
Review_Text: We stayed here 5-12 Nov and the remit was sun soaked relaxation with culture on our doorstep.    We were collected by friendly hotel driver from airport all seamless. 200 dirham return pp. it's a lot in comparison to local taxi's but saved us hassle.    We were booked into a mini suite which was ideal for us. A huge opulent bathroom massive bed a living area and a balcony (our view was the garden area directly above french restaurant). For the ladies: good hair dryer. The downsides though - the rooms are very hot which made it difficult to have a comfortable rest. Also the noise from rooms screeching chairs heels stomping around and the lifts was annoying. On a separate note we had a welcome bottle of water and fruit. I would think when one is paying £200 + per night a daily bottle of complimentary water is not too much to ask.    The hotel is charming and the architecture is simply lovely great pool area and we also liked the roof pool with the most breathtaking view of the Atlas Mountains.  The swimming pool however could cause a cardiac arrest!!    Lovely outside space pool table library and covered areas to take a break from the sun.    Great buffet breakfast - loved the fresh juice whilst it is continental it also offered hot food - omelettes pancakes bacon. We often took coffee and pastries back to our room to enjoy on balcony.    The restaurants are poor - on our first night tired from travelling we went to the Moroccon restaurant we had lamb and monkfish tagines bland and expensive. The Indian was also the same to be honest. The staff could do with slapping a smile on too.    The piano bar is great for a cocktail and comical/cheesy pianist though not intentionally (sorry).    All of the hotel staff Indian restaurant aside were so lovely to us friendly and welcoming. We had an issue with our bill at check out (someone signed for items using our room number and they handled it very well).    So I hope a balanced review and we do recommend this hotel - thank you so much Les Jardins our remit was accomplished.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Recently stayed at this hotel with two friends for a long weekend with each of us having our own room. The hotel is in an excellent location literally on the doorstep to the Jamaa el Fna square and the Souks. The convenience of just being able to pop over to the Medina without having to deal with the hassle of taking a cab every time is hard to beat. The hotel itself has a great deal of charm and is decorated lavishly. If you look closely there's some of wear and tear but in a way it just adds to the charm a bit like an old aunt in a glamorous but slightly frayed ball gown. Nevertheless it's absolutely clean no dirt or bugs anywhere.    The rooms are all great but there are huge differences in categories. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a mini suite and felt truly spoilt in a huge room with patio green marble bathroom and huge bed. There are some issues with noise however mostly due to the stone floors. One morning I was woken up by someone dancing tango in high heels in the room above or at least that's what it sounded like.    The staff is very sweet and helpful as well. You do get a smile from most of them and they're all quick to fulfill any requests. Special mention should go to the public relations manager who will listen to each of your concerns and will go out of her way to help.    Only let-down for me was the spa. The Hammam experience my friends and I booked was a complete yoke. From the 45 minutes the actual "hands-on" time was perhaps ten with just a superficial and very unmotivated scrub-down. Anyone who's ever been to a proper hammam can only shake their head especially for a price tag of 45 Euros.    In all I can definitely recommend the hotel and for me it would always depend on the available rate to decide if it's a good deal or not. It may not be a true 5 star hotel but with prices at around a quarter of La Mamounia it's a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Lovely hotel shame about the food
Review_Text: The hotel itself is lovely. It's an oasis of calm in an area full of the hustle and bustle of old Marrakech. The courtyards are lovely and make a great place to just sit and relax. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. What lets it down is the food. We tried three of the restaurants and none of them left us very impressed. Food was average and our lunch from the snack bar was very disappointing. We had to return the salad as it had not been washed. They did change it but then the omelette was very undercooked. We also went to the Indian restaurant to book and choose a table for dinner only to arrive later and it was taken and no record of the booking. On the second morning we came down for breakfast and they were not ready so we could not have what we wanted. It's a shame because the hotel itself is lovely. The bar is great and there are lots of corners to sit and relax.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sharon H wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: My friends and I stayed at this hotel and just loved it. The hotel is an oasis of calm really close to the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.  The staff are all so friendly and cannot do enough to help. The rooms are big and very traditional. Lots of toes petals!  The food was excellent.  I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The lobby the rooms the riad the cigar bar--very nearly breathtaking. The type of hotel a great novel of romance and adventure and wealth would have been set in decades ago.    Friendly staff... English fairly frequent.    Good location--a nice oasis in what can be a frenetic city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends
Reviewer_Location: Washington, District of Columbia, District of Columbia, United States

Review_Date: Kath T wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. We were greeted by friendly staff at reception when I gave my credit card over to be swiped I was told to put it away as this was not necessary - this is very unusual. We were shown to our suite which was at the back of the hotel and had the most amazing view of La Koutoubia Mosque. We went for dinner in the Moroccan restaurant and had a delicious tagine - the service overall was very good - everyone was very pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. My only criticism is that there are not enough beds around the pools - the bottom pool loses the sun at around 4.30pm - whereas the one on the 3rd floor doesn't lose it till much later we managed to get beds up there on two of the days we were there the third day we had to take ones at the bottom pool and on the last say we actually reserved our own beds upstairs. If you are eating in the European restaurant at the hotel you must book - we were told that it was not necessary and when we got there the outside terrace was full but they did offer us a small table and went out of their way to accommodate us. The food was excellent. You are only a very short walk to the square where it all happens at of course the souks. We travelled with Kuoni and the offer a walking tour of the souks which cost about £15 per head for 4 hours but was worth every penny. We would stay here again as it is so central I do feel that some parts of the hotel could do with a bit of a tart up in places - the toilets by the 3rd floor pool were a little disappointing but overall it was comfortable clean and everyone was very helpful. Marrakech is all that you think it is going to be and more beware of the henna sellers in the square - my daughter got accosted by one who grabbed her hand and started drawing when we had not asked for it - she then demanded 800 dirhams and got a little nasty when we refused - she finally went away and took rather 20 dirhams offered.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Richard A wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: The Perfect Hotel For People Who "Get It"
Review_Text: After booking this hotel and then reading some of the negative reports I was slightly anxious. However from the second I walked through the door at 1.30AM to my departure I have nothing but admiration for this hotel and its fantastic staff. Our room was upgraded on arrival and the room was fabulous. The pool areas are great especially the roof top with the bar and restaurant service. We ate at the Indian restaurant one evening which was also fantastic. Beautiful settings which was consistent throughout the hotel. When I read of people saying this hotel is 3 star 4 star at best and that the walls should be painted.......my advice to these people is stick to tacky hotels in Las Vegas or Dubai with no character or meaning. This is Marrakech you obviously don't get it. I'm amazed these people haven't also complained that there are no Pizza Hut Restaurants in Jemaa El Fnaa! This is an Aladdin's cave of luxury and the icing on the cake is the Spa. I challenge anybody to doubt this is not 5 star!! If you want to experience Marrakech literally half a streets length from the main hustle and bustle of El Fnaa but inside is a pure tranquil heaven....this is the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Koen D wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We stayed 3 night in this hotel. It is a very nice hotel and the feature is its location. The hotel has amazing view over la Koutoubia mosque and has a nice pool to hang out.    Overall you are not treated friendly by the staff. We woke up 3 nights because of the fire alarm in our room. Apparently the battery nearly died so it went of sometimes.. Every morning we mentioned the complained nothing happened till the last night when i called very angry the reception.. This is highly inappropriate if you pay that much for a night!!    Overall #dissapointed stay...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: To say this hotel is only seconds away from all the madness of Marrakesh it is just so quiet and peaceful a haven of tranquility. You wouldn't class it as European 5 star but overall it is pretty good. Rooms were clean and well equipped we got a double upgrade to a suite with two bathrooms and a large lounge but as it had no balcony we swapped it for a ground floor room in the new section of the hotel overlooking the French restaurant which came with outdoor seating and sun loungers too. Cant understand the recent visitor who complained the room was only made up once a day? I dont know any hotels anywhere in the world that make up rooms 2 or 3 times a day!  Bathroom was good we had bathrobes slippers and loads of toiletries all the time bed was comfy room safe and mini-bar and 40" plasma though 90% of the programmes are in French but TV wasn't a big deal for us here.  Breakfast could be improved to say there are legions of staff always seemed to be a shortage of tables cleaned and set. French restaurant was ok without being outstanding we ate at the rooftop Indian first night as we arrived late and didnt fancy trailing out was ok but not a patch on Indian eateries we are used to.  Pool areas were spot on. There is the pool in the central courtyard and an even better one on the rooftop very well looked after by attendants who provide towels move the parasols and deliver snacks whenever you are ready. Mercifully you can get sunbeds even if you explore the city in the morning then want to sunbathe in the afternoon none of the early morning rubbish to reserve spots here!  Even though there isn't a vast choice of places outside the hotel to have a drink apart from restaurants the bar and courtyard areas were very quiet on an evening whether that was due to there not being many who liked a tipple being there during our stay or becuase the drinks were quite pricey I dont know.  I would recommend the hotel though if we visit Marrakesh again would probably try a different one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Has the potential to be first rate but falls down in some areas
Review_Text: I was torn between a 3 and 4 rating - but decided to be generous as it suited our purpose but not sure I would return.    The location and facilities are very good if you don't fancy staying in a riad in the alleyways of the medina but you do sacrifice warm hospitality personal service and attention to detail which I'm sure would receive in a good riad. We found reception staff to be acceptable - some more helpful than others. We did have a lovely mini suite with our friends in the adjoining one so we had a own private courtyard. However there were issues - a double bed and not the twin we requested (this couldn't be separated) and a bath in the bedroom and no bathroom door! (we went as a group of female friends). We were shown alternative rooms but they were not nice (paint smell and décor sparse) so we put up with the originals. One excellent thing was - it was so quiet. Maybe it was just our room but we didn't hear a thing even at 8am. Not sure many places in Marrakech are so peaceful!    We ate in the Moroccan restaurant on the first night as we arrived late - food and service not great. However we enjoyed the breakfasts - good choice fresh pastries and freshly cooked omelettes/eggs while you waited.
