However we couldn't understand why the pancake/crepe lady precooked them and just heated them up (while you waited) - this took just as long as cooking from fresh - she had a bowl of batter so why not cook fresh? - and they were tough and rubbery when reheated.  Some of the waiters/waitresses were positively rude - a couple of older male waiters were offhand and unhelpful at breakfast and one waitress was sullen and unhelpful when serving tea - how come a hotel which markets itself as 5* cannot find a biscuit or piece of cake to serve with afternoon tea?? We ended up (after complaining) with a plate of their "pastries" which are really petit fours - almonds/coconut etc bite size. There was plenty of cake at breakfast so why not have extra!    The carpets throughout (all red) look worn and tatty - there were being cleaned in the reception area but have no idea how often this is done. The ones in the corridors and in our room didn't look clean - it would be better (and more hygienic) to just have tiled floors. The uneaten "pastries" were left in the room for our entire stay and not replenished or taken away. Again not very hygienic!!  The gardens and pool are very attractive - our suite was lovely and some of the service was very good (the younger waiters were much more helpful and smily) - but with some improvements in the areas outlined above it could be a fabulous hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: eleanor c wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at the is hotel for 5 nights on recommendation of a family member who had stayed 2 years ago. On arrival we were greeted with refreshing mint tea. Reception staff were charming and helpful (as they were throughout our stay) . We were upgraded to junior suite at no extra charge.  Sadly the corridors leading to the room do not give great first impression - carpets are worn and threadbare. The suite was well equipped and spacious. Sadly the standard of housekeeping was not to luxury standards - drinking glasses that had been used were never replaced. Fresh fruit was not replenished and we shared the room with a very large cockroach for 24 hours. Despite putting the "make up the room" sign on the door the room was not freshened other than the standard once a day or the minibar ever refilled.  Breakfast buffet was adequate but was exactly the same on each day.  We ate at the Relais de Paris restaurant on the first night - the food was nothing special but adequate. The service was friendly but terribly slow and somewhat amateurish.  The facilities in the hotel are excellent - 2 wonderful swimming pools comfortable seating areas and an abundance of towels sun beds etc.  The location in the heart of the Medina and just a few minutes walk from the El Fnar square and the wonderful sights and sounds of Marrakech cannot be beaten.  Several members of staff do not speak english - this is not usually a problem as I speak passable french however for some this was still a problem. All the members of staff were pleasant and helpful but sadly they lack adequate training and experience that one would expect in a truly 5* hotel.  I would recommend this hotel for the location and facilities that it offers and for the ambiance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A relaxing oasis right next to the marvellous madness that is Marrakech
Review_Text: We returned last week after staying for 7 nights to celebrate my 40th birthday and I have to say I am so glad we chose this hotel as it was just perfect for us. The location is great as it's literally a 2 min stroll into the main square where you can enjoy the hassle and bustle with the reassurance your hotel is so close. The hotel manages to keep an air of serenity despite being based on a busy street we spent most days sunbathing on the lovely roof terrace complete with loungers pool and great restaurant service. It which was so peaceful you couldn't believe you were so close to the madness. The room was lovely couldn't fault the cleanliness and the staff always left rose petals and made shapes out of towels etc nice little touches breakfast was fine with good variety and staff in all areas were nothing but helpful and polite during our stay.    Some tips we found useful -    Visit the artisan ensemble complex a 5 min walk past the koutabia mosque on avenue Mohammed IV as this is a fixed price outlet so you can get an idea of prices you should be paying before you start haggling in the souks. It is actually a really nice place with a shop selling each type of traditional craft but they actually make the stuff there and you can watch them I.e. Rug making jewellery leather bags etc    Do eat in one of the pop up market stalls in the square for the experience the food is fine we ate from stall 26 with no ill effect!    Likewise the orange juice sellers are really friendly and fresh juice for about 30p is amazing    While you do see westerners walking around barely clothed I always wore maxi dresses with a pashmina and never once felt intimated and felt as though as though i gained more respect by dressing conservatively    Similarity make the effort and learn at least the word "shokran" thank you in Arabic it goes a long way    Finally PLEASE don't encourage the vile trade in monkey poaching from the wild and have your photo taken with the guys hauling them pitifully on chains for tourists to pose with - seeing a crate crammed full of terrified baby monkeys was the low of the holiday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent hotel located in the heart of the medina near the central souks. Service was impeccable. The rooms were very clean. The staff welcomed us with mint tea and pastries. The restaurants were nice and the food was reasonably priced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This Riad is extremely centrally located for the tourist with the souksKoutabia mosque tourist bus on your doorstep ( or at least a very short walk away ).  It has everything you could need: excellent Spa;restaurants serving very good foodreasonably priced.  The staff are helpful and the Riad itself is a welcome haven from the chaos and frenzy outside.  We had a very enjoyable stay and would highly recommend it .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely 5 star experience . Beautiful property with full service gym and spa. Saba on the front desk was particularly helpful for anything you needed.very lost access to the medina . Recommend the breakfast
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Roger H wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Excellent place for a relaxing cocktail
Review_Text: We didn't stay at the hotel but popped into the bar a couple of times for pre-dinner drinks (turn left once inside the entrance). The staff were friendly and polite the drinks reasonably priced (cheaper than for example the Kosy Bar) and the setting very relaxing. The snacks that came with the drinks were almost a meal in their own right. A really great place to chill out in a calm setting just a stone's throw from Jemaa el Fna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a 9 night stay and our experience exceeded our expectations. Fantastic staff fabulous food amazing setting especially the pools and on arrival we were upgraded to a suite and loved the various patterns of rose petals that were on our bed each day. The hotel was spotlessly clean and nothing was too much trouble. We have already decided we are returning next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for our honeymoon for a week and loved it!  Although it is on a busy road as soon as you walk through the front doors its so quiet and calm you could almost forget your in the middle of the city. But in a great location just minutes walk away from the square which we felt perfectly safe walking out during the day or night.  On arrival the reception upgraded us to a suite which was beautiful fresh roses e.t.c however judging by the standard of the hotel i think all the rooms would be lovely.  The pools were nice - if not a bit on the cold side but very refreshing and cleaned daily. Comfortable sunbeds. The spa pool is nice however you have to pay extra for it so we did not use it.  All the restaurants are nice and romantic with roses and candles on the tables however we really liked the roof top Indian could of easily eaten everything off the menu if we stayed long enough food was excellent. Cocktail bar was also great to relax poolside in the evenings.  All the staff were helpful and friendly.  I read a few negative reviews about the hotel being outdated however we loved it just the way it was the building is 13th century and we found it traditional and authentic with beautiful Moroccan decor maybe if your looking for a ultra modern hotel don't book a traditional style riad or old hotel.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Poor service, needs a physical overhaul and better management
Review_Text: This "five star" hotel  quite away from being five star is located within a very old structure and is of noteworthy historical significance but is physically in poor shape with not very attractive decor. There is a sense of overall abandonment letting the structure itself and its very convenient location sell hotel rooms. Being objective the room I was given was an upgraded room which consisted of a bedroom a living area and an enclosed balcony which were quite comfortable. The bathroom was spacious  but the overall impression was a lack of luxury just heavy worn out furnishings of Moroccan style.  The breakfast was buffet style and while there were many offerings it could not be considered lavish nor high quality. The most interesting aspect of the breakfast were the three types of crepes offered however the breads and pastries were poor and flies around the outdoor sitting area were always bothersome.  The hotel's highlight is its poor service and I mean it! That is a lack of gusto to provide service. Yes when asking for something it is usually delivered but in a very reticent manner as if a favor was being performed to a person you dislike. This aspect of the hotel is what bothered me most. My feeling is that if the personnel resent providing service since it might be beneath them or a breach of their dignity then those individuals should be re-trained or replaced.  Providing service is what people seek in 5 star hotels and for which we pay dearly and just going through motions to provide service is not enough as there are other hotels which insist that personnel show the customer that they enjoy carrying out their duties.  The front desk service i.e. reception is rather surly with a very special negative vibe "attitude". The staff is rather poorly dressed and one or two had body oder. The staff at reception always seem to be bothered and hassled when approached. Are they fed up with tourism after so many years of catering to tourists.? If so perhaps they should consider how else to make a living just like doctors and lawyers and any other profession which might get fed up with providing services on a daily basis.  Notwithstanding everything which has been said I must say that the Indian restaurant on the third floor of the hotel was very good and provided excellent service in a romantic mystical atmosphere.  Also the gym facilities were quite good and three swimming pools within the hotel complex were also very nice although the one is the basement heated had an oder not very jasmine like.  This hotel has the possibilities of being great but somehow it does not seem to want to be at this time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Les Jardins de La Koutoubia to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel arranged for us to be met at the airport by their driver and we were then taken to the hotel at a cost of 100 dirham. Upon checking in we were given a free room upgrade we stayed in room 77 which was a stunning two storey room with two living rooms downstairs and bedroom toilet and bathroom with sunken bath and shower upstairs. We also had a patio and a balcony. After a hectic day sightseeing or in the souks there is nothing better than lying by one of the two large pools and enjoying a cold beer. The rooftop pool was our personal favourite and had a fabulous view of the Mosque. We had the breakfast every morning which was great and offered a wide selection to cater for all. One day we had a light lunch at the onsite Indian restaurant next to the rooftop pool which was also good and very tasty. This really is a perfect hotel a tranquil escape from the bustle of Marrakech - large enough to have all the facilities you need (the spa was fabulous too) but as it was originally a large Riad you still have all the beauty and traditional features of a Moroccan property. We would definitely recommend it and wouldn't hesitate to stay again if we return to Marrakech±
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a relief it was after driving through all the hustle and bustle surrounding the mosque and market to walk into such a beautiful hotel. Immediately upon check in we are offered traditional tea and cookies. All rooms are very large and have living rooms with large sofas. Traditional Arabic music is playing on the tv as soon as you are showed your room which again we find a display of cookies and fruits. Rose petals are scattered on the bed as well as in their spacious bathroom. Now you have to understand that this is still Morocco yes there is a slight smell everywhere the whole city smells different. Yes I think the red shag carpets in the hallway are out dated not pleasant to the eye and probably hold some of that odor however I think it's perhaps a cultural 'luxury' thing. Most ground/hallways are exposed to the outside elements so yes you will find some tiny ants here and there. Never in your bed or furniture mostly around bathroom. Nothing I feel to be alarmed of. Service is wonderful friendly and always accommodating! I do wish however that they had staff circling the pool area for guests who want to order food or drinks instead of having to get up. Food at the Moroccan restaurant and the Indian restaurant is great. Hotel is walking distance to the market. I recommend visiting the market during the day first as at night it can be a little overwhelming and intimidating. Don't shy away from food at the market I have a weak stomach and ate mixed meats at the market and it was amazing. I never got sick once I think it's due to the freshness of the meats and in America we are used to meats pumped the antibiotics and hormones. The 'new market' is a short distance away shopping mall etc. Never once felt unsafe. Don't be afraid to try new things. Aziz was by far the best and sweetest although most staff we encountered were :) We would hesitate at all to stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Manjit Julie wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Upon arrival we were greeted warmly by reception especially Abdul who served us lovely hot mint tea and escorted us to our room which was upgraded at no extra cost by reception to a mini suite..a wonderful surprise.  The room was everything I could have asked for. Roses scattered all over the room created a wonderful romantic mood.Great size room with a seating lounge an ample sized bathroom with all toiletries that are necessary. Huge wardrobes however no iron or ironing board. Personally I always prefer one in the room but I'm sure it's available on request.    The hotel has room services and a few restaurants. The food is average slightly more expensive than I think it should be. The hotel is literally a 2 min walk away. Once you exit the hotel and turn right you will see the famous Koutoubia mosque and once you turn left you will see the market.  We found a great place next to the hotel. Turn left once you exit the hotel and follow the road round. On the right hand side is a small store that sells some great cakes and soft drinks called Laiterie Yacoute.  Also breakfast was plentiful and fresh. Plenty of choices and one of the best coffees I've had in a long time.    The hotel has a few issues it needs to address that would make this a top 20 hotel on tripadvisor.  The room service menu needs revising. It's far to bland over priced and uninspiring.  The air conditioning is not as powerful as it should be. Sitting at the restaurant near the pool at 2pm in 38 degree heat and not have an air conditioned room was unbearable.  The room booklet needs to be redone also. I realised on the last day that there was a pool table downstairs. A map and list of amenities would have been wonderful.  The hotel is slightly worn but I think it adds a certain character.  But please do not be put off by my little gripes as this is directed at management. I would not hesitate to book here again. The location just cannot be beaten.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: michelle w wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Fantastic location close to the main square and bars. Hotel rooms were spotless and very well decorated (cleaned daily with personal touches added). The pools were fantastic and pool staff very attentive.    However took three hours to check in with no tour of hotel or offer of drink- or apology! Staff at desk rude and unwelcoming.

Wonderful peaceful relaxing! Service is great alongside delicious restaurants - the French being my favourite. Wines cocktails all fabulous!    Spa was a fantastic experience also the rooftop pool to cool down in the great heat of august!    The perfect thing about this is it's a oasis in the middle of the wholeness of Marrakech - souks medina and mosque literally outside the front door!    Don't be too surprised at the locals pretending they work at the hotel then trying to become your private guide they're just making a living and can help in the haggling process however cause no threat or danger but not for the faint hearted.    Would absolutely return in a minute!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved the location & ate at all the Restaurants - food excellent. Location brill. as right next to Jeema - el Fnaa. You need a large pool after your Medina adventure in August as it's so very hot & there are 2!. Also really appreciated the service & most especially the Front Reception as they were so helpful & happy. Would defo stay here again & have recommended this Hotel to friends. Thanks to the Hotel for the Taxi booking to the Airport @ 100 Dirham upon our return. When we arrived we caught the bus (for 2 was 60 Dirham) from the Airport to the Hotel as there was too much confusion as to price. I wasn't going to pay London Cabbie fares in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We loved our stay and the ease of walking into the heart of the medina so easily. The staff were wonderful and helped me book various things. We were a family - ages 76 to 7 - and all enjoyed our stay. Good size rooms. My parents had a suite which was fantastic. Highly recommended.

Never forget where you are... so in Morocco it deserves the five stars (probably not in Europe). Very clean best location ever in Marrakesh friendly staff very quiet. I spent 4 days with my wife snd we really enjoyed. I definitely recomend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tracy E wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: I was a little skeptical as the hotel was tucked away at the end of a street in the old city but it quickly changed to delight once entering the hotel. The room was adorned with rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom. A large room with a sitting area for the tv and sunken tub and shower stall. The hotel is located within walking distance to the Souk and fine dining.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good but could be much better
Review_Text: Stayed here for a week with my partner to explore Marrakech and surrounding areas. Overall we had a great stay at the Jardins de la Koutoubia but there is so much room for improvement it left us a little disappointed:    The pros:    - The location is great - 2 minutes walk to the main square and all the action  - We were upgraded to a suite on check-in though we'd only booked the cheapest room which was a nice surprise  - We were prepared to request a 'twin' rather than double room if asked at reception (2 guys travelling in a Muslim country) however no eyebrows raised and no questions asked and we were given a room with king size bed  - The room itself was very spacious with everything you need  - Staff at the piano bar were friendly and helpful as were the staff at the indian restaurant (the food and drinks at both were great)    The cons:    - Staff were generally unfriendly at the pool-side snack-bar and the breakfast restaurant. In particular asking for eggs was scarier than trying to negotiate a price for a snake charmer photo in the square  - We witnessed a bird drinking out of the orange juice jug (in fact it was inside the jug) and also eating fruit salad from the breakfast buffet - no staff around to do anything about it  - When I went to confirm my return transfer to the airport the staff couldn't find any record (despite my having a printed email confirming it). They happily booked another transfer though. The next day when we checked out we were ushered into a normal taxi?!  - Room needs attention to detail - shower bracket was loose and falling off drain was blocked and drained very very slowly air-conditioning was of the 'mild' variety  - Prepare for plenty of French tourists who love smoking everywhere in and around the hotel which they are allowed to do - there is no concept of a 'non-smoking' zone around the pool or anywhere.    Oh and prepare yourself to be rudely awoken by the Call to Prayer from the plethora of nearby mosques; all part of the Moroccan experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Loved it and will go again
Review_Text: The wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights to experience Marrakech before moving onto an all inclusive hotel for a week. If we had known how good and relaxing the hotel was we would have stayed for the entire trip.  The hotels location to experience Marrakech is perfect with a 2 minute walk to the square and Souks.  The hotel is not perfect and the building is untidy in places and when we arrived a waterfall was running into reception from somewhere above but this was soon sorted out.The relaxing nature when you walk into the courtyard with the pool in the centre is lovely and makes for many a good photo.  Our room was nice and the rose petals sprinkled on the bed and in the bathroom is a nice touch.  We enjoyed lunch on 2 occasions but were slightly disappointed with the Moroccon restaurant for dinner as you got a more realistic experience at a better price out in the square.  Sitting outside in the evening with a beer and free bowls of nuts and olives finished the days off perfectly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Generally Disappointing and Uninspiring Stay.
Review_Text: I'd heard lots of good things about this hotel but felt that the hype didn't match the experience.    The friendliness of the check-in frequently defines the experience and the staff behind the front desk seemed unwilling or unable to welcome anyone in a genuine and friendly manner. The rooms were nice but thick and worn red carpets throughout the rooms and in the corridors gave the impression of a hotel that had seen better times. It felt as though the management were desperate to save money as our corridor was pitch black until you managed to trigger a light sensor that would illuminate the part of the corridor you were walking in. Walking out of your room and into the corridor at night was light walking down the darkest alleyways in the souk.    The staff in the piano bar were really attentive and friendly and the highlight of the stay but the piano player made a bad choice in attempting to play over an electro / synth style backing track - it was like Les Dawson versus the Pet Shop Boys. When we returned for a nightcap Les was still playing on the piano so we sat outside. The staff in the International Restaurant made us wait 10 minutes on the premise that they were preparing a table for us that in fact was already available and when were eventually seated we were asked whether we were English or French. The waiter handed us 3 menus said these are in French and left swiftly leaving us to figure it out ourselves even though badly translated English menus were available. The chef's signature dish was sliced steak drowning in his signature sauce and topped with chips. Rather like the best looking dish in a motorway cafe in the 1980's but not 5 star dining. Over breakfast (and under the fabric umbrellas covered with bird poo and general muck) one of the waiters asked whether one of the female members in our party whether she would like tea or coffee. She replied tea and he walked over to his colleagues gestured to my female friend and said tea tea very quickly which met with much laughter. I expected better than adolescent behaviour from waiting staff in a 5 star hotel.    The swimming pools are great and the hotel is in a superb location but this hotel would benefit from a manager who has the time to look at every aspect of this hotel in detail. The 3 clocks above reception are supposed to show the times in different zones but the fact that Europe is 2 hours and 10 minutes in-front of Marrakech and somewhere else is so many hours and 5 minutes behind reflect the lack of attention to detail that pervades this hotel.    I asked the hotel to arrange a taxi to the airport and the price was agreed before 100 dhs. When I arrived at the airport I gave the driver 120 dhs to include a tip. He looked at the money in my hand and said it's ok  but this big taxi you pay more 150dhs. Avoiding being ripped off in Marrakech should be an Olympic sport and I was hoping that getting a 5 star hotel to arrange the transfer would prevent this type of situation. Not so.    Undoubtedly great in its time but desperately behind the times now in so many ways. My advice - avoid and stay somewhere else instead until they've addressed some of their issues.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We have just returned from a weekend staying at the above hotel. We flew easy jet early morning flight from gatwick and by 10 am arrived at the hotel. We took breakfast whilst waiting to check in. Nothing was too much trouble the pr lady was fantastic. She gave us a guided tour of the hotel and we were upgraded to a junior suite which was fantastic !  The rooms were clean lovely touches such as petals everywhere robes slippers etc. only downside to the room was that there was no kettle.  The pool area was beautiful lovely sun beds albeit in short supply. Hotel could defiantly do with adding more on the grass area. The poolside restaurant was nice only criticism would be could do with more snacks for the pool area as you don't always want a full meal at lunchtime.  We ate in the Asian restaurant on the first night which was disappointing. The location was great but to be honest I didn't rate the food.  We had treatments in the spa which was very nice and they have a huge indoor pool and relaxing area. I would recommend the massage.  All in all I would thoroughly recommend the hotel it's staff location and cleanliness. I will definitely  Be returning....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Harmen J wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: Superb hotel in the centre of the city!
Review_Text: Only positive comments on this hotel: close to the main city square everyone in the hotel is very friendly food is really good rooms are nice! If you want to book a city tour or day trip the people at the reception will offer to help you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: danielle m wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: This hotel is right off the main square and the entrance is very unimpressive however once you go inside it is a beautiful oasis. The pool area is tranquil and has pool side service. We had a junior suite overlooking the gardens and it was as nice as a Four Seasons. There were beautiful bathrobes fresh fruit and roses every day. The breakfast buffet was extensive and ha several hot selections. Highly recommend this hotel!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Pedro C wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: It's amazing what you can feel in this hotel right next to the djemaa el-fna plaza.  Very good suite and a nice breakfast. The swimming pool on the roof top its amazing.  I highly recommend this hotel not only for its quality but also for the location.    Also... try out the 'Relais the Paris' restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ronny S wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: This riad is big noe of the biggest in Marrakech but still it feels like home.  The rooms are cozy and spacious.  Theres 2 pools one on the rooftop and one outside in the garden. Both very Nice.  Theres 3 restaurants. We tired two of them and we can hoghly recomend them both! We didnt try the international restaurant tho.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa C wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: I've visited this hotel a few times over the years but now at last have stayed there. It is hard to put into words the feeling that you get when you walk into this hotel and in particular the swimming pool area at night. It awakens your senses with the smells sights and peaceful silence that greets you. Even the lifts smell divine!  We were up-graded to a suite which was incredible and overlooked the main pool.  There are 2 swimming pools the main one and a great roof top one. The spa looked fantastic although we weren't staying long enough to make use of it.  Can't wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Very lovely place - nice staff good quality and not too expensive food and drinks. Had lunch and drinks here a few times as our riad around the corner was tiny and didn't really cater much for that. I would stay here next time because the location is great and you don't feel ripped off. Very clean very lovely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Syd W wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: An oasis of tranquility on the doorstep of the medina
Review_Text: This is a great hotel in a great location.  Inside the hotel there is an aura of serenity and tranquility - but walk literally a few paces along the street outside and you are in the frenzy of the Jamaa el Fna and the Souks.  We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in June 2014 and were fortunate enough to be upgraded to one of their mini-suites - which was wonderful. However we also looked at a couple of their standard rooms and these were also great looking rooms - all a little different and all with characater and charm. The hotel staff were mostly very friendly and very helpful.  We ate in the (Indian) restaurant on the roof of the hotel one evening and the food and service there were also excellent.  The hotel has 2 swimming pools - a large one in the centre of the quadrangle formed by the hotel buildings and a small one on the roof of the hotel. Both were well maintained and clean and neither of them were very busy.  Two small criticisms  1. Despite the numerous settings on the control panel in our room the air conditioning operated in only two modes - either full power or off! Hence the room was generally too hot or too cold.  2. The hotel reception forgot to pass on the message from our travel agent advising that our departure flight was delayed - until I approached the desk to inquire whether it was normal for our transit bus to be so late.  Notwithstanding the above this is a great hotel and I recommend it to anyone who is visiting Marrakech - although the serene and tranquil atmosphere might not work so well with boisterous children.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: VINCENT M wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Very relaxing, good service, good everything!
Review_Text: Very surprised to find such excellent service together with really nice people and cannot fault any point about the stay at this hotel The location could not be better allowing access to all attractions. Good food in the French restaurant and the snack bar plus excellent breakfast choices and no rip offs anywhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights in a deluxe room. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room cleaned twice a day. The 3 restaurants all served delicious food and the pool looked very inviting although we didn't have time to test! This is a haven in the middle of a bustling city. The medina is on the door step and very safe to walk around at night had no problems 2 women on there own. Definitely recommend a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sundar R wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Terrible food coupled with coarse managers and staff
Review_Text: My wife and I went to have dinner at the Indian restaurant on the roof. The dhal was very badly made. We are Indians and know Indian cooking. Moreover we eat at Indian restaurants in New York City often and are familiar with Indian food as served in restaurants. When I complained the owner curtly said" if you don't like the food you can leave there is the door". I was shocked! We left and went to the reception and asked to speak to the hotel manager. The staff were resistant to calling the manager. When she came on the phone she was unhelpful and said she would speak to me the next day if I came by.  I am outraged by the conduct. The hotel has a nice ambience but the food and service will guarantee you a miserable experience. Dr. Ramaswami USA
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pamela S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: My husband and I visited this hotel for one night in June. It is a quiet clean and charming place in the middle of bustling Marrakech. The room is quaint and clean the pools are well-located and well maintained the restaurants and spa were very nice. The hotel offers a quiet ambience for those looking to relax. The service at the reception was a little bit iffy- not what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Overall a good experience but not as luxurious as we had hoped.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in the Heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: A great place to celebrate an anniversary which is what we did. Terribly romantic place down to the rose petals strewn all over our room and bathroom. We have our own tent like terrace where we could draw the curtains for privacy. We had a bit of an iffy start with a rather unresponsive staff upon our arrival that was swiftly and professionally resolve by the Manager Rokhaya. Overall great and happy experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After a morning of exploring Marrakech we decided on the basis of a recommendation in DK's Eyewitness Travel Guide that the hotel welcomed non-residents to use their pool. So we took our tired & hot 4 & 7 year old children. Apart from the friendly welcome by the Concierge at the door it was quickly apparent that we were not welcome! My wife was accosted by 2 male staff waiting for her to come out of the toilet demanding the equivalent of £50 for us to use the pool! She tried to explain that we had come in good faith on the basis of the travel guides recommendation but they were very aggressive and not in the least understanding. As we left we were again admonished by the Reception staff providing us with our only negative experience of 10 days in Marrakech which was otherwise filled with warm friendly and welcoming people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Imran R wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins de La Koutoubia for 4 days in the last week of May 2014. The moment we checked in we were accommodated by the super attentive staff. We had a suite with a beautiful balcony. The room was meticulously cleaned several times a day and the property and gardens were stunning! It's a stones throw from the mad chaos of the medina and most of the local attractions. Luckily the hotel arranged an english speaking local guide Abdel H'amid Labyad who was the best guide we toured with in our 10 day stay and experience with over 7 guides. We would highly recommend him to any one visiting Marrekech . Also the indian restaurant was beautiful and had amazing food we ate there 4 times and was a culinary high point for us since my husband loves indian food. Also the spa was well maintained and we went to a hamam and massage there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: email e wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: No way is this 5 star. it should be 3! food poisoning following a meal in their Indian restaurant so i lost two days. something went missing from the room!  if you want to get up at 6 to get a lounger near the pool then ok for you. The customer service is 'listen' and do nothing. forget it and try elsewhere . i wont go back. Jon B
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This was a 2 nd visit to Marrakesh en route to the desert and we stayed the night before we left and the night after we returned. Having sampled a lovely riad in the medina last time we wanted a base where we could leave our car for 5 days. The location service and rooms were lovely. we were 3 and had a suite overlooking the pool for one night with adjoining rooms - perfect. The pool after breakfast was refreshing before heading into the medina to explore. We would stay again as it's old world charm but comfort and bustle worked for us!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We went to Marrakesh for a week and chose this hotel because we wanted to have a pool in the sun all day - many of the riads have pools but are often shaded in the afternoon as the sun goes lower and the walls block the sun. This hotel not only has a great pool in the central courtyard but a wonderful rooftop pool with views across the city and the Koutoubia mosque. The setting service rooms and food were excellent and the rose wine at the end of the day was both reasonably priced at about £16 per bottle and tasted good too! We did venture out to various restaurants at the hotels suggestion but found the hotel food to be the best quality. Apart from an Italian restaurant whose name I cant' recall in the modern part of the town with a wonderful pool in the middle of it - hotel I'm sure can tell you where it is and the name! We were initially disappointed with the medina and just skirted around the edges - our mistake - you need to delve in and the constant hassling to buy knock off goods stops and the exotic world of the medina opens up. We also found the casbah near the palace to be just what we expected of marrakesh and felt like we were on the set of a james bond movie - the strawberry milk shake at the cafe casbah was wonderful sitting on their roof terrace. We loved it and woudl definatley return to the hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Old-Fashioned Charmer Right in the Middle of the Action
Review_Text: Just got back from 4 nights at this very nice hotel. It has an authentic Moroccan feel (the decor is pleasantly worn) and is only a couple of blocks away from the souks and craziness of the Jemaa El Fna. It still feels tranquil on the hottest of days. The rooftop Indian restaurant is good and the second swimming pool adjacent to it is a great escape from it all even if there aren't always enough deck chairs to go around. Cocktails or mint tea by the main riad-style pool are a treat and the staff is cheerful and helpful. Great for couples or families.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I have eaten in two of the restaurants in this hotel but have to admit I am more interested in drinking cocktails around the pool. The ambiance is lovely and the service is great. I wasn't keen on Des Jardins de Bala but the service was good and there were great views. Restaurant Marocain was very tasty and the tables outside by the pool added to the experience. I look forward to returning for another Mojito or two!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Layla C wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: We loved this hotel so peaceful and tranquil amongst the hustle and bustle of the square outside. Perfectly located in the centre of a Marrakech. Food was excellent in all it's restaurants. Rooftop pool was lovely. Our room was great and so was the service. Nothing negative to say!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Believe all the good reviews - it's true
Review_Text: Our natural inclination was to go with a major chain but upon reading reviews I quickly got the sense that going that route would be a missed opportunity to experience a riad. If you want an authentic Moroccan experience skip the usual and go with a riad. Now most riads are small but well appointed. The Jardins de la Koutoubia is one of the bigger ones with all the luxury you would expect from a branded luxury hotel. The difference being higher level of service with a Moroccan ambiance. This particular riad couldn't be in a better location. I read a review that the morning prayer call was a problem. To be honest I never heard the morning prayer call from the nearby Koutoubia mosque. Every morning we were delighted by a full buffet breakfast. By the time we got back from breakfast our room had already been cleaned. Everyday the bed was decorated with fresh rose petals. During our 3 night stay I never saw housekeeping. This riad has truly mastered the art of being discrete as the go about servicing their guests. I really felt like a guest here. Always greeted with a warm smile by all staff. I could keep writing but do yourself a favor and book a room and experience true Moroccan hospitality. I really can't think of a single bad thing about this property. If you decide to go enjoy as you will be spoiled.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect Oasis nestled in the Medina
Review_Text: Les Jardin is the Perfect Oasis literally 15 seconds from the Median and the Souks. It is literally the most convenient hotel its also a short cab ride from Yves Saint Laurant's former residence/memorial/Garden. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful with a pool/garden area that is very serene and a needed contrast to the bustling medina. We stayed in this hotel before and after our 3-day trek in the Sahara Desert and both instances we were upgraded at no additional cost! The breakfast buffet was also a good bonus. The hotel has 2 restaurants we ate at the rooftop restaurant and the food was tasty I recommend the lentil soup. Overall I loved this hotel and would recommend to anyone traveling to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel after travelling around Morocco for 7 days. We had stayed at several hotels but knew this last one in Marrakech would be special. We were not disappointed. The lobby is beautiful and then we walked out to the garden area and knew we had picked the right place to stay and rest for a few days. The garden and pool area were very relaxing and inviting. The flowers happened to be spectacular while we were there. The location was perfect for seeing the sights. We would go out for a few hours and then could easily come back and relax by the pool. There are lots of restaurants nearby we could walk to in the evening. The breakfast had a lot of variety and we loved being able to eat in the garden around the pool. We very much enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patricia B wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: A perfect oasis in Marrakech for chic families...
Review_Text: We arrived at the hotel for three days in between our tour of many Moroccan cities including the Sahara desert. WE LOVED IT. We felt chic we felt cared for particularly as we traveled with our 6 yr old daughter who was cared for by everyone there. Had awesome meals in the restaurant by the pool try the salmon. We also loved our breakfast in the Moroccan room. We also loved the piano bar (even our daughter had something there!). The front desk staff are the very best you can find. They helped us find a Spanish-speaking guide who took us everywhere inside the Medina (the tanneries and the silk souks are just amazing!). The room was outstanding (and they upgraded us so that our daughter could have her own bed). Perhaps the only thing we did not feel was 5 stars was the international restaurant (then again my husband is a Chef de Cusine hard to please). Otherwise I highly recommend the hotel for families. You can walk and shop all day and come back and feel like royalty. Will go back with the family once our son graduates college! Oh...I forgot the SPA...had an amazing body rub and my daughter and I had did our hair there. Great value!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The only good thing was that the hotel is very central located.  Service was very slow and rude especially the pool boy and at the reception.  Tv and shower were broken.  Food very bad quality.  Extra pay for using spa and restroom  Pool was dirty  Wifi did not work properly  Rooms very noisy  5 star hotel? Ridiculous! Absolutely not worth the money!

Review_Title: Great hotel for walking your of Marrakesh sights
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel with or kids and we all had a great time. It is an easy walk to the souk and he main square with snake charmers etc. also very close to the Kotoubia mosque (so close the morning call to prayer woke me a couple of times). He hotel used to be a palace and is beautifully arranged with a gorgeous courtyard and pool in the center. We all loved the fruit filled breakfast buffet.

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel and really great location to get to the souqs. The upstairs pool is charming and catches the sun with views of the mountains and the koutobia. Our room (136) was in the corner which even though it faced the main road was very quiet. Our tv didn't work when we first arrived but they soon fixed that. Only complaint is that there's was no wifi signal in our room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ellen A wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Some as a couple both 30 this was a different hoilday for us other than Ibiza!!!  So I wanted a hotel that had good reviews as wanted to feel slightly safer if u get me.    The hotel was so beautiful all the staff were so polite and couldn't help more.  Emailed the hotel before for transfers from the airport they were there holding a card. Charged 100dirhams each. Worth it. And took us back to the airport ?    We loved the pool rooftop the snacks were lovely and served so well.    We went quad biking for the morning once booked it via a little shop on the street  was one of the best experiences I've ever done would defo recommend it. It lasts for 3 hours.    We went to what they call the "new town" about 5mins away in a taxi for 50dirhams.  Basically it has newer shops and resturants. Ate at a place called mamma Mia's was lush and went to the sky bar this was so good. Had some old schoo fab songs and shisha. Defo worth a visit.    The souks are a must see the only day to really visit them is a Tuesday. Can get lots of spices.    They are some genuine good fake converse don't look any different from the real ones.    We went to le blue hammam spa was there for 3 hours proper traditional exfoliation massage pool defo worth a visit to one of them there are a few.    The mosque is over the road beautiful building even the sound of the prayer calling was so peaceful.  You very hardly get hassled not like Egypt or Turkey much more calmer and hassle free.    This hotel is more of the more pricer hotels but it's defo worth the money for the location safety atmosphere and the knowing u have a nice place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephy S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: This was a beautiful hotel. Yes if you look closely its a tad tired but this really doesn't matter. It has a lovely feel.    The room was beautiful and its very romantic to have rose petals and fresh roses on your pillow everyday. It did make you feel special.    The Piano Bar was great the staff were friendly and were attentive remembering what you liked to drink and even where you liked to sit!    We ate in all of the hotels restaurants which were ok the best place to eat was the lunchtime restaurant by the pool. The staff were great and very attentive.    We both had spa treatments and the pool and facilities were lovely. Although my first massage was slightly rough - I was left with bruises! However the pool and Hammam was great.    Position of hotel was great and we are planning to go back.    It was a lovely relaxing holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely riad on the edge of the main square
Review_Text: I have stayed in Marrakech several times but always in large 5 star corporate type hotels. This hotel was a really pleasant change it was charming if a little tired around the edges but it did not loose any points from me for this.  Reception and concierge staff were extremely helpful and went the extra mile to please. It was a real oasis away from the madness of the surrounding area being 2 minutes from the main square.  We had a patio room this was spacious with a desk and stool plus a settee and 2 easy chairs it felt like a mini suite. Bed and bedlinen were excellent and it was a nice touch with the different arrangement of petals each evening. I also liked the fact that every morning on returning from breakfast our room had been serviced. The bathroom was enormous with bath and separate large shower however the toiletries were not very good - pity considering there was a spa in the hotel.  Breakfast provided a good selection of hot and cold dishes with freshly made omelettes/eggs and a pancake station. I did not tire of it for the 6 mornings so it was definitely of an OK standard. The waiting staff were attentive and coffees reordered efficiently.  The loungers and the pool area I a not sure would work so well if the hotel was busy as one side never got the sun. Loungers were very comfortable and the pool service was fine.  We ate lunch each day in the poolside cafe which was excellent - a good range of dishes well cooked and served by really pleasant staff.  It gave us exactly the winter sun break we were looking for and I will certainly stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: We booked a couple of days' luxury here having spent the first part of our Marrakech holiday in a Riad. Well worth it.    It's very central just off the Jemaa El Fna central square and across from the main mosque. Taxis are easy to get outside but most of the Medina is walkable.    The central courtyard is lovely - peaceful atmospheric in the evenings with traditional music played and a wood fire in one of the luxurious lounge areas open to the courtyard. Cocktails are good (and not especially pricey by Marrakech standards). The pool on the roof terrace is small and shallow but is warm and has a lovely sun lounging area with an adjacent bar serving food attentive staff and a lovely view of the Koutoubia minaret and the mountains in the distance.    Our room (one of the standard rooms) was well furnished (if slightly in need of a refurb) with a luxurious marble bathroom and courtyard view. Rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom were a nice touch. Complimentary toiletries not great however.    Excellent buffet breakfast in the courtyard downstairs with everything I could think of (including lovely fresh fruit freshly cooked crepes and eggs) and good strong coffee. There are three restaurants on site. We tried the Indian upstairs (absolutely excellent) and the French place (good). Food at the poolside also very nice indeed.    Didn't use the spa which is in the basement level but looks suitably luxurious. The fitness centre is small with four cardio machines one weights machine and some dumbbells but wasn't busy.    Top tip: bring earplugs. The pre-dawn call to prayer is unavoidable anywhere in the Medina and the Koutoubia Muezzin is one of the more well amplified but less melodic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Hotel in the Middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel is simply beautiful. It has a gorgeous garden pool as well as a heated rooftop pool. The breakfast was very nice to include a DIY egg boiler and omelet station.    Our suite was a little odd. It was rooms 112/114. However they are forever a suite because 112 has a nice tub and great rain shower in that bathroom and 114 has a bathtub and the only toilet for the suite in there. It was kind of odd having to go into our kids' room to use the bathroom.    The hotel is hidden away on a crowded side street just 150 yards from the Koutoubia Mosque and seemingly around the corner from the main square. It is very convenient to walk just about anywhere in the old town.    We drove down and while I'm not sure where other people park security had us leave our car parked right there outside the front door for two days.    I did use the spa which has it's own pool as well. I would rate the spa as average on technique and value but above average on decor.    Right now they are doing some renovation in the hotel. They start the loud noises at 10 am and stop at 5 pm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Luxury in the wonderful chaos that is Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here around 8 years ago and I'm glad to report things haven't changed. It's an oasis in the middle of bustling Marrakech in a side street just a stones throw away from the main square it is built in Maroc style there's a pool on the ground floor and a heated pool on the roof which is a sun trap from here you can see the koutoubia minaret. The breakfast is great our room was upgraded upon check in. Great maid service.  The only slight moan is that the service on the rooftop bar was a little slow but this didn't really bother us.  There is also a great Indian restaurant on the top floor.  We stayed for a weekend and hired a minibus for a trip to Asni and Emily - atlas mountain villages.  The minibus was £100 all in for 7 of us(10-3pm) we had a tagine lunch up in the mountains and was back in Marrakech by 3pm. I would thoroughly recommend doing this our children loved it.  The hotel isn't very child friendly there are better hotels out in the palmeraie to cater for younger families this hotel would be better for couples or for those wanting luxury close to the city centre.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Peaceful haven in the heart of it all
Review_Text: If location is everything this hotel has so much more. Situated in the very heart of the medina it is steps from the Koutoubia and steps from the main square and the souks. Whilst the frenzy of Marrakech starts on the hotel doorstep inside all is the exquisite calm of unruffled luxury yet with the unique atmosphere of a riad. For a week in January we stayed in what they euphemistically call a 'junior suite' but is really so much more. From our balcony the size of another lounge and sumptuously furnished accordingly (even a retracting roof)we had a good view of the koutoubia.    The hotel is quite lovely cool walkways and quiet corners with seating abound and it is furnished and decorated in a traditional Moroccan style. The staff bring warmth and are genuinely welcoming and helpful.    We also enjoyed the room service and especially the hotel's Asian restaurant. This is a very well run quality and traditional hotel in a great location. Great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hélène F wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Great hotel in middle of the medina
Review_Text: Very peaceful place in middle of the massive chaos this city brings with it. It was just marvelous to be able to come back at lunch time and jump in the pool or if we simply needed a break of all the noise and people.  La place is just one footstep away and it is very simple to find its way back to the hotel.  Downside were the looks of the boys at the indian restaurants when we were in bikini at the pool next to it and that all the taxis waiting in front of the hotel were triple the price the other ones at the place asked for.  The concierge downstairs in the lobby were amazing and the rooms were clean. A couple of cracks in the wall but besides that everything was gorgeous. The roses in the room were a nice touch.    I'm more used to hostels so this was very luxurious and lovely nice to have stayed there!  Best thing ever: BREAKFAST! sadly it was so hot I could never eat as much as I wanted to!! So much choice and the orange juice is to die for!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This place is just gorgeous. It's so near the big square but it's so peaceful and welcoming. The batman there Ikmail (spelling) makes the best cocktails and offers impeccable service. Nothing is too much trouble. The nibbles to go with the drinks are a nice touch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent hotel placed very centrally in Marrakesh
Review_Text: I had the delight of visiting Marrakesh with my 4 year old daughter for a week. We stayed at Les Jardins de La Koutoubia.    We had a great time using the two excellent heated pools frequently - the top one with an excellent view of the Atlas Mountains. We received excellent service from the concierge - who helped book a perfect trip to the beginning of the Atlas Mountains.    The room we got was a very big room with both a bathtub and a shower in very good condition. The breakfast was very good - with everything you could want and need.    The best part of staying at the hotel was the very central placement of the hotel - only 3 minutes from the central square.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I'd go back. That's the bottom line. But you have to know what to expect. The location cannot be beat. Its ideal for touring the city right near the main square. I think no hotel in its class is as close. We had a huge room a suite really with a terrace in the Paris Relais part of the hotel (relatively new). The room was nicely furnished although everything was a little worn in a way that wasn't problematic but isn't what you'd expect in a "true" 5-star. Lots of light in the room and bird song from the garden outside. The facilities were magnificent in their day and worth experiencing despite being a little tired. The service was quirky but charming at the front desk. Room maid service was excellent. Room and bathroom scrupulously clean. Bathroom huge but use your own shampoo and bring conditioner (there's none).Rose petals in a different pattern on the bed every night. Our room was quite far from the main entrance so it proved a little easier to use the street that was "privatized" into the hotel when they bought up surrounding buildings over the years. Other comments: wifi weak breakfast (the only meal we ate there) adequate no better than that the front desk booked superb drivers for us at fair prices (!); front desk is charming but a little unreliable on wake-up calls messages etc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My daughter and i have just returned from Marrakech and we had 3 fantastic nights at this hotel it was everything we hoped for and more. We were thoroughly spoilt with rose petals arranged on our bed every day and a fresh rose it was definitely the most luxurious hotel room I have stayed in. Not only was there a bedroom and lounge there was also a dressing room and our own outside seating area. There are 3 pools but we used the lovely heated pool and sun terrace on the roof it had a beautiful view of the Atlas mountains for us to enjoy while we relaxed on our very comfortable sunbeds which an attendant had placed a towel on for us. I read reviews before we left that tipping was a problem at this hotel NOT true no one expected a tip and we gave tips at the end of our stay to the people we felt most deserved it. All the staff were very friendly and helpful I highly recommend this lovely opulent hotel. It is also perfectly situated with only a five minute walk to the main square which is very lively both day and night. We also recommend the small café close to the hotel a great cup of coffee very cheap clean and friendly
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Les Jardins De La Koutoubia is a fantastic location if you want to base yourself right in the thick of it. The interior of the hotel is comfortable warm and a pleasant sanctuary away from the busy streets outside. The hotel does indeed have that 'worn' feel but in a plesant way you can tell the hotel in well maintained and it feels like a more authentic Moroccan experience. The large riad style makes you feel like you are in a Moroccan palace and I loved the roses and rose petals which are dotted around the place it's a lovely touch. There is gorgeous warm red and orange furniture/fittings and many places to sit and have a coffee and soak up the sun. Our mini-suite was great the room was big clean and very comfortable. The only negative was our terrace did not catch the sun at all so you may need to be specific about your room's position if this is a problem. We ate in the Moroccan and Indian restaurants both served beautiful food although you will pay more for your meal compared to many restaurants outside. The rooftop pool was great and was very relaxing. We had a half day hammam the staff were great gave us plenty of time to relax in between treatments and it felt like we had the place to ourselves. All in all this hotel is a pleasure however you do pay a premium for the central location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: E M wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Nice place with quite some irritating aspects
Review_Text: The hotel is in an excellent location to explore the old city by walking. The facilities are very nicely decorated and create a nice atmosphere. That smoking is allowed in all public areas of the hotel like in the bar and all the restaurants is not to our taste.  Our room - a junior suite - was clean and cosy and well serviced. The very closely located minaret however provides a hard early morning wake up call.  The food was nothing to write home about. Mostly tasteless and not well presented.  We had booked half ward which turned out to be a big mistake. The daily rate (30 €/person)was not compensated when we did not go for dinner. Lunch was also not taken into account either neither were drinks. Eventually we paid much more by taking half ward instead of paying for what we ordered. This came as a bit of a surprise to us and the hotel administration showed an irritating lack of customer orientation here.  In summary: We would not go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carolyn J wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Road leading to hotel gave you no clue as to what was behind hotel doors. It was dream relaxed lighting friendly staff hotel built around two courtyards full of lush plants on with a swimming pool surrounded by tables where you can eat one of three resturants. Rooms were splendid we had a mini suite bath shower mini bar. Comfortable bed and settee. Lounge bar for pre dinner drink with a out of tune piano. Will go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here with my daughter's family (2 children) and had a wonderful stay. Extremely short stroll to the medina (passing a superb bakery just a few steps away). Rooftop heated pool was a hit with the kids...not to mention the joy at finding rose petals on the beds. Clean elegant nice piano bar and several food options at the hotel. Breakfast was a generous feast.    They only would allow one child in each room. For us no problem as we enjoy having a seven year old share our space. But something to keep in mind if you are 2 adults traveling with 2 young ones.    There was a spa but we did not use it.    We were also upgraded to rooms that shared a patio....so the kids were able to stroll back and forth between the rooms. For us...a really nice bonus.    Rugs in the hall were a bit tattered. A very slight defect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Bozena S wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: This is the best location to see the Medina- just few steps from Jemaa el Fna. We stayed with our 6 years old son and the service room and especially wonderful swimming pool were perfect. The hotel served as an oasis for us a peace of mind in this enchanting and bustling city. They provided wonderul service: we had an English speaking tour guide around Marrakech they provided driver and a guide to Atlas Mountains and Essaouira by the ocean even reservations in the most exquisite restaurants around the town. It is next to the souks of the Medina so shopping is just outside the doors. The hotel has few different restaurants and if too tired one can eat there as well. The staff was very kind and pleasant and always helpful. We had a time of our lives.

First of all it's summer in January. Then you are in a five star hotel  a real one ! Everything is five stars : the room ( waiting for you with rose petals all over the bed )  the breakfast  the service ( special thanks to the public relation "directrice" ) the restaurants of the hotel  the location ( right next to the medina in the very center of the town :)  Even the smell in the hotel is very special . You will only wait to come back !  So next time you are in Marrakech book this hotel and enjoy !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 5 days here. Staff helpful and friendly the breakfast was lovely and the heated rooftop pool was fantastic. We got upgraded to a quieter room with a view of the pool very tranquil and relaxing. The position is fantastic right by the square with loads to see. I would visit again most definitely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This hotel exceeded expectations. It is located on a side street that leads directly into the Djenna Elf'na square and the heart of the souks - literally a two minute walk. The other direction is a two minute walk ti the iconic Koutoubia Mosque. The room was HUGE! I couldn't have asked for more. The building is a bit old but in a charming and historic way that adds to the experience. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the Indian restaurant on the roof was quite good. I would book this hotel again in a heartbeat

Review_Date: Clive G wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: After the souks and the square of el f'na Les Jardins de La Koutoubia is a wonderful oasis. We had a very good lunch on the outside edge of the pool. A little bit expensive but worth the experience. The service was good and of course the flowers and pool make a wonderful setting. Everything was clean including the toilets. The concierge services were very helpful and quite a contrast to the responses we got from our own hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Traditional Rhiad, nice retreat from Marrakech markets
Review_Text: When you first pull up outside the Rhiad it doesn't look much from the outside. It's in a small backstreet with various stalls selling cheap watches and hi-fi stuff. When you then enter you are greeted with a cup of delicious mint tea while you check in and then taken taken to your room.  The Rhiad is very traditional with stone staircases which whilst looking slightly worn in places adds to the romantic traditional of the property. Our room was beautiful overlooking the courtyard and main Mosque which is lit up at night. The bed and bathroom were covered in fresh rose petals which were replaced every day when the room was serviced. The bathroom itself was large and comfortable and although showed some wear and tear it was in keeping with the atmosphere of the Rhiad (some minor knocks and bumps in stone is only to be expected).  The staff were polite and attentive without being "in your face" - a pleasant retreat after the attentions of street marketers of Marrakech.  Eating wise the breakfast was lovely (and very entertaining thanks to a beautiful and playful kitten who enjoys saying hello to everyone in the morning - ladies watch out for any flappy bits on your handbags!). The french restaurant attached to the Rhiad and the Moroccon restaurant were lovely. The Indian restaurant on the top balcony was lovely food but poor service. The lunch there is fairly basic.  We would definitely stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is a lovely hotel right in the medina of Marrakesh easily accessible by taxi from the rail station and just a few minutes’ walk to the main square of the medina. You enter directly into a rich red and quite lush lobby and seating area with luxurious sofas. Check-in service was efficient and courteous and a tea was provided. My room was located in the front of the building with a room looking down on to the busy medina street. I was glad of this rather than having a room looking down to the inner courtyard with the pool. It was actually quiet in the evening which was great. The room was spacious with fresh roses provided each day on the bed complete with rose petals. A very nice touch. The evening of my first day there a small set of tagines provided fresh chocolates. Bottles of water were available in the room. An in-room safe is provided. The bathroom was adequate for one person with a great tub and shower in the tub.    Breakfast was provided in the lobby level restaurant and it was excellent. A wonderful selection of hot and cold foods great variety of juices fresh fruit breads and pastries and eggs and waffles made to order. I also had dinner in the restaurant one evening. The lamb tagine was superb. The rooftop with bar and heated pool provided some good views over the medina as well as a magnificent sunset one evening. Internet service is free but dreadful. It is not available in the rooms and speed and stability varied from time to time in the busy lobby area where the best (?) access seemed to be available. Need to improve this considerably. Everyone seems to expect a tip even for minimal service. A little blatant. Need to teach staff some etiquette and discreetness here. Some lovely open lounge areas (and open fire) around the patios of the pool area. Very nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This traditional hotel has everything a traveller needs. We had two rooms with connecting balcony and the rooms were ample good beds and very nice bathroom with great shower!  The people working there very helpful. Breakfast is great too very nice orange juice.  Location is very good a 2 minute walk to the big square. We especially liked the Indian restaurant even our daughter who didn't like Indian food. That changed this holiday. Also the " snackbar' at the pool was very good. And one night we ate at the Moroccan restaurant were we had a modest show of two musicians and a belly dancer. We enjoyed it very much. One thing is for sure: we will return. Again in winter time because of the very nice weather 20-25 degrees during Christmas break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This hotel exceeded expectations. My husband and I were upgraded to a junior suite overlooking the patio and pool. Our 2 offspring had a double room each. The facilities were excellent including a heated pool on the roof top. The Indian restaurant was superb the breakfasts were fantastic and the bar was a great place to finish off the day. The roof top restaurant served great Moroccan food and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. This hotel is in a superb location in the medina near the square so easy to find but it is an oasis amongst the chaos of Marrakech. Thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We spent 5 days in the hotel in one of its suites (the best available accomodations) so one might take this fact in consideration if the choice is for another type of room. The suite is superb including a living room the room itself and a "salle de bain" with a confortable bathtub (for two). Great accomodation. The hotel has three restaurants (indian morrocon and international). We have not tried the latter but the first two are pretty good mainly the indian. There us a delicious spa which we also tried with different types of massages. The service is adequate although a bit slow when the hotel is fully booked (at a certain day it took one hour for the room service bring us some sandwichs). The location may be an advantage or disadvantage depending on the profile of the client. The hotel is practically inside place Djema El Fna. To me a huge disadvantage because I hate the noisy old town (and the hotel is an oasis of peace surrounded by that mess) but my wife was delighted to be in that place close to the souks in the heart of the Medina. But it is at a 15 minutes walk from the new town. I would go there again for sure
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Have always dreamt of staying in this hotel after visiting Marrakech many times and decided to finally pay for it as a special treat. Booked previously online at a discounted price which included breakfast.    Checked in which seemed to have taken such a long time however the front desk kindly upgraded our room which was nice we did see the previous room ‘medina view’ and would have been gutted staying there for the price we paid the mini suite we got upgraded too was gorgeous and very nice.    Location is the best location to be so close in the market but so quiet and lovely inside. The pools looked lovely such a shame they charge to use the indoor pool its pathetic after the price you pay to stay they charge so much to use an indoor pool!    Wifi was shockingly poor had better staying at a 2 star! Kept disconnecting after every minute I called reception and they apologised thats all they could do. I guess it is a common issue.    Hotel looks worn out and in need for refurbishment carpets tiles dust and generally.    The bathrooms have a see through glass so if going with a friend/family member be warned.    Breakfast had a very big selection of food but service was very poor they do not speak much English and not sure why they have to serve water and juice so you have to wait for a long time when you want a glass of water. But the selection was very good and tasty and filling.    Only reason not voted 1 star because we got upgraded and because of the location.    Would stay again if I could afford it and a mini suite would recommend it for someone wanting to stay close to the market.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Not so much of a 5 star hotel!
Review_Text: I don't know exactly how to start with this hotel but it's just terrible. No easy access if you have a car couldn't find a spot. so imagine having to drag your luggage in the middle of carts and cars and people.  Breakfast was just bland a "meh" is in order here. Nothing exciting really. Other than that it's beautiful from the inside but so are the 600 hotels in Marrakech the different lies with the quality of the food the treatment of the staff and so many other factors.    This hotel deserves much less than the 2 stars I gave it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in a not so beautiful location
Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel Nov 2013. Initial impressions when the taxi stopped we're not good the street outside is the route to the souks as such it resembles "The "Barras" in Glasgow. However inside the hotel was a completely different experience. The hotel has a colonial feel with a gorgeous open air courtyard in the centre. There is a great roof top area with pool and restaurant there is also two restaurants on the ground floor. There is a fabulous spa area with indoor pool and full range of treatments. We had two rooms with adjoining balcony which was brilliant the staff were fantastic also. I would definitely recommend the hotel and although the street outside was "manic" we never at anytime felt unsafe as the Moroccan people were very helpful and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Only came for the day to lounge by the pool and have lunch. Lovely hotel it seemed but staff very stuck up and rude and the food was nice but expensive for what it was.    I imagine the hotel rooms are beautiful as even the toilets were covered in fresh rose petals but we weren't treated particularly nicely so not sure I would go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew L wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: If you say you are a grand hotel, be truly grand
Review_Text: The grand structure of this elderly beauty and its placement near Fna el Jmaa is a good reason to stay here. It is an oasis amid the chaotic world outside it. The staff is very helpful and kind. The grounds are old world and grand. Upon closer inspection there are areas of inattention that could improve it to the highest stature. Here is my list that include typical amenities and services that I expect: Wash cloths Clean vents no dust on tops of doors and cabinets old pilling area carpets water that takes up to 5 minutes(timed) to get warm in the sink sheets that are correctly sized so that the can be tucked under the mattress do not disturb signs that mean the cleaners should not come into the room even while you are gone the extremely slow drains in the shower in the Clarins spa the lack of readily available towels everywhere within reach the choice of shampoo could be improved enormously.  All said and done it is a bit hefty on the price even with breakfast included. The mint tea is great the Moroccan crepes are wonderful but a hotel in this area should serve fresh orange or grapefruit or apricot or pomegranate juice to its guests not sweetened boiled juice diluted and standing for hours. This is what bothers me. If you say you are grand be grand.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
