Review_Text: When we first arrived at the hotel we were not too sure but as we walked in through the entrance we were not prepared for what lay beyond. It was like heading back in time and quite frankly in to another world. Large vaulted ceilings and sumptuous sofas greeted us. We were taken to the courtyard and served tea by the pool whilst we were checked in. The rooms were large and well appointed. The service was a great plus to this place and people could not do enough for us. There were multiple restaurants and a roof top pool.    We would certainly have no hesitation in staying here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rishil P wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Hit:  - Massage was great  - Spa facilities pools  - breakfast is sensational !!  - nice pool table  - plenty of chill-out seating  - beautiful hotel very authentic  - Super close to the Medina/Souk    Miss:  - Concierge desk is poor  - Porter expected a tip for taking bags up and gave us a very awkward look when we didn't tip (we didn't have any cash). Very uncomfortable and unnecessary  - Showers are terrible
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed here one night as the grand finale to a biking trip. Our room and the surroundings were lovely. However it was overpriced and the front desk staff tended to be sullen. It was the first time in our 10 days in Morocco we had seen that type of attitude. My husband was quite ill while we were there so I went in search of some bottled water for him. No one showed the least concern but did manage to charge a very steep amount for the water. All that said the buffet breakfast is lavish and delicious. We had originally planned to stay n extra 2 days but the price pet night was over US$350 per night. Marrakesh offers many other options for lovely accommodation without this price or attitude.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Overrated and too expensive for what you get
Review_Text: The hotel has a really excellent location in the heart of the medina. But that's unfortunately about all there is that is positive. During our stay we found a lot of negative points: the elevator didn't work for 3 days (and the management didn't even care to post an out of order message) our room was not cleaned well (we spare you the details) the breakfast is not as good as you await from this kind of hotel and half of the time the tables we not cleaned properly and the napkins for meals were untidy. So the hotel is in our opinion overrated and not worth the high price we paid.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claire A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: I must start by stating my confusion regarding some of the recent reviews we found the staff and service to be one of the great selling points of this hotel.Having previously stayed at La Mamounia where the staff were incredibly distantwe found the friendliness and helpful attitude of the staff a lovely touchwe were made to feel very welcome nothing was too much trouble.The hotel itself was in a very central locationgreat for popping back to drop off souk purchases and a safe walk down the street at night after eating in the squarea must do.Having visited before we knew what to expect from Marrakech .We did not eat lunch or dinner at the hotel so cannot rate but thoroughly enjoyed the range available at breakfastomelettes are lovelytoast machine a bit of a chore though! All in all we loved our staynot quite perfect but would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I simply had lunch in the Patio Restaurant and the quality of the service and of the food was not of a five stars hotel restaurant. The staff was not supportive and the food was very "normal" (and for the price very expensive!). The atmosphere is very nice as well as the location. But it is not very clean (please look at the chairs' pillows in the Patio restaurant! It seems my 2 years daughter tee shirt after her lunch: dirty and a lot of spots!  Sorry never again...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mike M wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Performance Did Not Match Their Image
Review_Text: This hotel holds itself as a five star property and much of it is beautiful but the air conditioning should work in a hotel room that is so expensive. Not only did it not cool the room adequately but there was more hot air than performance in their attempt to fix it. They would not change our room either even though we met people who were checking out and were satisfied with their rooms. We checked out after one night and moved elsewhere for our other two nights in Marrakech. Other than that we had a great time in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard E wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: nice place shame about the staff
Review_Text: The hotel has a great location just off the main square with two lovely pools and all the usual trimmings  It's a pity they don't invest a bit more in staff training - we found them slow disinterested and verging on discourteous at times.  Took the edge off what has the potential to be a great hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Both pools too shallow to enjoy swimming and pool on the roof very dirty especially as it's 5* hotel with two pools that can be cleaned at different times! Hotel has lovely gardens camp piano/cocktail bar excellent location etc....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Lovely place bang on the main square but like an oasis when we wanted a break from the experience of Marrakech.    Great service nice people    Nice food including a great choice for breakfast    Enjoyed the piano bar    Nice rooms lovely surrounds    We would definately return if we went back to Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Still my favourite place to stay in Marrakech. Great location and facilities. Slightly suspect service at times and the medina rooms are nowhere near as good as the pool facing ones but overall as good as I remembered.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We stayed here from 1st-5th September to celebrate our sons 21st birthday as a family party of 5 adults. When we arrived we were upgraded to a suite at no extra cost even though we had only paid for a triple room. The suite was really lovely. The following day we asked to move to a larger suite as we were sharing with our son this was not a problem. We were shown a number of suites and chose a 2 room one with balcony. (All the rooms we were shown were different which makes this hotel so different) We were prepared to pay the extra cost but the hotel manager said as it was our sons birthday it would be a gift from the hotel to us. The rooms were kept lovely and clean and toiletries replenished every day. The air conditioning in the room was fantastic especially when it's 35*c outside.    The pool area is lovely no problem getting a bed as the pool man puts clean towels out each time the bed is vacated. We only ever used the main pool on the ground floor but there are two other pools.    The breakfast was served around the pool each morning there was plenty to choose from wonderful fruit selection omelettes and pancakes cooked to order.    Most lunchtimes we ate in the hotel pool bar which served great salads and fish also great burgers. We found the prices very reasonable and really nice food.    We stayed in the hotel for two evening meals one in the French restaurant and one in the Moroccan restaurant. The meals were ok not fantastic.    The piano bar is great for cocktails and drinks in the evening you can sit outside in the lovely gardens or in the cool air conditioned bar. All the drinks are served with a selection of olives and nuts.  The hotel arranged for a guide (Hamid) to take us around the souks he was so knowledgeable and well worth paying for.    While the hotel is a little tired in places it adds to the charm it's quite shabby chic and individual which we loved. It is also a 2 minute walk to the Medina and the Souks. The staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. A special thank you to Abdul who looked after our party so well nothing was too much trouble.    We would recommend staying here to our friends and will go back and stay again we loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We spent 5 days at the hotel. We were upgraded too (lots of reviews say this!). The room was big but a tad worn (plastic toilet seats shower would not drain old carpets).  The major negative is the aircon. The hotel simply does not seem to have a proper ventilation system. We complained 3 times even the hostess who comes around at breakfast but nothing was done and nobody enquired if it had been sorted so they are very aware of the problem. I would not recommend this hotel in the Summer time because it gets very hot in Marrakech.  The pools were good. The ground floor one is not heated but the rooftop one is. Breakfast was nice too and we could get free internet in most places including near the pools. Great location. Service was ok.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are just back from a 4 night stay at JdlK. We were in the cheapest room but for some reason we ended up with a suite which was really pretty big - bedroom separate sitting room and two bathrooms each with bath and shower. This was way bigger than we expected and we peeked at other rooms being cleaned and these were a lot smaller so I guess we were just lucky. There was zero noise from other rooms the a/c was great it felt reasonably clean and we were pretty happy on the whole.    The servicing of the room let things down a bit - despite two bathrooms we only had one set of towels and on one day the maid took these and did not replace them so we had to call for more. Our mini bar was not replenished once during our stay either.    I think other people complained about the service and while it isn't American or Asian levels of service we found everyone to be helpful - at the font desk changing money or asking for restaurant recommendations or at the restaurant by the rooftop pool where they were pleased to fetch drinks and food.    Breakfast had a good selection and choice including bacon which we thought they might not have. Oddly they had a toaster which took forever to basically turn bread into biscuits and coffee which was sludge and watered down orange juice. All unforgivable at a supposed 5* hotel I would say. It's so easy to get these basics right. We know they can do fresh OJ - we had it by the pool later on for 25dh (although it is for sale at 4dh in the main square!). We found poolside food and drinks to be a little more expensive than they should have been and one day we ate the obligatory club sandwich which was very poor.    On the final day we booked massages at the spa and expected to be able to use the full facilities while there. The only facilities we were allowed to use were the cold pool and were told we could not use the hammam. Quite why anyone would use a cold basement pool when there is a hot rooftop one is beyond me. No one was in the hammam and it was all on and we were paying £100 for two massages yet not allowed in. I feel this is poor. The massages were good though and they had nice changing facilities.    The hotel is excellently located just a few mins walk from the chaos of the main square yet immune to the noise.    So room was better than expected service was fine food and drink somewhat of a let down the spa was mean ... not good at what is supposed to be a 5* hotel. If this is 5* then I guess La Mamounia must be a 10*. We did have a comfortable stay though and the rooftop pool is nice. If they styled themselves as a 4* hotel my rating would be higher.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good Hotel, not 5 star but this is reflected in the price you pay here.
Review_Text: This is not an amazing luxury hotel like Royal Mansour Mamounia La Sultana etc... but at less than half the price it is a great option for most who want good facilities in a central location. We booked a standard room and were amazed at the size and the fact we had 2 bathrooms! turned out we had been given 2 rooms 103 and 104 which would be great if you are planning a family trip. The rooms are a little tired as is the whole feel of the hotel but there was nothing terrible..... oh apart from the man singing in the bar at night... I am not sure if it was a joke??? he was so bad it was amusing! They were a bit mean with the pillows and towels but we survived! The pools are fine with comfy loungers we found the rooftop pool the nicest place to sit and the staff up there were very friendly and and worked very hard looking after everyone. Breakfast was good enough however it's slightly irritating that they gave you cheap watery orange juice when you know you can get amazing fresh juice in the square for 4 Dirhams! The tea and coffee were bad too. We had lunch of times by the pools and it was adequate the Asian option being the better by the room top. We had treatments in the spa on our last day and the facial and massage were good. We were allowed to use the pool in the price of our treatment but not the Hamman which seemed a bit mean given the cost of the treatments.... the pool inside by the way is cold and not worth paying for additionally. With a few tweaks this place could be really great but for the money its not bad....just don't expect too much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location and a bit of tranquility in the city
Review_Text: We have stayed at the Koutoubia several times. The rooms are large enough to easily accommodate our two children (two cribs/pack-n-plays) and there are enough corridors/pathways to give them some running-around room. I would give it five stars but some of the rooms and the corridors are a little run-down (as previous reviewers have noted) but the Indian restaurant on the roof the Thai restaurant next door and the breakfast buffet easily make-up for it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Lovely traditional peaceful oasis in the heart of the city, great rooms, facilities and staff
Review_Text: I don't get some of the reviews and ratings here. We have just completed our stay at the hotel and we've had a lovely peaceful time and the hotel and staff have all been great. We had a great holiday and the hotel was the perfect base. We were well treated and looked after perfectly.    It is probably one of the largest and best equipped hotels this close to the centre of the city. So it is perfect being only 5 mins walk from Jemaa el Fna the souks and nowhere in the medina is more than about 30 mins walk. If you want a large modern spa hotel then you'll probably be better off further out or if you want a small cosy riad then go for that - but if you want a hotel with all the 5* facilities AND be close to the centre then this hotel is perfect.    The staff were all friendly and tried their best to help with every request. They didn't always provide the quickest service but that was all part of relaxed atmosphere. The concierge was helpful and we booked two trips and a cookery class and all our transfers through the hotel - all of which worked out well.    The hotel is based around two large courtyards. The first courtyard contains the main pool and is surrounded at ground level by a lovely garden the entrance lobby the bar one of the restaurants the cafe and a whole series of quiet cosy alcoves and rooms. At night it is delightful to sit out with a drink to take in the glinting lights the gentle local music and the wonderful birdsong.    The other courtyard has a garden overlooked by the patio rooms and suite balconies and contains one of the three restaurants.    There are three pools the main courtyard pool the rooftop sun terrace pool and another in the spa. Three restaurants all of which were great although I think the Asian "Jardins de la Bala" was the best.    We had one mix-up. I'd emailed in advance to the hotel to arrange a transfer from the airport however the Moroccan government decided to change daylight saving time at the last minute so there was a misunderstanding about our arrival time. But it was resolved quickly.    As far as rooms are concerned we were upgraded to a mini-suite so we had a super large bed then down some steps there was a large seating area - we had a balcony overlooking the garden courtyard and the bathroom was lovely traditional 'old Moroccan style'. The bed linen and bathroom were clean and well kept and were very comfortable. The rooms had a lot of light and storage space which is often not the case.    The one gripe was a shortage of accessible plug sockets.    One thing highlight though was that on arrival the rooms was beautifully decorated with roses (actually there were roses all over the hotel) water some nice fruits and a selection of Moroccan pastries. Lovely :) And a sign of how well they look after you :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Good location ideal to explore Marrakech situated in the old city lovely rooms good facilities good restaurants. Friendly staff. 3 pools to choose from. Beautiful spa with good choice of treatments.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: JULIAN M wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Second Visit, just a delightful hotel
Review_Text: Having had such an excellent trip last year we decided to revisit this hotel 12 months on.    Thankfully very little has changed and i still rate this hotel as one of the finest in Marrakesh for location service levels qulaity and standard of rooms and general all round appeal.    There have been a lot of neagative reviews on TA regarding this hotel and to be fair everyone is entiltled to their own opinion however i feel that some of the reviews are far from justifield.    The staff are extemely helpful and accomodating having emailed the hotel prior to our visit they were kind enough to arrange a taxi for us which was waiting at the airport as we arrived. Check in was simple and efficent and an upgrade to poolside suite was most appreciated. The hotel is also spotlessly clean.    The room itself was stunning very large comfortable bed big lounge 2 bathrooms and 2 sets of patio doors which opened up to the view of the pool. attention to deatil is wonderful from the fresh fruit in the room well stocked mini bar selection of complimentary toiletries right dowm to the rose petals laid out on the bed after the room has been cleaned    We used the roof top pool where we found the poolside bar staff to more than helpful there is an excellent choice for lunch and the food it lovely very weel cooked and presented and not partucualrly expensive for a hotel of such quality. Sunbeds are plentiful and very comfy and the sunterrace is just a lovely quiet sun trap    Breakfast is great plenty of choice and again well cooked and dinning on the terrace by the pool is just a great way to start the day. There are also the hotel restraunts which have been revieed seperatly    In all if you want a very relaxing quality hotel just a short stroll from the medina but set in its own completly tranquil setting this hotel is peerfect and highly recomended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Josephine B wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Nice hotel and services - go for a mini-suite
Review_Text: This hotel is in a great location  minutes from the central square and close to taxis to get anywhere else you want to go. The swimming pools are great a cold one on the ground floor and a heated pool on the roof. We managed to get upgraded to a mini suite with a nice terrace which was great however we were due to be in a standard Medina view double room. I asked to see this room as well and I have to say if we had not been upgraded I would have been very disappointed in the value for money as this hotel is on the expensive side and the standard rooms are very standard! Everything is very clean the breakfast and restaurants were great and the staff very very helpful. I would definitely recommend but I would say go for the nicer rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bronwyn W wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: This fantastic hotel is in a perfect location close to the main square in the Medina -it provides a perfect sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of central Marrakech-you can relax in the quiet courtyard by the pool after a hard morning haggling in the souks.  It is incredibly 'soundproof' to the chaos outside both day and night so you can enjoy a quiet drink in the bar or on the terrace before heading out to enjoy a Moroccan dinner  The restaurants in the hotel are a good standard with a variety of cuisine - breakfast provides a wide range of fresh food to set you up for the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I am hardly ever compelled to write a review about any hotel I stay in negative of positive but the treatment we have received from one of the staff was one that was appalling and has motivated me to unfortunately write.    We arrived to stay our last day in Marrakech in the hotel to be greeted by a very unprofessional staff but specifically one in particular who is working in reception. The woman working at the reception desk was completely unprofessional in handling both our check in and check out. She was very rude indeed and had a very disrespectful attitude and tone. At check in her unfriendly mannerism took us by surprise and we thought she might be having a bad day. However during checkout when asked did we take something from the mini bar under the assumption that the water was complimentary we said no as we were leaving she ask the porter to call us back into the hotel and across the hall yelled out that we did not pay and that we have lied. When I confronted her and asked her to speak in a politer manner she continued her unprofessional yelling and hand gestures that I have never seen a receptionist in a 5 star hotel behave! My partner had to also ask her to lower her voice and speak to the clients with some respect. I was about to tell her that we are not trying to save 20 dirhams on a water bottle when we have paid around 3000 dirhams for a room but refrained from making this obvious comment.    It is unfortunate to have to experience this at a luxurious place like Les Jardin de Kotoubia we were very much looking forward to spending our last night in a nice place which in our case was really dampened by this woman at reception.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location but not five star
Review_Text: Great location by the main square and souks but as others have said far from five star. In need of major upgrade of some rooms and most corridors. To be fair work was happening on the top floor- sadly loudly during our stay! Our children were given an updated room which was lovely with a good bathroom. Our next door room was old and pretty disappointing with the bathroom floor flooding every shower due to ill fitting shower head and curtain that was too small air con that rattled loudly unless on full power which made the room too cold. Service and food very variable but that true of everywhere we went in Morocco- we live in Asia where service is generally considerably better. Certainly expected a little more leeway on checkout time. We asked for an extra two hours for one of our two rooms but this was denied. Wish our room had been cleaned so promptly during our stay! We were surprised that the third indoor pool was not free. One MAJOR problem for us was the poor wifi. The computers in the computer room were wifi reliant and we could not find anywhere in the hotel where the wifi was reliable. Unfortunately though on holiday wifi was necessary for us on a couple of days and there was none available for many long stretches during our stay. It would not take much to really improve thus hotel and the staff. We visited a smaller riad for dinner which showed what could be done and where the rooms just looked more cared for and where service was excellent with management very visibly monitoring service levels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lindsay B wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: Overall a super hotel with great facilities
Review_Text: First impression is not good - the hotel entrance is on a rather horrible narrow road full of vehicles motorbikes donkey and cart (yes really!). However as soon as you enter the hotel it opens out into a lovely setting around a stylish pool. Despite organising our pick-up from airport the hotel said that since it was after 4pm we had to pay the driver ourselves in local currency - which you can't get in the UK. Hotel therefore paid driver and asked us to to re-imburse them in euros. What a faff! Why could they not simply charge our room account? Anyway without asking our mini-suite was upgraded to a lovely junior suite. Large marble bathroom separate bedroom with sitting room opening onto large balcony. Room needed a bit of maintenance eg poor sealant round bath sink not draining etc. Le Relais and Jardins de Bala restaurants are great. Fillet steak costs around £14 and nice local wine at £11 a bottle! Moroccan restaurant was not too great and we were not the only diners to be less than impressed. Hotel reception could not give me change of a 100 note (ie about £8) and we had to wait for a porter to nip round to a shop. Shows that they still have a bit to go to be a 5 star European standard hotel. The Spa is very good and a full one hour massage was about £50. Heated rooftop swimming pool is lovely and was never that busy. Staff at the hotel were all friendly and helpful. You are very close to the mosque and if you are a light sleeper get ready for calls to prayer at various times of day and night. 5 minute walk to the main square if you can be bothered - you will either love it or hate it. We thought it was quite awful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gavin K wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: This is by far one of the most beautiful and welcoming hotels in Marrakech. The staff are so kind polite and really go out of their way to ensure you have a first class stay. The Riad is beautifully decorated with quiet rooms to sit and read a book or take in the birds singing in the foliage. The centre focal point being the swimming pools and dining area. We tried all of the restaurants and they were equally fantastic the food was cooked to perfection and served in the same manner. We were unfortunate to be there while building work was on which was slightly off putting hearing that each morning but it didn't spoil the holiday and everything else made up for it. The location of the hotel is perfect if you wish to explore and we took one of the hotel provided trips to Essouria which was a fantastic cultural but tiring day out. I booked a luxury suite and it was total luxury with a beautiful and spacious bedroom balcony over the courtyard seperate living room and very large bathroom every morning rose petals were placed in the the bathroom and on the bed their attention to detail is noticable in all they do. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The beautiful thing about returning to a Hotel with great staff is the greeting on arrival. It really was a warm welcome and we were ushered to our room very quickly due to the lateness of the hour. At breakfast all the old faces came to say hello and the pancake lady had a long chat with our 11 year old daughter. The rooms are excellent with service to match. At lunch the chef even made us a pasta dish as suggested by wife. This is much more then I can say for the "Indian" restaurant on the roof of the hotel. The first time I we had a miserable experience. I thought I would give the chef a chance to improve and tried to explain to him how we would like the food cooked - he was not interested and even questioned why I would want to eat there. This was a huge favour as we were recommended the original Riyadh Restaurant (Maison Arabe) by the receptionist. The Hotel is well suited for families and the kids were having a fantastic time in the pool. It is even better suited for walking everywhere due to its very central location. Ideal for the square and souk as this can only be visited in short bursts. In between one can enjoy some fantastic cocktails in the bar - I would recommend the Mojito. There have been reviews questioning the 5 start status. It is the location quality and above all the staff that make it 5 star.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Robert v wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: Colonial comfort with excellent service and friendly staff.  This older hotel is such a contrast to its surrounding and you would expect to see the actors of Casablanca come out of the elevator or dine in the fine Morrocan restaurant.  Nice pools and beautiful courtyard.

We stayed at the Les Jardin Kotoubia hotel from 14th to 21st August. We booked a standard room but was upgraded to a mini suite. The hotel facilities were excellent and the staff were extremely polite pleasant and helpful.    The hotel itself it excellent had a really old worldly feel about it (hence the faded colonial glory) and you could imagine what it was like in days past.    There were 3 pools but the main one was my favourite. It had a wonderful relaxing feeling and staff ensured that if the beds weren't being used then they were cleared for others. The pool on the roof was an absolute sun trap (perfect for topping up your tan.)    Not only was the hotel beautiful but it was also extremely close to the Souks and the Medina.    Whilst there were a few minor issues (mainly around our room looking a little tired) I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Booked through travel agent to stay at the Les Jardin Kotoubia hotel(central Marrakech).  Arrived at the hotel 16th August @ 12.30am.  Fast Check in by Abdul (hotel Manager).  Room was beautiful clean contemporary spacious.  We booked a standard room but was upgraded to a mini suite.  Buffet breakfast served with a poolside view waiters wonderful polite and cannot fault the professionalism.  Roof terrace pool & further 3rd pool available if other pool is busy.  Public Relations Manager Rukaya frequently seen daily asking feedback & how to improve the hotel & services!  You never see this in any hotel even in the UK!! (Awesome).  The 7 days stay flew by as a family loved our stay.  The staff were faultless cleanliness guaranteed!    Clarins spa within the hotel Pool table/table tennis WiFi Fully Air conditioned rooms room Safe facilities as standard.  G4S Security Guards manning the entrance/exit doors to keep riff raff out!    Look forward to seeing you again a couple of months!    Saeed & family!

This is a fantastic restaurant with really great service. Staff very friendly and the food truly the best in Marrakech in my experience. I would reccomend this as a must for any trip to Marrakech. Although I didnt stay at the hotel it looked very good with very large suites etc. The hotel exteria is misleading as with most properties as once you get in it looks very impressive
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just at El-Fna and still o so calm.Very relaxing.  We received a room upgrade for free: thank you!  2 Swimming Pools/3 Restaurants (different styles of food).  Friendly staff always there for you.  If we come back to Marrakech we go back to this autentic hotel for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our second stay at this hotel and it was just as good as the first time. The hotel is very well placed for the Medina only a few hundred yards to the souk. We went for the sun (lots of) and a relaxing time the hotel did not disappoint. Some of the areas could do with abit of updating  i.e around the roof top pool the decking is getting abit tried and some of the fittings in the room could of been better. It was abit hit or miss with pool side service one day good the next not too  clever ....different staff. Norman in the piona bar was very good and also as we went during Ramandam he explained the holy festival to us which made the experience very moving. We would not go again during Ramandam as it limited the times you could go the souk.    Overal we will be going back in few years as we find the hotel and city a very interesting place to visit. Yes you can get abit of hassle but it's nothing to worry about if you go as a couple or more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel but certainly not a 5 star as advertised. It has a lovely feel to it as its very "colonial" and one really feels as you are staying in a traditional Morroccan hotel. They say there are 3 pools but you can only use two properly. The other is a plunge pool by one of the restaurants and you cant sit around it. The hotel is literally a 5 min walk to the main sq and souks you couldnt really be any closer. The food is good and its worth asking to be upgraded as we got a free upgrade to a junior suite. The air conditioning was very good and the breakfast was superb.    There is a however and apart from a few individuals the staff were appalling. We were not made to feel welcome either by the reception staff of the waiting staff. If any of the management read this review they really need to upskill their staff in customer service especially as they advertise this as a 5 star hotel. Our check out left a sour taste in our mouths as well. We had paid our bill and then came rushing out to tell us that they hadnt charged us for our mini bar after I had paid our bill. They were neither apologetic nor friendly about this which really annoyed me. We asked for an air conditioned cab which didnt arrive until 25 mins mins after the time that we wanted and left us running late for our plane again they were neither apologetic or didnt really seemed that bothered.    In short a really nice feeling hotel very authentic close to everything but appalling customer service. Would I go back....yes!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We did not stay in this hotel but we stopped by almost daily. It is the perfect location on your way to or from the main square of Marrakesh/the souks or other sights. We loved the entry into this oasis of calm when just a hundred or so meters away there were thousands of people out and about. We would stop for pre or post-dinner drinks or a lunch or just to calm down before returning to our riad a bit further away. Always enjoyed the somewhat colonial atmosphere if that that description is allowed beautiful setting with the pool and lights good service nice snacks served with drinks and cool decor. We felt the prices were fine also for rooms for what the hotel seemed to offer were fine even for Morocco for such a central location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: reece h wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Title: Oasis of calm in a hectic city
Review_Text: Excellent hotel friendly and helpful staff.  Meals were pricey but in line with the top hotels in Marrakech.  Room and facilities excellent always cleaned and well maintained.  Rooftop pool good but courtyard pool too cold .... in February when outside temperature reached mid 20's !!  reece
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A little hard to fine (down a side street from the Koutoubia mosque) but it could not be more central....just 2 blocks from El Fna.    There is nothing really wrong with the hotel. It's perfectly nice but it could be so much better. There were lots of little things...the carpets a bit care worn the flowers not so fresh bit of a mustiness to the smell...I think with a little refurbishing they could be great.    Our room a junior suite was very nice (minus complaints of mustiness and old flowers). Sheets lovely and AC perfect.    The food poolside was just ok...as was breakfast. But the Moroccan restaurant was good with excellent musicians and a belly dancer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My family with 2 boys at 3 and 8 stayed for a week at the Koutoubia in the begnning of May 2013. We booked a junior suite and were very pleased when we saw our room. A 2 room suite with plenty of space for the kids. Everything nice and clean and with "authentic" Moroccan decoration. The room overlooked the garden restaurant and had a wonderful balcony.    The hotel is a demonstration in french decadence in both service and guest. It's great to see a few french guests sitting at the breakfast terrace restaurant smoking Gauloises in the pleasant mornings.    For the kids the roof terrace pool was great. It is heated to compensate for the cool nights and big enough to play in for hours. Some guests are not too happy with loud noises from kids but were able to make nearly everybody happy with the balance between noise and happy laughter.    The pool in the courtyard is not heated and a good place to go to if you want to avoid noisy kids - although when the days are hot the pool is ok for a swim at the end of the day.    It only takes 5-7 minutes to walk to the Djemaa el Fna which makes this hotel perfect with kids since they can quickly come to see the wonderful crazy life at the square quickly see a little of the Souk and then return in good shape to the hotel.    The garden restaurant is perfect for a quick dinner. The food is ok and the garden is beautiful in the evening. Can also be recommended for guests not living at the hotel - the same of course goes for the famous cocktail bar which is a decadent pearl of cocktail bars in Africa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had to walk a short distance to get to our hotel as the road outside was full of activity. Entering we were immediately in an oasis of peace and tranquility. We had a mini suite which was very clean and quiet. Breakfast is fine even for someone not liking eggs! Oranges are every where in Marrakech but the orange juice at breakfast was guarded like the crown jewels - and your glass of juice was poured at your table rather than being self-service! A basic I thought was missing was complimentary water in our room - plenty in the mini bar to purchase but we found it much cheaper and plentiful outside the hotel. Evening meals - menus offered a very limited choice!! Position of the hotel was perfect and minutes from the main square - handy to drop off your shopping. Thanks to the staff of the Piano Bar who were always full of suggestions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely hotel, super staff, not quite a 5* hotel though.
Review_Text: We had read lots of reviews of this hotel before we arrived and must agree with previous comments that although the hotel is lovely the staff superb and the location next to perfect it is not quite 5*. We have no complaints everything was super and attentative there was always a lounger available at the pool the lifts were free and available (one of our party uses a mobility scooter) the food was great breakfast fresh and pleantiful etc. The only place the hotel falls down is in the slightly dated decor and the carpets in the halls with were rather thin. Also a room service tray near our room was left on the floor for almost 12 hours. Having said that given that we visited in June with temperatures of 40+ this is the only hotel with lifts and two beautiful pools which were needed come the early afternoon so close to the medina and I would gladly stay again. A huge thank you to all the staff who were so very accommodating to our scooter user. Also the hotel is happy to recommend autorised tour guides - we had a lovely chap who charged 20 euro for 3-4 hours and knowledgeable and thorough and defrfinately worth hiring. Overall an excellent stay I have only given it 4/5 because of the decor otherwise everything was superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: So glad Jardins was our pick!
Review_Text: We were so grateful for our oasis Les Jardins during our stay Marrakech. We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Marrakech. We enjoyed all the amenities including the two pools the beautiful courtyard breakfast the Piano Bar (where we would stop before and after our evening out and Noman our bartender took such good care of us with tips on the town and the culture too). The food was also quite good but above all the scenery within the hotel is so lovely.    Rarely mentioned is the fitness center - I thought that it was excellent considering hotel fitness centers. Relatively modest in size but clean and updated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Could be one of the great hotels of the world
Review_Text: Day one: Surly check in. Awful room little natural light dangerous electrics muddy brown water coming from taps old shower with loose shower curtain which flooded bathroom air conditioning that barely functioned. Barely slept. Requested room change in the morning.    Day two: moved to stunning lateral room overlooking pool area beautiful marble bathroom clean water working air-conditioning. Very happy.    With a lot of TLC this could be one of the finest hotels in the world the location has to be the best in Marrakech.    Positives: breakfast pool (courtyard) bars atmosphere location  Improvements needed: poolside service rooms and air conditioning    Our thanks to the guys at the Piano bar for looking after us so well each evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dina F wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: We very much enjoyed staying at Les Jardins de la Koutubia. It is well appointed hotel with a lovely lobby and bar two very good pools (the main one is outside the lobby in the courtyard surrounded by palsm and bougainvillea with excellent service). Our minisuite room was spacious and very comfortable. The staff are very nice and helpful. It is a delightful place to stay only a five minute walk from the Djemaa al Fna -- very nice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best point it's their location just 3 min of walking from the heart of Marrakech. A lots of bars shops and retaurants in the nearby. The staff in all departaments are welcoming and ready to assist. Spacious and clean room with all facilities I needed during my stay. Great authentic design. Also great swimming pool with seating area very quiet and relaxing another smaller pool also was availble. Good food and quite rich breakfast buffet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: If you want to use the pool/spa book ahead
Review_Text: We arrived here hoping to use the pool and spa as advertised in guide books etc. unfortunately we failed to book and when we got there were greeted by the surly concierge who said they were fully booked (they weren't) and then suggested his mate took us somewhere else in his taxi. He recommended water park oassiria but when I explained we wanted something smaller and more comfortable a hotel with pool and grounds etc he simply changed the name of the water park to a hotel name and sent us on our way (at a 50% taxi premium).  So we didn't stay here or visit here and this may sound like sour grapes....but if you are thinking of using the spa or pool book ahead - I'm sure it is lovely - but don't get scammed or fobbed off with a water park which is more expensive unless you want flames and wave pool etc (see my separate review) and you can also get a free minibus.  Top tip- book ahead!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Johanna B wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: You expect 4 star and you get more.The staff were so welcoming and catered to our every need.The room was outstanding. 2 pools for every taste and ambiance.  Breakfast was a feast...to say the least .Locatiion stunning during the day and at night.  It was so handy to stay right by the medina yet be in such a relaxing clean and luxurious place.  Kids adored the hotel.They were free to wander. It was safe and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Great hotel locality and an amazing place to experience the vibrancy and atmosphere of Marrakech. Fantastic hotel. swimming pools amazing pool bar superb. Cleanliness awesome. Pool cocktail bar fantastic too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here in July 2012 and had a great time. The hotel staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. The hotel has a traditional older feel and is very comfortable. What was really impressive was how quiet the hotel was particularly as the hussel and bussel of the streets was just1 minute walk away. The central swimming pool area was incredible during the day - the pool is great the sunbeds all new and modern with cooling misting machines which cool you down with a light spray of mist every minute - they really had thought of everything!    The service around the pool was also fantastic - as soon as your glass was empty a member of staff was there to ask if you needed anything else.    There is also a number of places to dine on the top of the hotel which looks out over the city - great champagne bar too !    We were eager to see the hidden bits of the city and reception arranged us our own personal tour guide who showed us around which worked out at about £30 for two hours! The guide spoke fluent english and was great when at the market as he really had our backs.    Being a health and fitness fanatic I was very impressed with the gym and spa facilities. The gym lacked free weights but the cardio equipment were good.    I would rate this hotel highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It's very different from staying in a Riad and if it's the first time in Morocco I would recommend the experience in a Riad at least for part of the trip!  Said that... Les Jardins de la Koutoubia is a very authentic hotel with very tasteful moroccan decoration!  -Rooms are very confortable. We had views to the huge patio with the pool lots of tress flowers plants birds... It's amazing being almost in the heart of Jma El Fna it's like being in an oasis! Very quiet and calm!  -Breakfast was really good.  -There are a lot of different lounges living-rooms and restaurants with good food.  You can just relax and enjoy the hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A great experience in Marrakech previously stayed in Riads but decided to try a hotel and we were not disappointed. It's not much to look at from the outside but when you go in its like taking a step back in time in a good way! It's a mix of classic morroccon and western decor.... Service was quick efficient & friendly and once our rooms ready..... We were not disappointed we had been upgraded to garden view rooms and had a beautiful view of the courtyard pool. We were on 2nd floor. Our room was beautiful with rose petals spread across the bedding and in the bathroom. Had a separate living room area with a partition. Only negative about the room was the bathroom in the 1st day they were having problems with the water and it appeared to be a red/brown substance which had us worried! But this was soon rectified and no other problem the rest of the time. Spent the first few days at the rooftop pool which got quite busy from about 11am onwards there is waiter service there but if it's just water you would like better of going to a shop beside the hotel and buying a few bottles to keep with you in the hotel. We did order food at the rooftop pool and the Thai chicken salad was delicious! Highly recommend it!! We ate in the Moroccan restaurant in the hotel 1 evening and the food was lovely with traditional Moroccan music and belly dancing. Must try a cocktail in the Piano bar also although the pianist would be better off not singing.... The mojitos were divine! But my favourite part of the hotel was breakfast! So much choice! From fresh fruit cooked breakfast pancakes omelettes breads and pastries there was something to suit everyone's taste!! Overall my friends and I had a great experience we found the staff to be friendly and helpful plus it's a great location to the medina! And the main square. Would we go back? Very much so!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: There were so many faults with this hotel that I don't know where to begin. We had arranged for the hotel to collect us at the airport. The car didn't show. The rooms were claustrophobic and of really bad quality. There was a red rug on the floor and I had the feeling that it had never been cleaned. The bathrooms were sub-standard an awkward shower over the bath which flooded everywhere and the water would turn hot/cold in a second. The free products were tacky and it was obvious that they were 'filled' daily! The towels were rough and cheap. I had to phone twice for a bathrobe which was missing and Reception insinuated that I was blind. TV is boring only 4 English speaking channels and 2 of these are news only. There is one lift in the hotel which is always full of staff and maintenance people. The main pool is nice but has brown stains on the bottom. The service around the pools are almost non-existent. On day two I couldn't find a sunbed and was told to come back the next day! The menu for lunch is basic the food always served 'warm' and not hot. Moroccan restaurant very nice but I had to ask for my wine glass to be changed twice as it was filthy. The staff are ok some a little surly. The one redeeming feature is the Clarins spa - now that is 5*. This hotel has so much potential as it is a beautiful building with a good location but there are way too many faults and it should be graded as a 3-star.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title:
A hotel living in the past - really
not worth the price
Review_Text: Stayed for three nights and was disappointed by the quality of the rooms and the service. The air-conditionner was noisy and smelled very bad. No hot water two of four mornings. One had to ask twice to get towels for the swimmingpool. For the price they could have provided a bottle of mineral water every day (especially as a bottle costs close to nothing outside the hotel).  Positive remarks are: the location the Spa and Swimmingpool areas...

Our travel agent said this hotel was a 5 star but in our standards it was more of a 2 or 3 and we rarely stay in hotels that are 5 star. This hotel is located in the old town near the medina and markets (souks). So it was close enough to not need taxis or other transportation. If that is what someone is interested in then it's a perfect location. But to enter the hotel one has to go down a small narrow lane crowded with people donkeys and carts cars scooters and trash. The outside is dirty and unimpressive. The inside was quiet and welcoming and felt very safe.    The hotel staff was nice at the front desk and in the restaurants. The breakfast was plentiful with a good variety of food. The room was tired worn and far from clean. It had two bathrooms with one toilet....strange layout. They provided robes and slippers which I appreciated as I would not have gone barefoot. The pictures in the brochure made the hotel look plush but it was far from it. It was a gross misrepresentation. Even the pool looked worn. The tiles on the floor were brown (see pic). However the pool attendants were very accommodating and it was nice to get out of the mayhem on the streets outside the hotel.    We didn't complain to the hotel as that's not our style but as we depend on recommendations we felt it necessary to let other readers know. I don't really know if the cost represented the standard or not. I made the mistake of not doing my own research and had a travel agent make our reservations for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have stayed in marrakech many times and this was our first visit here. It's perfectly located being only 1 min walk from la place. The pool is large and the roon was welk appointed. We had booked a mini suite and got upgraded to a junior suite.  Check in was swift and mint tea was offered. My only slight moan wasvib a suite I would expect complimentary water and perhaps a small bowl of fruit.  The room was large and it offered a balcony/terrace with views of the mosque.  We used the clarins spa and I would do this again. Facilities are great the spa pool divine and treatments very well priced.  Breakfast is served from 0630 and has a very good choice. although the cooked items arrived cold and then were re-heated by a gas burner.  All said 8/10

Review_Title: Catalogue of errors by this hotel ruined our stay in Marrakech. DO NOT STAY HERE!
Review_Text: Chose this hotel based on other trip advisor reviews as I normally do. We are lucky enough to have stayed in Marrakech several times for business and pleasure. Our first choice hotel "Dar Ayniwen" was fully booked and we had to travel at short notice so needed another good 5 star hotel with pool spa facilities etc. On paper this hotel looked great - sadly that's where it ended!  Our customer picked us up from the airport and drove us to the hotel he was not impressed with the service we got on arrival at reception and had words with them. I turned a blind eye to this as was tired and looking forward to getting comfortable in the room and freshening up. We were pleasantly surprised with a room upgrade to a suite. Good start I thought. Walked through lovely gardens to our room. Can't fault the setting and layout of the hotel. The room was large and seemed fine at first glance so we tipped the porter and started to freshen up and change ready to meet up again with our customer and guests for dinner. Had a meal in the Brasserie restaurant and the food was good. They did however serve our Moroccan customer with the wrong dessert which he was understandably unhappy about and it wasn't remedied. We had cocktails in the piano bar afterwards then said our goodbyes to retire to bed. This is where the real catastrophes began!  Our room was really hot so my OH put the air conditioning on. Didn't seem to make any difference and there was no air to breathe. We didnt call reception as it was the early hrs of the morning so resorted to 'sleeping' outside in the patio area on the plastic seating out there. On top of that when we went to get a cold drink from the fridge we found that it wasn't working and the drinks were warm. Obviously hardly any sleep was had at all and not a good start to our 4 day stay.  My OH reported the faults to reception in the morning and was told that he must have turned the heating on in the room as no air conditioning was available in the hotel til next month??!!!! a) the switch was turned to the icicle symbol as on all a/c units so how could this be the heating? b) why was a/c not available in a 5 star hotel at any time of the year and especially when outside temperatures were so high??!!! c) why weren't we advised that there was no a/c available and fans provided in the rooms??!!! d) how dare they blame my OH for the temperature of the room!! I would never have booked a hotel without air conditioning.  They told us that the fridge would be fixed whilst we were out that day. We were shown a standard room to look at but it was tiny and we were told nothing else was available as they were fully booked so decided to see whether it would be ok to remain in the room without 'heating' and with a working fridge! We went to check out the rooftop pool. As we were so exhausted from no rest the previous night we fell fast asleep sitting next to the pool and got badly sunburnt. We travel extensively and have never burnt before so yet another disaster to add to the list - due to complete exhaustion from the room situation.  Went out for dinner with our client again that evening but had to leave early missing the evening show at the restaurant due to tiredness and my OH feeling unwell from his sunburn. We returned to a boiling hot room fridge still not working and now the toilet wouldn't stop running after being flushed! Another extremely uncomfortable night on the patio with no sleep. The room although large was also very tatty electrical wires sticking out no handles on the bath to get in/out very cheap toiletries bland black & white badly photocopied prints on the walls poor mattress etc. What a farce. No way that this is of 5 star standard. I think in fact they had most probably been overbooked and shoved us into a room that isn't usually used rather than being 'upgraded'!!  As you can imagine we were fuming by now. 2 nights stayed but not a single night being able to sleep in the bed in the room!  After more complaints and trips to reception my OH was told that another larger room had magically appeared and we could move into that. Of course that meant that whilst he was out on business I was left to pack all our clothes up wait for a porter and unpack it all in the new room. (Whilst this was happening yet another workman was trying to fix the fridge and remove it from the room!). So that was a day completely wasted for me - no trips to the souks or relaxing to be done. Great! We were meant to be dining together in a restaurant we had booked before leaving the uk but had to cancel that as were both far too exhausted. My OH booked me in to have a massage to cheer me up and try to soothe my exhaustion and stress. We ate later in the Indian restaurant at the hotel. The meal was ok but certainly nothing to rave about. And so to bed... Still no a/c of course but at least the bed had a wooden fan above it on the ceiling. I managed some sleep but my OH again was too hot and had to try to get some sleep outside on the balcony. This room was more up to date and also had a working fridge!  We tried to salvage our last day by shopping in the medina to be followed by what should have been a lovely evening dining in one of our favourite restaurants. We'd pre booked the restaurant through the hotel and had received emails from them confirming the booking.  A young guide was chosen by reception to walk us to our restaurant through the winding corridors of the medina. He said he would leave his telephone no. at the restaurant so we could call him to guide us back to the hotel. Nice touch we thought. At the restaurant they were very surprised to see us and asked whether we had booked. Of course we had and showed them the email confirmation of the booking from our hotel. Well no surprise by now to learn that our hotel hadn't booked the restaurant! In fact the restaurant would never have taken a booking for that time as there is only one service which started an hour earlier. At this point I just couldn't take any more and burst into tears. How could our hotel have even ruined this! Thankfully the wonderful staff and chef at GastroMK saved the night and made a special place for us (see separate restaurant review).  The hotel guide hadn't even left his no. at the restaurant so one of the hosts kindly walked us back to the hotel. The guide then greeted my OH with sneering and wanting payment - no chance! The GastroMk host had words with reception as he was very angry that they had messed up our booking like this. When he had gone the receptionist then laughed. I would gladly have strangled him had my OH not firmly guided me away!  Next day we packed and went to the rooftop to have lunch. Yet another cock up. I ordered lamb chops and was presented with a type of kebab and had to wait another 15 mins for it to be resolved by which time my OH had finished his meal. I couldn't wait to leave this god awful hotel.  Praise where it's due however to the Clarins spa. I had 2 massages as was suffering from stress and exhaustion as well as a very sore back. Both were excellent and the staff there were wonderful.  How on earth can a hotel get things so wrong one after another after another??! This could be a fabulous hotel as the setting and position is amazing. We were treated appallingly - absolutely no sense of customer care at all. This is the worst experience we have ever had at any hotel that we've ever stayed in. A complete nightmare from start to finish!!

Review_Date: Pedro L wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: Best value/price in the area. Excellent location.
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights and it has been a very positive experience. Best value/price in the area.  Excellent location; 5 minutes walk far from the Medina area and square. Very convenient; no need to take taxis to visit the area.  Service was superb; very kind and helpful. They also recomended us Jawad a professional guide (he speaks 6 languages) to help us visiting the medina casbah and surroundings and also some touristic areas close to the city. He was very nice and professional with us and helped us with all our shopping.  The hotel has a very nice warmed pool on the roof with very nice view of the Koutoubia tower and the Atlas mountains. Gorgeous view.  They also have a cute bar to enjoy drinks and mint tea. Only they allow smokers ;-)  Breakfast buffet was good. Orange juice was superb; and the rest was a standard European breakfast buffet. Including bacon and eggs and also ham and sausages.  I'll stay there again if I come back to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Stephanie S wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel would definately recommend and can't wait for our next visit. Staff were friendly efficient and are quick to organise restaurants give directions to places of interest call for taxis etc. Hotel has a heated roof top pool plus a courtyard pool and an amazing indoor spa pool. The food in the Indian restaurant was the best my husband has had and many people were saying the same. Breakfast is a buffet with something for everyone. Good cocktails in the Piano bar. This hotel has everything that you will need gym spa good food clean rooms and is literally a minutes walk from the main square. Also child friendly with a pool table and relaxed atmosphere
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent five nights at this wonderful hotel who upgraded is to a beautiful suite. The suite was spotless and adorned with fresh rosé petals every day. The bar was friendly and a good place to relax after a frenetic day in the souks. The Indian restaurant in the hotel provided delicious food. The hotel location was brilliant and meant that you could pop back to the hotel easily during the day. Would come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Phil C wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: We stayed here at the beginning of March and it is the perfect base to explore Marrakech. It is one street away from Djemaa El Fna which is the main square where all the action takes place and a 2 minute walk to the Souks. The main Mosque (Koutoubia Mosque) is pretty much at the end of the street - so if you don't want woken by the early moring call to prayers probably best keep your window closed. The hotel itself has 2 pools (one rooftop) and an indoor spa and pool. The piano bar is very atmospheric and all of the staff are very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed it - felt it was much better value than the Mamounia which is also inside the Medina (and worth a visit for a beer). Other hotels are outside the Median and are all very pleasant but you really want to be in the heart of the city and the Koutoubia is the perfect spot .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Love it: Best combination of relaxing Hotel Oasis and central location
Review_Text: We stayed in Marrakech over the Easter break and were delighted with this lovely hotel. The Hotel is very centrally located yet it is very quiet and one is only a short walk away from the Djemaa El Fna. The hotel rooms are very clean extremely delightful decorated and bright.  The central pool area is the diamond of this hotel the real oasis where one can relax under palm trees and listen to the birds. A real treat after a few hours full of live in the Medina of Marrakech. Every time we went through the hotel lobby it felt like all 100 TV channels of Marrakech life have been switched of and we entered another world. The general service of the hotel and the breakfast was up to the expected standards for a place in this price range. I would recommend this Hotel to couples families and singles alike.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We loved this hotel and stayed for 7 nights. We had room 75 which is located on the ground floor in the annexe next to the restaurant. It has it's own private archway entrance from outside to what could be described as a conservatory with furniture. The room was huge with another suite of funiture and the bathroom palatial. All beautifully decorated with roses or rose petals every day it felt very clean. I was concerned about getting a noisy room but this room was so quiet without neighbours a real haven. The central pool area is fabulous and beautiful both night and day it was just great to be there. The last few evenings were warm and it was nice to have a drink before going out to dinner. If you aren't staying here I would recommend calling in for a drink as it is so special.  We ate at the Indian on the first evening and it was perfectly enjoyable but not amazing compared to places at home. Breakfast is very good with a good choice.  The best thing about this hotel is that it feels very Morrocan without having to rough it and much. much nicer than a typical chain hotel which could be anywhere in the world. My wife says that we can not go back to Marrakech as it could never be as perfect as this trip and we would never get a room as nice again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Pleasant oasis right in the centre of the medina
Review_Text: The location of this hotel is absolutely amazing! You are right next to the Koutoubia which means as soon as you walk out the hotel you are in the hustle and bustle of the city. It still amazes me how it can be so noisy outside the hotel but as soon as you walk in you are in a peaceful hotel!    Breakfast was good with fresh crepes and eggs and omelettes made to how you want them.  We had dinner at the Indian restaurant which was called Jardin de Bala (i think?) where the food was nice but a bit salty and the atmosphere was a bit stuffy. We also ate twice at the french restaurant Relais de Paris which was nice service was amazing and food also quite nice.    The reception was incredible for the trip we asked them to book taxis restaurants and day excursions and were generally very helpful with all of our queries.    The fitness centre was well equipped and the spa was amazing! The piano bar was nice but I think it would be even nicer if the piano man didn't play to a soundtrack as I did think it was a little cheesy.    However I do agree that in comparison to an English 5 star hotel this hotel is not the same level however it still is very luxury!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful haven and sanctuary from crazy Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary weekend. We have been to Marrakech on 3 other occasions and each time we had lunched here so it was for us the perfect place to stay. Our room was overlooking central courtyard and pool it was lovely waking up to the birdsong. Everyday our room was cleaned and fresh roses laid out on our bed which was a lovely touch. The tv was also useful for one particularly rainy day as one channel showed back to back films. We had wifi in all areas including the roof top pool! We ate in the India restaurant La Bala which was ok and had lunch in poolside restaurant which was fine. The thing about Marrakech is that you need to appreciate the hustle and bustle smells and attack on all senses. Therefore staying somewhere like the Koutoubia helps you refresh and regroup before venturing out into the square.    I would also add that the breakfast was fab! A whole range of foods fresh crepes if you wanted them and also omelettes and fried or boiled eggs. Plenty to fill up on when you have a full days exploring ahead and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. There was a bit of work going on while we were there but it was discreet and we didn't let it affect us! It costs more than other places but with the surge in building and new riads/hotels cropping up in the city the Koutoubia is fast becoming as iconic as the Mamounia.

I have never stayed at this hotel but have visited a couple of times for evening cocktails during my 2 stays in Marrakech. This hotel is situated only a few moments from the hectic main square in Marrakech and provides a very welcome respite from the busy streets. It is just beautiful sitting by the pool or in the piano bar. Cocktails and drinks are reasonably priced and service is attentive. I would highly recommend you seek this out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice place, close to the action
Review_Text: We were looking for a good middle-class hotel close to the souk and Koutoubia delivered. It's right off the central market square moments from souk labyrinth. Both hotel restaurants were pretty good and breakfast was quite good. The spa was nice for a break from the sun. Quite pleased.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: perfect mini break for 30yrs london couple
Review_Text: Have been to Marrakech a few times but wanted to upgrade the riad experience we had in our early/mid 20s - spend a bit more on hotel better food better booze. We only had 3/4 days and wanted to stay in the thick of it but still have some peace and pool time and the Koutoubia fitted the bill perfectly.    Main attractions for me:  Location - just a few mins from Jamaa el Fna (main square)  Courtyard - gorgeous and peaceful unexpected considering hectic surroundings  Pools - both fab great having roof terrace pool for uninterrupted ray catching  Food - decent food in the hotel restos breakfast crepes were ace.  G&Ts - really nice to be able to get a good drink overlooking the lovely courtyard.    Downers:  Couple of moody French mulling around with noisy kids and the room was a tiny bit tired and not particularly inspiring. The rest def makes up for this though.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Only visited the Piano Bar for cocktails but was wonderful !
Review_Text: I went to the Piano Bar at this hotel for cocktails before dinner at the Narwama restaurant which is practically next door.  The hotel is beautiful  just a short walk from the square. The setting is stunning  we were there when it was dark so the pool area was lit beautifully. We had a little walk around outside deciding if to sit outside or in. We chose in as it was a little cold. The staff were welcoming.    The Piano bar was quiet apart from the man singing at the piano. The bar staff were very friendly and chatty and we ended up sitting at the bar on three stools. We had our cocktails whisked up in front of us and they were delicious. Nuts & olives were flowing and used shells whipped away without us noticing ! We were celebrating a birthday and the man on the piano and the bar staff all sang Happy Birthday in English  French and Arabic !    We had a real laugh and would of stayed all night had we not had a dinner reservation. The cocktails were 70-80 Dh each  so about £5 - £6 cheap compared to London prices and worth it for a special start to an evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sam D wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: Exceeded my expectations. I booked last minute and in the rush it seems we double booked but once we got to the hotel the receptionist was happy to clear one of the rooms for no charge and no fuss. I hadn't told them I needed a car but once I arrived I called them for the address and the woman tried to see if they had one available alas they didn't but not a problem.    The location is insane. Jmaa El Fna and the Koutoubia Mosque are 3 steps away and the surrounding area has cash machines restaurants and the traditional souks to enjoy yourself in. You are right in the action.  When you enter the hotel however it is different. Well-secure high class and an elegant place with a fantastic piano bar and two great pools. The staff at both bars were so friendly and the indian restaurant was great.    To end with the value for money is good. We stayed for three nights made phone calls abroad used a laundry service which was fast and constantly used the concierge to make us bookings and what we paid was well well worth it.    Only negative points they are strict on visitors and the wifi in the rooms isn't great. Didn't try the breakfast so can't comment.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ed S wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: When we drew up to the hotel we thought "OMG" but once in - super! Great rooms good food and .right in the middle of Marrakechech 2 minutes from the square.  Staff helpful central courtyard with pool calm and verdant just as advertised.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed the experience. It's not in the class of an internationally recognised 5 star hotel but for Morocco it is a class above mostly everything else. Lovely to see rose petals and roses used in our room. Staff were very friendly and attentive.    We had a room in the new/recently renovated Relais de Paris section. You had to actually go outside to get to to this normally not an issue in Morocco but for our stay it was cold and wet! Also the room had a strong smell of paint/paintstripper one day - I think they're doing work across the hotel as we heard occasional banging too but the smell went away and the work wasn't obtrusive. I couldn't connect my iPhone or iPad to the wifi in the room but could connect in the reception area.    We ate in all 3 hotel restaurants (rather than chancing our luck finding something outside or around the square) and we were very happy with them all. Yes they're more expensive than outside but we found the quality to be very good. The outside heated pool on the roof was nice if a little shallow to have a proper swim but the views were impressive. Would've loved to use the comfy looking loungers but on our short winter stay it was simply too cold!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Slightly shabby splendour but great location
Review_Text: I would agree with previous reviewers that this is not really a 5 star hotel more like a 4 star. It just doesn't have quite the luxury and attention to detail that I would expect for 5 star although some rooms are better than others. We had two rooms for our party of five which were next door to each other. However the room my parents were in had a terrible smell (a recurring theme on reviews) and they had to complain. They sent up the maintenance men and the smell got better but then recurred. In the end they moved my parents to what was a much nicer room but over in the annexe by the Relais de Paris restaurant. Lovely room but to get to it you had to go out of the hotel and down a short alley so they were miles away from the rest of us. We gathered from speaking to the public relations lady at the hotel that problems with smell are not uncommon. So if you have a problem I would suggest you just raise the issue with reception straight away and ask to be moved.  So saying this is still a lovely hotel and it's like a tranquil oasis when you come in from the city. It's so convenient for the square and for that reason if no other I would definitely consider it again. Breakfast was lovely loads of choice and we always found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We were there with two children and it was great to have so much space inside the hotel complex where they could safely roam and also things like the heated pool and snooker table.  Ate at the Moroccan restaurant at the hotel on the first night but this was expensive and the food was much less good than that which we had at the Marrakchi restaurant off the main square on a later night. Also the Imlil snack bar is really expensive for what you get.  All in all a lovely hotel but don't quite expect 5 star. Well worth considering though just for the amazing location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kay W wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Peace & calm away from the streets.
Review_Text: A beautiful hotel in an excellent location. Staff were friendly & helpful and very calm which was welcoming when coming in from the frenzy of Marrakech. Our room was large and beautiful a bed was ready for our daughter as requested.  We ate in all 3 restaurants and the food was very good. The pool on the roof terrace is heated and we swam here. - the indoor pool is only free if you are using the spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Perfect place to end a busy day
Review_Text: Having been here before 2 years ago I was very pleased to find it again and just as we remembered it.  A group of 8 of us ended our busy day and hussle round the night market and souks here for a lovely cocktail or 3. The Piano Bar was our destination and was pleased to see the sane chap playing along to his backing tracks and singing a range of songs. He really enjoyed us dinging along with him and applauding him at the end. Some bum notes and words missed but it added to the fun. The waiters give excellent service and make very nice cocktails and table snacks always served. These are hotel prices though so be careful how many you have. It's a lovely looking hotel and seems to be a well kept secret as not very busy bearing in mind most restaurants in the area do not serve alcohol ad in sight if the mosque. It's just off the main square so hardly any walk at all. There are cabs available outside which is handy. It was great to visit again.

Review_Title: Use the "piano Bar" for a relaxing end to the hustle of the day
Review_Text: Having spent the day wandering around the dusty and noisy ( yet brilliant) medina and markets then this hotel bar has just what you need. The piano bar is a dark oasis offering " cheesy" piano music alongside a menu of cocktails and beers. The staff were very friendly and the atmosphere relaxed and refreshing. Sit back relax and accept it for what it is
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel falls way short of a five star hotel we were not advised by Kuoni (our travel agent) that work was being carried out during our stay. There were at times dust flying around constant banging drilling and workmen shouting.
