At one point we had no electricity in our room as it had been turned off (without warning) due to the fact that workmen were working on a lift. Staff at this hotel were very helpful if you gave them a tip! On checking our bill on the day of our departure errors were found and had to wait until these were rectified. Our credit card was handed over only to be rejected this threw us into panic as we have a substantial limit we then had to pay cash. Upon checking with our credit card company on our return home our credit card transaction was authorised in the UK but somehow the Morrocan system rejected it for some unknown reason. All in all we had a lovely break in the sun we would return to this hotel as it is so convenient but ladies don't pack your five star hotel clothes as you will not need them. Stay away from the Relias de Paris restaurant at this hotel staff need management direction none to be found sadly here. Chef thinks that if he ladens his food with salt it will taste better. Steak was as tough as old boots. The Asian/Indian restaurant on the rooftop of the hotel was a welcome delight all the staff and management were always pleasant caring and attentive. I have to say that this resaurant is not run by the hotel and you can see the remarkable difference a wonderful experience for lunch and dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have stayed in MANY hotels and inns around the world and in this time we have enjoyed and endured these places. And in this time we have rolled with the punches and we have NEVER complained. But this pretentious hotel is a joke! Endure it if you must.  Service is poor standard rooms smell level 3 pool bar staff ignore you breakfast staff ignore you reception staff tell you to come back and talk to someone else air-conditioning fills the room with an acrid stench the Indian restaurant is average at best internet unavailable in our wing although offered no water in the rooms no kettle poor reception on the TV poor staff training... etc etc etc. Sure language barriers exist and as thats our issue not theirs then thats NOT a problem.  5 star? What the hell?? They probably got a local brass merchant to whip up the stars for them. And boy are we reminded of the 5 stars!!! Every directional sign has the 5 stars and there are MANY signs.  If you like getting what you dont want then this place is perfect ... for a 3 star hotel.

This is a gorgeous hotel whose prime is clearly past. Though it has surely lost its former grandeur the public spaces are still quite impressive and it retains plenty of advantages: its central and convenient location right near the Jemaa el Fna; enormous rooms with their own bath "complexes"; a great hammam (though admittedly I have nothing to compare it to) with a beautiful heated underground pool (in addition to two outdoor pools); and a very extensive breakfast buffet (including made-to-order omelets as well as pork products). Everyone was nice the grounds were lovely and the staff at the front desk and restaurant spoke good English. On the down side it's hard to imagine why they keep the ratty red rugs in the hallways which make the place look like a flophouse. Simply replacing the rugs would do wonders! Similarly the extra touch of using fresh flowers everywhere was ruined because they are using dead roses. The room had multiple sets of interior doors (one to the toilet room another to the changing room) all of which had clunky pendant knockers that looked pretty but created a racket whenever you moved through them. In the winter the concrete bathroom and toilet room were quite cold. You had to go through two sets of doors to wash your hands after using the toilet. It took quite a long time for check in (we had to wait about 30 minutes to get into our room) but by the same token (and probably for this reason) they were quite generous about late check-out. If you're coming to Marrakesh for a honeymoon or to hang out in your room this is probably not the place for you. But if you're going to spend your time in the souks this is a good value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect - oasis of peace in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: We stayed early January for a week in this beautiful hotel with a group of six. We all had beautiful very large rooms very well appointed quiet and with roses refreshed every day.  The hotel pool with a great view of the Koutoubia is a great asset to bask in the winter sun. The pool itself is a little shallow to properly swim and is rather overheated at 32°C. For those who like to have a proper swim there is the large pool on the ground floor which unfortunately isn't heated so only to be used by polar bears in wintertime.  Being situated around the corner from Place Djemna El Fna the hotel makes a great place to venture into the medina. After strolling around the hustke and bustle of the town it is great to find this oasis your home.  Service was impeccable all over including all four restaurants. The Parisian pool restaurant and the Indian restaurant on the top floor are all excellent. The Moroccan restaurant comes out rather weak in comparison to the many good Moroccan restaurants in the neighbourhood.  We traveled with Jetair and our package included half pension. The breakfast was very sumptuous while you could choose to either use your main meal a la carte at one of the four restaurants either lunch or dinner.  A place to remember!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An oasis among the chaos of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Been to N Africa before and love to be in the centre but that can be overwhelming. We didn't want to stay in the more soulless new area though and this hotel turned out to be perfect. It's a 5 minute walk from Jemaa El Fna and the sights and sounds of the city but once you go in it's an absolute haven. We were upgraded to a suite in the new part which was huge spotless and beautifully decorated Moroccan style- there was even an indoor fountain and rose petals were put everywhere. Sheets changed daily and service across the board was polite and very smiley. There are 3 restaurants- we were half board and it was a very good deal. Few issues for a vegetarian coeliac but I had a lot of omelettes and veggie tajines Indian restaurant was particularly good too. We had great weather for Jan and the heated pool on 3rd floor was a blessing as was the Clarins Spa. We did a couple of trips with a guide via the hotel which were just us so pretty laid back- 2 long days 1 into Atlas Mountains and 1 to Essouiria. They were good value and well worth the drives which were in very comfy 4 wheel drives. Loved the souks as ever and also the Marjorelle Gardens and a day of tombs storks and palaces- got lost but no-one anything but helpful. I reckon there is far less hassle then 10 years ago and people are just trying to make a living. A lot of smiling and polite thank yous go a long way wherever you are in the world. Did but some great bargains from tin makers square too and fabulous week away at miserable time of year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Patricia T wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: This is the place to stay in Marrakech. The location is fantastic--just away from the main square and great food shopping and sites. In addition the property is totally private and absolutely gorgeous. The staff if fantastic--very helpful and friendly with kids and grown-ups alike. This is a good choice for families with the wonderful restaurants in house and 3 pools but it's not overrun with children and I'd definitely head there for a romantic stay as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: sophia f wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: the hotel was beautiful. its a real get away from the busy streets of marrakech. the staff are friendly and helpful. our room was the mini suite and had a view of the patio- definitle would recommend this hotel to anyone    the hotel has three restaurants- indian on the terrace morrocan and french on the ground floor. we went to all of them and found the food lovely. in fact there was some entertainment when we went for dinner at the morrocan restaurant- with a pair of men playing what im guessing was native music (think guitar and drum) and a bellydancer also made an entrance- i would reccomend that the hotel make this a "bigger" thing. as we really enjoyed it.    we also visited the spa and had a pedicure done- the staff were really helpful and did a good job    overall a good solid five star hotel worth the money
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Tripadivsor said it was good but that is understated.  Could not fault it every thing was perfect.  Had 3 pools!!!!!  Wonderful spa bar and staff.    We had Our room upgraded....wow!!  We had rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom every day.    Can highly recommend.  We booked this trip with expiadia and the price was amazing for a 5 star hotel.    Would recommend to anybody.

Amazing hotel located really close to the main square opposite mosque.Inside its typically Morrocanstaff really helpfullfood very goodand exceptionally clean.We used the swimming pool on the roof which is heated as it was Novemberalso the Indian resturant in the hotel was worth a visit.Medditeraneen resturant also lovely.In the evening the piano was a must offering drinks.It was a safe peacefull haven inside the hotel compared to the madness of the souks outside.I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately go back.We were also upgraded to a junior suite this was fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: AN OASIS IN THE HUSTLE AND BUSTLE OF THE MEDINA
Review_Text: This was our second stay. It is not a riad but an hotel. It is not new and to be honest it reflects this in some parts. Our room (2 adults + 6 year old child) was very big. It is close to a mosquee so you can hear the muezzin calling at 5.30 in the morning but it was not noisy it just added charme to the place. On the first day we found both our bed and the child's one covered with roses and petals and some fruit to be eaten. Good breakfast with also an egg station and a crepes one. Close to the swimming pool on the first floor there is the international restaurant where you can have salads and burgers for lunch. Before dinner we enjoyed a Negroni and a glass of wine (they brought some peanuts with them) in front of the swimming pool before having dinner in the Medina (where alcohol is forbidden in many restaurants beware!). The location could not be beaten; you turn the road and you find yourself in the Djeema el Fna but you are also close to Mohammed V avenue where you can catch a taxi to go wherever you want. The location of the famous hotel Mamounia is not at all so good as this one. Staff was very nice: a bee stang me one night and one of the piano bar waiter was so helpful to take off the bee point from my arm and to bring me some ice without even asking
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A true palace in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: This is a truly outstanding hotel. First of all it is huge but it never feels that way. The different sections of the hotel are all well furnished decorated and kept brilliantly. The rooms are huge (we had two fully equipped bathrooms!) and fairly quiet. Fairly because (as in many hotels) the cleaning crews start early and if that is in the room directly above you might as well get up - the noise! That same crew makes a pattern with rose leafs everyday on your bed - very romantic.  The hotel ouzes old world charm without it being opressive. The breakfast is great with fresh juices fruits all types of bread and anything you could wish for. The ground floor restaurant is also good but not outstanding. It is however on a much higher scale than any restaurant in the vicinity of the hotel so if you're not willing to walk in the dark medina or take a taxi you might as wll eat here. They make great cocktails (especially mojito's) in the pianobar but both me and my wife where wondering if there was any alcohol in them as we couldn't detect any. The location of this hotel is absolutely superb - right in the thick of it just a minute's walk from the main square. It is arguably the only five star hotel in the medina and that might well be true. The staff is attentive but not intrusive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carlos N wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: paradise in the middle of the medina
Review_Text: It was a very nice stay. Lovely atmosphere very frindly staff great breakfast.  I had the opportunity to try the luxury indian restaurant and it has been a very nice experience.  All the hotel amenities are fantastic.  Recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent hotel and bar, service a bit hit and miss
Review_Text: The hotel is walking distance from the main square but you wouldn't know it once you're there as its so quiet and peaceful. It's a beautiful setting and very old school Marrakech.    Hotel decor is of good quality and the rooms were excellent although we were lucky and got an upgrade. This was a room along a passageway from the hotel and was actually above one of the restaurants which at first seemed a bit odd but was not a problem the especially when we had a bigger room and you couldn't hear a thing    Reception staff were mixed one chap was great and very helpful the woman there wasn't so helpful or knowledgeable which a bit frustrating when we were asking her advice on which restaurants to go to/how best to get there. You should watch out for the taxi they use outside the hotel (Mustafa) as well as he turned out to be a bit of a rip off - we nicknamed him Must-haffa-more-money!    The spa was excellent and reasonable value surprising for a good quality hotel which normally charge the earth. They were very accommodating with me moving appointments as well    The breakfast was average the service was too some of the waiters were a bit surly but it was a pleasant place to sit in any case with a coffee    Lunch - a fairly limited menu but it was all very nice. Again some waiters/waitresses were better than others -it seemed they were easily distracted and forgot to bring things we'd asked for so didn't exactly ruin the experience    The bar is great and probably worth a visit even if you're not staying as its such a lovely setting. The head waiter there was really good very attentive service all round.    We ate in the Indian restaurant which was very good we didn't go to the other two. The Moroccan one looked ok but we preferred to go out of the hotel to some of the more highly recommended restaurants arund the city.    Would highly recommend the hotel we really enjoyed our stay and its beautiful. It was full of various european visitors mostly french rather than British so you really feel like you've found a gem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Quiet oasis in the medina, well worth it's price
Review_Text: Writing this while still sitting in the hotel courtyard after four nights. Our experience couldn't have been any better. From the moment of arrival from the craziness of driving in this city (certainly wouldn't recommend that to anybody) in this oasis of calm and quiet and pleasant smells and very friendly as well as attentive staff until now we enjoyed every minute.    Don't want to repeat what other positive reviewers said as I can only confirm with their assessments. But to give a couple of examples of the attentiveness: previous guests of our room (very beautiful and very spacious junior suite) seemed to have taken the antenna cable of the TV as well as the hair dryer. Once we called the reception they replaced both within minutes. Nomad the bar waiter was together with the lady concierge (sorry don't have the name) the most friendly ones. We truly felt at home here.    If I would change one thing in this hotel it's the pianist who really isn't that fantastic however by not being that great he is very entertaining as well.    After reading comments about supposedly inattentive service I can only assume that these guest must have been the ones who are in general unfriendly with anyone working in service and not willing to tip. A couple of dirhams make things go a very long way in Morocco. Don't forget that people in the service industry are making a fraction a month of what you spend in a hotel like this per night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel was ideally situated for the jema al fna and the koutoubia mosque. Outside the hotel you got a real feel for Marrakech and within the hotel walls it was peaceful & relaxing. The room was very comfortable the hotel facilities were great ( including a spa & 3 pools & 2 restaurants) & the staff were helpful & efficient.

Firstly the setting was 4-5 days in Marrakesh with my wife unsure as to what was on offer. The hotel is as many have already described an oasis in the middle of the mayhem that is Marrakesh so location is perfect.    Room excellant and restaurants all apart from the International not actually connected to the hotel are worthy of a visit or even two. Indian and Paris are top notch and reasonably priced for 5*.    Quiet and relaxing no question and I found the staff friendly and helpful also....... albeit and only because we are talking 5* somewhat unattentive when it comes to the service around the pool area. YES we had to wait and sometimes had to go and force our order usually during the day however it never took away from an otherwise excellant experience.    Would stay again ....... YES
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: anne b wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: This hotel has the best location in Marrakesh. Right outside the Medina. Two minutes from the Jemaa El Fna Square. Wonderful rooms. Fantastic Spa. Four different restaurants in the hotel.  Very good breakfast that you can have in the garden. The service was wonderful. This is absolutely a place I wsnt to visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aoife W wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Stayed here with a group of friends/colleagues for 3 nights in early October. The hotel is lovely - traditional in style service is excellent and all staff are polite professional and courteous.  The hotel is not uber modern but still in good condition and very clean. If you are looking to stay somewhere with a more authentic feel this is a great option. There is a lovely courtyard in the centre with a pool lots of trees and a gorgeous smell of jasmine. The roof top pool is great and gives you sunshine all day long whereas the pool in the courtyard has shaded areas.  The spa I assume is a recent addition as it is much more modern than the hotel itself. We were accommodated for appointments for massage/hamman/etc at short notice which was great. The courtyard and bar are nice settings for evening drinks. There is plenty of choice for breakfast the food is all very fresh. Hotel is in a central location near the souks and other attractions but not at all noisy. The beds were the best part for me - I slept like a log!  We did a number of trips with a tour guide named Khalid Amor - he was fantastic and took us to places you would never find on your own as a tourist. The restaurants we visited were the best in Marrakech - Yacut being my favourite. Traditional Morrocan food (lots of it) with amazing views over the Medina. Dar Moha Bo & Zin and Jad Mahal were other restaurants we visited. The first being a traditional Morrocan restaurant the other 2 offered Asian and Morrocan food. Jad Mahal has traditional belly dancers which were very entertaining.  Overall a great trip and the perfect hotel to base ourselves from.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: travel with Tyra wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: me and my friends arrived at the hotel 18th of september 2012 all excited once in reception it hit me this was supposed to be a 5 star hotel decor was old and the red carpet was antique including the furniture. After waiting 4 hours we were finally given our rooms which were very nice n pleasantly modern and spacious unfortunately directly opposite we had workmen drilling and in full view. Each time we called reception the phone was put down without a goodbye or a call back .  We waited one and half our waiting for a menu by the pool on the ground floor then to be told it was too late to order and the management didn't care how we were ignored.  luckily we hadn't paid in full we paid £250 for one night and left we had a lovely time at the le meridian.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I spent the last two days of our holiday with this hotel. We were a little worried because we had seen mixed reviews but we need not have been. It was so much more than we could have asked for.    Hotel was stunning and the rooms were big and well appointed. We had no problem with air conditioning as has been reported in the past about this hotel and we ended up with two rooms as we were given a courtesy room on the last day of our stay as we flew in the evening and check out was at 12. (this was offered by the hotel and we were stunned to have been given such a service with no charge)    The hotel staff discover it was my birthday and surprised me in the restaurant on our last evening with a birthday cake and flowers.. again this was not something we had advised of or requested and it was a fantastic touch!    We loved being here. The spa was sensational    I would say that there are many great places to stay in Marrakech. We have visited a number of times and stayed in a lot of Riads. However if you want top end luxury and I mean top end. This would be the place to stay. 5* and decadent luxury. Well worth a top review.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: JULIAN M wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: A Wonderful Stay in a First Class Hotel
Review_Text: We have just returned from a most relaxing stay in this wonderful hotel.    Firstly i must point out that i have to disagree with most of the negative comments    From our arrival the treatment recieved from all the staff was excellent. A pleasant suprise was a room upgrade to a suite which was luxurious. The air conditioning was not the greatest as previously reported but we found it to be quite adequate.    The pool areas are loveley and we especially enjoyed the roof top area which is just perfect for sunbathing and lazing around. The area was never crowded and the service from the bar staff was great.    The quality of food in the restraunts is excellent the Indian being especially good.    All in all i would recomend this hotel to anyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: N N wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: My daughter and I found the hotel much much better than expected given some of the comments and the price we paid. It’s a very gentile quiet spacious place with lots of room to sit outside or by the two pools. We enjoyed speaking French (English is spoken but French felt more natural for all) and the service was excellent but not intrusive if you don’t ask you don’t get but that’s good for us we didn’t want to be bothered all the time. The breakfast choice is superb hot and cold with freshly cooked omelettes and pancakes and lots of fresh fruit and yogurt and honey etc. All the food is very good and not too pricey options immediately outside the hotel are limited so we ate in a lot and the poolside service was a special treat. We spent many hours happily sunbathing reading swimming or eating in between visiting the delights of the medina which does need escaping from after only an hour or two. The main square is a mere 2 minutes walk so popping in and out was easy and we liked knowing we could be ‘home’ the minute we decided enough was enough for our fragile European souls!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed here in August booked out holiday through Eton Travel and Kouni; both of which were excellent. On arrive we were greated by our personal Kouni Rep very good english polite and incredibly helpful. We read reviews and was grateful that we got a room with working and quite air conditioning. The rooms was lovely large very clean and confortable 6 ft bed was great. The pool areas was delightful especially in early evening with a G&T. It was a wonderful feeling coming from the chaos of the market and souks entering the hotel door to find calm and peace. We ate in all three restaurants all good particularly the french restaurant; prices were very similar in all three and were as you would expect but not too over the top. All staff were helpful and friendly; service was good. We were pleased we only stayed here for three night not because of the lovely hotel but because of the hussle and bussle outside. we met Brit coming into the restaurant to eat who said that it was much better than their 5* in Merrakech. We then moved onto Agadir which was completely different. If we were to return to Merrakech we would definately come back. If you get to go on an excusion via Kouni to the Atlas Mountains for a dayit is recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: staff unfriendly and need further training
Review_Text: Although Le Jardin de la Koutoubia hotel is in a great location and the pool area is an oasis of calm my friends and I found all the staff (apart from two waiters) very unfriendly and at times rude. For instance when we arrived at reception we received no greeting at all and the receptionist preferred to answer the phone rather than give us her attention. No concierge was available to give us any assistance and the maitre'd did not welcome us at breakfast. We were not supplied with water in the room and the air con was almost non existant. My husband sent me an e-mail whilst I was at the hotel but this was never given to me. Having stayed at another hotel just one hour away where the staff were berbers and extremely friendly and helpful I think the manager at the J de la K needs to seriously look at training the hotel staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Shockingly poor service in the bar...
Review_Text: We stayed at a riad in the Medina but were told you could pay to use the pool at les Jardins de la Koutoubia... So four of us tried. At first the receptionist said yes but then said that as all the loungers had been reserved (with towels but no people in evidence) we couldn't swim but we were welcome to have a drink. That proved more difficult than we'd imagined... After 10 minutes of being ignored by two waiters I went to ask for menus. After another 10 minutes I went to ask them to come and take our order to be told to go back and get the order myself and bring it to the waiter. I did this like an idiot but when he suggested that I come back to collect the drinks and take them to the table myself even I balked. The hotel and bar and pool and gardens looked pretty but if they treat hotel guests the way they treat non resident guests I wouldn't stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Lovely place for drinks and food
Review_Text: We didn't actually stay at the hotel but were staying at a riad around the corner to this hotel and so found this by chance on our first night. We ate here at the rooftop Indian restaurant and were not disappointed at all. The food was absolutely delicious in lovely surroundings and very pleasant staff. The bar downstairs was also lovely where we would often sit by their lovely pool and enjoy a mojito before heading back to our riad. We travelled around Cuba last year and nowhere served a delicious mojito as at this bar they were divine! If we were to return to Marakesh I would surely like to stay at this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anton W wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: We have stayed in this hotel many times. It is close to the main square in Marrakesh and great for getting a feel of the locals. The staff are very helpful and speak excellent English. Rooms good and food excellent. An oasis in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sherry E wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: We were hesitant about booking this hotel due to some of the comments..including in regards to the air conditioning...but we are very glad we did! We arrived very early 830am but were welcomed and asked if we would like to have breakfast while our room was prepared. (thought in my cynical mind...sure we will get a charge but we didn't.). When our room was ready at 930..the bell man took us over to see the upgraded room and to ensure we were happy before bringing our bags. We were given a suite but it was in a separate building which we were unsure of..so they showed us our original room and let us make the choice...how often does that happen!? Again a very nice touch. After checking in we throughly enjoy both pools very relaxing. No need to get up early to save loungers...there were plenty! Also the food at the restaurants was very good in particular the Indian one on the roof we ate there twice.  We found most of the staff very helpful and pleasant who were happy to give us directions and advice on pricing in the souks..what we should pay for certain souvenirs..which really helped in  our negotiations. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely Hotel hidden in the city!
Review_Text: Along with my friend we visited marrakech for a week in July 2012 and it was hot!! Nearly 45degrees almost every day! So we loved our hotel because it was an amazing escape from the intense sun during the high sun.  We arrived at marrakech airport on a sunday afternoon and bought our currency at the airport from a buerue de change. We then went to get a taxi to the hotel which for the two of us with 2 small cases was 250dirhams. Now im sure we got ripped off but we were expecting to (think it should be no more than 200 dirhams so we didnt get ripped off too much!)  We arrived at the hotel after about 15 minutes and it was lovely!! There were bellboys at the door (we had no change for a tip but they didnt look like they would badger you for it).    The hotel is two floors of hotel rooms and the ground floor with restaurants spa etc. It is a jardin so there are pretty plants providing shade and breeze and in the centre there is a pool - this was perfect for the intense heat!! There was also a roof pool but we found in that heat it was too hot - we only lasted 10 minutes up there with no sun umbrella! They do have umbrellas and beds and towels for the pools however the roof one can be abit busier.    The hotel room was very nice although previous reviewers are right the air con is poor. However they do have fans above the beds so this is enough. To be honest the aircon in alot of hotel rooms are poor - you can see how they would struggle in such heat! Another negative point was the water - we had a bath with a shower over and it was standard - not power shower or a constant temperature however it was by no means a turn off for the hotel i would still go back and stay there again.    The main selling point for the hotel is that firstly its a family friendly hotel - from the pools to the food in the restaurants offering spaghetti and fries! Secondly the pool is a little oasis in the middle of marrakech! And thirdly the location. The location was amazing!! You could walk to new town in about 20 minutes though in that heat it took us about 30-45 minutes if we sat along the way. There were lovely icecream parlours on the way (Dinos was amazing) and a mcdonalds in the new city. Koutoubia was literally 2 minutes down a road. Opposite that road a 5 minute walk took you to the main square for yummy fresh orange juice. We often went there in the evenings and ate in one of the restaurants overlooking the square/markets and people watched into the late evenings. And going opposite to the new city for about 20 minutes took you to the palaces. The only thing we took a cab for was the majorelle gardens which were beautiful.    Breakfast was included with our trip and it was a light buffet lunch. they had pancakes fresh fruit yoghurt cereal dried fruits toast eggs (though they sometimes undercooked this for us) - it wasnt a full english but there was enough to be had for sure. And orange juice - plenty of it!    We took two excursions from the hotel via an expedia tour agent - one to trek the atalas mountains and eat at the berber village where the tagines were to die for (~1.5hr drive; trainers needed not for the light hearted) and the second to the ouzaid waterfalls which was stunning (3 hour drive well constructed steps take you to 3 levels of the waterfalls; do not need trainers and low fitness should be fine)    We took about £200 each to exchange into dirhams and due to the excursions and the continuous thirst we found we actually needed £250 each for 6 nights in marrakech. That was plenty for food drink excursions and souveneirs.    All in all i would recommend this hotel and go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An oasis of calm in a crazy city!
Review_Text: As many of the reviews say this hotel is really close to the exciting centre of the Median the Souks Jmaa el Fna and the other historic sites. In fact the square is almost outside it. Yet when you enter the front door you are met with total calm tranquilit and professionalism.    The rooms are excellent and as the photos on here show the housekeeping staff keep them clean and enticing with rosepetal and towel formations!    There are three restaurants. We tried them all and found the food to be tasty and well presented. On occasions the service was a tad random but we found that was so in many Marekech eateries. It becomes part of the charm.    The hotel staff were very helpful and knowledgeableand if small niggles arose (like no water in the minibar) they rectified this imediately with no fuss.    The pool area is well maintained and one can laze about there to be served with snacks drinks or towels!    We met several people who were on return trips to the hotel because they had enjoyed it so much previously. We woul dreturn without hesitation.    I have to mention the piano bar.... we were in hysterics most nights as the piano man coul dneither sing nor play the piano really. WE went to the bar each evening for a Koutoubia cocktail very yummy and to play 'guess the tune' form the piano man. Priceless!    The ast thing is the breakfast selection: a huge array of choices plus two women whose sole job it was to make either pancakes or omelettes to order. Fab.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It's fair to say that this hotel is in probably one of the greatest locations in Marrakech. We were looking for a hotel in the old town with a proper pool; while there are many amazing hotels many of them don’t have anything more than a paddling pool on the roof. However this hotel is approximately 250 meters from the Square and the souk and slap bang in the middle of the crazy life that is Marrakech.    We were upgraded on arrival to a suite which was very kind and unexpected the room was very spacious clean comfortable. We did think that being so close to the hustle and bustle we would hear the outside noise however we heard nothing (not even the call to prayer from the main Mosque which was only a couple of 100 meters away. The only slightly downside was that the aircon in the room seemed to struggle with the heat and at night it was warmer than you would like however it was 46oC during the day so we weren’t really surprised!!  As for the hotel yes it is a bit dated but it has a wonderful colonial feel to it. The pool area is great to spend the afternoon relaxing. The Spa is great (top end prices though) the food and drink within the hotel is great. The staff are so friendly. If fact I have pretty much nothing negative to say about this hotel.    In short great hotel great location worth a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A blissful place to call home...
Review_Text: Blissful Tranquil Calming Friendly Unobtrusive Relaxing Comfortable... Just a few words to describe the 'Les Jardins de La Koutoubia' Hotel in Downtown Marrakech.    After a rather bad start to our first vacation in Morocco we had to move hotels next day; I went in search for a hotel that I could rate 'clean' and 'friendly'. Thanks to my iPad and hotels.com within 2 hours I stumbled upon the 'Les Jardins de La Koutoubia'. Situated in the cities old-town (The Medina) I knew I was home as soon as I walk though the front doors. I checked in for 7 nights and never looked back... blissful could only describe the well kept surrounding of this larger than normal boutique hotel. In anyone’s standards this was truly 5 star. I met several of the hotel guests during my stay; some of who were British American but most were obviously French.    The hotel has several outdoor swimming pools as well as a wellbeing underground pool in the hotel's luxury spa. The main pool area was situtated in the hotels courtyard area. It had plenty of clean comfortable sun-loungers shaded with Palm-trees. The noise from the hustle & bustle from Marrakech's noisy streets was completely blocked by the shape of the hotel... With only the sound of birds in the overhanging palm-trees I had to keep reminding myself I was in the middle of a busy city. Marrakech Square is only 5 minutes away a place everyone goes of an evening. The Souk’s busy backstreets surround the hotel from all areas. To soak-up the Moroccan experience I had picked a hotel ‘right-bang-smack’ in the perfect location.    A full breakfast service was available to all guests in the hotel’s ground floor restaurant and poolside terrace. By day… soft drinks coffees teas beers light lunches & ice cream were served to you by the pool our nearby restaurant’s terrace. Of an evening the hotel’s three truly wonderful restaurants opened for dinner. The main eatery was the ground floor Moroccan Restaurant. Close by the hotel’s gardens were turned into a wonderful international restaurant serving tasty meats chicken fish and vegetable dishes. On the hotel’s rooftop terrace restaurant we were delighted by the flavours of Asia… the ‘Les Jardin’s de Bala’ Indian Restaurant. By day they served light Asia snacks and meals either in the restaurant or by the rooftop poolside but by evening the ‘Les Jardin’s de Bala’ burst into life… ‘Indian style’. The food and service were wonderful in all restaurants.    Our hotel suite was clean modern & very spacious. It had a large balcony overlooking the hotel’s garden 2 large wall mounted LCD Televisions with a few English speaking news and movie channels plenty of wardrobe space large bathroom with separate bath & shower... but most importantly of all... a very comfortable bed.    My stay at the 'Les Jardins de La Koutoubia' was perfect in every way but its friendly staff made my visit most memorable a special mention to ‘Kareem’ one of the hotels young concierge staff… he was so welcoming friendly & helpful when we arrived. If I ever return to Marrakech I will most definitely stay at this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel. Great pool area on ground floor and another smaller pool on terrace. Had a very nice room and was surprised that my friend and I each had our own bathroom. Windows completely shut out noise. Superb location just a 3 minute walk to Djamaa. Helpful concierge called Royal Air Maroc to confirm our reservations for the flight home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July and absolutely loved it. I don't really have anything negative to say about it.    The hotel has an excellent location right next to the main square. It is on a very busy street but it really is incredibly relaxing and quiet inside. The pool area was very quiet and clean and you could order food and drinks (there are two outdoor pools-one in the central courtyard and one on the roof-both were lovely). You could also get a bed by the pool easily anytime.    The room was lovely with small moroccon pastries in the room on arrival. It was nice and clean with a lovely view out to the central courtyard and pool. It was also nice and quiet. It is true that the air-conditioning was not very strong (there is also a ceiling fan) but we were there in July and found the temperature at night with the air-con and ceiling fan on was fine.    The hotel itself is lovely and in a traditional design. The bar area and seating outside were nice and we enjoyed having a drink there in the evening. The cocktails were really good. The staff at the bar were also very friendly and attentive.    Food- we ate at both the moroccan restaurant and the indian rooftop restaurant in the hotel and had really good meals in both. We also ate lunch in the poolside bar and the food there was really good and reasonably priced compared to other 5* hotels in Marrakech that I have visited.  We also ate out in Marrakech and the hotel reception were very helpful in recommending places and booking tables for us. They were also very helpful in getting us a taxi out in the evening if we needed it. I found that everyone working there had good English.  Breakfast was pretty good with all the things you need and they also make crepes.    We would definitely stay at this hotel if we return to Marrakech. Overall i'd say that it had a nice character and the staff were really welcoming and helpful so we really had a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Good service a warm welcoming with sweets and peppermint tea.  The lobby is quite impressive specially when you see the swimming pool area outside.  Breakfast is ok but they have a bar on the roof (with another swimming pool) where they serve indian tapas. OMG! Try them!  In the evening try their delicious tagine (careful huge portion).  The rooms are good and their spa is just like heaven.  Super location maybe even too close to the market :)  Be careful with some strange people coming and offering to take you to a tour. The hotel has some people for that and they are really good. One of them took us shopping on the good stores hidden and interesting spots for a really fair price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pablo A wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Location Location Location....  This beautiful Hotel is located next to the Medinas and the main Plaza. You can feel really safe visiting the traditional market and the Plaza late at night.  The Hotel layout follow traditional Morrocon architecture meaning all spaces are open towards a central patio this time filled up with a gorgeous pool.    Room sizes are large enough to accommodate an spacious sitting area and a comfortable queen bed daily decorated with different rose petals. Bathroom area has a separate toilet room.If you travel with friends the corner rooms shares a terrace perfect for an evening email check (internet is free) and night activities planning.    The staff is very friendly and fluent in French English and some Spanish and in Morocco that's a plus.    Breakfast buffet is well provided and satisfies diversities from plain cereals to elaborated pottage. In house you can choose from three different restaurants Morrocan Indian and International with hi end setups but lacking a very short menu and almost no wine options    The Piano Bar is well provided and with elegant sitting areas perfect hideout where you can enjoy a generous drink while waiting for your wife to get ready.    The Clarins Spa is great make sure you call in advance to get the Vapor room ready... it's a must !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: More a 4 star than a 5 but great location
Review_Text: Awful start to a holiday when you exit an airport and the taxi cab drivers shout abuse at you for not wanting to pay 4 times over the odds for a cab ride. 80dhm is approximately what you should be looking at. Absolutely roasting at the mo with humidity at about 100%. Good long daylight hours with hot nights. Didn't see any mozzies. Great location for the hotel- needs more attention to detail to bring this up to a good 4 star. Most hotels do themselves a dis-service by overselling themselves. Structurally beautiful with high ceilings and authentic furniture pieces. The B.A Rep was selling very overpriced excursions which you can pick up for alot less anywhere else (NB. haggle) Pool side drinks are very expensive- especially when they are being presented in just a can. An advantage if you can speak french/morrocan as very little english is spoken by key hotel personnel (reflected in cable tv channels- only 2 in english). Internet works sporadically. The pool side is un-manned for 95% of the time. Towels are limited on a first come first served basis. Sun beds were comfortable with plenty of shaded seating areas. The pool and surrounding areas were kept clean. I had read on other reviews that the a/c didn't always work; unfortunately this problem continues. It really is no joke in those kind of temperatures. We did have a lovely big room with 2 a/c units the one nearest the bed didn't work properly and sounded like a drilling machine. Nights were very uncomfortable as the ceiling fans only moved the air around and the beds are made up of a duvet when a thin sheet is all that is required. There is no view to speak of as the curtains need to remain drawn to keep the sun out. The curtains are made up of a heavy material and a black out curtain. Nothing inbetween which would allow you to enjoy looking out over the pool; as soon as you draw back the curtain you are looking directly into someone elses room. Very intrusive. This also meant that the windows remained closed and the toilets had very poor extraction fans. Not a very plesant aroma. A cool box would remain colder than the fridge. There is not enough hanging space in the small closet and no hooks to hang towels up in the shower room. The bedside lights didn't work on the left side of the room which was annoying as the whole room would then have to be lit up when reading at night. Breakfast is clean and plentiful with a large variety. Ask for Nescafe if you can't handle the local gloop. The orange juice is delicious. Bewarned that pick pockets and beggars are rife outside/in the market. Be warned to keep your wits about you when outside the hotel; you'll get jostled spoken to rudely dismissed with a hand gesture and ladies WILL get groped. Personal space is not respected. Be aware when eating outdoors as we were duped/lured into a restaurant only to be told that they served a 3 course set menu at an extortionate price (after they'd sat us down and taken drinks orders) The price for a carriage ride should be around 200Dhms for the hour irrespective of how many of you get in the carriage. Everyone is out to put one over on you needless to say I wont be going back. The food in the hotel pool bar is definately worth the price. Well presented fresh and authentic. Chocolate milkshake is highly recommended. Be warned the lifts regulary break down. The spa seems very over priced therefore empty.The points I have made all seem small but when you put them all together a 5 star hotel it does not make...BUT a lovely 4 star which I would recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Great physical property, horrible attention to detail
Review_Text: This hotel is a complete enigma. On one hand you have a beautiful physical property that is perfectly situated and provides a sunny oasis from the bustling city. Pool scene is quiet and luxurious restaurants are delicious and relatively high end piano bar offers refreshing cocktails by the pool western style brunch...all pretty solid. We were even upgraded to a mini-suite upon arrival free of charge. But I've been fooled on first dates before. As I got to know the property better say on day 2 and 3 I began to encounter a frustrating and at times off putting lack of attention to detail. Where to begin? Day 1 my air conditioner unit did not work and my room was unbelievably hot. Repairmen came but were unable to fix the problem. Day 2 we switched suites into a unit with a balcony (upgrade?). Although we got the balcony we also became proud owners of an undrainable / overflowing shower an ant infestation a repeatedly dysfunctional keycard for our door and spotty wifi at best (actually didn't work at all in new room). Also the spa and pool area is very nice however the tiny 2 machine gym is legitimately a safety hazard for adults over the age of 25. The 100 degree gym temperature might be bad enough but when combined with a humid sauna and no circulation it is essentially a heat death trap waiting for some overweight 50 year old man to stroke out. Still all this aside - I actually want to really like this hotel. We spent a few overall very pleasant days by the sultanesque pools (main and roof deck) and ate two really great meals in the garden and roof area. The manager was very helpful when I asked for help both in switching my room and in booking us a great tour guide. He is doing his very best to make it a great experience but the hotel simply needs a bit more money to focus on some details. Overall perfect location in dead center of city for site seeing great pool and restaurant scene friendly staff BUT pathetic lack of attention to functioning of a/c units showers ants keycards gym and other small tidbits. I'm giving this 4 stars because it's a great oasis but really it's a 5 star property in location and room size with 3 star attention.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful the rooms are very big and the location is PERFECT!.  The breakfast service was really good and complete the main pool is lovely the restaurants serves delightful dishes.  The bad things: we were ther with some of our clients and 3 of them reported that some jewelry and shoes had been stolen. Another person said he found his door room opened eventhough he had closed it early that morning.  A beautiful place but as always you have to be careful with your stuff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: We spent a few nights in this hotel before and after our trekking in the Atlas. This hotels is special in the way that we automatically felt like "at home" when we arrived. We had already been there for a fe drinks in a previous trip some years ago and we really wanted to come back.  The location is excellent very close from the koutoubia and from the Jema Elfna square : convenient for going out and also to find the way back!  The hotel has the shape of a riad with an inner garden and pool with birds and flowers... its like an oasis after a long day outside around the medina or in the souks under 35°...  Very relaxing.  It is true that there is not much variation for the breakfast or for the snack menue but I think this is the same in every hotel (it is difficult to reinvent brakfast...) Anyway this is an adress that I do recommend although face prices are a bit high.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hi    My partner & I stayed at the Les Jardins de La Koutoubia hotel for 4 nights before heading to Casablanca.    It is a lovely hotel and the main advantage is location..location...location. The reception staff were nice but we had to ask for things about 3 times cause they were busy.    Lack of wi-fi was a pain as we had to move around to gain access to the internet. It was doing our heads in!!!!    Hotel - is clean & serves fab cocktails around 80 dirhams each..expensive but good for a special occasion or if you wish to relax by the lovely pool. Breakfast is fab. They serve everything you could possibly want. You must ask them for more orange juice which was a pain considering we paid 5* prices & they should constantly top your glass up. This is a minor thing really.    People staying there - was a complete mixture from your model types who hit the trendy joints of Marrakesh @ night & lots of couples as well. Mainly French of course who dress to impress. Dress code is very relaxed as I was causal throughout.    Fridge - our fridge wasn't working but we didn't complain. Overall a lovely hotel with a great location..fab breakfast & nice staff. It is very clean which is my main concern.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place for a day visit, otherwise overpriced and in need of better management and maintenance
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel on a friend's recommendation having spent a few previous days in a stunning Riad in the Medina. In hindsight we should have stayed in the Riad. This hotel has beautiful grounds and public rooms full of bird song and flowers around a large lovely courtyard with a swimming pool. It has a great location as well. We would recommend it for a day visit as you can pay to use the pools and access the public areas and restaurants on a 'day pass'. The Indian restaurant on the Terrace with a great view of the main Mosque was very good.  However we would not recommend a stay here as it is very over-priced for what it is now as  the hotel appears to be suffering from a lack of effective management. Our rooms were large and nicely decorated. However it had poorly functioning air-conditioning which despite three requests for attention and intervention left our rooms hot and stuffy at night making sleeping difficult. It was also venting air from the kitchens below so the room smelt of stale oil. The shower sumps did not drain properly and the carpets whilst cleaned daily were clearly in need of replacement. Our request to change rooms was gently batted away by Reception. The hotel is generally very clean the common areas are certainly beautiful and aesthetically pleasing. However it is the small things that let down a hotel of this nature boasting 5 stars. At early morning breakfast which is a very good buffet the cleaning staff were still out mopping sweeping and vacuuming amongst the hotel guests. Something that should have been done at 6am before breakfast service has started. Despite this evidence of cleaning the sun loungers by the pool were never lifted for cleaning and a carpet of discarded nutshells cans and other detritus could be seen from eye level when swimming in the pool. Not nice.  Definitely worth a day visit but avoid staying here it is not worth the price despite the fantastic location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We spent a week here in May; the weather was perfect and this our most convenient hotel in all our four visits to the city over recent years. It is a stone's throw from the Jemaa el f'na and souks as well as the Koutoubia mosque and gardens. It's not far from the Mamounia either if you fancy an expensive drink and a spot of Russian oligarch-spotting in the beautiful gardens! Food in the restaurants was good and the staff helpful: we had a 6am start on the day we left and they arranged a light breakfast for us with coffee and rolls.  The only drawback was the airconditioning which gave off a strange and unpleasantly stale smell; as it was early in the year the ceiling fan was enough to keep the room cool but it would be a different matter in high summer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stopped here for a lovely lunch n the courtyard restaurant. Food was good and the atmosphere very pleasant. The hotel is very well located near the main square for those who find themselves looking for somewhere to stop when the temperature starts rising at lunchtime. Great sorbet!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Well located for key sites and a welcome oasis from hustle and bustle
Review_Text: As other reviewers state this hotel benefits from a brilliant location - immediately next to the main square souks Koutoubia mosque and gardens. When the activity outside becomes too much it's great to step through doors into calm interior. Public spaces are spacious our room was great - very large with a beautiful bathroom with large bath and shower very large balcony with sun shades (an 'inner patio room' in separate patio area that annexes the main hotel building). A lovely touch was different arrangements of rose petals on the bed each night. We ate at the Indian restaurant and found the food flavoursome and we also enjoyed the salads at lunchtime in the restuarant adjoining main pool area. The main pool is reasonably large with plenty of sunbeds (the pool attendant was pretty good at clearing used towels and freeing up beds) plus an unexpected pool on the roof. The spa facilities were good although my husband objected to paying for use of the steam room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Hotel is very beautiful and close to the Jemaa el Fna souks and all the attractions that this magical city has to offer. Indeed its location was one of the best assets helping us to escape from the hustle and the heat whenever we wanted.    The staff in general was very friendly and accommodating. They were fluent in French English and Spanish making everyone in our party feel welcomed.    The Hotel has 2 wonderful outdoor swimming pools: one in the main patio surrounded by palm trees and cushioned lounge chairs and the one located in the rooftop with direct view to la Koutoubia tower. In both areas pool butters offer towels and drinks but it is better to retrieve them since they take a long time to deliver them. Nevertheless we highly appreciated the complimentary fruit skewers offered while sunbathing.    The rooms are clean and surprisingly large; we never expected to have separated living area to sit and enjoy a lazy afternoon. Even more surprising our room had a second bathroom! Airco is mild so do not expect to have polar air even if you set up the temperature to zero.    We have a nice experience with our room with rose and petals decorating the bed the bathrooms and the living. However my friends suffered different problems with their room: first with the not working airco and second with almost two days without electricity. The Hotel was fixing a general problem in that floor but they did not inform the guests about the work in progress and its consequences. Because the Hotel was fully booked it was not possible to move them to another room.    Breakfast was great boasting different pastries breads rolls crepes omelettes fresh fruit great coffee and different type of yogurts. We sat everyday outside the pool to enjoy the warming up morning and the birds chirping in the patio. Super...    The Hotel boasts 3 restaurants: one French one Moroccan and one Indian/Asian cuisine with good food and attentive service. We enjoyed our Moroccan dinner with live music and a belly dancer.    The bar at the patio is great for an afternoon drink while the one in the roof is good to chill out along the swimming pool.    The Clarins Spa is great. We had the traditional Hammam ritual and it was fantastic. We were so pleased that we brought home some of the products. The hairdresser also did a great job caring for my hair. In addition there is a third pool inside the SPA but only available for a fee or free of charge if you are taking any of the treatments.    In general we had a wonderful time in Les Jardins de la Koutoubia and I probably will go back. I wished they had informed us in advance about the work in progress so my friend were not caught in darkness...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Good Points  Central location  Friendly staff  Clean Rooms    Not so Good Points  AC not working  Remodeled Hotel so Room sizes are different  Same Breakfast for three days  No care for Vegetarians inspite of 3 rooms for 3 nights  Indian Restaurant on Terrace has pathetic food for Vegetarians    Would I stay again  No as Marrakech is a small city and central location is not an advantage. Travel within city is 10 to 15 mins by taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Just next to the market and still quite in hotel. Great pools to relax from the outside hectic

Amazing place in the heart of the Medina. The city is literally on the doorstep so its so easy to explore and then stop for a break back at the pool. Embrace the culture people and the amazing food and you will have an fantastic time. Luckily we live just across the water in Spain so will hopefully get another chance soon to return to this beautiful city. Will def stay again in Les Jardines.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Some tips on the hotel:  - breakfast is good breakfast staff could be better  - take a mini suite swimming pool side they are fantastic! we had n°211  - ground floor pool in easter holiday is not heated and cold roof pool is heated  - the spa and hamman are superb one of the bests i have ever been in  - indian restaurant on the roof is very good we ate there twice in five days.  - restaurant Paris is nothing special  - cocktails in the piano bar are very good they know the classics although they are not on the menu the wodka-martini dry tasted very good.  - reception staff is very helpfull and polite  - if you don't like smoking people in your room restaurant breakfast room ... just avoid Morrocco.  - the "snackbar" at the pool for lunch has a very good price-quality range.    If i would return to Marrakech for a city trip (nothing longer) i would choose again for Les Jardins de la Koutoubia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in the best location
Review_Text: The hotel is less than 5 minutes away by walk from Jemaa Fna. Inside the hotel is fantastic and relaxing with very good service. The room was avery day ornament with roses petals.  Very good restaurants in case you do not want to go out for dinner.  Only one think I do not like was Clarins SPA they want me to pay because I used the pool they do not tell me in advance that you have to contract a service for use the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Juliet H wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: This is a beautiful hotel to which to retire after a day of touring the hectic city. The pool is lovely highly recommend enjoying cocktails there at the end of the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This hotel has the best location. It's just around the corner from Place Jemaa El Fna and the Souks. Once inside the hotel it's so relaxing. Great Moroccan atmosphere with all the comforts. Some reviews say the decor is a little 'tired' but we saw renovations are in hand so this should not put you off. Breakfast is great and plentiful with pancakes and eggs made to order as well as pastries fruit saladcereals yoghurts etc. There are many places just to sit and relax and it is as it appears in the website photos.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Lovely oasis of calm and tranquility
Review_Text: We stayed here in the peak summer season and chose it because if its locality and reviews.  Indeed it was a fabulous place to retire to once the expeditions of the jema el fna were over for the day. It is painfully close ( literally a 1-2 minute walk) to The Place yet exudes auch calmness that you feel like you have left that hustle bustle so far back.  Once inside the hotel you can enjoy brilliant service from reception and concierge service. The pool is just ahead through the doors that divide the riad style courtyard from the lovely reception area. The rooms we stayed in was a junior suite and was lovely with a outside seating area next to another pool and the french themed restaurant Relais de Paris- lovely food and waiters.  There is a spa and hamam service available with Clarins and was also a lovely experience. A small clean gym area is located near the spa. The breakfast area is by the pool or just inside if you like to stay near the serving area and the staff again more than happy to assist. The breakfast though repetitive is nice and filling but of kot much variety- continental.  There is a piano bar just besides the reception on the right and is quite nice in the evenings. Besides the pool areas there are several rooms for ones relaxation and a pool table with tv too.  On the terrace there is another pool and is quite popular during the summer. There is a nice indian themed restaurant too - a little pricey and service can be slow but the food is delicious.

We stayed over a weekend in February. We used the car service that was offered by the hotel and were met at the airport and whisked away in a lovely mercedes. We were so glad we did. On approach to the hotel entrance we wondered what we had gotten ourselves into. But you walk through the doors into a lovely oasis. The grounds are very pretty and the service was wonderful. We were upgraded to a suite and the room was gorgeous. And everything was spotlessly clean. The hotel is just around the corner from the main square so the location is excellent if you like to be in the middle of the action. We ate lunches by the main pool and although simple the food was good. We ate at Narwama the restaurant between two sections of the hotel and really enjoyed our meals and the atmosphere. I'm not sure though whether this restaurant was actually part of the hotel. We truly enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to recommend it to our friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel has a good location in the heart of Medina: short distance to Jemaa El Fna and souks. Breakfast was good and plentiful variety of beverages were also great (they serve alcohol thank good). Our room was quite large and cozy with separate bedroom and livingroom separate bathroom and toilet were very pleasant too. Hotel has very nice lounge areas and pools interior is very Maroccan but also a little shabby. Although the hotel seems to be high end hotel it’s hardly value for five star rating. Rooms were very over-priced and we didn’t get value for our expectations. Staff was impassive and spoken English were clumsy. We didn’t use the spa because it was ridiculously expensive: extra expense on high room rate no thanks. Free wi-fi works only at the reception lobby and hardly even there. Hotel’s Moroccon restaurant was bad experience very expensive and just a poor and tasteless food we got better food at Jemaa El Fna food stalls.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were there last October and we enjoyed very much the location it will take you about ten minutes to Yamaa el Fna. The hotel is nice and pool is between trees a real pleasure. Staff is very kind and helpful. Rooms are not very big but are nice decorated. Although there were some bugs (bathroom is made of stone and wood) and breakfast was a little poor I have to say that location is perfect and the hotel is nice and comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is our 4th trip to the hotel - so yes we love it!    It's extremely well situated a couple of minutes from both Koutoubia Mosque and the square. The style is traditional Moroccan so if heavy wood tobacco coloured walls old red rugs and an eclectic mix of local artwork ornaments furniture and subtle lighting aren't your thing this may not be for you.    Reception staff are very helpful and if you've booked without a travel company they are excellent at organising anything you might want to do and providing any information you might need. The receptionist picked up that while we were there it was my birthday so I was surprised with a birthday cake at breakfast!    Our room was delightful we had a suite with a small sitting area and a patio area outide. All amenities are in the room except tea and coffee making facilities. So no need of a hairdryer shampoo etc. Safes in the room are roomy and there was lots of strorage space.    Breakfast is a good spread with lots of variety: an egg station fruits cereals and yoghurts bread cakes and some hot food. We occassionally eat lunch around the pool which might be considered expensive but the food quality is excellent. We tried all 3 restaurants (French Indian and Moroccan) on this trip and weren't disappointed with any. Food variety is good well cooked and the service of the restaurant staff is excellent.    The piano bar is lovely for a drink to unwind after the chaos of the square and the staff are both polite and attentive.    There are 3 pools included one which is heated and a Clarins spa (though we didn't visit the spa)    All in all an excellent 5 star hotel if like us you prefer to avoid the chain hotels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is an excellent hotel located right in the Medina and within walking distance of the souk so visiting the old city is a simple matter.  From outside the hotel looks ordinary but inside it has great character. We were met on arrival with a cup of mint tea while our registration process was completed and were upgraded to a room overlooking the square around which the hotel rooms are located. The square contains a good sized swimming pool with very comfortable seating areas and there is another pool on the roof top where you can sunbathe even in February. The rooms are well furnished with a large king sized bed rather firm but pleasant.  The bathroom is well equipped and the TV has numerous channels in English. The hotel has 2 good restaurants one serving Moroccan food the other French. In the evening there is a piano bar and outside a fire was lit for us to sit around the pool. Staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Prices are reasonable by European standards though perhaps on the high side for Morocco but you get what you pay for and it is worth the price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian M wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: A really enjoyable visit with great hotel in a great location with excellent friendly staff.  An oasis of tranquility and good service in a crazy and bustling place.  Atmospheric Medina friendly guides to take local walks and day trips especially into the mountains.  Hotel service was excellent and the restaurants very good with variety IndianEuropean and local cuisine with Belly dancer.  Do not be put off by the stories about Marrakech the visit and this hotel a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Service was very good and we enjoyed the variety of Food & Beverage options. Hotel offers all the typical luxury hotel amenities. Spa is very nice.    Not sure why you would stay outside the Medina in one of the "compounds" when you could stay at Les Jardins de La Koutoubia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: richard w wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Title: A week at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia, February 2012
Review_Text: An excellent hotel in a perfect place just 100 metres from "The Square" Jemaa El Fna - this is the place to be morning noon and night so bussy exciting and entertaining.  Hotel staff were exceptional food great (especially breakfast) and our room (one of the cheapest) was massive. Overlooking the medina garden from our balcony which comfortably held a four piece suite of sofas/chairs.    As you approach the hotel down the narrow congested road full of stalls people donkey carts and badly parked cars don't be put off - you step through the doors and into a top class hotel.    Unheated giant pool at ground level but good for sunbathing and the heated rooftop pool is where you can enjoy a swim even if it is cool as it was last week.    We had an amazing week and so glad we were smack in the centre of the old town rather than miles away in the "new" hotel tourist area.  Richard & Dawn
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everything about this hotel oozes calm efficiency and discreet service. The location a 5 minute walk from the Djemma el fna is ideal you can delve into the chaos of the square and the souks and then retreat back to the calm of the hotel.  Breakfast was superb with a large choice and fresh eggs and omelets on offer amongst the ususal fare of pastries and cereals We ate at two of the hotels restuarants the Relais de Paris and the Jardins de la Bala and again both were excellent.  There is also a Piano bar in the hotel serving alcoholic drinks the pianist and his repertoire may not be to everyones taste but we found it to be a relaxing way to round off the day.  All in all I will definitely be returning to this hotel in'shallah.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stella H wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: We arrived at lunchtime and were greeted by hotel staff and poured a glass of mint tea. Unfortunately our room was not ready for half an hour so we relaxed for a while.  Room was lovely rose petals everywhere !!(only on the first day). Everything you needed including an easily operated safe!  The setting was lovely we overlooked the main pool and the sun decks and heated pool on the roof was great.  There are 3 restaurants we ate in each of them over the 3 nights we stayed. Food OK not a great choice and would get bored if we had stayed longer - perhaps the menus are extended in busier times. The French restaurant was a let down in terms of service they forgot our starter altogether and when reminded delivered it with the main!  Breakfast was great and the hotel staff were excellant.    The hotel is slap bang in the middle of things so be prepared to be jumped on the minute you set foot onto the street. If its your first trip do your homework and try and get an idea of prices especially trips etc from the hotel staff who were very good in that respect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We pre-booked for a meal in their Moroccan Restaurant and it was amazing. doesnt look much from the outside but inside it's like an Arabian palace - red velvet gold lighting absolutely beautiful. We had cocktails in the piano bar first (good prices and fab service). The meal was fantastic with live music and belly dancer. Well worth a visit. 5* hotel 3 course meal with wine was approx £30pp. Couldn't rate it enough. Great end to the holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Ideally situated hotel with just what you need to enjoy your trip.
Review_Text: Hotel is 5 Star just off the main square - just like an oasis a stones thorow away from the noisy crowded 'smelly' Jamaa El Fna. We were given a suite overlooking the pool area in the middle despite having made an online reservation for double room medina view. The sun terrace on the top is ideal to relax after a busy day and if you dont want to go out to eat the restaurants are excellent both the quality of the food and the atmosphere. After a couple of days visiting the sights around time we spend the third afternoon in the Spa relaxing a worthwhile experience!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful hotel for a first visit to Marrakesh
Review_Text: This hotel was an excellent choice for our first visit to Marrakesh. It was centrally located within the city walls a short walk to the central square Djemma el Fna and then to the medina. We stayed in a mini-suite which was spacious and very well-equipped with a comfortable seating area and balcony overlooking an inner garden. It was very quiet and a welcome retreat after a day walking in the souk etc. The breakfast (included) was an excellent buffet with a chef making omlettes and cooked eggs to order and plenty of fruit bread cereals etc. We also enjoyed dinner our first night at the hotel's Moroccan restaurant with a good choice of dishes. The staff were very helpful finding us an excellent guide and driver for our first morning to go to the Jardin Majorelle etc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Lovely luxury hotel in heart of old Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights in early January. Got a great deal on a Patio facing room and breakfast by searching hotel booking websites. Room was large and well appointed with separate seating area and good sized bathroom. Public areas are reminiscent of the type of hotel you expect Poirot to appear in! Lovely large pool with pretty gardens on one side which house a delightful restaurant where lunch is served. Hotel has 3 restaurants for dinner - we ate in the french one in the modern annexe and in the Moroccan one where we were lucky to have traditional musicians and a belly dancer. Piano bar does a nice range of cocktails and we thought the breakfast was excellent - try the pancakes with fresh figs and fig jam!! The real plus for this hotel is the location - 2 minutes from the square and the Koutoubia mosque. We loved Marrakech - it is a winning mixture of the traidtiional Moroccan and French colonialism.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Judith F wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Old fashioned luxury near old city center
Review_Text: The luxury this beautiful hotel offers is not flashy. The style is not that of international design with a Moroccan touch. It is a kind of discreet luxury reminiscent of the 40s or 50s. A nice welcoming touch are the rose petals strewn in the beautifully designed bathrooms with modern fittings and on the firm comfortable bed. We loved this hotel and recommend it highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel of New Year's eve. The location is perfect - just outside the medina - literally steps from Djemma el Fna Square and all the activity. The common areas are terrific - the pool is lovely. I had a hammam which was fine - nothing exceptional. The rooms are clean and comfortable - not huge. The food is just ok. I had an Italian buffet one night which was really not good. The other meals were fine. Service is very nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Good choice for full relax in Marrakech
Review_Text: I have examined through Internet a lot of options concerning fantastic Riad in Marrakech and I am now convinced that searching for intimate luxury and sophisticate atmosphere some places are surely best than Les Jardins de La Koutoubia.  But aiming at a confortable and elegant hotel not too big centrally located in La Medina with a set of very nice relaxing areas like a Spa and 3 swimming pools one of them in a splendid terrace looking the Koutobia Minaret and the red roofs of this enchanting town Les Jardin de la Koutoubia is the ideal choice.  I found a very good level of service nice and wide rooms elegant common areas with a deep touch of moroccan design also if not extremely refined.
