The only contraint is that the SPA use and especially the use of internal swimming pool is not included in the rate of the room.  Breakfast instead included is in the average with not a wide range of choices.  Overall taking into consideration the position the service level and the fantastic outdoor pool on the roof especially pleasant for europeans during their winter time and the appropriate (but not low) price Le jardins de La Koutoubia has fully satisfied our expectations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place, right in the heart od Marrakech
Review_Text: This place is a must great food great staff and belly dancers with dinner what more could you ask for will be back !

Review_Date: Damian M wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel whilst on a work holiday with my last Media company back in July 2009. The Hotel was extremely luxurious and the finishes throughout were of a very high standard. It's prefect located as well just a short 2-3 minute stroll to the Medina and Souks and the service was great. The pool bar on the top floor is great if you just want to chill with a few beers and soak up the sun whilst also taking in a view of the rest of the City. All in all I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: We've just got back from a lovely stay at this hotel. The location was perfect the outdoor swimming pools were great and the chill out rooms dotted around were ideal.. The Indian restaurant on the terrace was lovely the food and service excellent. The international restaurant downstairs had a romantic setting and the food was good.. Breakfast was fine although some mornings the staff were very slow in replenishing the buffet. I think it's more of a 4 star hotel as far as service is concerned.  The air conditioning worked well-in fact i had to turn it off in the middle of the night. I got woken up by the early morning chants but it didn't last long.  My only complaint is the piano player-he just can't sing and play the piano and most of the time he wasn't in tune. It was always a relief when he stopped for a break so we could enjoy the peace!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: julian a wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: This hotel unlike many others in Marrakech is situated right in the very centre and 5 mins walk to main square and souks. It is very luxurious with incredibly helpful staff be sure to get their car pick up service in with price of room.  We were there for a special anniversary week end and were upgraded to a suite on the top floor and our daughters to a junior suite and I had already negotiated a very keen price. so don't be afraid to ask everything in morocco is negotiable!  The hotel has 3 restaurants but rather quiet for my taste. But the breakfast is fantastic !  I have been to Marrakech twice this year and always use the same guide . He is a most educated and delightful man and would be pleased to pass on his details. With MUSTAFA you get to see the real city and can't get lost!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It is chaotic around the hotel which is a couple hundred yards from the Jema el-Fnaa square. Even moreso because they were celebrating Eid. However once inside the confines of the hotels it is tranquill and restful. The service is excellent. The breakfast was passable though the lunch time restaurant was pretty good. Tried the Indian restaurant on the roof terrace and suggest this be left out of the itenararry unless you want a bad experience. The room (we were lucky enough to have a junior suite) was spacious clean very comfortable and well decorated aswell as having a private patio area. The AC was not upto par though having a ceiling fan helped as it was really hot.    If you want to be in the middle of the action then this is the place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just arrived back from a 4 night stay at this hotel. Firstly let me assure you that we have travelled all over and are not novices.    I cannot understand some of the previous reviews on here at all. The hotel is great and so tranquil. It is literally on the Medina yet once inside you cannot hear the noise or smell the traffic fumes. We were never woken up by the mosque at 5am (I am a very light sleeper). The staff were fantastic and we did not once find them unfriendly or unhelpful in fact quite the opposite. The room was lovely. The pools are lush with beach towels provided. We had a couple of things in our room break / go wrong but they were fixed immediately.    The food in the restaurants was great and breakfast was also very nice standard for anywhere abroad. They even had bacon!    My only complaint is the air con as others have mentioned. It is not just particular rooms but speaking to other guests is standard in the hotel. I am afraid it is just not good enough when it is 43 – 49 degrees!!!! There was a ceiling fan and that with plenty of wine/beer enabled us to sleep. I would not recommend this hotel for the summer months. It is the worst air con I have ever experienced in the world!    However the hotel is absolutely charming and kind of a boutique style with lovely little chill out rooms off the pool area. Full of character etc. I am normally hard to please but I would definitely go back here – but not in July / Aug.    Marrakech was an experience! Not really for me. Too crowded hot polluted smelly and with blatant displays of animal cruelty that I prefer to pretend does not exist.    We ate in the hotel mostly and when we did venture out to eat on the stalls in the Medina (as recommended on TA) we ended up with food poisoning! Note: The airport when trying to leave is an absolute nightmare BTW. Maybe we left on a bad day but it took 2 hours from once checked in to get to the gate!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in the middle of a mad place!
Review_Text: We stayed for four nights and were very impressed. We were given an upgraded room and had a patio overlooking the garden. The room was clean and very spacious staff were extremely helpful and kind and all meals we had were superb! The Clarins Spa was lovely with a beautiful indoor pool. A very peaceful and relaxing stay. We would definitely visit this hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful oasis in the madness of Marrakech!
Review_Text: On arrival at the koutoubia we were upgraded from a medina room to a beautiful mini suite very spacious with lovely balcony overlooking a courtyard massive bed & lounge area v nice the hotel is very quirky with lots of traditional features the centre being. Beautiful swimming pool with very comfortable sunbeds!  Despite other reviews I found service to be very good at reception and in the restaurants cleanliness of the hotel was excellent however the maid didn't mop the bathroom floor once in 7 days as we had a few bugs which met a grisly end that were never swept up!  Breakfast was plentiful even if it was the same every day we were half board and ate at the pool bar moroccain and the Indian all very nice although some didn't open til 8pm a little late sometimes.  Drinks were expensive £4 a small beer but wine starting at £13 a bottle better value.  All in all this is a great hotel very boutique style to it right in the heart of the medina a bit noisy with mosque every morning at 4am tho! I got a great deal as I work in the travel industry so I'm not sure if it is worth the advertised £350 a night for the suite but if you can get a good deal I would definately give it a try.

Ok we had a greatly mixed experience at Les Jardins De La Koutoubia. The bottom line is that we will not be returing to this hotel. Here is the good and the bad:    The Good  • The location is definitely as convenient as advertised on two fronts. First it is literally 2 minutes from the medina and main square. You really cannot be better located. Second it is located right across from the Koutoubia Mosque which is an ideal landmark for the geographically challenged in the ever confusing streets of Marrakech!  • The spa...the spa. Brittany described it as the best spa experience of her life.    The Bad  • The hotel has definitely seen better days -- like during the Chirac Adminstration. :) The furniture and red carpets are worn. We were left with the impression that this place was the hot spot in the 1990s but a lot of time has marched by since then. Unfortunately it is priced for its 1990s glory rather than its current state.  • The front desk staff could be described as unfriendly - and worse as willing participants in the ever present "shakedown" of Marrakech. We were actually overcharged upon checking out of the hotel. It was probably only $20-40. However it was irksome when the reservation agent acknowledged there was a mistake and then told us to handle it with Priceline - or call back later. He made no attempt to fix the problem.  • The food in the hotel provides variety - Indian Morrocan French International - but unfortunately nothing is special about the food. You are better off eating at Cafe Arabe (http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g293734-d1070587-Reviews-Cafe_Arabe-Marrakech.html) Terrase des Epices(http://www.tripadvisor.com.sg/Restaurant_Review-g293734-d1740685-Reviews-La_Terrasse_des_Epices-Marrakech.html) or elsewhere.  • We were supposed to have complimentary breakfast with our reservations but the hotel would not honor -- even when it was clearly marked on the confirmation.  Btw we had absolutely great experiences at all other hotels/riads in Morocco.    Happy travels! Brittany and Scott
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Humiliating. I shall never go back
Review_Text: My wife and I have just returned from a five-night break at this hotel. It’s a charming property on the edge of the Djemma al Fan’aa square. The pool area is an oasis of calm in this otherwise frenetic city and the rooms are comfortably furnished the staff generally cheery and helpful and the three restaurants each serve a fine menu of International Moroccan and Asian dishes.  But - and it’s a BIG but. After I had settled the bill (of something over 1000GBP) we took a taxi from the hotel to the airport. On the way the driver took a call on his mobile and handed the phone to me. It was a girl in reception telling me (quite wrongly in fact) that I had failed to pay for a beer at the pool area and what was I going to do about it. I was speechless. In 10 years as Travel Editor of a UK National newspaper I have never been treated in such a humiliating fashion. This crass incident soured an otherwise enjoyable trip and I shall never go back to the hotel. Try the charming Riad Kniza near the Bab Doukala instead. At least they‘ll treat you like a human being.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing in Marrakech. It is right next to the Place Jemna el Fna but is very quiet. Beautiful setting around the pool with plenty of cool quiet place to sit and read or have a drink. There are several restaurants and bar.    The reception desk was under manned and one always had to wait but the staff were friendly. Breakfast was mediocre and room service menu was very limited.    I had a suite overlooking the pool which was very roomy with a bathroom with bath and shower - the shower was blocked and despite having asked three times for it to be unblocked it never was so I showered in the bath. The second bathroom had a basin and WC.    This hotel is not 5 star by any means due to lack of attention to detail - more like a three star but i did enjoy my stay there.    Wifi in my room was working on and off but one could always connect in reception.    Being a solo female traveller I was completely at ease.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Just returned from Marrakech and hotel was perfect for us. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. We had no problem with our room it was clean and they treated us very well. It was nice to walk into a room that was clean with rose petals and a single rose on the bed. I would recommend this hotel but with one caution the hotel is close to a mosque with loud speakers so at 5am you will hear the first call for prays. This last for about 5 - 10 minutes and there are five calls per day! We got used to this after the second day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Full service hotel in a great location.    Desk staff was begrudgingly accommodating. Restaurant cafe & bar staff was friendly.    Ongoing toilet issue but the room was clean with the noise of moving furniture in another floor in the early early hours of the morning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen H wrote a review May 2011
Review_Title: MOROCCAN RESTAURANT HAS A FANTASTIC ATMOSPHERE
Review_Text: We didn't stay at the Riad but used the restaurant a couple of times. Very nice poolside bar for aperitifs. Service was great and food quality very good. Moroccan salad selection and Lotte Tajine were superb. Booking recommended dinner 19.30 to 22.00.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Gorgeous Riad and Hotel in One!!
Review_Text: The decor of this hotel was gorgeous - exactly what you would expect from a hotel in Marrakech!! The rooms are beautiful the hotel has three swimming pools and many other break out / chill out rooms all gorgeously decorated. The feel is very much of a large riad than a 5* hotel. The location is fantastic literally a 5 min walk from the Souks and the main square.    I found the breakfast a bit limiting and felt there could have been more choice. The attitude of some staff members was a bit hostile (e.g. lady who made the eggs in the morning!).    Some members of our group experienced a sewer smell in their room at certain times of the day and no running water which was not pleasant to say the least. However I made a complaint to the manager and we were compensated with a free spa treatment and entry to the spa pool (access to the pool I think should be free to guests anyway) - which I have to say was AMAZING.    One small point I was disappointed that the manager did not bother speaking to me in person - which is important for customer service.    On a final note my sister enjoyed her 40th birthday and the hotel did organise for a gorgeous surprise cake - which was lovely and generous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: nice enough hotel, but service is lacking
Review_Text: The hotel was nice enough I suppose although we expected more of a "five star". The negative experiences with hotel staff however will ensure that we never return. In general we found that the staff were unfriendly and appeared ticked off if we asked for something (a spoon at breakfast information about a taxi). One experience with the concierge was very negative - he gave us a price for stamps and when we brought it to his attention that he had not given us enough change ranted about how we could go out to the square to get stamps if we wanted. He pulled out a calculator to show us the cost...the result of his calculations verified our position that he had not given us enough change. He yelled something in Arabic and left the room. Yikes! The front desk staff were less-than-helpful on other occasions also making us wait for them to finish laughing at a joke or wait while they looked at something on their cell phone. Very unprofessional. I do not recommend this hotel. For the service that you get it is way overpriced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We booked this hotel on a recommendation from a friend and didn't see any reviews until after it was booked.I have to say we were a little concerned after reading some of the recent reviews and came very close to cancelling the hotel but decided to stay put as it offered want we wanted as a family.So off we went with some anticipation but were pleasantly surprised on arrival and continued to be during our stay.The position of the hotel could not be betterour rooms were lovely and hotel/gardens a haven after the hustle and bustle of the souks and fantastic for the kids to go off on their own to enjoy their own experience in the market etc being only 2-3mins away.This hotel is a little rough around the edges (not top notch 5 star) but more then adequate and would definitely recommend it to another family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The hotel has a wonderful central position and feels an oasis of calm after the madness of Marrakesh. The lobby chairs are old and tired. Our VIP(?) garden room had a chair with a stain on the side the soles of my feet were black from walking on the tiles without shoes and the room needed a thorough clean! I spilt face-powder on to a window seat and when I tried to remove this with a damp towel - the towel was black!! Breakfast selection could also be improved and often the burners under the food were not switched on and tomatoes/potatoes were cold.    Staff in the Piano Bar were very pleasant. The saving grace was the superb staff on Reception. I think we will book a good Riad next time round.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location within the city walls. The main square is literally a 2 minute walk. An oasis to return to after activities elsewher in the city or surrounding area. Get a balcony room its worth a little extra. Drinks are a little expensive food in its 4 (?) restaurants is generally good. Nice rooftop pool with view of the Koutoubia Mosque about 2-300 metres away. Spa is also good and a little cheaper than many equivalent European spas.  10-15 minute transfer to/from the airport. Usual warnings about souks apply. The sellers are persistent but accept a firm no.  This was our second visit and if we go to Marrakech again we would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Angela W wrote a review Mar 2011
Review_Text: This was a once great hotel (in the 1970's?) that now is need of a complete refurbishing. It is dark dowdy and rundown. In the absence of a refurbishing it needs aggressive and detail oriented housekeeping. The latter would include a scrub brush (vs. a mop) a paintbrush and a serious effort to regrout and replaster replace poolside turfre plant flowers and planter boxes every six weeks ect. Management should also find a new and trendier lobby shop keeper upgrade appearance of front entrance better staff uniforms and work to have neighboring cheesy souvenir stalls and hawkers replaced and or upgraded. Sound proof as there's a VERY loud mosque nearby. I suggest that the manager start by redecorating the lobby. It's very dated!!!  One good thing the staff is well trained and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stayed here on first visit to Marrakech and it was an ideal location relaxing and peaceful. Excellent breakfast and good food in restaurants. Pool area well serviced and on a whole staff charming and helpful with the exception of brusqueness verging on indifference in one person at concierge desk. Would agree with comments about flooding bathroom - very difficult to have a shower without flooding the floor. Would return and would recommend though if you are not good on stairs make sure the lift situation is resolved - guest lift from main lobby never worked during our 5 days and infrequent tempermental service from other lifts .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel overall a great experience and I would visit it again. First the location is ideal as you are a 100m walk from the main square. That was good as after a few hours of looking around the area you could head back to your hotel for a rest.    The hotel has three pools one in the main courtyard another on the roof and a third in the Spa. The courtyard is a great place to hang out and enjoy a drink. The rooftop pool has a nice large deck with lounges around it and in February it was heated as well. There is a bar at the top near the pool. The third pool at the Spa is used by those at the Spa. Several friends use the spa services for massages and such and raved about it.    The rooms vary in size some of us had a single room and others had small suites. My only complaint about the stay was that my room was very warm. During the day I had to leave the window open as the air conditioning system was not working - at least that I could tell.    The staff was pretty good although I found sometimes that the staff at the front desk was rather brusque. Staff in the Piano Bar and the restaurant were much nicer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I stayed here with my husband for a special occasion on our first visit to Marrakesh and were not disappointed. Our suite was spacious and had a great view of the pool the maid service was excellent and staff were friendly at all times. The location is really good right in the middle of everything but once you are in the hotel everything is calm and peaceful. I would definitely return to Marrakesh and would stay in this hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: classic 5 star hotel, service position and ambiance all 5 star,
Review_Text: from moment of arrival the service was excellent.the junior suite was spacious comfortableclean with a large balcony overlooking garden area (room 252).good attentive service in piano bar and koutoubia restaurant.step outside tranquility of hotel into the real heartmadness of marrakech.will definetly be back for another visit.be aware very near minaret so can hear calls to prayer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Not a true 5 star, but better than other reviewers suggest
Review_Text: Stayed in this hotel late November 2010 with my wife for a three night break.    Position of hotel is great only 1-2 minutes walk from the Jeema-el-Fna Square. This means it is almost in the souk area. Many other luxury hotels in Marrakech might be 20 mins walk or a taxi from this true central area.    Like another reviewer I had no response by email from the hotel to requests. When I phoned them before arriving they expressed surprise that emails hadn't been dealt with but . . .    I have no connection with the hotel and have no need to apologise for it. Carpets were not filthy. It seems to be a Berber luxury style to have red long pile carpets. Public areas were attractive the central pool was cool and reflecting there was a log fire lit in the central courtyard every evening. The ground floor bar with piano player was relaxing too.    Reception staff could be more friendly we nearly complained when one seemed to be chatting to a friend rather than dealing with us. However they helped us with many other things advice booking restaurants and taxis. There was mineral water supplied and the free wifi worked well faster on off peak times it was slower around breakfast time and early evening.    Spa and indoor pool are beautiful many rooms built around the various pools. Several restaurants. Breakfast was not to a European 5 star standard more like an Italian 4 star - scrambled eggs ready although they had a chef making eggs to order and another chef making crepes to order at breakfast. There was a shortage to teaspoons at breakfast but we laughed about it and carried on.    To compare with other comments in November cooler month there were towels by the pools plentiful supply the hotel was full and the pool area was kept clean and tidy.    The rooftop Asian style restaurant was good we enjoyed lunch there and rested around the rooftop pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel was nice enough.Good spa. We booked a suite which was v modern and in good order so we did not experience any of the problems suffered by others below. Marrakech old town filthy and seedy I'm afraid . Some people may call it' full of character' but I take no pleasure in viewing squalor and poverty.  Enjoyed mint tea in cafes overlooking the square but cringed at tourists being hassled and intimidated below. Awful experinece one night (2am) when call girl knocked on our room demanding to be let in (we were two women staying alone). Called security and instead of promptly escorting her off the premises made us feel as if we were in the wrong for complaining. Food in hotel fine  except for instance where food fell on the floor and they simply plonked in back on our plates. Yes and the red shag pile rugs do look like they need a good clean. We had a laugh and made the best of the weekend . Recommend Bozin restaurant a £5 taxi ride out of town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I stayed at this appalling hotel during a recent visit to Marrakech. The hotel was dirty carpets throughout the public areas and floor corridors filthy. I woke up every morning with swollen eyes limbs and my room temperature could not be lowered below 25C for the duration of my stay. Bathroom flooded every time the shower was used room had a permanent smell of mould and damp.  Whilst it is in a good location there is clearly no management and the staff are leaderless.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Travel Richly wrote a review Oct 2010
Review_Title: Nice location and not much else
Review_Text: Nice looking hotel perfectly located in the old medina. Unfortunately almost nothing in our rooms (was traveling with friends) worked as it should. The list includes: non-existent water pressure in the shower; air-conditioning that never brought the room temperature below 75 degrees (23 C); electricity that would go off at any time of the day or night; and internet service (free) whose reception was spotty at best.    Other annoying things: smelling cigarette smoke coming through our room vent from nearby rooms; charging for bottled water (tap water is not drinkable); TV cable going off and on; front desk forgetting our wake-up calls; having to wait forever to get coffee and other hot drinks at breakfast.    There are lots of accommodation choices in Marrakech and this one does not merit consideration until they revamp and fix the numerous problems.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Our opinion of Les Jardins de la Koutoubia
Review_Text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and can only say what a lovely time we had. The hotel is absolutely excellent and deserves 5 stars in most things. I will say though that it was perhaps expensive for 4 nights on a bed and breakfast basis. Also our room was directly over the bar which in itself was not noisy but you could clearly hear everyone sitting outside. These are only our opinions and not necessarily great problems but they are worth knowing about before you go. However the actual hotel is lovely and its position in Marrakech is superb. Just a short walk from the front door and you are right in the middle of everything going on in Marrakech (and there is usually lots going on). The staff in the hotel could not do enough for us while we were there and the hotel was spotless. Our room was kept lovely at all times. I can only say that if you are thinking of going there you will not be sorry we certainly were not.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the busy street outside you enter the oasis of the Koutoubia hotel. Located next to the Souk this hotel offers a unique Arabian atmosphere both charming and luxurious. The hotel itself is not 100 % perfect but this is what creates the effect of beeing part of "Arabian Nights". We visited several other fantastic hotels during our stay (Mamonia etc) but always felt more at home in our own Koutoubia palace! The Spa is fantastic the pool area is fantastic (both roof pool and courtyard pool) and the restaruants are very good. Breakfast is a feast although they could improve their service during breakfast. We often had to order our coffee two or three times and tell them to replenish the fruit salad clean the tables etc. If this doesn't bother you this hotel will offer you everything you would wish for during your stay.    We are definately going back for more!!    PS. If you can afford it I would highly recommend a night in the suites on top of the hotel. These are the most fantastic suites I have ever experienced with their own "courtyard" and fantastic interior.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Looks great but staff are inept and 40% mark-up on exchange rate since they want to bill in Dirham.
Review_Text: Stayed 5 nights. Although we had booked on-line and sent email & 'phoned (because no reply to email) to arrange collection from airport they were still surprised when we arrived. No one had a clue what to do. Eventually we changed and went for a walk. When we can back 3 hours later they had still not sorted a room.  Breakfast should be recorded on You-Tube. It took 4 requests to 4 different member of staff to get a tea-spoon. Each member of staff appears to have their own specific duty therefore unless that is part of their "responsibility" they are not interested. Breakfast items are eventually replenished when a mass of guest have gathered around the self service area waiting for food.  The concierge service is a complete waste of time. They are unhelp and not interested.  The final straw was the bill. Although we had booked on-line with a price quoted in Euros the hotel insisted on converting this to Dirham @ 40% above any available exchange rate. We asked to pay in euro but they refused...wonder why.  The return trip to the airport which we thought had been booked with the hotel had not been booked....therefore after much discussion & frustration we caught a taxi outside the hotel. Fortunately we had allowed sufficient time to make our flight.  In conclusion great location wonderful looking riad but awful service and complete lack of management. My advice go for a drink there and use the pool but don't stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Poor management ruins potentially good hotel
Review_Text: Stayed with my wife Thursday to Monday probably about the right amount of time to spend in Marrakech IMHO.    The hotel could be very good the location is excellent quality of building the.facilities and the rooms all undoubted 5* .    However the staff training and their managemernt is an inept shambles. Staff amble about without direction avoid eye contact and fail to deliver a service above 3*. I simply don't understand the generous praise of the staff elsewhere on this site. I paid around $500 per night and I am used to hotels at that level around the world I have had better service from better trained staff everywhere except New York!    The food varied from a good buffet breakfast a very poor lunch/snack/pool restaurant which delivered the worst Club Sandwich I have ever seen. Appalling and the Caesar's salad was only marginally better. The Moroccan restaurant was only adaquate; meat and vegetables served in a tangine but of a standard which might pass muster in a B&B in Margate but is not impressive in this location or at this price.The other two restaurants in the hotel were considerably better. the Relais de Paris (fish and grilled meats) was a nice meal and the Asian Restaurant combined good food with the only good restaurant manager and unsurprisingly therefore by far the best standard of service we encountered during our stay.    There are 3 main pools 1 exclusively for spa clients the others roof top and in the main coutyard area. All are quality facilities but again no managed presence of staff means no towels (plenty used none clean!) no clearing away of glasses etc. Very uninviting despite great potential.    With the right management this hotel could be turned around in a few weeks until that happens I wouldn't recommend it to anyone as a 5* destination.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Have just returned from a five night stay at this wonderful hotel. I travelled with three female friends and as this was our first trip to morrocco we were slightly apprehensive. That is until we stepped into this dream of a hotel. Staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Our rooms were immediately upgraded when they heard that I was celebrating my 50th birthday. The hotel has two beautiful pools and plenty of staff around to bring cool drinks when required. We dined in the relais de paris restaurant and the indian restaurant both within the hotel complex and the food was delicious and not over priced. The hotel has a clarins Hammam and spa where my friend enjoyed a lovely hot oil massage.  The hotel is situated just beside the medina and jma el fna square which is busy but lots of fun. The vendors are friendly and were never intimidating but they do like a good chat!! Always barter for goods it is expected. If you get lost in the market there is always a friendly local who will guide you back to the square....for a few dirhams of course!  When the heat and the noise became a bit overwhelming we were only a short walk from our lovely hotel haven.  We had a look at the other 5 star hotels in the new medina (gueliz) but the area appeared a bit lacking in character and we were so glad we stayed in the colourful and busy old medina area.  If you are looking for a hotel in the morroccan style full of colour warmth and charm we could not recommend this hotel more highly. Have fun!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A fabulous hotel with great service
Review_Text: We stayed here before going on a weeks trip to Mt Toubkal. We had a wonderful time and recieved the best service from all the staff. All the staff were very helpful and always had a smile on their faces. We stayed in a mini suite which was lovely and spacious and kept immaculatley clean. The restuarants were very good especially the Indian restuarant. Breakfast was good with lots of choice. The Piano Bar was a lovely secluded start or end to our evening.  I have recommended to our friends and would definatley return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A wonderfull place very calm and relaxing  two blocs from the medina (where is very very noisy) . The staff very kind  the rooms really confortable and beautifull; excellent breakfast. We really had a wonderfull time there . We want to come back soon . Also excellent indian restaurant . I only didn't like the morocco restaurant .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent 4 night stay in this superb riad hotel. Fab surroundings great pool lovely rooms - spacious and spotless clean - AND unbeatable location just off the main square.  Tip - restaurant Riad Monceau ( #1 Moroccan restaurant in town) is just a few steps away too ; definitely worth a visit.  We will come back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic place in the Medina a Must !
Review_Text: Stayed at this Hotel August 2010 4 adults 3 young children very nice Hotel good service lovely Asian restaurant upstairs piano bar good great pools the only thing that wasn't great was the breakfast they could'nt cope when is it was busy about 9.30/10.00 am (get up early to have breakfast) but over all we had a very very nice time.  Thank you to all the staff at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Stunning hotel in the best location in Marrakech
Review_Text: Found this holiday as a last minute deal and picked it for its reviews and location! It was incredible. The drive into town is a little hairy and you are dropped at the end of the road we were wondering what on earth to expect as could not see any decent looking hotels at all...... then the doors open and it really is a haven. The manic hustle and bustle of the streets outside and then the peace and quiet and cleanliness of all areas of the hotel were so welcoming. We were very fortunate to be upgraded to a suite and it was so big had separte lounge 2 plasma TVs and a massive marble bathroom.  Regardless of the room luxury the hotel pool are was so relaxing and calm with luxurious sunbeds and plams everywhere.  We chose not to eat dinner in the hotel restaurants even though they looked stunning were very expensive and we actually wanted to sample the cuisine of the square.  Watch your bags say no and mean it and dont touch anything your not interested in buying! We loved the whole trip and had we had longer we would loved to have gone to the Atlas Mountains having said that we would NOT have booked with the dodgy looking men around selling these uninsured trips.  If you would like luxurious peace and quiet in an absolutley fantastic location choose here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Literally 2 mins walk from the main square of Djem el Fna and set within the old city this hotel is a very relaxing place to stay and yet very central.  Both pools were good but were quite busy even in this the low season. The sunbeds were filled and it was sometimes difficult to get pool towels as they ran out.  Staff were pleasant and courteous.  There was a very limited choice for vegetarians at the hotel's restaurants the best being the Indian one on the roof terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After travelling across southern Morocco for a number of weeks I was in need of a base in Marrakech that combined the traditional with modern creature comforts. Fortunately for me I secured a reservation at the Jardins de la Koutoubia for a week at the end of July - a very hot time to be in Marrakech!    Staying here was a real lifesaver. The location is incredible - you are right beside the Place Jemnaa el Fnaa the medina and the Koutoubia mosque but the hotel is a tranquil oasis in the heart of a very bustling city. I couldn't believe how quiet both the hotel and rooms were and appreciated being able to walk anywhere in the medina from the hotel. My room was a beautiful mini suite with a private balcony that overlooked the gardens and the Koutoubia mosque; so I could hear the beautiful call to prayer - so comforting and soothing. The room was large with lots of storage and a safe and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous with a seperate rain shower and big soaker tub and no shortage of hot water or issues with water pressure. The plasma tv had a good variety of stations and there was room in the mini bar to keep extra bottles of water.    One thing I really must comment on is how well trained the staff at this hotel are. Multilingual helpful and very polite the staff were all wonderful and made me (a solo female traveller) feel very welcome and safe. I tried some of the restaurants (there are five!) and found the food to be excellent and not bad overcooked hotel food. Their room service is also excellent and welcome when you need a quiet meal. Considering this is a five star luxury hotel the prices for food and drink were really reasonable and good quality. The same is true for the spa which I made good use of. While this was not the best hamman I have ever had all the services were excellent and not overpriced. And the pools - especially the large one in the courtyard of the main building - were a welcome escape from the afternoon heat of Marrakech. The free internet workstations - on Macs no less! - were also welcome and it was nice not to be charged for this service as many other high-end hotels tend to do. I think there may have also been wifi in the hotel but did not access it to find out.    If I had one criticism of this hotel - and I really have to search to find one - it would be that there were some problems with their telephone service. The phones crashed a few times and calls/messages were not forwarded. A minor frustration but annoying. They might also consider getting rid of the shag carpeting in the lobby as this hotel is certainly not stuck in the 1970's but the bad shag gives off a dated impression which does the hotel a disservice.    Other than that this hotel is a gem and I can't recommend it highly enough. I loved the mix of traditional architecture and hospitality with the modern conveniences location and the incredible staff. If you can stay at the Jardins de la Koutoubia! I look forward to returning in the future as this hotel puts many of the other high-end Marrakechi hotels to shame.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Lovely hotel which is so close to the Djemaa el fna yet take one step inside and you are transported into tranquility personified. The hotel has many lovely architectural features and the garden area around the pool is particularly peaceful. We were immediately upgraded to a suite which was a nice touch although it is clear that the end of July / beginning of August is not their busiest season. The breakfast was excellent and service throughout the hotel was fine which to be honest is very hard to find in Marrakesh! There are a couple of areas in which the hotel could improve though; the air conditioning within the room was fair at best the mini-bar was definitely not cold and the toilet required frequent flushing. However for the reasons listed above I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Have just returned from hotel stay with wife ( 10 days stay ). Hotel in superb location and rooms are a great standard. Service in hotel very good and food in all 3 restaurants very good. Can seem exspensive but very good. Hotel location is superb for exploring marrakesh on foot as all located within walking distance of hotel. Can get taxi from outside hotel but ensure you agree fare befor getting in ( whatever price driver says agree 1/2 of that ).Would recommend this hotel as place to stay in marrakesh as can spend time relaxing in hotel when needed as pool on roof is great nice and cool. You can then pop out of hotel when you want to explore.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Probably the most luxurious building I have ever stayed in. A huge palace-like building with several swimming pools free wireless internet lots of different and charming lounges and other areas to sit and read or have a drink several restaurants with different styles of food including one on the roof with a fabulous view. Huge LCD televisions in the rooms. Brilliantly sited very close to the souks and the main square and also close to the main Thai restaurant which is nice but pricey. On the minus side: the minibars were lukewarm and didn't really keep anything cold the toilet required three or four flushes before everything disappeared the airconditioning did its best in extremely hot weather but didn't get the temperature down very much. And the shower wasn't very powerful. Trivial criticisms really. The hotel was the perfect place to go after a walk in the blisteringly hot sun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Room  We were upgraded to a mini suite which gave my daughter and myself enough room to have our own space. Nice bathroom with great walk in shower. Seperate toilet in own little curpboard. Fabulour wardrobe space and lots of storage. Nice seating area..    Food  Breakfast memorable for the fresh orange juice . Good selection from which a very picky daughter managed to choose.  Lunch - again good seledction  Dinner - semi vegetarian daughter struggled - I enojyed the indian / thaiselction in the rooftop restuarant .  Drinks - expensive.  Pools - beautful once we manged to work out how to get towels.  Staff - the breakfast staff and the boys on lunchand bar duty were lovely..Unfailingly nice to us.  The room housekeeping seemed hit and miss at times.    We appreicated breakfast running until 10.30.  Also the wireless access  The hotel was in the perfect place in Marrakech.  I loved how when you stepped into the hotel from outside it was just so other worldly.    If you were small you had no mission of reaching the in room safe.It was at the very top of a very tall wardrobe.    But yes I would go back.the location was perfect.

Review_Title: silent paradise in the midle of the old town
Review_Text: Very nice hotel a big riad (+/- 80 rooms) with nice garden and swimmingpool. Nice furnitured with old Moroccan stuff. Not more than 300 meters from Jamaa El Fna.  Only the bathroom and (sometimes) the service could be better.  Food was correct. One of the restaurants is at the roof-top.  They have a fantastic spa-center in the cellars.  When you step outside the hotel; you are directly in the middle of the Moroccan life and the souks in the middle of the old town between the Toukoubia Mosque and the Jamaa El Fna square.  Very good choice!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just come back from 5 nights in this hotel and AMAZING is the only word that describes it. The location is perfect right in the centre of town but when you walk through the front doors it's just paradise. The only problem with this hotel is it is so no nice it is hard to leave the front door to go and discover Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Pretty good hotel inside the Medina
Review_Text: Overall the hotel is pretty good with attentive staff and above-average service. Rooms are clean and of a decent size; the restaurants inside the hotel are all pretty great as well. One important thing before deciding to stay at this hotel: it is located in a rather messy corner within the Medina which is the old part of town. It can be quite a hassle to get to the hotel...the taxi could only get you so far into the Medina and then you have to walk the rest of the way. I would recommend this hotel to people who are more adventurous and interested in exploring the Medina on foot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Natalie P wrote a review Apr 2010
Review_Title: heaven in the middle of the medina
Review_Text: The hotel was just fantastic from start to finish. Greated by friendly staff given mint tea to unwind while they did the check in and swiftly got a room upgrade. The room was large and overlooked the pool.    The most striking thing was the tranquility of the hotel when it was so close to the madness of the main square - the only noise was from the birds singing in the courtyard and the call to prayer from the Koutoubia mosque.    The location was fantastic - literally a 2 min walk to Jamar El Fnar down a road which we felt safe on even at night as 2 women alone. The landmark of the Koutoubia mosque means that even with very limited French it is easy to get back to the hotel in a taxi.    The staff were friendly and helpful; the rooftop pool was like paradise... Lunches were great in the hotel. The Clarins spa was reasonably priced and the treatments were fantastic. In fact the only problem was trying to find reasons to leave the hotel - even all the best restuarants in the area seemed to be in the hotel according to the guides!  in short i couldn't recommend it more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An classy oasis in the midst of the city, just by the medina.
Review_Text: Spent a week here. We were upgraded to a suite with pavilion outside. Rooms are very comfortable the gardins are lovely too.Two outdoor pools and a small subterraneum gym adjacent to a very large spa.  Hotel restaurants were good but pricy. Breakfasts excellent.  If you eat in the medina avoid the cold dishes - I caught the dreaded stomach bug.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joao M wrote a review Apr 2010
Review_Title: Excelent option for a Marrakesh visit
Review_Text: Perfect location (2 min walking to Jamaa el Fna)  excelent rooms (patio rooms) and service. Recomended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We were excited about going to Jardins de la Koutoubia as photos on the website look amazing and it is a 5 star hotel. However we feel it once may have been a 5 star but is v dated today with poor levels of service making it at the very most a 3/4 star. It has a fabulous pool and amazing spa (Clarins spa) but that's about it. You arrive into the lobby and it feels like you are back in the 70s. No great welcome from the staff at the front desk (in fact one girl was permanently on the phone and would answer your questions with the phone hanging on her shoulder....5 star hotels dont try and multi task!). The food at the poolside snack bar (downstairs) was terrible and the service v poor. The service at the restaurant at the top of the hotel should be used as an example...the lady who is front of house is amazing. So charming and welcoming...but she needs to teach the rest of the hotel her tricks! We had to ask for our room to be cleaned a couple of times...they don't do turn down service in the evening (again is this really a 5 star hotel?) and we had to ask for the cleaning staff to be quieter in the morning. Our room (don't get 220) was right next to all the cleaning cuphoards...so it was fairly chaotic early in the morning. No sleep ins! Next time we go to Marrakech we will opt for a smaller classier hotel at probably much better value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter t wrote a review Mar 2010
Review_Text: We stayed 5 nights in the hotel in mid March. Upgraded from a mini suite to a junior suite which was still a very average room size. Don't let the "suites" fool you. Made us wonder how regular rooms look like. Cleanliness of the rooms was below everage and all linnen was quite worn out. Service is generally friendly and speaks fluent French and English.  Bfast again is average and not up to int´l 5star standards. Note that the hotel has a main building and 2 separate but connected other buildings. We stayed in one of the latter.  The main garden is definately an asset. Also the garden next to the 2 other buildings are okay. The main pool can be chilly. With ths hotel as a base you can see Marrakech by foot. If you have a good deal this hotel may be okay.    P.S: We didn´t visit the spa due to rather unwelcoming staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderfully relaxing hotel with very friendly staff & super restaurants in a great location!
Review_Text: We were upgraded to a suite which had rose petals scattered everywhere! The views from the room were lovely. It is located a minute's walk from the main Square and despite the rather busy bustling road that leads one to the hotel once inside you enter a peaceful and relaxing sanctuary. It has a traditional charm and you truly feel as though you are in Morocco unlike some other 5* hotels which could be based anywhere. The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. The restaurants especially the French restaurant at the hotel were very good. Enough to keep us from eating elsewhere! Room service was very quick and the room was always spotless. We were initially concerned that being a stone's throw away from the Koutoubia & Square we might be disturbed by the noise...but it was the complete opposite and we found it to be very peaceful. Yes there is the Call to Prayer several times a day - but one is in Marrakech it is to be expected! The hotel is walking distance away from the main tourist sites. The Clarins Spa at the hotel is fabulous and the therapists ensure that you are their No.1 client and pamper you incredibly well! The hotel staff will happily arrange transportation and tours if needed. Relaxing long weekend break - highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel & it didn't disappoint on a second visit. We booked direct with the hotel & were upgraded on arrival to a mini suite which was lovely. The room was very comfortable very Moroccan in style and room service kept it spotless.  The staff were all very friendly corteous and helpful nothing was too much trouble & they even helped us learn a little Arabic.  The location of the hotel is second to none if you want to explore the city on foot - in sight of Koutoubia and a few minutes walk from the main square.  We will definitely return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We recently stayed at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed out stay. The hotel is perfectly placed to explore the wonderful sights of Marrakech. Located in the Median area everything is within easy walking distance.    The hotel itself was lovely. The rooms spacious and clean the choice of restaurants excellent (and reasonable) and the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming.    So do yourself a favour - take a trip to Marrakech and check out this property!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic hotel. Very well located. Service is very nice and helpful. SPA is very clean. Its swimming pool is beautiful. One heated swimming pool on the roof (28°C) and one in the ground floor (cool water).  Beautiful breakfast lots of variety great orange juice.  Rooms are clean well designed. Beds are very confortable. TV and WiFi in the room.  3mns walking distance from Jna el Fnaa Place. Perefect location to go around the town and enjoy.  A great hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have staygin at this hotel for 5 days and on the second day we get robbed my phone and MP4. Ok this things happens but the most chocking was that the hotel didn´t take there responsiblity they didn´t do any law complaint (the police wanted that the director does it!!) we didn´thear anything from the director at all. Imazing for an hotel with 5 stars.    We were there to celebrate our 15 yeas mariage but with all this we had a very bad holiday!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is in the centre of Marrakech - a few minutes walk from all the sights. The rooms are stunning and it has two pools and gardens that are quite beautiful. Many restaurants including a great Indian and good breakfasts.  The outside is unimposing and hides a hidden treasure inside.  Also has very nice Spa and many other facilities
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: On our first visit to Marrakech my wife and I found Les Jardins de la Koutoubia a fantastic hotel within minutes to the main square in the medina. We loved everything about the hotel. Our room was lovely overlooking the swimming pool the food excellent and the staff were very friendly.    The hotel is a world away from the streets outside. When you are in the main square with the beggars snake charmers belly dancers and countless people offering their services as a guide you step through the door of the hotel to find a peaceful relaxing haven. It was great to experience 2 different worlds. One minute haggling with the people in the Souks the next sun bathing by the swimming pool.    We didnt take a chance and eat outside of the hotel but there are 4 restaurants to choose from with plenty of choice. The Indian/ Asian restaurant was my favorite. The other comment i will make is that i thought that everything in the hotel wasnt expensive. The drinks(with the exception of champagne) was much cheaper than the UK. In fact we struggled to spend money this trip! Happy days!    This hotel is a must. The location is superb and we loved it. Special mention must go to the staff who were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Haven of Tranquility amidst the Hubbub
Review_Text: Les Jardins de La Koutuobia is a beautiful tranquil hotel located right in the heart of the medina. The staff are friendly the food is excellent and the spa and pool facilities are top class. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean. You can make what you want of a trip here - immerse yourself in the hustle and bustle of the souk (only a few steps away) or enjoy the peace and tranquility of a beautiful riad hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my boyfriend arrived from Marrakech we din't stay at this Riad (we stayed at Riad Mille et Une Nuites but we dinner for two nights at this Riad restaurant. Excelent service and the best location! If we return to Marrakech it will be definitly our choice. The Riad is located next to Place Djemaa El-Fna and two swimmingpools. We loved the meals and the service. It's a very romantic place where we can rest and be calm away from the outside confusion at the Place. Maybe it's not the best 5 star Riad but has a nice decoration and service and remember you are not in Europe you are in Africa in a poor country so I consider that it's one of the best Riad that we could see on the city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A would like to be five star hotel much too expensive you may get as well for 1 / 10 of the price in the Marrakech Ryads
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Having read some of the reviews on this site I was more than a little apprehensive. Will the Muezzin wake us up? Will it be grubby? Will it be pricey? (Who writes these things?) Certainly I had no need to be. From the moment we arrived we were treated like visiting dignitaries. The staff could not do enough for us and I feel some of our own hotel staff could learn a thing or two from the friendly helpful staff at the Koutoubia.    The hotel was immaculately clean and well-cared for - it seemed the staff spent their whole day cleaning. I tried to find fault with the place (because we all do) and the best I could do was the doors into the bathroom were a bit awkward and the handles on the wardrobes were a bit heavy and therefore noisy.    That was all !    Apart from that it was a great place to stay in the midst of all the noise and heat of Marrakech it was alittle oasis of calm.    i want everyone to go there. I loved it. Go there. You will too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Not truly a Five Star hotel
Review_Text: On the plus side this hotel is well situted for the many souks the gardens and palace. However in the evening the main entrance of the hotel is surrounded by touts and the taxis mopeds and donkey carts present a bit of a challenge.    On the plus side the room we were offered looked and felt authentically Moroccan. However it was not particularly clean - there were food crumbs and a used tissue in the bathroom pee stains on the toilet floor which was not washed during our stay the curtains were grubby and had stains of dubious origin the bedding smelled as though it had been riding on the donkey outside and the blanket on my bed had a cigarette burn in it.    On the plus side the hotel benefits from three lovely swimming pools - one at garden level one on the roof and one in the indoor spa. However the garden level pool is ice cold and if you do decide to swim you'll be lucky to find a member of staff to provide you with towels. I made two attempts before eventually going to the main reception desk and asking them for help.    Breakfast was more of a 'continental' affair than anything else but you could get baked beans lentils stewed chicken chicken cocktail sausages and fried eggs if that's your bag. Be prepared though to share your breakfast with some of the non-paying guests. The birds are fearless. They are on a flight path from the dining room to the breakfast tables on the terrace and will race in and out feeding from the baskets of bread and pastries uninterrupted by the inattentive catering staff.    On the plus side there are 3/2 restaurants to choose from in the hotel and food can be ordered and eaten on the garden terrace. I would recommend the Asian-style restaurant on the roof terrace which has an extensive menu and provides fine quality food at a very reasonable price (roughly 400 Dh for 2 starters 2 main courses 2 soft Drinks and coffee). However the Moroccan-style restaurant for which you have to pre-book came in way below expectations. I ordered the beef chicken and lamb brochette combo (which were actually the size of ice lolly sticks) and were only luke warm - served with a scoop of green coloured rice. My friend ordered the chicken tagine which was one emaciated limb flanked by five green olives. For this a serving of sliced orange three cold scotch pancakes (described as Moroccan-style) smeared with chocolate spread not chocolate sauce and missing its cinnamon a bottle of red wine and a bottle of mineral water we paid ......... more than we should have.    The hotel spa provides a welcome retreat with a good selection of treatments. Not all of the staff speak English so you may want to read up on what your treatment entails and avoid any surprises. If things get a bit hot for you no one will notice and you won't be offered water. But if you ask you'll be given a 500ml bottle - no glass nor straw - however it will at least be chilled .    I hope that the foregoing will provide you with a helpful insight to the hotel and won't discourage you from trying it out. There are many features and settings which you have to experience for yourself and the coutryard and pool areas are particularly beautiful at night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights with our teenage son. The hotel is in a perfect location for the square jamaa el Fna and the souks. It has about 3 or 4 restaurants which are good but a little overpriced. The Indian restaurant is good for lunch but very disappointing in the evening. Best to follow the adage "When in Rome...."  There are 2 pools which are well tended and clean but it can get very competitive for sun loungers as many guests stay by the pool all day every day. Also in the afternoon one side of the pool is in shade so places on the sunny side are at a premium.  The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. we were upgarded to a mini suite which was fine but didn't have a very nice view. Also there was a cockerel somewhere making a terrible racket for most of the day and early morning. I think we could have easily wrung its neck!! Also the hotel is very close to koutoubia mosque so you get the call to prayer very early in the morning.  Breakfast is continental though you can have eggs pancakes etc if you pay a little extra. It is more than adequate and the service is excellent.  As you can't take dinars into or out of the country we changed our dollars and euros at the main desk. Also there are quite a few ATMs just off the square.  As mentioned the square is is a short walk from the hotel. you have to negotiate beggars and numerous mopeds and motor bikes en route. Petrol fumes are pretty choking in the souks and some drive at great speed. It means you have to be aware of them all the time. Crossing the road is a bit of a nightmare as pedestrian crossings seem to be a complete waste of time so just run!!!    I wouldn't want to return to Marrkesh but the hotel is to be recommended for a few days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We booked this hotel as a break on our own for relaxation. Unfortunatly this hotel is not up to 5 star expectations.Good points were the staff were very friendly and helpful and the Morrocan and Relais De Paris resturant was great but he other two resturants were averageThere is also some building work going on which we were not told about before or after we booked our holiday.There was also a big leak in the main reception area due to the rain which they put a large sheet and buckets down to capture the rain water.There are also broken tiles along the 3rd floor which you would not expect to see in a 5 star hotel.We were lucky to have been given a big room but others we spoke to had been given much smaller rooms.The spa is mediocre and whilst there work men were continualy walking through not the most relaxing experience. This hotel needs to be regraded as a 3 - 4 star as it is no where near a 5 star and is very over priced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a splendid hotel Moroccan character with modern reliability. Mostly very friendly and helpful staff. Three swimming pools a full spa and hamman Four restaurants mostly very high standard cuisine not sure about the pink chicken in the 'Indian' restaurant but the rest was very good. One complaint was that paying for half board in advance cost 25% more than it would have done just to pay cash on the night. But hey Marrakech is all about bargaining and they did give us an upgrade.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Superbe location in a city with great vibe
Review_Text: We booked a last minute trio to Marrakech in February the hype around the city has calmed down but we were keen to see it by ourself and go to a sunny place for a short break away from London winter... This hotel gave us all we wanted just 3 hours flight away from London and only 15 minutes taxi ride from the airport right in the middle of "the action".  We were at first disappointed with the somewhat shambolic aspect of the city but then the puzzle gets solved and the combination of light colour of buildings ( ocre everywhere ) snow capped Atlas mountain in the background and the superbe location of the hotel ( right in the middle of it yet feeling like a retreat ). You get woken up by the calls for prayers so have to be a good sleeper but for the rest this is as exotic as one can dream of. The bedroom ( suite ) was large with a separate room for our 4yrs old son the staff was friendly - altough a bit amateur-ish but this is really the only thing I would point out  the 3 restaurants offer you plenty of food choice and we were fans of the Asian restaurant on the rooftop by the heated pool - the hotel has 3 swimming pools but during winter only the rooftop one is actually used but this was not problem as scenery is amazing and it never felt overcrowded despite mid term week a few kids were playing from time to time so the pool could be a bit noisy but they had separated area on the roof as well as a very quiet main pool. The building is superbe quite large hotel but it felts like a boutique hotel at all time tks to small-ish common area.  The Spa is again large yet plenty of small rooms and great atmosphere in the hotel basement with heated pool etc...  So strongly recommend the place for a short break spending one full week there might be too long tough unles you are into carpets moroccan art etc and want to spend your time shopping for new furnitures... We did not visit much but the Jardin de Marjorelle is a must see for its amazing colour mix...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My husband and I booked 3 nights at the Jardins Koutoubia in Marrakech as a romantic weekend getaway. We opted for the wellness package which included a hamman and massage daily breakfast free airport transfer (though we tipped) and a complimentary room category upgrade. We booked the patio suite and expected to be upgraded to a mini suite. When we arrived at the airport the hotel shuttle was waiting for us with a sign right on schedule. The ride to the hotel only took about 10 minutes and they swiftly took our luggage inside the lobby while we checked in and they served moroccan pastries and mint tea. The hotel is very close to the Medina which is good for sight seeing but bad because it is next to Koutoubia mosque and you will hear the call to prayer early in the mornings and until sunset though my husband thought it gave a real cultural experience to the trip. The room they gave us the supposed mini suite was too small for our expectations we could hear the noise from the inner courtyard from people enjoying the outdoor fireplace and found ourselves confined to two single beds for our romantic break. My husband complained to reception and they moved us the 2nd night to a junior suite which had a lovely canopy bed and more importantly a single double bed! The staff was lovely and really did make an effort but there was always something short of perfect at the hotel to include no hot water on our 2nd day the water actually was running brown yuck! They did fix it in less than a day though. There is no clock or alarm clock in the room so we scheduled a wake up call to find out the phone in our bedroom did not ring and they never managed to fix it so we had to use the alarm on our mobile phone. The food in the onsite Moroccan restaurant is very good an excellent value compared to the tourist trap restaurants that await you outside. Overall we felt Marrakech was overpriced for what you get in the end and the hotel is not at 5-star level though they charge ritz carlton prices. If you can find a good price at the hotel and specify exactly what room you want then it might be okay. The Clarins spa was very nice the indoor pool is very relaxing and the treatments are top notch.    Positives  - Close to Medina where you can pick up a sightseeing bus and local goods and food. The spice shops have nice selections.  - Onsite spa rootop heated pool and good restaurants    Negatives  - Small rooms and not well maintained (mould on the bathtub cracks on the walls phone does not ring no hot water for one day)  - Service was friendly but very slow  - Noise from the Koutoubia mosque at the crack of dawn
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Hotel Jardins de la Koutoubia - like a peaceful island retreat in a sea of perpetual motion. Whenever the sounds the heat or the general melee of souk persistance became too overpowering the assuring adjacency of this lovely hotel was very comforting. The staff were wonderfully considerate and the amenities could not be faulted. Our break though short was interesting and memorable.

We have been in Morocco for 5 days. A short break just to see diferent things and rest. We choose this Hotel and ...is Simply the Best!  The location is perfect: just in the center of the Medina. We don't need taxis we have where to eat when we want the souks and everything is near. Al the other 5 stars Hotels don't have this excellent location . TheMamounia is closed so...  The Hotel is very good. At arrivel try some thé a la mente and Morocco cookies. Excellente decoration Morocco style plenty of charm fireplaces lights terrrace with nice view of the Medina swimming pool outodoors with a lovely garden and a patio with a giant fireplace. A very goods Spa of Clarins with a blak swimmin pool just to relax.  MAGIC! Don't thing again and go!  Every photos you see in the sight are even better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 200 yards from the Main Square, peaceful, great pools
Review_Text: The hotel is located 200 yards from the Jema' al-fna - the main square in the Medina. From the main square you will explore the Souks (shops selling antiques leather and tat). Perfect hotel location when you just want to flee the pestering merchants.    Hotel has 3 pools (one heated on roof one main outdoor and one indoor pool & spa). The main outdoor pool is freezing in the winter the rooftop pool is heated but few guests ventured in and the indoor is warm. The seating areas around the pools are lovely.    Breakfast is good but little variety from day to day.    Staff are excellent - friendly and helpful. Tipping in cash is greatly appreciated 10-20 dirhams. They were flexible with late check-out.    The quoted rate calling the property directly does not include 10% tax.    The room we had was in the newly constructed wing of the hotel with its own private garden. Although it's a bit of a maze to find the rooms I think they were better because most had balconies or patios (if on the ground floor). The rooms overlooking the main pool in the old hotel don't seem to have balconies large enough to sit out on. Medina facing rooms might be a bit noisy but we didn't stay in one.    Overall this is an excellent hotel with a full service offering and superb location. My main complaint was making the reservation. E-mails to the hotel and spa were either ignored or just very slow - one expects immediate responses in this day and age. I gave up and called directly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Jardins is in an ideal location to explore all treasures of the Medina and Jemaa El Fna has to offer in Marrakech ... this is run by genuinely friendly respectful and culturally knowledged hoteliers who have created a hotel experience which was beyond 5* .... beautiful luxurious unique and extremely guest focused..... $450 a night gave access to a wonderfully spacious room with beautiful balcony ...... but I am sure any of the smaller rooms would have been just as good ... and of course the Clairns Spa ... that is a definite bonus ... well worth the extra $$$  far superior than any of the high end Riads ... or the 'chains' Hilton Meridien etc at the other end ... Absolutely Divine! Tassanum Sayed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Oasis of calm, great hotel returning in Dec 08
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel quiet oasis just one minute from the main square and souks. We had four wonderful days in January 08 we were a group of 7 and had four spacious rooms with balcony overlooking the beautiful majestic central pool and garden. Some of us are returning in December 08 as the hotel is so nice and relaxing. In January the weather was warm great to swim in the heated pool on the roof terrace and chill out in the sun on the big sun beds. All the restaurants in the hotel have good food we had lunch on the rooftop terrace and under the trees in the garden and one night in the Indian restaurant on the roof. Good buffet breakfast with hot and cold selection. Friendly staff who speak quite good English try a little French if you can. The spa is a relaxing haven stunning pool and we tried lots of different spa treatments.    Roses and rose petals all around the hotel and in the room give a wonderful perfume. Try relaxing with an evening drink in the lounges with open fires around the pool then go to the main square to see the hustle and bustle of the evening stalls.    Take the open top bus to see the sights and gardens around town and try out the restaurant run by women called Al Faisir the hotel can book a table as it is very popular. We had a fantastic stay and can't wait to come back to the hotel in December 08 for another relaxing time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This is THE best place to stay in the center of Marrakesh hands-down. The photos on the website don't even do it justice. The rooms were modern with a Moroccan touch and had all the necessary amenities including bathrobes blow dryer etc. From the moment my boyfriend and I walked in and smelled the fragrant jasmine in the lobby we were in heaven. They upgraded our room on the 2nd of our 3 nights without us even asking. The pool is amazing. The spa one of the most gorgeous I have ever seen. Very convenient and tasty food options. Extremely helpful staff and concierge. 24-hour free internet in the business center. This hotel is literally 1 minute off the main Djemna square where you will find snake charmers musicians etc. If you want to be in the middle of it all but still feel like you're on luxury vacation stay here!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakech is the most amazing mad place I have ever been to. Spent 5 days there with my husband celebrating our 10th Wedding Anniversary. Absolutely fell in love with the place. It was Ramadan and we had no problems getting food and drink although we felt it was courteous to be discreet. Les Jardins was a great choice of hotel. Perfectly located for the hustle and bustle of the square souks and surrounding sites but an absolute haven of calm as soon as you walk through the doors. It is not located on a dead end street as a previous reviewer says but on a small side street heading directly to the square.    The hotel is airy spacious and wonderfully decorated. The pool area is peaceful and relaxing whether sunbathing during the heat of the day or enjoying a pre or after dinner drink in the evening. Breakfast is lovely with a buffet of continental english cooked and more traditional dishes. Make sure you sit outside to enjoy the morning birdsong. We got a free upgrade to a mini suite with a view of the annexe garden area and the Koutoubia Minaret. Great room especially when decorated with rose petals by the maid each morning.    We would love to return and hopefully we will (if the grandparents will baby sit again!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A BEAUTIFUL OASIS IN A CRAZY FUN CITY!
Review_Text: We have just returned from 4 days in this hotel we split our week into two but afterwards i do wish we had of stayed here all week. When you arrive the road outside that you trundle down with your cases is a bit crazy but then as soon as you walk through the big hotel doors always being greeted by the friendly staff it's like walking into another world. The hotel is beautiful! It's nice and quiet you can easily forget the hustle and bustle of the city! All of the staff are all very friendly and all speak good english which is great if you can't speak french. The rooms are lovely very clean morracan style rooms. If you can then try and get a room that over looks the pool. The pool area is beautiful woith lots of morracan features big flowing curtains open fire places! The cocktail bar make a great moijito!! The location is fantastic! Also i would recommend the rooftop asian restaurant! I would return to this hotel tomorrow ! We will defeinately go back there! Marrakech is a fantastic city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After arriving during a thunder storm for our first visit to Morocco we were gob smacked at the hustle and bustle on the roads donkeys everwhere. The bus dropped other people off on route to our hotel which was on a dead end street full of donkeys and carts a couple on the bus wished us luck but after walking through the main door we found a calm sun drenched court yard with an inviting pool. The rooms were good the reception staff and porters were a bit offish but the rest of the steff were very helpfull and polite. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back! You have to be firm with people wanting to be your guide as they are good at getting you lost.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Relaxing, stylish hotel in ideal location
Review_Text: Just spent 7 nights at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia. Got free upgrade on arrival (because it was my birthday although I didn’t specifically mention this) to a mini suite room overlooking pool area with complimentary fruit water and pastries. Very quiet (except for announcements from Koutoubia mosque around 4am!). Room split into 2 with a flat screen TV in each. Bathroom small but had everything we needed.
